module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AacSettings

-- | Aac Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAacSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AacSettings
AacSettings' :: Maybe AacRateControlMode -> Maybe AacCodingMode -> Maybe AacSpec -> Maybe AacRawFormat -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AacInputType -> Maybe AacProfile -> Maybe AacVbrQuality -> Maybe Double -> AacSettings

-- | Rate Control Mode.
[$sel:rateControlMode:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacRateControlMode

-- | Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
[$sel:codingMode:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacCodingMode

-- | Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2
--   Transport Stream containers.
[$sel:spec:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacSpec

-- | Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
[$sel:rawFormat:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacRawFormat

-- | Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
[$sel:sampleRate:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio +
--   AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will
--   be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
[$sel:inputType:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacInputType

-- | AAC Profile.
[$sel:profile:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacProfile

-- | VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
[$sel:vbrQuality:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacVbrQuality

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control
--   mode and profile.
[$sel:bitrate:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>AacSettings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateControlMode:AacSettings'</a>,
--   <a>aacSettings_rateControlMode</a> - Rate Control Mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_codingMode</a> -
--   Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spec:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_spec</a> - Use MPEG-2
--   AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawFormat:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_rawFormat</a> -
--   Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputType:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_inputType</a> - Set
--   to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio + AD
--   (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will be
--   set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profile:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_profile</a> - AAC
--   Profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vbrQuality:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_vbrQuality</a> -
--   VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
newAacSettings :: AacSettings

-- | Rate Control Mode.
aacSettings_rateControlMode :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRateControlMode)

-- | Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.

-- | Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2
--   Transport Stream containers.
aacSettings_spec :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacSpec)

-- | Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
aacSettings_rawFormat :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRawFormat)

-- | Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
aacSettings_sampleRate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio +
--   AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will
--   be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
aacSettings_inputType :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacInputType)

-- | AAC Profile.
aacSettings_profile :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacProfile)

aacSettings_vbrQuality :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacVbrQuality)

--   mode and profile.
aacSettings_bitrate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings

-- | Ac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAc3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Ac3Settings
Ac3Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Ac3DrcProfile -> Maybe Ac3CodingMode -> Maybe Ac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Ac3MetadataControl -> Ac3Settings

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
[$sel:dialnorm:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
[$sel:drcProfile:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3DrcProfile

-- | Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
[$sel:codingMode:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3CodingMode

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
[$sel:lfeFilter:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3LfeFilter

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See
--   ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.
[$sel:bitstreamMode:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
[$sel:bitrate:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the
--   DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was
--   not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata
--   settings will be used.
[$sel:metadataControl:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3MetadataControl

-- | Create a value of <a>Ac3Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_dialnorm</a> - Sets
--   the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcProfile:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_drcProfile</a> -
--   If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 for background
--   on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to "followInput",
--   encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder
--   that supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of
--   these streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newAc3Settings :: Ac3Settings

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
ac3Settings_dialnorm :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
ac3Settings_drcProfile :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3DrcProfile)

-- | Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
ac3Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3CodingMode)

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
ac3Settings_lfeFilter :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3LfeFilter)

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See
--   ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.
ac3Settings_bitstreamMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
ac3Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the
--   DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was
--   not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata
--   settings will be used.
ac3Settings_metadataControl :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3MetadataControl)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Ac3Settings.Ac3Settings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Ancillary Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAncillarySourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AncillarySourceSettings
AncillarySourceSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
[$sel:sourceAncillaryChannelNumber:AncillarySourceSettings'] :: AncillarySourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AncillarySourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceAncillaryChannelNumber:AncillarySourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber</a> -
--   Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
newAncillarySourceSettings :: AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber :: Lens' AncillarySourceSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AncillarySourceSettings.AncillarySourceSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AncillarySourceSettings.AncillarySourceSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection

-- | Audio Language Selection
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioLanguageSelection</a> smart constructor.
data AudioLanguageSelection
AudioLanguageSelection' :: Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy -> Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies
--   audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs
--   such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is
--   no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language
--   returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose
--   another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it
--   can't find one with the same language.
[$sel:languageSelectionPolicy:AudioLanguageSelection'] :: AudioLanguageSelection -> Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy

-- | Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio
--   source.
[$sel:languageCode:AudioLanguageSelection'] :: AudioLanguageSelection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioLanguageSelection</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageSelectionPolicy:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy</a> - When set to
--   "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies audio streams
--   by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs such that an
--   audio stream matching the initially selected language is no longer
--   present then mute will be encoded until the language returns. If
--   "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose another audio
--   stream in the program with the same stream type if it can't find one
--   with the same language.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageCode</a> - Selects a specific
--   three-letter language code from within an audio source.
newAudioLanguageSelection :: Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies
--   audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs
--   such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is
--   no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language
--   returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose
--   another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it
--   can't find one with the same language.
audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection (Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy)

-- | Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio
--   source.
audioLanguageSelection_languageCode :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioLanguageSelection.AudioLanguageSelection

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio Normalization Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioNormalizationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioNormalizationSettings
AudioNormalizationSettings' :: Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl -> AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM
--   Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
[$sel:algorithm:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm

-- | Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a
--   default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM
--   Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128
--   specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
[$sel:targetLkfs:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the
--   chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured
--   but not adjusted.
[$sel:algorithmControl:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioNormalizationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithm:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm</a> - Audio normalization
--   algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM Act specification,
--   itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetLkfs:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs</a> - Target LKFS(loudness)
--   to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a default value will be
--   used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM Act (1770-1)
--   recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128 specification (1770-2)
--   recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithmControl:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl</a> - When set to
--   correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the chosen algorithm.
--   If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured but not adjusted.
newAudioNormalizationSettings :: AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM
--   Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm)

-- | Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a
--   default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM
--   Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128
--   specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the
--   chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured
--   but not adjusted.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioNormalizationSettings.AudioNormalizationSettings

--   audio loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BatchSuccessfulResultModel.BatchSuccessfulResultModel

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping

-- | Maps a caption channel to an ISO 693-2 language code
--   (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2), with an optional description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionLanguageMapping</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionLanguageMapping
CaptionLanguageMapping' :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> CaptionLanguageMapping

-- | Three character ISO 639-2 language code (see
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Text

-- | Textual description of language
[$sel:languageDescription:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Text

-- | The closed caption channel being described by this
--   CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel mapping must have a unique
--   channel number (maximum of 4)
[$sel:captionChannel:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionLanguageMapping</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionLanguageMapping'</a>,
--   <a>captionLanguageMapping_languageCode</a> - Three character ISO 639-2
--   language code (see http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageDescription:CaptionLanguageMapping'</a>,
--   <a>captionLanguageMapping_languageDescription</a> - Textual
--   description of language
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionChannel:CaptionLanguageMapping'</a>,
--   <a>captionLanguageMapping_captionChannel</a> - The closed caption
--   channel being described by this CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel
--   mapping must have a unique channel number (maximum of 4)
newCaptionLanguageMapping :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> CaptionLanguageMapping

-- | Three character ISO 639-2 language code (see
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)
captionLanguageMapping_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionLanguageMapping Text

-- | Textual description of language
captionLanguageMapping_languageDescription :: Lens' CaptionLanguageMapping Text

-- | The closed caption channel being described by this
--   CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel mapping must have a unique
--   channel number (maximum of 4)
captionLanguageMapping_captionChannel :: Lens' CaptionLanguageMapping Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionLanguageMapping


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle

-- | Caption Rectangle
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionRectangle</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionRectangle
CaptionRectangle' :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For topOffset, specify the position
--   of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height.
--   The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of
--   the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
[$sel:topOffset:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
[$sel:height:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
[$sel:width:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don't
--   have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display
--   rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video
--   frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left
--   edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all
--   within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are
--   percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must
--   specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position
--   of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The
--   rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the
--   frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
[$sel:leftOffset:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionRectangle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_topOffset</a> - See the description in leftOffset.
--   For topOffset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle,
--   as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the
--   top edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the measurement is
--   10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at
--   that position from the top edge of the frame. This field corresponds
--   to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_height</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_width</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:leftOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_leftOffset</a> - Applies only if you plan to
--   convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make
--   sure to leave the default if you don't have either of these formats in
--   the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that
--   is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle
--   by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge,
--   and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video
--   frame. The units for the measurements are percentages. If you specify
--   a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of
--   them. For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the
--   rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative
--   to the left edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the
--   measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left
--   edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame. This
--   field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
newCaptionRectangle :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For topOffset, specify the position
--   of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height.
--   The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of
--   the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
captionRectangle_topOffset :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
captionRectangle_height :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
captionRectangle_width :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don't
--   have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display
--   rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video
--   frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left
--   edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all
--   within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are
--   percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must
--   specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position
--   of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The
--   rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the
--   frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
captionRectangle_leftOffset :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionRectangle.CaptionRectangle


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CdiInputResolution

-- | Maximum CDI input resolution; SD is 480i and 576i up to 30
--   frames-per-second (fps), HD is 720p up to 60 fps / 1080i up to 30 fps,
--   FHD is 1080p up to 60 fps, UHD is 2160p up to 60 fps

[fromCdiInputResolution] :: CdiInputResolution -> Text

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
newtype DeviceSettingsSyncState
DeviceSettingsSyncState' :: Text -> DeviceSettingsSyncState
[fromDeviceSettingsSyncState] :: DeviceSettingsSyncState -> Text
pattern DeviceSettingsSyncState_SYNCED :: DeviceSettingsSyncState
pattern DeviceSettingsSyncState_SYNCING :: DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DeviceSettingsSyncState.DeviceSettingsSyncState

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbNitSettings

-- | DVB Network Information Table (NIT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbNitSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbNitSettings
DvbNitSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> Natural -> DvbNitSettings

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
[$sel:repInterval:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The network name text placed in the networkNameDescriptor inside the
--   Network Information Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:networkName:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Text

-- | The numeric value placed in the Network Information Table (NIT).
[$sel:networkId:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbNitSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repInterval:DvbNitSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbNitSettings_repInterval</a> - The number of milliseconds between
--   instances of this table in the output transport stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkName:DvbNitSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbNitSettings_networkName</a> - The network name text placed in
--   the networkNameDescriptor inside the Network Information Table.
--   Maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkId:DvbNitSettings'</a>, <a>dvbNitSettings_networkId</a>
--   - The numeric value placed in the Network Information Table (NIT).
newDvbNitSettings :: Text -> Natural -> DvbNitSettings

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
dvbNitSettings_repInterval :: Lens' DvbNitSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The network name text placed in the networkNameDescriptor inside the
--   Network Information Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
dvbNitSettings_networkName :: Lens' DvbNitSettings Text

-- | The numeric value placed in the Network Information Table (NIT).
dvbNitSettings_networkId :: Lens' DvbNitSettings Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbNitSettings.DvbNitSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbNitSettings.DvbNitSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbNitSettings.DvbNitSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings

-- | DVB Service Description Table (SDT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSdtSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSdtSettings
DvbSdtSettings' :: Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSdtSettings

-- | Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
[$sel:outputSdt:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt

-- | The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service
--   Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:serviceName:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the
--   Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:serviceProviderName:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
[$sel:repInterval:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSdtSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSdt:DvbSdtSettings'</a>, <a>dvbSdtSettings_outputSdt</a>
--   - Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceName</a> - The service name placed in the
--   serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is
--   256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceProviderName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceProviderName</a> - The service provider name
--   placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table.
--   Maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repInterval:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_repInterval</a> - The number of milliseconds between
--   instances of this table in the output transport stream.
newDvbSdtSettings :: DvbSdtSettings

-- | Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
dvbSdtSettings_outputSdt :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt)

-- | The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service
--   Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
dvbSdtSettings_serviceName :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the
--   Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
dvbSdtSettings_serviceProviderName :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
dvbSdtSettings_repInterval :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSdtSettings.DvbSdtSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings

-- | Dvb Sub Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSubSourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSubSourceSettings
DvbSubSourceSettings' :: Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSubSourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
[$sel:ocrLanguage:DvbSubSourceSettings'] :: DvbSubSourceSettings -> Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage

-- | When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
[$sel:pid:DvbSubSourceSettings'] :: DvbSubSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSubSourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ocrLanguage:DvbSubSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubSourceSettings_ocrLanguage</a> - If you will configure a
--   WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use
--   this field to provide the language to consider when translating the
--   image-based source to text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pid:DvbSubSourceSettings'</a>, <a>dvbSubSourceSettings_pid</a>
--   - When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
newDvbSubSourceSettings :: DvbSubSourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
dvbSubSourceSettings_ocrLanguage :: Lens' DvbSubSourceSettings (Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage)

-- | When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
dvbSubSourceSettings_pid :: Lens' DvbSubSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubSourceSettings.DvbSubSourceSettings

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3LfeControl.Eac3LfeControl
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3LfeControl.Eac3LfeControl

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings

-- | Eac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEac3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Eac3Settings
Eac3Settings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Eac3CodingMode -> Maybe Eac3LfeControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3DcFilter -> Maybe Eac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix -> Maybe Eac3DrcRf -> Maybe Eac3DrcLine -> Maybe Eac3PhaseControl -> Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode -> Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3SurroundMode -> Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl -> Maybe Eac3MetadataControl -> Eac3Settings

-- | Left only/Right only center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:loRoCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Left total/Right total center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:ltRtCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
[$sel:dialnorm:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
[$sel:codingMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3CodingMode

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
[$sel:lfeControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3LfeControl

-- | Left only/Right only surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:loRoSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Left total/Right total surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:ltRtSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
[$sel:dcFilter:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DcFilter

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
[$sel:lfeFilter:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3LfeFilter

-- | Stereo downmix preference. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:stereoDownmix:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix

-- | Sets the profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures
--   that the instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
[$sel:drcRf:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DrcRf

-- | Sets the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
[$sel:drcLine:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DrcLine

-- | When set to shift90Degrees, applies a 90-degree phase shift to the
--   surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:phaseControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3PhaseControl

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, sets whether an extra center back surround
--   channel is matrix encoded into the left and right surround channels.
[$sel:surroundExMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream.
--   See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E) for background on these values.
[$sel:bitstreamMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode

-- | When set to attenuate3Db, applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround
--   channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:attenuationControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
[$sel:bitrate:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When encoding 2/0 audio, sets whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded
--   into the two channels.
[$sel:surroundMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3SurroundMode

-- | When set to whenPossible, input DD+ audio will be passed through if it
--   is present on the input. This detection is dynamic over the life of
--   the transcode. Inputs that alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content
--   will have a consistent DD+ output as the system alternates between
--   passthrough and encoding.
[$sel:passthroughControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl

-- | When set to followInput, encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD,
--   DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not
--   supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings
--   will be used.
[$sel:metadataControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3MetadataControl

-- | Create a value of <a>Eac3Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoCenterMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtCenterMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dialnorm</a> -
--   Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeControl:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeControl</a> -
--   When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dcFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dcFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stereoDownmix:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_stereoDownmix</a> - Stereo downmix preference. Only
--   used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcRf:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcRf</a> - Sets the
--   profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures that the
--   instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcLine:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcLine</a> - Sets
--   the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phaseControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_phaseControl</a> - When set to shift90Degrees, applies
--   a 90-degree phase shift to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundExMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundExMode</a> - When encoding 3/2 audio, sets
--   whether an extra center back surround channel is matrix encoded into
--   the left and right surround channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E)
--   for background on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attenuationControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_attenuationControl</a> - When set to attenuate3Db,
--   applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_bitrate</a> -
--   Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundMode</a> - When encoding 2/0 audio, sets
--   whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded into the two channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passthroughControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_passthroughControl</a> - When set to whenPossible,
--   input DD+ audio will be passed through if it is present on the input.
--   This detection is dynamic over the life of the transcode. Inputs that
--   alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content will have a consistent DD+
--   output as the system alternates between passthrough and encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to followInput, encoder
--   metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that
--   supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of these
--   streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newEac3Settings :: Eac3Settings

-- | Left only/Right only center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_loRoCenterMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Left total/Right total center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_ltRtCenterMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
eac3Settings_dialnorm :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
eac3Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3CodingMode)

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
eac3Settings_lfeControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3LfeControl)

-- | Left only/Right only surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_loRoSurroundMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Left total/Right total surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_ltRtSurroundMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
eac3Settings_dcFilter :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DcFilter)

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
eac3Settings_lfeFilter :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3LfeFilter)

-- | Stereo downmix preference. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_stereoDownmix :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix)

-- | Sets the profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures
--   that the instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
eac3Settings_drcRf :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DrcRf)

-- | Sets the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
eac3Settings_drcLine :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DrcLine)

-- | When set to shift90Degrees, applies a 90-degree phase shift to the
--   surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_phaseControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3PhaseControl)

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, sets whether an extra center back surround
--   channel is matrix encoded into the left and right surround channels.
eac3Settings_surroundExMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode)

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream.
--   See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E) for background on these values.
eac3Settings_bitstreamMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode)

-- | When set to attenuate3Db, applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround
--   channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_attenuationControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When encoding 2/0 audio, sets whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded
--   into the two channels.
eac3Settings_surroundMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3SurroundMode)

-- | When set to whenPossible, input DD+ audio will be passed through if it
--   is present on the input. This detection is dynamic over the life of
--   the transcode. Inputs that alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content
--   will have a consistent DD+ output as the system alternates between
--   passthrough and encoding.
eac3Settings_passthroughControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl)

-- | When set to followInput, encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD,
--   DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not
--   supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings
--   will be used.
eac3Settings_metadataControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3MetadataControl)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Eac3Settings.Eac3Settings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Ebu Tt DDestination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EbuTtDDestinationSettings
EbuTtDDestinationSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl -> Maybe Text -> EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. Complete this field if you want to include the
--   name of the copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
[$sel:copyrightHolder:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies how to handle the gap between the lines (in multi-line
--   captions). - enabled: Fill with the captions background color (as
--   specified in the input captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
[$sel:fillLineGap:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl

-- | Specifies the style information (font color, font position, and so on)
--   to include in the font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. -
--   include: Take the style information (font color, font position, and so
--   on) from the source captions and include that information in the font
--   data attached to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the
--   source captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
[$sel:styleControl:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl

-- | Specifies the font family to include in the font data attached to the
--   EBU-TT captions. Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you
--   leave this field empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If
--   styleControl is set to exclude, the font family is always set to
--   "monospaced".) You specify only the font family. All other style
--   information (color, bold, position and so on) is copied from the input
--   captions. The size is always set to 100% to allow the downstream
--   player to choose the size. - Enter a list of font families, as a
--   comma-separated list of font names, in order of preference. The name
--   can be a font family (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such
--   as serif), or default (to let the downstream player choose the
--   font). - Leave blank to set the family to monospace.
[$sel:fontFamily:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyrightHolder:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_copyrightHolder</a> - Applies only if you
--   plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an
--   output. Complete this field if you want to include the name of the
--   copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
--   
--   <a>$sel:fillLineGap:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fillLineGap</a> - Specifies how to handle
--   the gap between the lines (in multi-line captions). - enabled: Fill
--   with the captions background color (as specified in the input
--   captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:styleControl:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Specifies the style
--   information (font color, font position, and so on) to include in the
--   font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. - include: Take the
--   style information (font color, font position, and so on) from the
--   source captions and include that information in the font data attached
--   to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the source
--   captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontFamily:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fontFamily</a> - Specifies the font
--   family to include in the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions.
--   Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you leave this field
--   empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If styleControl is set
--   to exclude, the font family is always set to "monospaced".) You
--   specify only the font family. All other style information (color,
--   bold, position and so on) is copied from the input captions. The size
--   is always set to 100% to allow the downstream player to choose the
--   size. - Enter a list of font families, as a comma-separated list of
--   font names, in order of preference. The name can be a font family
--   (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such as serif), or
--   default (to let the downstream player choose the font). - Leave
--   blank to set the family to monospace.
newEbuTtDDestinationSettings :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. Complete this field if you want to include the
--   name of the copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_copyrightHolder :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how to handle the gap between the lines (in multi-line
--   captions). - enabled: Fill with the captions background color (as
--   specified in the input captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fillLineGap :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl)

-- | Specifies the style information (font color, font position, and so on)
--   to include in the font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. -
--   include: Take the style information (font color, font position, and so
--   on) from the source captions and include that information in the font
--   data attached to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the
--   source captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_styleControl :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl)

-- | Specifies the font family to include in the font data attached to the
--   EBU-TT captions. Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you
--   leave this field empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If
--   styleControl is set to exclude, the font family is always set to
--   "monospaced".) You specify only the font family. All other style
--   information (color, bold, position and so on) is copied from the input
--   captions. The size is always set to 100% to allow the downstream
--   player to choose the size. - Enter a list of font families, as a
--   comma-separated list of font names, in order of preference. The name
--   can be a font family (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such
--   as serif), or default (to let the downstream player choose the
--   font). - Leave blank to set the family to monospace.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fontFamily :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.EbuTtDDestinationSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.EbuTtDDestinationSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings

-- | Embedded Plus Scte20 Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings
EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings' :: EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EmbeddedSourceSettings

-- | Embedded Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmbeddedSourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EmbeddedSourceSettings
EmbeddedSourceSettings' :: Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection -> Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708 -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> EmbeddedSourceSettings

-- | Set to "auto" to handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned
--   SCTE-20 and Embedded captions.
[$sel:scte20Detection:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
[$sel:convert608To708:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
[$sel:source608TrackNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
[$sel:source608ChannelNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>EmbeddedSourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte20Detection:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_scte20Detection</a> - Set to "auto" to
--   handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned SCTE-20 and
--   Embedded captions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:convert608To708:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_convert608To708</a> - If upconvert, 608 data
--   is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the
--   708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the
--   source content will be discarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608TrackNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_source608TrackNumber</a> - This field is
--   unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608ChannelNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber</a> - Specifies the
--   608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract
--   captions. Unused for passthrough.
newEmbeddedSourceSettings :: EmbeddedSourceSettings

-- | Set to "auto" to handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned
--   SCTE-20 and Embedded captions.
embeddedSourceSettings_scte20Detection :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection)

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
embeddedSourceSettings_convert608To708 :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708)

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
embeddedSourceSettings_source608TrackNumber :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
embeddedSourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EmbeddedSourceSettings.EmbeddedSourceSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EmbeddedSourceSettings.EmbeddedSourceSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FeatureActivations

-- | Feature Activations
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFeatureActivations</a> smart constructor.
data FeatureActivations
FeatureActivations' :: Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions -> FeatureActivations

-- | Enables the Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare
--   actions in the schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you
--   disable the feature on an existing schedule, make sure that you first
--   delete all input prepare actions from the schedule.
[$sel:inputPrepareScheduleActions:FeatureActivations'] :: FeatureActivations -> Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions

-- | Create a value of <a>FeatureActivations</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPrepareScheduleActions:FeatureActivations'</a>,
--   <a>featureActivations_inputPrepareScheduleActions</a> - Enables the
--   Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare actions in the
--   schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you disable the feature
--   on an existing schedule, make sure that you first delete all input
--   prepare actions from the schedule.
newFeatureActivations :: FeatureActivations

-- | Enables the Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare
--   actions in the schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you
--   disable the feature on an existing schedule, make sure that you first
--   delete all input prepare actions from the schedule.
featureActivations_inputPrepareScheduleActions :: Lens' FeatureActivations (Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings

-- | Fec Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFecOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FecOutputSettings
FecOutputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec -> FecOutputSettings

-- | Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1. The width of the FEC protection matrix.
--   Must be between 1 and 20, inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then
--   larger values increase robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is
--   the number of transport stream packets per row error correction
--   packet, and the value must be between 4 and 20, inclusive, if
--   includeFec is columnAndRow. If includeFec is column, this value must
--   be 1 to 20, inclusive.
[$sel:rowLength:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1. The height of the FEC protection
--   matrix. The number of transport stream packets per column error
--   correction packet. Must be between 4 and 20, inclusive.
[$sel:columnDepth:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Enables column only or column and row based FEC
[$sel:includeFec:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec

-- | Create a value of <a>FecOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowLength:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_rowLength</a> - Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The width of the FEC protection matrix. Must be between 1 and 20,
--   inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then larger values increase
--   robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is the number of transport
--   stream packets per row error correction packet, and the value must be
--   between 4 and 20, inclusive, if includeFec is columnAndRow. If
--   includeFec is column, this value must be 1 to 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnDepth:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_columnDepth</a> - Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The height of the FEC protection matrix. The number of transport
--   stream packets per column error correction packet. Must be between 4
--   and 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeFec:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_includeFec</a> - Enables column only or column
--   and row based FEC
newFecOutputSettings :: FecOutputSettings

-- | Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1. The width of the FEC protection matrix.
--   Must be between 1 and 20, inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then
--   larger values increase robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is
--   the number of transport stream packets per row error correction
--   packet, and the value must be between 4 and 20, inclusive, if
--   includeFec is columnAndRow. If includeFec is column, this value must
--   be 1 to 20, inclusive.
fecOutputSettings_rowLength :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1. The height of the FEC protection
--   matrix. The number of transport stream packets per column error
--   correction packet. Must be between 4 and 20, inclusive.
fecOutputSettings_columnDepth :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Enables column only or column and row based FEC
fecOutputSettings_includeFec :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FecOutputSettings.FecOutputSettings
