module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Start time for the action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings' :: Text -> FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for
--   the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to
--   the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All
--   the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the
--   two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
[$sel:time:FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:time:FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings_time</a> - Start time for the
--   action to start in the channel. (Not the time for the action to be
--   added to the schedule: actions are always added to the schedule
--   immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All the letters
--   are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the two constants
--   "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Text -> FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for
--   the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to
--   the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All
--   the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the
--   two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings_time :: Lens' FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings

-- | Fmp4 Hls Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFmp4HlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Fmp4HlsSettings
Fmp4HlsSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Fmp4NielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe Fmp4TimedMetadataBehavior -> Fmp4HlsSettings

-- | List all the audio groups that are used with the video output stream.
--   Input all the audio GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video,
--   separate by ','.
[$sel:audioRenditionSets:Fmp4HlsSettings'] :: Fmp4HlsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
[$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'] :: Fmp4HlsSettings -> Maybe Fmp4NielsenId3Behavior

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input
--   to output.
[$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'] :: Fmp4HlsSettings -> Maybe Fmp4TimedMetadataBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>Fmp4HlsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioRenditionSets:Fmp4HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fmp4HlsSettings_audioRenditionSets</a> - List all the audio groups
--   that are used with the video output stream. Input all the audio
--   GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video, separate by ','.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fmp4HlsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fmp4HlsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to
--   passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input to output.
newFmp4HlsSettings :: Fmp4HlsSettings

-- | List all the audio groups that are used with the video output stream.
--   Input all the audio GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video,
--   separate by ','.
fmp4HlsSettings_audioRenditionSets :: Lens' Fmp4HlsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
fmp4HlsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior :: Lens' Fmp4HlsSettings (Maybe Fmp4NielsenId3Behavior)

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input
--   to output.
fmp4HlsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior :: Lens' Fmp4HlsSettings (Maybe Fmp4TimedMetadataBehavior)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings.Fmp4HlsSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings.Fmp4HlsSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings.Fmp4HlsSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings.Fmp4HlsSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Fmp4HlsSettings.Fmp4HlsSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Settings to specify if an action follows another.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings
FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings' :: Text -> FollowPoint -> FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | The action name of another action that this one refers to.
[$sel:referenceActionName:FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> Text

-- | Identifies whether this action starts relative to the start or
--   relative to the end of the reference action.
[$sel:followPoint:FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> FollowPoint

-- | Create a value of <a>FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   action name of another action that this one refers to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:followPoint:FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>followModeScheduleActionStartSettings_followPoint</a> - Identifies
--   whether this action starts relative to the start or relative to the
--   end of the reference action.
newFollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Text -> FollowPoint -> FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | The action name of another action that this one refers to.
followModeScheduleActionStartSettings_referenceActionName :: Lens' FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings Text

--   relative to the end of the reference action.
followModeScheduleActionStartSettings_followPoint :: Lens' FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings FollowPoint

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FrameCaptureSettings

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFrameCaptureSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FrameCaptureSettings
FrameCaptureSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe FrameCaptureIntervalUnit -> FrameCaptureSettings

-- | The frequency at which to capture frames for inclusion in the output.
--   May be specified in either seconds or milliseconds, as specified by
--   captureIntervalUnits.
[$sel:captureInterval:FrameCaptureSettings'] :: FrameCaptureSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Unit for the frame capture interval.
[$sel:captureIntervalUnits:FrameCaptureSettings'] :: FrameCaptureSettings -> Maybe FrameCaptureIntervalUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>FrameCaptureSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:captureInterval:FrameCaptureSettings'</a>,
--   <a>frameCaptureSettings_captureInterval</a> - The frequency at which
--   to capture frames for inclusion in the output. May be specified in
--   either seconds or milliseconds, as specified by captureIntervalUnits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captureIntervalUnits:FrameCaptureSettings'</a>,
--   <a>frameCaptureSettings_captureIntervalUnits</a> - Unit for the frame
--   capture interval.
newFrameCaptureSettings :: FrameCaptureSettings

-- | The frequency at which to capture frames for inclusion in the output.
--   May be specified in either seconds or milliseconds, as specified by
--   captureIntervalUnits.
frameCaptureSettings_captureInterval :: Lens' FrameCaptureSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Unit for the frame capture interval.
frameCaptureSettings_captureIntervalUnits :: Lens' FrameCaptureSettings (Maybe FrameCaptureIntervalUnit)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Hdr10Settings

-- | Hdr10 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHdr10Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Hdr10Settings
Hdr10Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Hdr10Settings

-- | Maximum Content Light Level An integer metadata value defining the
--   maximum light level, in nits, of any single pixel within an encoded
--   HDR video stream or file.
[$sel:maxCll:Hdr10Settings'] :: Hdr10Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Maximum Frame Average Light Level An integer metadata value defining
--   the maximum average light level, in nits, for any single frame within
--   an encoded HDR video stream or file.
[$sel:maxFall:Hdr10Settings'] :: Hdr10Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Hdr10Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxCll:Hdr10Settings'</a>, <a>hdr10Settings_maxCll</a> -
--   Maximum Content Light Level An integer metadata value defining the
--   maximum light level, in nits, of any single pixel within an encoded
--   HDR video stream or file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFall:Hdr10Settings'</a>, <a>hdr10Settings_maxFall</a> -
--   Maximum Frame Average Light Level An integer metadata value defining
--   the maximum average light level, in nits, for any single frame within
--   an encoded HDR video stream or file.
newHdr10Settings :: Hdr10Settings

-- | Maximum Content Light Level An integer metadata value defining the
--   maximum light level, in nits, of any single pixel within an encoded
--   HDR video stream or file.
hdr10Settings_maxCll :: Lens' Hdr10Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Maximum Frame Average Light Level An integer metadata value defining
--   the maximum average light level, in nits, for any single frame within
--   an encoded HDR video stream or file.
hdr10Settings_maxFall :: Lens' Hdr10Settings (Maybe Natural)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsAkamaiSettings

-- | Hls Akamai Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsAkamaiSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsAkamaiSettings
HlsAkamaiSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsAkamaiHttpTransferMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> HlsAkamaiSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to Akamai.
--   User should contact Akamai to enable this feature.
[$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe HlsAkamaiHttpTransferMode

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Token parameter for authenticated akamai. If not specified, _gda_ is
--   used.
[$sel:token:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Salt for authenticated Akamai.
[$sel:salt:HlsAkamaiSettings'] :: HlsAkamaiSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsAkamaiSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of file
--   cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_httpTransferMode</a> - Specify whether or not to
--   use chunked transfer encoding to Akamai. User should contact Akamai to
--   enable this feature.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts that
--   will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the connection is
--   lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:token:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>, <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_token</a> -
--   Token parameter for authenticated akamai. If not specified, _gda_ is
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
--   
--   <a>$sel:salt:HlsAkamaiSettings'</a>, <a>hlsAkamaiSettings_salt</a> -
--   Salt for authenticated Akamai.
newHlsAkamaiSettings :: HlsAkamaiSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
hlsAkamaiSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to Akamai.
--   User should contact Akamai to enable this feature.
hlsAkamaiSettings_httpTransferMode :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe HlsAkamaiHttpTransferMode)

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
hlsAkamaiSettings_numRetries :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
hlsAkamaiSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Token parameter for authenticated akamai. If not specified, _gda_ is
--   used.
hlsAkamaiSettings_token :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsAkamaiSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Salt for authenticated Akamai.
hlsAkamaiSettings_salt :: Lens' HlsAkamaiSettings (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsAkamaiSettings.HlsAkamaiSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsAkamaiSettings.HlsAkamaiSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsBasicPutSettings

-- | Hls Basic Put Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsBasicPutSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsBasicPutSettings
HlsBasicPutSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HlsBasicPutSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsBasicPutSettings'] :: HlsBasicPutSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsBasicPutSettings'] :: HlsBasicPutSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsBasicPutSettings'] :: HlsBasicPutSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsBasicPutSettings'] :: HlsBasicPutSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsBasicPutSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsBasicPutSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsBasicPutSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of file
--   cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsBasicPutSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsBasicPutSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts that
--   will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsBasicPutSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsBasicPutSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the connection is
--   lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsBasicPutSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsBasicPutSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
newHlsBasicPutSettings :: HlsBasicPutSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
hlsBasicPutSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' HlsBasicPutSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
hlsBasicPutSettings_numRetries :: Lens' HlsBasicPutSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
hlsBasicPutSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsBasicPutSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsBasicPutSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsBasicPutSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsBasicPutSettings.HlsBasicPutSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsBasicPutSettings.HlsBasicPutSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsBasicPutSettings.HlsBasicPutSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for the action to insert a user-defined ID3 tag in each HLS
--   segment
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings
HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings' :: Text -> HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | ID3 tag to insert into each segment. Supports special keyword
--   identifiers to substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported
--   keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
[$sel:tag:HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings'] :: HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings_tag</a> - ID3 tag to
--   insert into each segment. Supports special keyword identifiers to
--   substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
newHlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings :: Text -> HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | ID3 tag to insert into each segment. Supports special keyword
--   identifiers to substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported
--   keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
hlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings_tag :: Lens' HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings Text

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings

-- | Hls Media Store Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsMediaStoreSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsMediaStoreSettings
HlsMediaStoreSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HlsMediaStoreSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When set to temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory
--   for faster reading and writing.
[$sel:mediaStoreStorageClass:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsMediaStoreSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of
--   file cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts
--   that will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaStoreStorageClass:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_mediaStoreStorageClass</a> - When set to
--   temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory for faster
--   reading and writing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of
--   seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output
--   fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value
--   of 0 means never restart.
newHlsMediaStoreSettings :: HlsMediaStoreSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_numRetries :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When set to temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory
--   for faster reading and writing.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_mediaStoreStorageClass :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsMediaStoreSettings.HlsMediaStoreSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings

-- | Hls Input Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsInputSettings
HlsInputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsScte35SourceType -> HlsInputSettings

-- | The number of seconds between retries when an attempt to read a
--   manifest or segment fails.
[$sel:retryInterval:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified the HLS stream with the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most
--   closely matches this value will be chosen, otherwise the highest
--   bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be chosen. The bitrate is specified
--   in bits per second, as in an HLS manifest.
[$sel:bandwidth:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
[$sel:retries:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, reading of the HLS input will begin this many buffer
--   segments from the end (most recently written segment). When not
--   specified, the HLS input will begin with the first segment specified
--   in the m3u8.
[$sel:bufferSegments:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the source for the SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will
--   ingest. Messages can be ingested from the content segments (in the
--   stream) or from tags in the playlist (the HLS manifest). MediaLive
--   ignores SCTE-35 information in the source that is not selected.
[$sel:scte35Source:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe HlsScte35SourceType

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsInputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryInterval:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_retryInterval</a> - The number of seconds between
--   retries when an attempt to read a manifest or segment fails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bandwidth:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bandwidth</a> - When specified the HLS stream with
--   the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most closely matches this value will be
--   chosen, otherwise the highest bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be
--   chosen. The bitrate is specified in bits per second, as in an HLS
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retries:HlsInputSettings'</a>, <a>hlsInputSettings_retries</a>
--   - The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferSegments:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bufferSegments</a> - When specified, reading of
--   the HLS input will begin this many buffer segments from the end (most
--   recently written segment). When not specified, the HLS input will
--   begin with the first segment specified in the m3u8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Source:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_scte35Source</a> - Identifies the source for the
--   SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will ingest. Messages can be ingested
--   from the content segments (in the stream) or from tags in the playlist
--   (the HLS manifest). MediaLive ignores SCTE-35 information in the
--   source that is not selected.
newHlsInputSettings :: HlsInputSettings

-- | The number of seconds between retries when an attempt to read a
--   manifest or segment fails.
hlsInputSettings_retryInterval :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified the HLS stream with the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most
--   closely matches this value will be chosen, otherwise the highest
--   bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be chosen. The bitrate is specified
--   in bits per second, as in an HLS manifest.
hlsInputSettings_bandwidth :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
hlsInputSettings_retries :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, reading of the HLS input will begin this many buffer
--   segments from the end (most recently written segment). When not
--   specified, the HLS input will begin with the first segment specified
--   in the m3u8.
hlsInputSettings_bufferSegments :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Identifies the source for the SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will
--   ingest. Messages can be ingested from the content segments (in the
--   stream) or from tags in the playlist (the HLS manifest). MediaLive
--   ignores SCTE-35 information in the source that is not selected.
hlsInputSettings_scte35Source :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe HlsScte35SourceType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsInputSettings.HlsInputSettings

pattern HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode_CHUNKED :: HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode

instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode.HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings

-- | Hls Webdav Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsWebdavSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsWebdavSettings
HlsWebdavSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HlsWebdavSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to WebDAV.
[$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsWebdavSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of file
--   cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_httpTransferMode</a> - Specify whether or not to
--   use chunked transfer encoding to WebDAV.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts that
--   will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the connection is
--   lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
newHlsWebdavSettings :: HlsWebdavSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
hlsWebdavSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to WebDAV.
hlsWebdavSettings_httpTransferMode :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode)

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
hlsWebdavSettings_numRetries :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
hlsWebdavSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsWebdavSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsWebdavSettings.HlsWebdavSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel

-- | Input Channel Level
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputChannelLevel</a> smart constructor.
data InputChannelLevel
InputChannelLevel' :: Natural -> Int -> InputChannelLevel

-- | The index of the input channel used as a source.
[$sel:inputChannel:InputChannelLevel'] :: InputChannelLevel -> Natural

-- | Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.
[$sel:gain:InputChannelLevel'] :: InputChannelLevel -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InputChannelLevel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputChannel:InputChannelLevel'</a>,
--   <a>inputChannelLevel_inputChannel</a> - The index of the input channel
--   used as a source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gain:InputChannelLevel'</a>, <a>inputChannelLevel_gain</a> -
--   Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.
newInputChannelLevel :: Natural -> Int -> InputChannelLevel

-- | The index of the input channel used as a source.
inputChannelLevel_inputChannel :: Lens' InputChannelLevel Natural

-- | Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.
inputChannelLevel_gain :: Lens' InputChannelLevel Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputChannelLevel.InputChannelLevel

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioChannelMapping</a> smart constructor.

-- | The index of the output channel being produced.
[$sel:outputChannel:AudioChannelMapping'] :: AudioChannelMapping -> Natural

-- | Indices and gain values for each input channel that should be remixed
--   into this output channel.

--   channel being produced.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputChannelLevels:AudioChannelMapping'</a>,
--   <a>audioChannelMapping_inputChannelLevels</a> - Indices and gain
--   values for each input channel that should be remixed into this output
--   channel.
newAudioChannelMapping :: Natural -> AudioChannelMapping

-- | The index of the output channel being produced.
audioChannelMapping_outputChannel :: Lens' AudioChannelMapping Natural

-- | Indices and gain values for each input channel that should be remixed
--   into this output channel.
audioChannelMapping_inputChannelLevels :: Lens' AudioChannelMapping [InputChannelLevel]

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestinationRequest

-- | Endpoint settings for a PUSH type input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDestinationRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InputDestinationRequest
InputDestinationRequest' :: Maybe Text -> InputDestinationRequest

-- | A unique name for the location the RTMP stream is being pushed to.
[$sel:streamName:InputDestinationRequest'] :: InputDestinationRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDestinationRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:InputDestinationRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputDestinationRequest_streamName</a> - A unique name for the
--   location the RTMP stream is being pushed to.
newInputDestinationRequest :: InputDestinationRequest

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination

-- | The settings for a PUSH type input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDestination</a> smart constructor.
data InputDestination
InputDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDestinationVpc -> InputDestination

-- | The system-generated static IP address of endpoint. It remains fixed
--   for the lifetime of the input.
[$sel:ip:InputDestination'] :: InputDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The port number for the input.
[$sel:port:InputDestination'] :: InputDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | This represents the endpoint that the customer stream will be pushed
--   to.
[$sel:url:InputDestination'] :: InputDestination -> Maybe Text
[$sel:vpc:InputDestination'] :: InputDestination -> Maybe InputDestinationVpc

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:InputDestination'</a>, <a>inputDestination_ip</a> - The
--   system-generated static IP address of endpoint. It remains fixed for
--   the lifetime of the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:InputDestination'</a>, <a>inputDestination_port</a> - The
--   port number for the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:InputDestination'</a>, <a>inputDestination_url</a> - This
--   represents the endpoint that the customer stream will be pushed to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:InputDestination'</a>, <a>inputDestination_vpc</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newInputDestination :: InputDestination

-- | The system-generated static IP address of endpoint. It remains fixed
--   for the lifetime of the input.
inputDestination_ip :: Lens' InputDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | The port number for the input.
inputDestination_port :: Lens' InputDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | This represents the endpoint that the customer stream will be pushed
--   to.
inputDestination_url :: Lens' InputDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
inputDestination_vpc :: Lens' InputDestination (Maybe InputDestinationVpc)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDestination.InputDestination

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

-- | Configurable settings for the input device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceConfigurableSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
InputDeviceConfigurableSettings' :: Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput -> Maybe Int -> InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

-- | The input source that you want to use. If the device has a source
--   connected to only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which
--   source the device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources
--   connected to both its input ports, and you want to use a specific
--   source, specify the source.
[$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'] :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput

-- | The maximum bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle
--   the bitrate of the source video.
[$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'] :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDeviceConfigurableSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_configuredInput</a> - The input
--   source that you want to use. If the device has a source connected to
--   only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which source the
--   device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources connected to
--   both its input ports, and you want to use a specific source, specify
--   the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_maxBitrate</a> - The maximum
--   bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle the bitrate
--   of the source video.
newInputDeviceConfigurableSettings :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

-- | The input source that you want to use. If the device has a source
--   connected to only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which
--   source the device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources
--   connected to both its input ports, and you want to use a specific
--   source, specify the source.
inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_configuredInput :: Lens' InputDeviceConfigurableSettings (Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput)

-- | The maximum bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle
--   the bitrate of the source video.
inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_maxBitrate :: Lens' InputDeviceConfigurableSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings.InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceNetworkSettings</a> smart constructor.

--   IP address.

--   
--   <a>$sel:ipScheme:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'</a>,

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceHdSettings

-- | Settings that describe the active source from the input device, and
--   the video characteristics of that source.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceHdSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputDeviceHdSettings
InputDeviceHdSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceScanType -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput -> Maybe Double -> Maybe InputDeviceState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceActiveInput -> InputDeviceHdSettings

-- | The height of the video source, in pixels.
[$sel:height:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The scan type of the video source.
[$sel:scanType:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceScanType

-- | The width of the video source, in pixels.
[$sel:width:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The source at the input device that is currently active. You can
--   specify this source.
[$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput

-- | The frame rate of the video source.
[$sel:framerate:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The state of the input device.
[$sel:deviceState:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceState

-- | The current maximum bitrate for ingesting this source, in bits per
--   second. You can specify this maximum.
[$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | If you specified Auto as the configured input, specifies which of the
--   sources is currently active (SDI or HDMI).
[$sel:activeInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceActiveInput

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDeviceHdSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_height</a> - The height of the video source,
--   in pixels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scanType:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_scanType</a> - The scan type of the video
--   source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_width</a> - The width of the video source, in
--   pixels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_configuredInput</a> - The source at the input
--   device that is currently active. You can specify this source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerate:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_framerate</a> - The frame rate of the video
--   source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceState:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_deviceState</a> - The state of the input
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_maxBitrate</a> - The current maximum bitrate
--   for ingesting this source, in bits per second. You can specify this
--   maximum.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_activeInput</a> - If you specified Auto as
--   the configured input, specifies which of the sources is currently
--   active (SDI or HDMI).

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary

-- | Details of the input device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data InputDeviceSummary
InputDeviceSummary' :: Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState -> Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDeviceType -> Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState -> InputDeviceSummary

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type UHD.
[$sel:uhdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings

-- | The network MAC address of the input device.
[$sel:macAddress:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type HD.
[$sel:hdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings

-- | The state of the connection between the input device and AWS.
[$sel:connectionState:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState

-- | Network settings for the input device.
[$sel:networkSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings

-- | The status of software on the input device.
[$sel:deviceUpdateStatus:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus

-- | The unique ARN of the input device.
[$sel:arn:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the input device.
[$sel:id:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A name that you specify for the input device.
[$sel:name:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique serial number of the input device.
[$sel:serialNumber:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the input device.
[$sel:type':InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceType

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
[$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDeviceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uhdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_uhdDeviceSettings</a> - Settings that describe
--   an input device that is type UHD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_macAddress</a> - The network MAC address of the
--   input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_hdDeviceSettings</a> - Settings that describe an
--   input device that is type HD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionState:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_connectionState</a> - The state of the
--   connection between the input device and AWS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_networkSettings</a> - Network settings for the
--   input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceUpdateStatus:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_deviceUpdateStatus</a> - The status of software
--   on the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_arn</a> -
--   The unique ARN of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique ID of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_name</a> -
--   A name that you specify for the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_serialNumber</a> - The unique serial number of
--   the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_type</a>
--   - The type of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_deviceSettingsSyncState</a> - The status of the
--   action to synchronize the device configuration. If you change the
--   configuration of the input device (for example, the maximum bitrate),
--   MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The device might not
--   update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device has updated its
--   configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated its
--   configuration.
newInputDeviceSummary :: InputDeviceSummary

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type UHD.
inputDeviceSummary_uhdDeviceSettings :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings)

-- | The network MAC address of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_macAddress :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type HD.
inputDeviceSummary_hdDeviceSettings :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings)

-- | The state of the connection between the input device and AWS.
inputDeviceSummary_connectionState :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState)

-- | Network settings for the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_networkSettings :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings)

-- | The status of software on the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_deviceUpdateStatus :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus)

-- | The unique ARN of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_arn :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_id :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A name that you specify for the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_name :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique serial number of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_serialNumber :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_type :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceType)

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
inputDeviceSummary_deviceSettingsSyncState :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputDeviceSummary.InputDeviceSummary


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter

-- | Input Filter
newtype InputFilter

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputFilter.InputFilter


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation

-- | Input Location
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLocation</a> smart constructor.
data InputLocation
InputLocation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> InputLocation

-- | key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
[$sel:passwordParam:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:username:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniform Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file
--   accessible to the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the
--   output type. For example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar
--   to: "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
[$sel:uri:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLocation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordParam:InputLocation'</a>,
--   <a>inputLocation_passwordParam</a> - key used to extract the password
--   from EC2 Parameter store
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:InputLocation'</a>, <a>inputLocation_username</a> -
--   Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:uri:InputLocation'</a>, <a>inputLocation_uri</a> - Uniform
--   Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file accessible to
--   the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the output type. For
--   example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar to:
--   "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
newInputLocation :: Text -> InputLocation

-- | key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
inputLocation_passwordParam :: Lens' InputLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLocation_username :: Lens' InputLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniform Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file
--   accessible to the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the
--   output type. For example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar
--   to: "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
inputLocation_uri :: Lens' InputLocation Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLocation.InputLocation


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | Dvb Sub Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSubDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSubDestinationSettings
DvbSubDestinationSettings' :: Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings
--   are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
[$sel:alignment:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
[$sel:teletextGridControl:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it
--   to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:xPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor

-- | When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowXOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:font:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
[$sel:yPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontResolution:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowYOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSubDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These
--   source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL,
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to auto fontSize
--   will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive
--   integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newDvbSubDestinationSettings :: DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings
--   are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_alignment :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor)

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor)

--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl)

--   transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it
--   to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no

--   be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for

--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_xPosition :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor)
