--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontSize :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor)

--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_yPosition :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineSize :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontResolution :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | Burn In Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBurnInDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data BurnInDestinationSettings
BurnInDestinationSettings' :: Maybe BurnInAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInShadowColor -> Maybe BurnInOutlineColor -> Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
[$sel:alignment:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInAlignment

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInShadowColor

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInOutlineColor

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
[$sel:teletextGridControl:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to
--   0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
[$sel:xPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInFontColor

-- | When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowXOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:font:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must
--   match.
[$sel:yPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontResolution:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowYOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BurnInDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to 'auto'
--   fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a
--   positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newBurnInDestinationSettings :: BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_alignment :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInAlignment)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInShadowColor)

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_outlineColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInOutlineColor)

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
burnInDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to
--   0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInFontColor)

-- | When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontSize :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_font :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor)

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must
--   match.
burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BurnInDestinationSettings.BurnInDestinationSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BurnInDestinationSettings.BurnInDestinationSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate

-- | Blackout Slate
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlackoutSlate</a> smart constructor.
data BlackoutSlate
BlackoutSlate' :: Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BlackoutSlateState -> Maybe Text -> BlackoutSlate

-- | Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp
--   and png images are supported.
[$sel:blackoutSlateImage:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio,
--   and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an
--   SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor
--   is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must
--   contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
[$sel:networkEndBlackout:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout

-- | Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be
--   scaled to fill the entire output raster.
[$sel:networkEndBlackoutImage:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when indicated by program metadata.
[$sel:state:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe BlackoutSlateState

-- | Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
[$sel:networkId:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlackoutSlate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackoutSlateImage:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_blackoutSlateImage</a> - Blackout slate image to be
--   used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are
--   supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkEndBlackout:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout</a> - Setting to enabled causes
--   the encoder to blackout the video, audio, and captions, and raise the
--   "Network Blackout Image" slate when an SCTE104/35 Network End
--   Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The blackout will be lifted
--   when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   Network End and Network Start descriptors must contain a network ID
--   that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkEndBlackoutImage:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage</a> - Path to local file to
--   use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be scaled to fill the
--   entire output raster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_state</a> - When
--   set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when
--   indicated by program metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkId:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_networkId</a> -
--   Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
newBlackoutSlate :: BlackoutSlate

-- | Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp
--   and png images are supported.
blackoutSlate_blackoutSlateImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio,
--   and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an
--   SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor
--   is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must
--   contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout)

-- | Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be
--   scaled to fill the entire output raster.
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when indicated by program metadata.
blackoutSlate_state :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateState)

-- | Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
blackoutSlate_networkId :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlate


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking

-- | Avail Blanking
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAvailBlanking</a> smart constructor.
data AvailBlanking
AvailBlanking' :: Maybe AvailBlankingState -> Maybe InputLocation -> AvailBlanking

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when insertion metadata is added.
[$sel:state:AvailBlanking'] :: AvailBlanking -> Maybe AvailBlankingState

-- | Blanking image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and
--   png images are supported.
[$sel:availBlankingImage:AvailBlanking'] :: AvailBlanking -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>AvailBlanking</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:AvailBlanking'</a>, <a>availBlanking_state</a> - When
--   set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when
--   insertion metadata is added.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availBlankingImage:AvailBlanking'</a>,
--   <a>availBlanking_availBlankingImage</a> - Blanking image to be used.
--   Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are supported.
newAvailBlanking :: AvailBlanking

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when insertion metadata is added.
availBlanking_state :: Lens' AvailBlanking (Maybe AvailBlankingState)

-- | Blanking image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and
--   png images are supported.
availBlanking_availBlankingImage :: Lens' AvailBlanking (Maybe InputLocation)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AvailBlanking.AvailBlanking


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Audio Only Hls Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioOnlyHlsSettings
AudioOnlyHlsSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType -> Maybe InputLocation -> AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.
[$sel:audioGroupId:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Four types of audio-only tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant
--   Stream The client can play back this audio-only stream instead of
--   video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   in the HLS manifest. Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client should try to play back by default.
--   Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES,
--   AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented
--   as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client
--   will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in
--   the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
[$sel:audioTrackType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType

-- | Specifies the segment type.
[$sel:segmentType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType

-- | Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for
--   an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the
--   image increases the output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to
--   the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per
--   the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
[$sel:audioOnlyImage:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioGroupId:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId</a> - Specifies the group to
--   which the audio Rendition belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTrackType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType</a> - Four types of audio-only
--   tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant Stream The client can play
--   back this audio-only stream instead of video in low-bandwidth
--   scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF in the HLS manifest.
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client should try to play back by default. Represented as an
--   EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client may try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA
--   in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio,
--   not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client will not try to
--   play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS
--   manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType</a> - Specifies the segment type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioOnlyImage:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage</a> - Optional. Specifies the
--   .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for an audio-only output.
--   We recommend a low bit-size file because the image increases the
--   output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to the audio as an ID3
--   tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per the "ID3 tag version
--   2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
newAudioOnlyHlsSettings :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Four types of audio-only tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant
--   Stream The client can play back this audio-only stream instead of
--   video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   in the HLS manifest. Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client should try to play back by default.
--   Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES,
--   AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented
--   as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client
--   will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in
--   the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType)

-- | Specifies the segment type.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType)

-- | Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for
--   an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the
--   image increases the output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to
--   the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per
--   the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe InputLocation)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyHlsSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossFailoverSettings
InputLossFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After
--   that time, an input failover will occur.
[$sel:inputLossThresholdMsec:InputLossFailoverSettings'] :: InputLossFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLossFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossThresholdMsec:InputLossFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossFailoverSettings_inputLossThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After that time,
--   an input failover will occur.
newInputLossFailoverSettings :: InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After
--   that time, an input failover will occur.
inputLossFailoverSettings_inputLossThresholdMsec :: Lens' InputLossFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputLossBehavior

-- | Input Loss Behavior
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossBehavior
InputLossBehavior' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossImageType -> InputLossBehavior

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:blackFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Natural

-- | When input loss image type is "color" this field specifies the color
--   to use. Value: 6 hex characters representing the values of RGB.
[$sel:inputLossImageColor:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Text

-- | When input loss image type is "slate" these fields specify the
--   parameters for accessing the slate.
[$sel:inputLossImageSlate:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:repeatFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether to substitute a solid color or a slate into the
--   output after input loss exceeds blackFrameMsec.
[$sel:inputLossImageType:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe InputLossImageType

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLossBehavior</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_blackFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageColor:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageColor</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "color" this field specifies the color to use. Value: 6 hex
--   characters representing the values of RGB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageSlate:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageSlate</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "slate" these fields specify the parameters for accessing the
--   slate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repeatFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_repeatFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageType:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageType</a> - Indicates whether to
--   substitute a solid color or a slate into the output after input loss
--   exceeds blackFrameMsec.
newInputLossBehavior :: InputLossBehavior

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLossBehavior_blackFrameMsec :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Natural)

-- | When input loss image type is "color" this field specifies the color
--   to use. Value: 6 hex characters representing the values of RGB.
inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageColor :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Text)

-- | When input loss image type is "slate" these fields specify the
--   parameters for accessing the slate.
inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageSlate :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLossBehavior_repeatFrameMsec :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Natural)

--   output after input loss exceeds blackFrameMsec.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration

-- | Global Configuration
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlobalConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data GlobalConfiguration
GlobalConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs -> Maybe InputLossBehavior -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource -> GlobalConfiguration

-- | Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.
[$sel:initialAudioGain:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g.
--   end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will
--   restart at the beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured
--   the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user
--   specified slate images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration
--   until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the
--   Channel Schedule API).
[$sel:inputEndAction:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction

-- | Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING -
--   MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the other. EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the
--   output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.
[$sel:outputLockingMode:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode

-- | Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates.
--   This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one
--   video frame per second.
[$sel:supportLowFramerateInputs:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs

-- | Settings for system actions when input is lost.
[$sel:inputLossBehavior:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe InputLossBehavior

-- | Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder
--   should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to
--   another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source
--   that is providing the input stream.
[$sel:outputTimingSource:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource

-- | Create a value of <a>GlobalConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialAudioGain:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_initialAudioGain</a> - Value to set the initial
--   audio gain for the Live Event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputEndAction:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputEndAction</a> - Indicates the action to
--   take when the current input completes (e.g. end-of-file). When
--   switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will restart at the
--   beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured the encoder
--   will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user specified slate
--   images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration until the next
--   input switch occurs (which is controlled through the Channel Schedule
--   API).
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLockingMode:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputLockingMode</a> - Indicates how MediaLive
--   pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt
--   to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the other. EPOCH_LOCKING
--   - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the Unix epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportLowFramerateInputs:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_supportLowFramerateInputs</a> - Adjusts video
--   input buffer for streams with very low video framerates. This is
--   commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one video
--   frame per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossBehavior:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputLossBehavior</a> - Settings for system
--   actions when input is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputTimingSource:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputTimingSource</a> - Indicates whether the
--   rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder should be paced by its
--   system clock (which optionally may be locked to another source via
--   NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source that is providing
--   the input stream.
newGlobalConfiguration :: GlobalConfiguration

-- | Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.
globalConfiguration_initialAudioGain :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g.
--   end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will
--   restart at the beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured
--   the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user
--   specified slate images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration
--   until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the
--   Channel Schedule API).
globalConfiguration_inputEndAction :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction)

-- | Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING -
--   MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the other. EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the
--   output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.
globalConfiguration_outputLockingMode :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode)

-- | Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates.
--   This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one
--   video frame per second.
globalConfiguration_supportLowFramerateInputs :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs)

-- | Settings for system actions when input is lost.
globalConfiguration_inputLossBehavior :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe InputLossBehavior)

-- | Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder
--   should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to
--   another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source
--   that is providing the input stream.
globalConfiguration_outputTimingSource :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.GlobalConfiguration.GlobalConfiguration


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputMaximumBitrate

-- | Maximum input bitrate in megabits per second. Bitrates up to 50 Mbps
--   are supported currently.
newtype InputMaximumBitrate
InputMaximumBitrate' :: Text -> InputMaximumBitrate
[fromInputMaximumBitrate] :: InputMaximumBitrate -> Text
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_10_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_20_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_50_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered. If \"EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE\",
--   then the active input will stay active as long as it is healthy. If
--   \"PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED\", then always switch back to the primary
--   input when it is healthy.
newtype InputPreference
InputPreference' :: Text -> InputPreference
[fromInputPreference] :: InputPreference -> Text
pattern InputPreference_EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE :: InputPreference
pattern InputPreference_PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED :: InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPreference.InputPreference

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputResolution

-- | Input resolution based on lines of vertical resolution in the input;
--   SD is less than 720 lines, HD is 720 to 1080 lines, UHD is greater
--   than 1080 lines

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource

-- | The settings for a PULL type input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSource</a> smart constructor.
data InputSource
InputSource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InputSource

-- | The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
[$sel:passwordParam:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The username for the input source.
[$sel:username:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | This represents the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
[$sel:url:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordParam:InputSource'</a>,
--   <a>inputSource_passwordParam</a> - The key used to extract the
--   password from EC2 Parameter store.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:InputSource'</a>, <a>inputSource_username</a> - The
--   username for the input source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:InputSource'</a>, <a>inputSource_url</a> - This represents
--   the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
newInputSource :: InputSource

-- | The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
inputSource_passwordParam :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The username for the input source.
inputSource_username :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)

-- | This represents the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
inputSource_url :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSource.InputSource

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType

-- | There are two types of input sources, static and dynamic. If an input
--   source is dynamic you can change the source url of the input
--   dynamically using an input switch action. However, the only input type
--   to support a dynamic url at this time is MP4_FILE. By default all
--   input sources are static.
newtype InputSourceType
InputSourceType' :: Text -> InputSourceType
[fromInputSourceType] :: InputSourceType -> Text
pattern InputSourceType_DYNAMIC :: InputSourceType
pattern InputSourceType_STATIC :: InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSourceType.InputSourceType

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputTimecodeSource

-- | Documentation update needed
newtype InputTimecodeSource
InputTimecodeSource' :: Text -> InputTimecodeSource
[fromInputTimecodeSource] :: InputTimecodeSource -> Text
pattern InputTimecodeSource_EMBEDDED :: InputTimecodeSource

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest

-- | Settings for a private VPC Input. When this property is specified, the
--   input destination addresses will be created in a VPC rather than with
--   public Internet addresses. This property requires setting the roleArn
--   property on Input creation. Not compatible with the
--   inputSecurityGroups property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputVpcRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InputVpcRequest
InputVpcRequest' :: Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> InputVpcRequest

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Input
--   VPC network interfaces. Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then
--   the VPC default security group will be used.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:InputVpcRequest'] :: InputVpcRequest -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. Subnet IDs must be
--   mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:InputVpcRequest'] :: InputVpcRequest -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>InputVpcRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Input VPC network interfaces.
--   Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_subnetIds</a> - A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. Subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones
--   (AZ).
newInputVpcRequest :: InputVpcRequest

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Input
--   VPC network interfaces. Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then
--   the VPC default security group will be used.
inputVpcRequest_securityGroupIds :: Lens' InputVpcRequest (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. Subnet IDs must be
--   mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
inputVpcRequest_subnetIds :: Lens' InputVpcRequest [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputVpcRequest.InputVpcRequest

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup

-- | An Input Security Group
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InputSecurityGroup
InputSecurityGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputSecurityGroupState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [InputWhitelistRule] -> Maybe [Text] -> InputSecurityGroup

-- | Unique ARN of Input Security Group
[$sel:arn:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The Id of the Input Security Group
[$sel:id:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the Input Security Group.
[$sel:state:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe InputSecurityGroupState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Whitelist rules and their sync status
[$sel:whitelistRules:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe [InputWhitelistRule]

-- | The list of inputs currently using this Input Security Group.
[$sel:inputs:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_arn</a> -
--   Unique ARN of Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_id</a> - The
--   Id of the Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_state</a>
--   - The current state of the Input Security Group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_tags</a> -
--   A collection of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:whitelistRules:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_whitelistRules</a> - Whitelist rules and their
--   sync status
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputs:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_inputs</a> - The list of inputs currently using
--   this Input Security Group.
newInputSecurityGroup :: InputSecurityGroup

-- | Unique ARN of Input Security Group
inputSecurityGroup_arn :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The Id of the Input Security Group
inputSecurityGroup_id :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the Input Security Group.
inputSecurityGroup_state :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe InputSecurityGroupState)

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
inputSecurityGroup_tags :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Whitelist rules and their sync status
inputSecurityGroup_whitelistRules :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe [InputWhitelistRule])

-- | The list of inputs currently using this Input Security Group.
inputSecurityGroup_inputs :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSecurityGroup.InputSecurityGroup

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior.M2tsNielsenId3Behavior
