module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte20SourceSettings

-- | Scte20 Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte20SourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Scte20SourceSettings
Scte20SourceSettings' :: Maybe Scte20Convert608To708 -> Maybe Natural -> Scte20SourceSettings

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
[$sel:convert608To708:Scte20SourceSettings'] :: Scte20SourceSettings -> Maybe Scte20Convert608To708

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
[$sel:source608ChannelNumber:Scte20SourceSettings'] :: Scte20SourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte20SourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:convert608To708:Scte20SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte20SourceSettings_convert608To708</a> - If upconvert, 608 data
--   is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the
--   708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the
--   source content will be discarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608ChannelNumber:Scte20SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte20SourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber</a> - Specifies the
--   608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract
--   captions. Unused for passthrough.
newScte20SourceSettings :: Scte20SourceSettings

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
scte20SourceSettings_convert608To708 :: Lens' Scte20SourceSettings (Maybe Scte20Convert608To708)

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
scte20SourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber :: Lens' Scte20SourceSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte20SourceSettings.Scte20SourceSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings

-- | Scte27 Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte27SourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Scte27SourceSettings
Scte27SourceSettings' :: Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage -> Maybe Natural -> Scte27SourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
[$sel:ocrLanguage:Scte27SourceSettings'] :: Scte27SourceSettings -> Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage

-- | The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
[$sel:pid:Scte27SourceSettings'] :: Scte27SourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte27SourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ocrLanguage:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte27SourceSettings_ocrLanguage</a> - If you will configure a
--   WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use
--   this field to provide the language to consider when translating the
--   image-based source to text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pid:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>, <a>scte27SourceSettings_pid</a>
--   - The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
newScte27SourceSettings :: Scte27SourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
scte27SourceSettings_ocrLanguage :: Lens' Scte27SourceSettings (Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage)

-- | The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
scte27SourceSettings_pid :: Lens' Scte27SourceSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte27SourceSettings.Scte27SourceSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to the archive_allowed parameter. A value of
--   ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED corresponds to 0 (false) in the SCTE-35
--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag' :: Text -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
[fromScte35ArchiveAllowedFlag] :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag -> Text
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag.Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_NOT_CANCELED corresponds to 0 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is an insertion request.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_CANCELED corresponds to 1 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is a cancelation request, in
--   which case complete this field and the existing event ID to cancel.
newtype Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator' :: Text -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for a SCTE-35 splice_insert message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings
Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Optional, the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To
--   convert seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter
--   a duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can
--   read the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a
--   duration, the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.
[$sel:duration:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'] :: Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in
--   SCTE-35.
[$sel:spliceEventId:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'] :: Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> - Optional,
--   the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert
--   seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter a
--   duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can read
--   the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a duration,
--   the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spliceEventId:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings_spliceEventId</a> - The
--   splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in SCTE-35.
newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings :: Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Optional, the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To
--   convert seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter
--   a duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can
--   read the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a
--   duration, the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.

--   SCTE-35.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | Scte35 Splice Insert
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsert</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsert
Scte35SpliceInsert' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior -> Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | When specified, this offset (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad
--   Avail PTS time. This only applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and
--   does not apply to OOB messages.
[$sel:adAvailOffset:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Int

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
[$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
[$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsert</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:adAvailOffset:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_adAvailOffset</a> - When specified, this offset
--   (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad Avail PTS time. This only
--   applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and does not apply to OOB
--   messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_noRegionalBlackoutFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
--   
--   <a>$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_webDeliveryAllowedFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
newScte35SpliceInsert :: Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | When specified, this offset (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad
--   Avail PTS time. This only applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and
--   does not apply to OOB messages.
scte35SpliceInsert_adAvailOffset :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
scte35SpliceInsert_noRegionalBlackoutFlag :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior)

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
scte35SpliceInsert_webDeliveryAllowedFlag :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to the web_delivery_allowed_flag parameter. A value of
--   WEB_DELIVERY_NOT_ALLOWED corresponds to 0 (false) in the SCTE-35
--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag
Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag' :: Text -> Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag
[fromScte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag] :: Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag -> Text
pattern Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag_WEB_DELIVERY_ALLOWED :: Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag
pattern Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag_WEB_DELIVERY_NOT_ALLOWED :: Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag.Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35DeliveryRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 delivery_not_restricted_flag parameter. To
--   declare delivery restrictions, include this element and its four
--   "restriction" flags. To declare that there are no restrictions, omit
--   this element.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35DeliveryRestrictions</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35DeliveryRestrictions
Scte35DeliveryRestrictions' :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag -> Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag -> Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag -> Scte35DeliveryRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 device_restrictions parameter.
[$sel:deviceRestrictions:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'] :: Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Scte35DeviceRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 archive_allowed_flag.
[$sel:archiveAllowedFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'] :: Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 web_delivery_allowed_flag parameter.
[$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'] :: Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 no_regional_blackout_flag parameter.
[$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'] :: Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35DeliveryRestrictions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceRestrictions:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'</a>,
--   <a>scte35DeliveryRestrictions_deviceRestrictions</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 device_restrictions parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveAllowedFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'</a>,
--   <a>scte35DeliveryRestrictions_archiveAllowedFlag</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 archive_allowed_flag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'</a>,
--   <a>scte35DeliveryRestrictions_webDeliveryAllowedFlag</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 web_delivery_allowed_flag parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35DeliveryRestrictions'</a>,
--   <a>scte35DeliveryRestrictions_noRegionalBlackoutFlag</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 no_regional_blackout_flag parameter.
newScte35DeliveryRestrictions :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag -> Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag -> Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag -> Scte35DeliveryRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 device_restrictions parameter.
scte35DeliveryRestrictions_deviceRestrictions :: Lens' Scte35DeliveryRestrictions Scte35DeviceRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 archive_allowed_flag.
scte35DeliveryRestrictions_archiveAllowedFlag :: Lens' Scte35DeliveryRestrictions Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 web_delivery_allowed_flag parameter.
scte35DeliveryRestrictions_webDeliveryAllowedFlag :: Lens' Scte35DeliveryRestrictions Scte35WebDeliveryAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 no_regional_blackout_flag parameter.
scte35DeliveryRestrictions_noRegionalBlackoutFlag :: Lens' Scte35DeliveryRestrictions Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_descriptor.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
Scte35SegmentationDescriptor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:subSegmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing
--   the hexadecimal representation of the characters that make up the
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
[$sel:segmentationUpid:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Text

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:segmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid
--   for the specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:subSegmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter
--   one of the types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a
--   decimal. For example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in
--   decimal. In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in
--   the SCTE-35 specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in
--   decimal (for example, "12").
[$sel:segmentationUpidType:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for
--   the specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:segmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the
--   segmentation_type_id values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On
--   the console, enter the ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI,
--   API, or an SDK, enter the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal
--   (for example, "52").
[$sel:segmentationTypeId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Holds the four SCTE-35 delivery restriction parameters.
[$sel:deliveryRestrictions:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration
--   for the time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks,
--   multiple the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If
--   you do not enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you
--   insert a cancellation message.
[$sel:segmentationDuration:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
[$sel:segmentationEventId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
[$sel:segmentationCancelIndicator:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpid:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpid</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing the hexadecimal
--   representation of the characters that make up the SCTE-35
--   segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentsExpected</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpidType:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpidType</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter one of the
--   types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a decimal. For
--   example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in decimal. In the
--   CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in the SCTE-35
--   specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in decimal (for
--   example, "12").
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentsExpected</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationTypeId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationTypeId</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the segmentation_type_id
--   values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On the console, enter the
--   ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter
--   the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal (for example, "52").
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryRestrictions:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_deliveryRestrictions</a> - Holds the
--   four SCTE-35 delivery restriction parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationDuration:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationDuration</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration for the
--   time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks, multiple
--   the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If you do not
--   enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you insert a
--   cancellation message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationEventId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationEventId</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationCancelIndicator:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationCancelIndicator</a> -
--   Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
newScte35SegmentationDescriptor :: Natural -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentNum :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing
--   the hexadecimal representation of the characters that make up the
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpid :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Text)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentNum :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid
--   for the specified segmentation_type_id.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentsExpected :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter
--   one of the types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a
--   decimal. For example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in
--   decimal. In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in
--   the SCTE-35 specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in
--   decimal (for example, "12").
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpidType :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for
--   the specified segmentation_type_id.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentsExpected :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the
--   segmentation_type_id values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On
--   the console, enter the ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI,
--   API, or an SDK, enter the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal
--   (for example, "52").
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationTypeId :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Holds the four SCTE-35 delivery restriction parameters.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_deliveryRestrictions :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration
--   for the time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks,
--   multiple the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If
--   you do not enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you
--   insert a cancellation message.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationDuration :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationEventId :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationCancelIndicator :: Lens' Scte35SegmentationDescriptor Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | Ms Smooth Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMsSmoothGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MsSmoothGroupSettings
MsSmoothGroupSettings' :: Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode -> Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior -> Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode -> Maybe Natural -> OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | When set to send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't
--   start until all streams start.
[$sel:streamManifestBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Length of mp4 fragments to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must
--   be compatible with GOP size and framerate.
[$sel:fragmentLength:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | MS Smooth event ID to be sent to the IIS server. Should only be
--   specified if eventIdMode is set to useConfigured.
[$sel:eventId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a
--   trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
[$sel:certificateMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode

-- | The ID to include in each message in the sparse track. Ignored if
--   sparseTrackType is NONE.
[$sel:acquisitionPointId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Number of retry attempts.
[$sel:numRetries:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
[$sel:segmentationMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode

-- | If set to passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment
--   absolute time will be set to the current timecode. This option does
--   not write timecodes to the audio elementary stream.
[$sel:audioOnlyTimecodeControl:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl

-- | Specifies whether or not to send an event ID to the IIS server. If no
--   event ID is sent and the same Live Event is used without changing the
--   publishing point, clients might see cached video from the previous
--   run. Options: - "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId -
--   "useTimestamp" - generate and send an event ID based on the current
--   timestamp - "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.
[$sel:eventIdMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode

-- | Number of milliseconds to delay the output from the second pipeline.
[$sel:sendDelayMs:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the type of data to place in the sparse track: - SCTE35:
--   Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source content. With each message,
--   insert an IDR frame to start a new segment. -
--   SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source
--   content. With each message, insert an IDR frame but don't start a new
--   segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse track for any outputs in this
--   output group.
[$sel:sparseTrackType:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server
--   if the connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and
--   the cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection
--   is re-established.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
[$sel:inputLossAction:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut

-- | Timestamp offset for the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is
--   set to useConfiguredOffset.
[$sel:timestampOffset:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to sendEos, send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the
--   event
[$sel:eventStopBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior

-- | Type of timestamp date offset to use. - useEventStartDate: Use the
--   date the event was started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an
--   explicitly configured date as the offset
[$sel:timestampOffsetMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode

-- | Number of seconds before initiating a restart due to output failure,
--   due to exhausting the numRetries on one segment, or exceeding
--   filecacheDuration.
[$sel:restartDelay:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Smooth Streaming publish point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts
--   as a "Push" encoder to IIS.
[$sel:destination:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>MsSmoothGroupSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamManifestBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_streamManifestBehavior</a> - When set to
--   send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't start until all
--   streams start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of
--   file cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fragmentLength:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_fragmentLength</a> - Length of mp4 fragments
--   to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must be compatible with GOP
--   size and framerate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventId</a> - MS Smooth event ID to be sent
--   to the IIS server. Should only be specified if eventIdMode is set to
--   useConfigured.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_certificateMode</a> - If set to
--   verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a trusted
--   Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acquisitionPointId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_acquisitionPointId</a> - The ID to include in
--   each message in the sparse track. Ignored if sparseTrackType is NONE.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_segmentationMode</a> - useInputSegmentation
--   has been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioOnlyTimecodeControl:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_audioOnlyTimecodeControl</a> - If set to
--   passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment absolute
--   time will be set to the current timecode. This option does not write
--   timecodes to the audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventIdMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventIdMode</a> - Specifies whether or not to
--   send an event ID to the IIS server. If no event ID is sent and the
--   same Live Event is used without changing the publishing point, clients
--   might see cached video from the previous run. Options: -
--   "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId - "useTimestamp" -
--   generate and send an event ID based on the current timestamp -
--   "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendDelayMs:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_sendDelayMs</a> - Number of milliseconds to
--   delay the output from the second pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sparseTrackType:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_sparseTrackType</a> - Identifies the type of
--   data to place in the sparse track: - SCTE35: Insert SCTE-35 messages
--   from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR frame to
--   start a new segment. - SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35
--   messages from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR
--   frame but don't start a new segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse
--   track for any outputs in this output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of
--   seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server if the
--   connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and the
--   cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection is
--   re-established.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Parameter that control
--   output group behavior on input loss.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampOffset:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffset</a> - Timestamp offset for
--   the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is set to
--   useConfiguredOffset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventStopBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventStopBehavior</a> - When set to sendEos,
--   send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the event
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampOffsetMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffsetMode</a> - Type of timestamp
--   date offset to use. - useEventStartDate: Use the date the event was
--   started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an explicitly
--   configured date as the offset
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_restartDelay</a> - Number of seconds before
--   initiating a restart due to output failure, due to exhausting the
--   numRetries on one segment, or exceeding filecacheDuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_destination</a> - Smooth Streaming publish
--   point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts as a "Push" encoder to
--   IIS.
newMsSmoothGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | When set to send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't
--   start until all streams start.
msSmoothGroupSettings_streamManifestBehavior :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior)

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
msSmoothGroupSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Length of mp4 fragments to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must
--   be compatible with GOP size and framerate.
msSmoothGroupSettings_fragmentLength :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | MS Smooth event ID to be sent to the IIS server. Should only be
--   specified if eventIdMode is set to useConfigured.
msSmoothGroupSettings_eventId :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a
--   trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
msSmoothGroupSettings_certificateMode :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode)

-- | The ID to include in each message in the sparse track. Ignored if
--   sparseTrackType is NONE.
msSmoothGroupSettings_acquisitionPointId :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Number of retry attempts.
msSmoothGroupSettings_numRetries :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
msSmoothGroupSettings_segmentationMode :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode)

-- | If set to passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment
--   absolute time will be set to the current timecode. This option does
--   not write timecodes to the audio elementary stream.
msSmoothGroupSettings_audioOnlyTimecodeControl :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl)

-- | Specifies whether or not to send an event ID to the IIS server. If no
--   event ID is sent and the same Live Event is used without changing the
--   publishing point, clients might see cached video from the previous
--   run. Options: - "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId -
--   "useTimestamp" - generate and send an event ID based on the current
--   timestamp - "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.
msSmoothGroupSettings_eventIdMode :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode)

-- | Number of milliseconds to delay the output from the second pipeline.
msSmoothGroupSettings_sendDelayMs :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Identifies the type of data to place in the sparse track: - SCTE35:
--   Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source content. With each message,
--   insert an IDR frame to start a new segment. -
--   SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source
--   content. With each message, insert an IDR frame but don't start a new
--   segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse track for any outputs in this
--   output group.
msSmoothGroupSettings_sparseTrackType :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server
--   if the connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and
--   the cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection
--   is re-established.
msSmoothGroupSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
msSmoothGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut)

-- | Timestamp offset for the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is
--   set to useConfiguredOffset.
msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffset :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to sendEos, send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the
--   event
msSmoothGroupSettings_eventStopBehavior :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior)

-- | Type of timestamp date offset to use. - useEventStartDate: Use the
--   date the event was started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an
--   explicitly configured date as the offset
msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffsetMode :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode)

-- | Number of seconds before initiating a restart due to output failure,
--   due to exhausting the numRetries on one segment, or exceeding
--   filecacheDuration.
msSmoothGroupSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Smooth Streaming publish point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts
--   as a "Push" encoder to IIS.
msSmoothGroupSettings_destination :: Lens' MsSmoothGroupSettings OutputLocationRef

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.SmpteTtDestinationSettings

-- | Smpte Tt Destination Settings
--

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsOutputSettings

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsOutputSettings
HlsOutputSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsH265PackagingType -> Maybe Text -> HlsSettings -> HlsOutputSettings

-- | String concatenated to end of segment filenames.
[$sel:segmentModifier:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video
--   description. Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1
--   or HVC1.
[$sel:h265PackagingType:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe HlsH265PackagingType

-- | String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Accepts
--   \"Format Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.
[$sel:nameModifier:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings regarding the underlying stream. These settings are different
--   for audio-only outputs.
[$sel:hlsSettings:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> HlsSettings

--   MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1 or HVC1.

--   <a>$sel:nameModifier:HlsOutputSettings'</a>,

--   Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StartTimecode

-- | Settings to identify the start of the clip.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTimecode</a> smart constructor.
data StartTimecode
StartTimecode' :: Maybe Text -> StartTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to start the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter
--   the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
[$sel:timecode:StartTimecode'] :: StartTimecode -> Maybe Text

--   The timecode for the frame where you want to start the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter
--   the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
newStartTimecode :: StartTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to start the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter
--   the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
startTimecode_timecode :: Lens' StartTimecode (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for the action to activate a static image.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings
StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | The height of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank
--   to use the native height of the overlay.
[$sel:height:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Placement of the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   right.
[$sel:imageX:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The width of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank
--   to use the native width of the overlay.
[$sel:width:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Placement of the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   bottom.
[$sel:imageY:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If
--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.
[$sel:duration:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be
--   overlaid on the video, each layer with a different image. The layers
--   are in Z order, which means that overlays with higher values of layer
--   are inserted on top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is
--   0.
[$sel:layer:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Opacity of image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque.
--   Default is 100.
[$sel:opacity:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The time in milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts
--   at the start time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
[$sel:fadeIn:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Applies only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for
--   the image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is
--   hit, so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no
--   fade-out).
[$sel:fadeOut:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The location and filename of the image file to overlay on the video.
--   The file must be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be
--   larger (in pixels) than the input video.
[$sel:image:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_height</a> - The height
--   of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will
--   be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank to use the
--   native height of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageX:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageX</a> - Placement of
--   the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the frame. If
--   the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right edge of
--   the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the right.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_width</a> - The width of
--   the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will be
--   scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank to use the
--   native width of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageY:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageY</a> - Placement of
--   the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the frame. If the
--   placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom edge of the
--   underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the bottom.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> - The
--   duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If
--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layer:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_layer</a> - The number of
--   the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be overlaid on the
--   video, each layer with a different image. The layers are in Z order,
--   which means that overlays with higher values of layer are inserted on
--   top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:opacity:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_opacity</a> - Opacity of
--   image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque. Default is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fadeIn:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeIn</a> - The time in
--   milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts at the start
--   time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fadeOut:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeOut</a> - Applies
--   only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for the
--   image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is hit,
--   so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no fade-out).
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_image</a> - The location
--   and filename of the image file to overlay on the video. The file must
--   be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be larger (in pixels)
--   than the input video.
newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings :: InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | The height of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank
--   to use the native height of the overlay.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_height :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Placement of the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   right.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageX :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The width of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank
--   to use the native width of the overlay.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_width :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Placement of the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the

--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the

staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageY :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.

-- | The number of the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be
--   overlaid on the video, each layer with a different image. The layers
--   are in Z order, which means that overlays with higher values of layer
--   are inserted on top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is
--   0.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_layer :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Opacity of image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque.
--   Default is 100.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_opacity :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The time in milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts
--   at the start time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeIn :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Applies only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for
--   the image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is
--   hit, so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no
--   fade-out).
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeOut :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The location and filename of the image file to overlay on the video.
--   The file must be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be
--   larger (in pixels) than the input video.
staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_image :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings InputLocation

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

--   in milliseconds for the image to fade out. Default is 0 (no fade-out).
