module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings

-- | Static Key Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStaticKeySettings</a> smart constructor.
data StaticKeySettings
StaticKeySettings' :: Maybe InputLocation -> Text -> StaticKeySettings

-- | The URL of the license server used for protecting content.
[$sel:keyProviderServer:StaticKeySettings'] :: StaticKeySettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Static key value as a 32 character hexadecimal string.
[$sel:staticKeyValue:StaticKeySettings'] :: StaticKeySettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StaticKeySettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyProviderServer:StaticKeySettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticKeySettings_keyProviderServer</a> - The URL of the license
--   server used for protecting content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:staticKeyValue:StaticKeySettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticKeySettings_staticKeyValue</a> - Static key value as a 32
--   character hexadecimal string.
newStaticKeySettings :: Text -> StaticKeySettings

-- | The URL of the license server used for protecting content.
staticKeySettings_keyProviderServer :: Lens' StaticKeySettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Static key value as a 32 character hexadecimal string.
staticKeySettings_staticKeyValue :: Lens' StaticKeySettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StaticKeySettings.StaticKeySettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings

-- | Key Provider Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyProviderSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KeyProviderSettings
KeyProviderSettings' :: Maybe StaticKeySettings -> KeyProviderSettings
[$sel:staticKeySettings:KeyProviderSettings'] :: KeyProviderSettings -> Maybe StaticKeySettings

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyProviderSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:staticKeySettings:KeyProviderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>keyProviderSettings_staticKeySettings</a> - Undocumented member.
newKeyProviderSettings :: KeyProviderSettings

-- | Undocumented member.
keyProviderSettings_staticKeySettings :: Lens' KeyProviderSettings (Maybe StaticKeySettings)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.KeyProviderSettings.KeyProviderSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings

-- | Hls Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsGroupSettings
HlsGroupSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame -> Maybe HlsIvInManifest -> Maybe HlsOutputSelection -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsEncryptionType -> Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [HlsAdMarkers] -> Maybe HlsManifestCompression -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsCodecSpecification -> Maybe HlsCdnSettings -> Maybe HlsMode -> Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsRedundantManifest -> Maybe HlsSegmentationMode -> Maybe HlsProgramDateTime -> Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType -> Maybe HlsTsFileMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut -> Maybe KeyProviderSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsClientCache -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsIvSource -> Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting -> Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat -> OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

-- | Length of MPEG-2 Transport Stream segments to create (in seconds).
--   Note that segments will end on the next keyframe after this number of
--   seconds, so actual segment length may be longer.
[$sel:segmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If set to "include", IV is listed in the manifest, otherwise the IV is
--   not in the manifest.
[$sel:ivInManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIvInManifest

-- | MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates manifests (master manifest, if
--   applicable, and media manifests) for this output group.
--   VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates media manifests for this
--   output group, but not a master manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not
--   generate any manifests for this output group.
[$sel:outputSelection:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsOutputSelection

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Encrypts the segments with the given encryption scheme. Exclude this
--   parameter if no encryption is desired.
[$sel:encryptionType:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsEncryptionType

-- | Place segments in subdirectories.
[$sel:directoryStructure:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure

-- | The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource
--   identified by the URI. If parameter is absent, an implicit value of
--   "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string can also be given.
[$sel:keyFormat:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Choose one or more ad marker types to pass SCTE35 signals through to
--   this group of Apple HLS outputs.
[$sel:adMarkers:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe [HlsAdMarkers]

-- | When set to gzip, compresses HLS playlist.
[$sel:manifestCompression:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsManifestCompression

-- | For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value
--   represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to
--   "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for
--   encryption.
[$sel:constantIv:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specification to use (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8
--   playlist generation.
[$sel:codecSpecification:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCodecSpecification

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
[$sel:hlsCdnSettings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCdnSettings

-- | If "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
[$sel:mode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsMode

-- | Include or exclude RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   tag of variant manifest.
[$sel:streamInfResolution:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of
--   segments in the media manifest file. After this maximum, older
--   segments are removed from the media manifest. This number must be
--   smaller than the number in the Keep Segments field.
[$sel:indexNSegments:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | ENABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes
--   information about both pipelines: first its own media files, then the
--   media files of the other pipeline. This feature allows playout device
--   that support stale manifest detection to switch from one manifest to
--   the other, when the current manifest seems to be stale. There are
--   still two destinations and two master manifests, but both master
--   manifests reference the media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The
--   master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information
--   about its own pipeline only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage
--   as the destination, the DISABLED behavior is always followed.
--   MediaPackage regenerates the manifests it serves to players so a
--   redundant manifest from MediaLive is irrelevant.
[$sel:redundantManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsRedundantManifest

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
[$sel:segmentationMode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsSegmentationMode

-- | Includes or excludes EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest
--   files. The value is calculated as follows: either the program date and
--   time are initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
[$sel:programDateTime:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsProgramDateTime

-- | DISABLED: Do not create an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the
--   master and media manifests (according to the Output Selection field).
--   STANDARD: Create an I-frame-only manifest for each output that
--   contains video, as well as the other manifests (according to the
--   Output Selection field). The I-frame manifest contains a
--   #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is I-frame only, and one or
--   more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the I-frame position. For
--   example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
[$sel:iFrameOnlyPlaylists:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType

-- | SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program as segments - multiple .ts media
--   files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if Mode field is VOD. Emit the
--   program as a single .ts media file. The media manifest includes
--   #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for playback. A typical use
--   for this value is when sending the output to AWS Elemental
--   MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file. Playback
--   while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP server
--   caching.
[$sel:tsFileMode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsTsFileMode

-- | Number of segments to write to a subdirectory before starting a new
--   one. directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting
--   to have an effect.
[$sel:segmentsPerSubdirectory:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether to insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child
--   manifests for this output group. Typically, choose Insert because
--   these tags are required in the manifest (according to the HLS
--   specification) and serve an important purpose. Choose Never Insert
--   only if the downstream system is doing real-time failover (without
--   using the MediaLive automatic failover feature) and only if that
--   downstream system has advised you to exclude the tags.
[$sel:discontinuityTags:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
[$sel:baseUrlContent:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | State of HLS ID3 Segment Tagging
[$sel:hlsId3SegmentTagging:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
[$sel:baseUrlManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to include the final (incomplete) segment in the
--   media output when the pipeline stops producing output because of a
--   channel stop, a channel pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto
--   means that MediaLive decides whether to include the final segment,
--   depending on the channel class and the types of output groups.
--   Suppress means to never include the incomplete segment. We recommend
--   you choose Auto and let MediaLive control the behavior.
[$sel:incompleteSegmentBehavior:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior

-- | Optional. One value per output group. This field is required only if
--   you are completing Base URL content A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in
--   a location different from the media files for pipeline 0.
[$sel:baseUrlContent1:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
[$sel:inputLossAction:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut

-- | The key provider settings.
[$sel:keyProviderSettings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe KeyProviderSettings

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the number of media
--   segments to retain in the destination directory. This number should be
--   bigger than indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
[$sel:keepSegments:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Mapping of up to 4 caption channels to caption languages. Is only
--   meaningful if captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
[$sel:captionLanguageMappings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping]

-- | Provides an extra millisecond delta offset to fine tune the
--   timestamps.
[$sel:timestampDeltaMilliseconds:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Optional. One value per output group. Complete this field only if you
--   are completing Base URL manifest A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the child manifest files for pipeline 1 of all
--   outputs are in a location different from the child manifest files for
--   pipeline 0.
[$sel:baseUrlManifest1:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Period of insertion of EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
[$sel:programDateTimePeriod:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When set to "disabled", sets the #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the
--   manifest, which prevents clients from saving media segments for later
--   replay.
[$sel:clientCache:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsClientCache

-- | Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited
--   list of version values (1/2/3).
[$sel:keyFormatVersions:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set, minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back
--   within the specified range for a nearby avail and extending the
--   segment size if needed.
[$sel:minSegmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If this setting is "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to
--   change every segment (to match the segment number). If this is set to
--   "explicit", you must enter a constantIv value.
[$sel:ivSource:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIvSource

-- | Applies only to 608 Embedded output captions. insert: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the manifest. Specify at least one language
--   in the CC1 Language Code field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for
--   each Language Code you specify. Make sure to specify the languages in
--   the order in which they appear in the original source (if the source
--   is embedded format) or the order of the caption selectors (if the
--   source is other than embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest
--   will not match up properly with the output captions. none: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE line in the manifest. omit: Omit any
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the manifest.
[$sel:captionLanguageSetting:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting

-- | Indicates whether the output manifest should use floating point or
--   integer values for segment duration.
[$sel:manifestDurationFormat:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat

-- | A directory or HTTP destination for the HLS segments, manifest files,
--   and encryption keys (if enabled).
[$sel:destination:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentLength</a> - Length of MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream segments to create (in seconds). Note that segments will end on
--   the next keyframe after this number of seconds, so actual segment
--   length may be longer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame</a> - Indicates ID3 frame
--   that has the timecode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivInManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivInManifest</a> - For use with encryptionType.
--   The IV (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction
--   with the key for encrypting blocks. If set to "include", IV is listed
--   in the manifest, otherwise the IV is not in the manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSelection:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_outputSelection</a> - MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates manifests (master manifest, if applicable, and media
--   manifests) for this output group. VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates media manifests for this output group, but not a master
--   manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not generate any manifests for this
--   output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period</a> - Timed Metadata
--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_encryptionType</a> - Encrypts the segments with
--   the given encryption scheme. Exclude this parameter if no encryption
--   is desired.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryStructure:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_directoryStructure</a> - Place segments in
--   subdirectories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormat</a> - The value specifies how the key is
--   represented in the resource identified by the URI. If parameter is
--   absent, an implicit value of "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string
--   can also be given.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adMarkers:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_adMarkers</a> - Choose one or more ad marker types
--   to pass SCTE35 signals through to this group of Apple HLS outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestCompression:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestCompression</a> - When set to gzip,
--   compresses HLS playlist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constantIv:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_constantIv</a> - For use with encryptionType. This
--   is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character text
--   string. If ivSource is set to "explicit" then this parameter is
--   required and is used as the IV for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSpecification:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_codecSpecification</a> - Specification to use
--   (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8 playlist generation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsCdnSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsCdnSettings</a> - Parameters that control
--   interactions with the CDN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>, <a>hlsGroupSettings_mode</a> - If
--   "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamInfResolution:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_streamInfResolution</a> - Include or exclude
--   RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF tag of variant
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexNSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_indexNSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of segments in the media manifest
--   file. After this maximum, older segments are removed from the media
--   manifest. This number must be smaller than the number in the Keep
--   Segments field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redundantManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_redundantManifest</a> - ENABLED: The master
--   manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information about
--   both pipelines: first its own media files, then the media files of the
--   other pipeline. This feature allows playout device that support stale
--   manifest detection to switch from one manifest to the other, when the
--   current manifest seems to be stale. There are still two destinations
--   and two master manifests, but both master manifests reference the
--   media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8
--   file) for each pipeline includes information about its own pipeline
--   only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage as the destination,
--   the DISABLED behavior is always followed. MediaPackage regenerates the
--   manifests it serves to players so a redundant manifest from MediaLive
--   is irrelevant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentationMode</a> - useInputSegmentation has
--   been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTime:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTime</a> - Includes or excludes
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest files. The value is
--   calculated as follows: either the program date and time are
--   initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iFrameOnlyPlaylists:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_iFrameOnlyPlaylists</a> - DISABLED: Do not create
--   an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the master and media manifests
--   (according to the Output Selection field). STANDARD: Create an
--   I-frame-only manifest for each output that contains video, as well as
--   the other manifests (according to the Output Selection field). The
--   I-frame manifest contains a #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is
--   I-frame only, and one or more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the
--   I-frame position. For example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
--   
--   <a>$sel:tsFileMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_tsFileMode</a> - SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program
--   as segments - multiple .ts media files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if
--   Mode field is VOD. Emit the program as a single .ts media file. The
--   media manifest includes #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for
--   playback. A typical use for this value is when sending the output to
--   AWS Elemental MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file.
--   Playback while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP
--   server caching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentsPerSubdirectory:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentsPerSubdirectory</a> - Number of segments
--   to write to a subdirectory before starting a new one.
--   directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting to
--   have an effect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:discontinuityTags:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_discontinuityTags</a> - Specifies whether to
--   insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child manifests for this
--   output group. Typically, choose Insert because these tags are required
--   in the manifest (according to the HLS specification) and serve an
--   important purpose. Choose Never Insert only if the downstream system
--   is doing real-time failover (without using the MediaLive automatic
--   failover feature) and only if that downstream system has advised you
--   to exclude the tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsId3SegmentTagging:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsId3SegmentTagging</a> - State of HLS ID3
--   Segment Tagging
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incompleteSegmentBehavior:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_incompleteSegmentBehavior</a> - Specifies whether
--   to include the final (incomplete) segment in the media output when the
--   pipeline stops producing output because of a channel stop, a channel
--   pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto means that MediaLive
--   decides whether to include the final segment, depending on the channel
--   class and the types of output groups. Suppress means to never include
--   the incomplete segment. We recommend you choose Auto and let MediaLive
--   control the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. This field is required only if you are completing Base
--   URL content A, and the downstream system has notified you that the
--   media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location different
--   from the media files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Parameter that control
--   output group behavior on input loss.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyProviderSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyProviderSettings</a> - The key provider
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keepSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the number of media segments to retain in the
--   destination directory. This number should be bigger than
--   indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageMappings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageMappings</a> - Mapping of up to 4
--   caption channels to caption languages. Is only meaningful if
--   captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampDeltaMilliseconds:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timestampDeltaMilliseconds</a> - Provides an extra
--   millisecond delta offset to fine tune the timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. Complete this field only if you are completing Base URL
--   manifest A, and the downstream system has notified you that the child
--   manifest files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location
--   different from the child manifest files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTimePeriod:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTimePeriod</a> - Period of insertion of
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientCache:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_clientCache</a> - When set to "disabled", sets the
--   #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the manifest, which prevents clients from
--   saving media segments for later replay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormatVersions:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormatVersions</a> - Either a single positive
--   integer version value or a slash delimited list of version values
--   (1/2/3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minSegmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_minSegmentLength</a> - When set,
--   minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back within the
--   specified range for a nearby avail and extending the segment size if
--   needed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivSource:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivSource</a> - For use with encryptionType. The IV
--   (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction with
--   the key for encrypting blocks. If this setting is
--   "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to change every segment
--   (to match the segment number). If this is set to "explicit", you must
--   enter a constantIv value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageSetting:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageSetting</a> - Applies only to 608
--   Embedded output captions. insert: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the
--   manifest. Specify at least one language in the CC1 Language Code
--   field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for each Language Code you
--   specify. Make sure to specify the languages in the order in which they
--   appear in the original source (if the source is embedded format) or
--   the order of the caption selectors (if the source is other than
--   embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest will not match up
--   properly with the output captions. none: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE
--   line in the manifest. omit: Omit any CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestDurationFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestDurationFormat</a> - Indicates whether the
--   output manifest should use floating point or integer values for
--   segment duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_destination</a> - A directory or HTTP destination
--   for the HLS segments, manifest files, and encryption keys (if
--   enabled).
newHlsGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

-- | Length of MPEG-2 Transport Stream segments to create (in seconds).
--   Note that segments will end on the next keyframe after this number of
--   seconds, so actual segment length may be longer.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentLength :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame)

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If set to "include", IV is listed in the manifest, otherwise the IV is
--   not in the manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_ivInManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIvInManifest)

-- | MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates manifests (master manifest, if
--   applicable, and media manifests) for this output group.
--   VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates media manifests for this
--   output group, but not a master manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not
--   generate any manifests for this output group.
hlsGroupSettings_outputSelection :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsOutputSelection)

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Encrypts the segments with the given encryption scheme. Exclude this
--   parameter if no encryption is desired.
hlsGroupSettings_encryptionType :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsEncryptionType)

-- | Place segments in subdirectories.
hlsGroupSettings_directoryStructure :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure)

-- | The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource
--   identified by the URI. If parameter is absent, an implicit value of
--   "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string can also be given.
hlsGroupSettings_keyFormat :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Choose one or more ad marker types to pass SCTE35 signals through to
--   this group of Apple HLS outputs.
hlsGroupSettings_adMarkers :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe [HlsAdMarkers])

-- | When set to gzip, compresses HLS playlist.
hlsGroupSettings_manifestCompression :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsManifestCompression)

-- | For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value
--   represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to
--   "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for
--   encryption.
hlsGroupSettings_constantIv :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specification to use (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8
--   playlist generation.
hlsGroupSettings_codecSpecification :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCodecSpecification)

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
hlsGroupSettings_hlsCdnSettings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCdnSettings)

-- | If "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
hlsGroupSettings_mode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsMode)

-- | Include or exclude RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   tag of variant manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_streamInfResolution :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution)

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of
--   segments in the media manifest file. After this maximum, older
--   segments are removed from the media manifest. This number must be
--   smaller than the number in the Keep Segments field.
hlsGroupSettings_indexNSegments :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | ENABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes
--   information about both pipelines: first its own media files, then the
--   media files of the other pipeline. This feature allows playout device
--   that support stale manifest detection to switch from one manifest to
--   the other, when the current manifest seems to be stale. There are
--   still two destinations and two master manifests, but both master
--   manifests reference the media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The
--   master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information
--   about its own pipeline only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage
--   as the destination, the DISABLED behavior is always followed.
--   MediaPackage regenerates the manifests it serves to players so a
--   redundant manifest from MediaLive is irrelevant.
hlsGroupSettings_redundantManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsRedundantManifest)

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentationMode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsSegmentationMode)

-- | Includes or excludes EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest
--   files. The value is calculated as follows: either the program date and
--   time are initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
hlsGroupSettings_programDateTime :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsProgramDateTime)

-- | DISABLED: Do not create an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the
--   master and media manifests (according to the Output Selection field).
--   STANDARD: Create an I-frame-only manifest for each output that
--   contains video, as well as the other manifests (according to the
--   Output Selection field). The I-frame manifest contains a
--   #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is I-frame only, and one or
--   more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the I-frame position. For
--   example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
hlsGroupSettings_iFrameOnlyPlaylists :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType)

-- | SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program as segments - multiple .ts media
--   files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if Mode field is VOD. Emit the
--   program as a single .ts media file. The media manifest includes
--   #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for playback. A typical use
--   for this value is when sending the output to AWS Elemental
--   MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file. Playback
--   while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP server
--   caching.
hlsGroupSettings_tsFileMode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsTsFileMode)

-- | Number of segments to write to a subdirectory before starting a new
--   one. directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting
--   to have an effect.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentsPerSubdirectory :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies whether to insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child
--   manifests for this output group. Typically, choose Insert because
--   these tags are required in the manifest (according to the HLS
--   specification) and serve an important purpose. Choose Never Insert
--   only if the downstream system is doing real-time failover (without
--   using the MediaLive automatic failover feature) and only if that
--   downstream system has advised you to exclude the tags.
hlsGroupSettings_discontinuityTags :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags)

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | State of HLS ID3 Segment Tagging
hlsGroupSettings_hlsId3SegmentTagging :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState)

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to include the final (incomplete) segment in the
--   media output when the pipeline stops producing output because of a
--   channel stop, a channel pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto
--   means that MediaLive decides whether to include the final segment,
--   depending on the channel class and the types of output groups.
--   Suppress means to never include the incomplete segment. We recommend
--   you choose Auto and let MediaLive control the behavior.
hlsGroupSettings_incompleteSegmentBehavior :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior)

-- | Optional. One value per output group. This field is required only if
--   you are completing Base URL content A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in
--   a location different from the media files for pipeline 0.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent1 :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
hlsGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut)

-- | The key provider settings.
hlsGroupSettings_keyProviderSettings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe KeyProviderSettings)

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the number of media
--   segments to retain in the destination directory. This number should be
--   bigger than indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
hlsGroupSettings_keepSegments :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Mapping of up to 4 caption channels to caption languages. Is only
--   meaningful if captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageMappings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping])

-- | Provides an extra millisecond delta offset to fine tune the
--   timestamps.
hlsGroupSettings_timestampDeltaMilliseconds :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Optional. One value per output group. Complete this field only if you
--   are completing Base URL manifest A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the child manifest files for pipeline 1 of all
--   outputs are in a location different from the child manifest files for
--   pipeline 0.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest1 :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Period of insertion of EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
hlsGroupSettings_programDateTimePeriod :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When set to "disabled", sets the #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the
--   manifest, which prevents clients from saving media segments for later
--   replay.
hlsGroupSettings_clientCache :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsClientCache)

-- | Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited
--   list of version values (1/2/3).
hlsGroupSettings_keyFormatVersions :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set, minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back
--   within the specified range for a nearby avail and extending the
--   segment size if needed.
hlsGroupSettings_minSegmentLength :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If this setting is "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to
--   change every segment (to match the segment number). If this is set to
--   "explicit", you must enter a constantIv value.
hlsGroupSettings_ivSource :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIvSource)

-- | Applies only to 608 Embedded output captions. insert: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the manifest. Specify at least one language
--   in the CC1 Language Code field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for
--   each Language Code you specify. Make sure to specify the languages in
--   the order in which they appear in the original source (if the source
--   is embedded format) or the order of the caption selectors (if the
--   source is other than embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest
--   will not match up properly with the output captions. none: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE line in the manifest. omit: Omit any
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageSetting :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting)

-- | Indicates whether the output manifest should use floating point or
--   integer values for segment duration.
hlsGroupSettings_manifestDurationFormat :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat)

-- | A directory or HTTP destination for the HLS segments, manifest files,
--   and encryption keys (if enabled).
hlsGroupSettings_destination :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings OutputLocationRef
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.HlsGroupSettings.HlsGroupSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode

-- | Settings to identify the end of the clip.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopTimecode</a> smart constructor.
data StopTimecode
StopTimecode' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior -> StopTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
[$sel:timecode:StopTimecode'] :: StopTimecode -> Maybe Text

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or
--   include the frame specified by the timecode.
[$sel:lastFrameClippingBehavior:StopTimecode'] :: StopTimecode -> Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>StopTimecode</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecode:StopTimecode'</a>, <a>stopTimecode_timecode</a> - The
--   timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional; if
--   not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFrameClippingBehavior:StopTimecode'</a>,
--   <a>stopTimecode_lastFrameClippingBehavior</a> - If you specify a
--   StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file), you can specify
--   if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or include the frame
--   specified by the timecode.
newStopTimecode :: StopTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
stopTimecode_timecode :: Lens' StopTimecode (Maybe Text)

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or
--   include the frame specified by the timecode.
stopTimecode_lastFrameClippingBehavior :: Lens' StopTimecode (Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.StopTimecode.StopTimecode


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputClippingSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputClippingSettings
InputClippingSettings' :: Maybe StopTimecode -> Maybe StartTimecode -> InputTimecodeSource -> InputClippingSettings

-- | Settings to identify the end of the clip.
[$sel:stopTimecode:InputClippingSettings'] :: InputClippingSettings -> Maybe StopTimecode

-- | Settings to identify the start of the clip.
[$sel:startTimecode:InputClippingSettings'] :: InputClippingSettings -> Maybe StartTimecode

-- | The source of the timecodes in the source being clipped.
[$sel:inputTimecodeSource:InputClippingSettings'] :: InputClippingSettings -> InputTimecodeSource

-- | Create a value of <a>InputClippingSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTimecode:InputClippingSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputClippingSettings_stopTimecode</a> - Settings to identify the
--   end of the clip.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimecode:InputClippingSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputClippingSettings_startTimecode</a> - Settings to identify the
--   start of the clip.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputTimecodeSource:InputClippingSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputClippingSettings_inputTimecodeSource</a> - The source of the
--   timecodes in the source being clipped.
newInputClippingSettings :: InputTimecodeSource -> InputClippingSettings

-- | Settings to identify the end of the clip.
inputClippingSettings_stopTimecode :: Lens' InputClippingSettings (Maybe StopTimecode)

-- | Settings to identify the start of the clip.
inputClippingSettings_startTimecode :: Lens' InputClippingSettings (Maybe StartTimecode)

-- | The source of the timecodes in the source being clipped.
inputClippingSettings_inputTimecodeSource :: Lens' InputClippingSettings InputTimecodeSource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputClippingSettings.InputClippingSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for the "switch input" action: to switch from ingesting one
--   input to ingesting another input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
[$sel:urlPath:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
[$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputClippingSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
[$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlPath:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_urlPath</a> - The value for the
--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference</a>
--   - The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings :: Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_urlPath :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings (Maybe InputClippingSettings)

-- | The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to prepare an input for a future immediate input switch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings
InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
[$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
[$sel:urlPath:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
[$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputClippingSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference</a>
--   - The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlPath:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_urlPath</a> - The value for the
--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_urlPath :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe InputClippingSettings)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleActionSettings

-- | Holds the settings for a single schedule action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleActionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleActionSettings
ScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Scte35TimeSignalScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsDeactivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe PauseStateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35ReturnToNetworkScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert SCTE-35 time_signal message
[$sel:scte35TimeSignalSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35TimeSignalScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to switch the input
[$sel:inputSwitchSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert HLS metadata
[$sel:hlsTimedMetadataSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to deactivate a motion graphics image overlay
[$sel:motionGraphicsImageDeactivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsDeactivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to activate a static image overlay
[$sel:staticImageActivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to pause or unpause one or both channel pipelines
[$sel:pauseStateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe PauseStateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to activate a motion graphics image overlay
[$sel:motionGraphicsImageActivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert SCTE-35 return_to_network message
[$sel:scte35ReturnToNetworkSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35ReturnToNetworkScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert SCTE-35 splice_insert message
[$sel:scte35SpliceInsertSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to deactivate a static image overlay
[$sel:staticImageDeactivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to prepare an input for a future immediate input switch
[$sel:inputPrepareSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert HLS ID3 segment tagging
[$sel:hlsId3SegmentTaggingSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleActionSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35TimeSignalSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'</a>,

--   insert SCTE-35 time_signal message

--   the input

--   activate a static image overlay
--   
--   <a>$sel:pauseStateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'</a>,

--

--   <a>$sel:motionGraphicsImageActivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'</a>,

--   Action to activate a motion graphics image overlay
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35ReturnToNetworkSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'</a>,

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction

-- | Contains information on a single schedule action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleAction
ScheduleAction' :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

-- | The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name
--   provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the
--   schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The
--   schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start
--   time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name
--   can be reused.
[$sel:actionName:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> Text

-- | The time for the action to start in the channel.
[$sel:scheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Settings for this schedule action.
[$sel:scheduleActionSettings:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> ScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_actionName</a> - The name of the action, must be
--   unique within the schedule. This name provides the main reference to
--   an action once it is added to the schedule. A name is unique if it is
--   no longer in the schedule. The schedule is automatically cleaned up to
--   remove actions with a start time of more than 1 hour ago
--   (approximately) so at that point a name can be reused.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionStartSettings</a> - The time for the
--   action to start in the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionSettings</a> - Settings for this
--   schedule action.
newScheduleAction :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

-- | The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name
--   provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the
--   schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The
--   schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start
--   time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name
--   can be reused.
scheduleAction_actionName :: Lens' ScheduleAction Text

-- | The time for the action to start in the channel.
scheduleAction_scheduleActionStartSettings :: Lens' ScheduleAction ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Settings for this schedule action.
scheduleAction_scheduleActionSettings :: Lens' ScheduleAction ScheduleActionSettings
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ScheduleAction.ScheduleAction

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings

-- | Teletext Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTeletextSourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data TeletextSourceSettings
TeletextSourceSettings' :: Maybe CaptionRectangle -> Maybe Text -> TeletextSourceSettings

-- | Optionally defines a region where TTML style captions will be
--   displayed
[$sel:outputRectangle:TeletextSourceSettings'] :: TeletextSourceSettings -> Maybe CaptionRectangle

-- | Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which
--   to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for
--   passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x"
--   prefix.
[$sel:pageNumber:TeletextSourceSettings'] :: TeletextSourceSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TeletextSourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputRectangle:TeletextSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>teletextSourceSettings_outputRectangle</a> - Optionally defines a
--   region where TTML style captions will be displayed
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageNumber:TeletextSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>teletextSourceSettings_pageNumber</a> - Specifies the teletext page
--   number within the data stream from which to extract captions. Range of
--   0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for passthrough. Should be
--   specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x" prefix.
newTeletextSourceSettings :: TeletextSourceSettings

-- | Optionally defines a region where TTML style captions will be
--   displayed
teletextSourceSettings_outputRectangle :: Lens' TeletextSourceSettings (Maybe CaptionRectangle)

-- | Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which
--   to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for
--   passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x"
--   prefix.
teletextSourceSettings_pageNumber :: Lens' TeletextSourceSettings (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TeletextSourceSettings.TeletextSourceSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionSelectorSettings

-- | Caption Selector Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionSelectorSettings</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionSelectorSettings
CaptionSelectorSettings' :: Maybe AncillarySourceSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe AribSourceSettings -> Maybe Scte27SourceSettings -> Maybe DvbSubSourceSettings -> Maybe Scte20SourceSettings -> Maybe TeletextSourceSettings -> CaptionSelectorSettings
[$sel:ancillarySourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe AncillarySourceSettings
[$sel:embeddedSourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedSourceSettings
[$sel:aribSourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe AribSourceSettings
[$sel:scte27SourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe Scte27SourceSettings
[$sel:dvbSubSourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe DvbSubSourceSettings
[$sel:scte20SourceSettings:CaptionSelectorSettings'] :: CaptionSelectorSettings -> Maybe Scte20SourceSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionSelector

-- | Output groups for this Live Event. Output groups contain information
--   about where streams should be distributed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionSelector</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionSelector
CaptionSelector' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings -> Text -> CaptionSelector

-- | When specified this field indicates the three letter language code of
--   the caption track to extract from the source.
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Maybe Text

-- | Caption selector settings.
[$sel:selectorSettings:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings

-- | Name identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate
--   this caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names
--   must be unique within an event.
[$sel:name:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionSelector'</a>,
--   <a>captionSelector_languageCode</a> - When specified this field
--   indicates the three letter language code of the caption track to
--   extract from the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectorSettings:CaptionSelector'</a>,
--   <a>captionSelector_selectorSettings</a> - Caption selector settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CaptionSelector'</a>, <a>captionSelector_name</a> - Name
--   identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate this
--   caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names must be
--   unique within an event.
newCaptionSelector :: Text -> CaptionSelector

-- | When specified this field indicates the three letter language code of
--   the caption track to extract from the source.
captionSelector_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionSelector (Maybe Text)

-- | Caption selector settings.
captionSelector_selectorSettings :: Lens' CaptionSelector (Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings)

-- | Name identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate
--   this caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names
--   must be unique within an event.
captionSelector_name :: Lens' CaptionSelector Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionSelector.CaptionSelector
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionSelector.CaptionSelector

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings

-- | Temporal Filter Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemporalFilterSettings</a> smart constructor.
data TemporalFilterSettings
TemporalFilterSettings' :: Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening -> Maybe TemporalFilterStrength -> TemporalFilterSettings

-- | If you enable this filter, the results are the following: - If the
--   source content is noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the
--   filter cleans up the source. - If the source content is already clean,
--   the filter tends to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate
--   control mode is QVBR.
[$sel:postFilterSharpening:TemporalFilterSettings'] :: TemporalFilterSettings -> Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening

-- | Choose a filter strength. We recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher
--   strength might take out good information, resulting in an image that
--   is overly soft.
[$sel:strength:TemporalFilterSettings'] :: TemporalFilterSettings -> Maybe TemporalFilterStrength

-- | Create a value of <a>TemporalFilterSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:postFilterSharpening:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_postFilterSharpening</a> - If you enable
--   this filter, the results are the following: - If the source content is
--   noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the filter cleans up
--   the source. - If the source content is already clean, the filter tends
--   to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate control mode is
--   QVBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strength:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_strength</a> - Choose a filter strength. We
--   recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher strength might take out good
--   information, resulting in an image that is overly soft.
newTemporalFilterSettings :: TemporalFilterSettings

-- | If you enable this filter, the results are the following: - If the
--   source content is noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the
--   filter cleans up the source. - If the source content is already clean,
--   the filter tends to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate
--   control mode is QVBR.
temporalFilterSettings_postFilterSharpening :: Lens' TemporalFilterSettings (Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening)

-- | Choose a filter strength. We recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher
--   strength might take out good information, resulting in an image that
--   is overly soft.
temporalFilterSettings_strength :: Lens' TemporalFilterSettings (Maybe TemporalFilterStrength)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TemporalFilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Mpeg2Settings

-- | Mpeg2 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMpeg2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Mpeg2Settings
