--   the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field
--   to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply spatial AQ using
--   the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply spatial AQ. If
--   you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores
--   any value in this field and doesn't apply spatial AQ.
h264Settings_spatialAq :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264SpatialAq)

-- | Determines how timecodes should be inserted into the video elementary
--   stream. - 'disabled': Do not include timecodes - 'picTimingSei': Pass
--   through picture timing SEI messages from the source specified in
--   Timecode Config
h264Settings_timecodeInsertion :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264TimecodeInsertionBehavior)

-- | Scene change detection. - On: inserts I-frames when scene change is
--   detected. - Off: does not force an I-frame when scene change is
--   detected.
h264Settings_sceneChangeDetect :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264SceneChangeDetect)

-- | This field indicates how the output pixel aspect ratio is specified.
--   If "specified" is selected then the output video pixel aspect ratio is
--   determined by parNumerator and parDenominator, else if
--   "initializeFromSource" is selected then the output pixsel aspect ratio
--   will be set equal to the input video pixel aspect ratio of the first
--   input.
h264Settings_parControl :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264ParControl)

-- | Color Space settings
h264Settings_colorSpaceSettings :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264ColorSpaceSettings)

-- | Only meaningful if sceneChangeDetect is set to enabled. Defaults to 5
--   if multiplex rate control is used. Enforces separation between
--   repeated (cadence) I-frames and I-frames inserted by Scene Change
--   Detection. If a scene change I-frame is within I-interval frames of a
--   cadence I-frame, the GOP is shrunk and/or stretched to the scene
--   change I-frame. GOP stretch requires enabling lookahead as well as
--   setting I-interval. The normal cadence resumes for the next GOP. Note:
--   Maximum GOP stretch = GOP size + Min-I-interval - 1
h264Settings_minIInterval :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Controls the target quality for the video encode. Applies only when
--   the rate control mode is QVBR. You can set a target quality or you can
--   let MediaLive determine the best quality. To set a target quality,
--   enter values in the QVBR quality level field and the Max bitrate
--   field. Enter values that suit your most important viewing devices.
--   Recommended values are: - Primary screen: Quality level: 8 to 10. Max
--   bitrate: 4M - PC or tablet: Quality level: 7. Max bitrate: 1.5M to 3M
--   - Smartphone: Quality level: 6. Max bitrate: 1M to 1.5M To let
--   MediaLive decide, leave the QVBR quality level field empty, and in Max
--   bitrate enter the maximum rate you want in the video. For more
--   information, see the section called "Video - rate control mode" in the
--   MediaLive user guide
h264Settings_qvbrQualityLevel :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Frequency of closed GOPs. In streaming applications, it is recommended
--   that this be set to 1 so a decoder joining mid-stream will receive an
--   IDR frame as quickly as possible. Setting this value to 0 will break
--   output segmenting.
h264Settings_gopClosedCadence :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Pixel Aspect Ratio denominator.
h264Settings_parDenominator :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Percentage of the buffer that should initially be filled (HRD buffer
--   model).
h264Settings_bufFillPct :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | For QVBR: See the tooltip for Quality level For VBR: Set the maximum
--   bitrate in order to accommodate expected spikes in the complexity of
--   the video.
h264Settings_maxBitrate :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Produces a bitstream compliant with SMPTE RP-2027.
h264Settings_syntax :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264Syntax)

-- | Number of reference frames to use. The encoder may use more than
--   requested if using B-frames and/or interlaced encoding.
h264Settings_numRefFrames :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | H.264 Level.
h264Settings_level :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264Level)

-- | Amount of lookahead. A value of low can decrease latency and memory
--   usage, while high can produce better quality for certain content.
h264Settings_lookAheadRateControl :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264LookAheadRateControl)

-- | H.264 Profile.
h264Settings_profile :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264Profile)

-- | Enables or disables adaptive quantization, which is a technique
--   MediaLive can apply to video on a frame-by-frame basis to produce more
--   compression without losing quality. There are three types of adaptive
--   quantization: flicker, spatial, and temporal. Set the field in one of
--   these ways: Set to Auto. Recommended. For each type of AQ, MediaLive
--   will determine if AQ is needed, and if so, the appropriate strength.
--   Set a strength (a value other than Auto or Disable). This strength
--   will apply to any of the AQ fields that you choose to enable. Set to
--   Disabled to disable all types of adaptive quantization.
h264Settings_adaptiveQuantization :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264AdaptiveQuantization)

-- | This field indicates how the output video frame rate is specified. If
--   "specified" is selected then the output video frame rate is determined
--   by framerateNumerator and framerateDenominator, else if
--   "initializeFromSource" is selected then the output video frame rate
--   will be set equal to the input video frame rate of the first input.
h264Settings_framerateControl :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264FramerateControl)

-- | This setting applies only when scan type is "interlaced." It controls
--   whether coding is performed on a field basis or on a frame basis.
--   (When the video is progressive, the coding is always performed on a
--   frame basis.) enabled: Force MediaLive to code on a field basis, so
--   that odd and even sets of fields are coded separately. disabled: Code
--   the two sets of fields separately (on a field basis) or together (on a
--   frame basis using PAFF), depending on what is most appropriate for the
--   content.
h264Settings_forceFieldPictures :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe H264ForceFieldPictures)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Required when the rate control mode is
--   VBR or CBR. Not used for QVBR. In an MS Smooth output group, each
--   output must have a unique value when its bitrate is rounded down to
--   the nearest multiple of 1000.
h264Settings_bitrate :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates that AFD values will be written into the output stream. If
--   afdSignaling is "auto", the system will try to preserve the input AFD
--   value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid). If set to
--   "fixed", the AFD value will be the value configured in the fixedAfd
--   parameter.
h264Settings_afdSignaling :: Lens' H264Settings (Maybe AfdSignaling)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.H264Settings.H264Settings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource

-- | Timecode Config Source
newtype TimecodeConfigSource
TimecodeConfigSource' :: Text -> TimecodeConfigSource
[fromTimecodeConfigSource] :: TimecodeConfigSource -> Text
pattern TimecodeConfigSource_EMBEDDED :: TimecodeConfigSource
pattern TimecodeConfigSource_SYSTEMCLOCK :: TimecodeConfigSource
pattern TimecodeConfigSource_ZEROBASED :: TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfigSource.TimecodeConfigSource


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig

-- | Timecode Config
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimecodeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TimecodeConfig
TimecodeConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Threshold in frames beyond which output timecode is resynchronized to
--   the input timecode. Discrepancies below this threshold are permitted
--   to avoid unnecessary discontinuities in the output timecode. No
--   timecode sync when this is not specified.
[$sel:syncThreshold:TimecodeConfig'] :: TimecodeConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
[$sel:source:TimecodeConfig'] :: TimecodeConfig -> TimecodeConfigSource

-- | Create a value of <a>TimecodeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncThreshold:TimecodeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>timecodeConfig_syncThreshold</a> - Threshold in frames beyond which
--   output timecode is resynchronized to the input timecode. Discrepancies
--   below this threshold are permitted to avoid unnecessary
--   discontinuities in the output timecode. No timecode sync when this is
--   not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:TimecodeConfig'</a>, <a>timecodeConfig_source</a> -
--   Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
newTimecodeConfig :: TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Threshold in frames beyond which output timecode is resynchronized to
--   the input timecode. Discrepancies below this threshold are permitted
--   to avoid unnecessary discontinuities in the output timecode. No
--   timecode sync when this is not specified.
timecodeConfig_syncThreshold :: Lens' TimecodeConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
timecodeConfig_source :: Lens' TimecodeConfig TimecodeConfigSource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.TimecodeConfig.TimecodeConfig

--   constructor.
data TransferringInputDeviceSummary
TransferringInputDeviceSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDeviceTransferType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TransferringInputDeviceSummary

-- | The optional message that the sender has attached to the transfer.

-- | The type (direction) of the input device transfer.
[$sel:transferType:TransferringInputDeviceSummary'] :: TransferringInputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceTransferType

-- | The unique ID of the input device.
[$sel:id:TransferringInputDeviceSummary'] :: TransferringInputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

[$sel:targetCustomerId:TransferringInputDeviceSummary'] :: TransferringInputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings

-- | Udp Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUdpOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UdpOutputSettings
UdpOutputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe FecOutputSettings -> OutputLocationRef -> UdpContainerSettings -> UdpOutputSettings

-- | UDP output buffering in milliseconds. Larger values increase latency
--   through the transcoder but simultaneously assist the transcoder in
--   maintaining a constant, low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating
--   clock recovery, input switching, input disruptions, picture
--   reordering, etc.
[$sel:bufferMsec:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Settings for enabling and adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP
--   outputs.
[$sel:fecOutputSettings:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> Maybe FecOutputSettings

-- | Destination address and port number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be
--   unicast or multicast RTP or UDP (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or
--   udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
[$sel:destination:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> OutputLocationRef
[$sel:containerSettings:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> UdpContainerSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>UdpOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferMsec:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_bufferMsec</a> - UDP output buffering in
--   milliseconds. Larger values increase latency through the transcoder
--   but simultaneously assist the transcoder in maintaining a constant,
--   low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating clock recovery, input
--   switching, input disruptions, picture reordering, etc.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fecOutputSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_fecOutputSettings</a> - Settings for enabling and
--   adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_destination</a> - Destination address and port
--   number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be unicast or multicast RTP or UDP
--   (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_containerSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
newUdpOutputSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> UdpContainerSettings -> UdpOutputSettings

-- | UDP output buffering in milliseconds. Larger values increase latency
--   through the transcoder but simultaneously assist the transcoder in
--   maintaining a constant, low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating
--   clock recovery, input switching, input disruptions, picture
--   reordering, etc.
udpOutputSettings_bufferMsec :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Settings for enabling and adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP
--   outputs.
udpOutputSettings_fecOutputSettings :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings (Maybe FecOutputSettings)

-- | Destination address and port number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be
--   unicast or multicast RTP or UDP (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or
--   udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
udpOutputSettings_destination :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings OutputLocationRef

-- | Undocumented member.
udpOutputSettings_containerSettings :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings UdpContainerSettings
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpOutputSettings.UdpOutputSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output

-- | Output settings. There can be multiple outputs within a group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutput</a> smart constructor.
data Output
Output' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> OutputSettings -> Output

-- | The names of the AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this
--   output.
[$sel:audioDescriptionNames:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the VideoDescription used as the source for this output.
[$sel:videoDescriptionName:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The name used to identify an output.
[$sel:outputName:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The names of the CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this
--   output.
[$sel:captionDescriptionNames:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Output type-specific settings.
[$sel:outputSettings:Output'] :: Output -> OutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>Output</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_audioDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoDescriptionName:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_videoDescriptionName</a> - The name of the VideoDescription
--   used as the source for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputName:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputName</a> - The name
--   used to identify an output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_captionDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSettings:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputSettings</a> -
--   Output type-specific settings.
newOutput :: OutputSettings -> Output

-- | The names of the AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this
--   output.
output_audioDescriptionNames :: Lens' Output (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the VideoDescription used as the source for this output.
output_videoDescriptionName :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The name used to identify an output.
output_outputName :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The names of the CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this
--   output.
output_captionDescriptionNames :: Lens' Output (Maybe [Text])

-- | Output type-specific settings.
output_outputSettings :: Lens' Output OutputSettings
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Output.Output

instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame.UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpGroupSettings

-- | Udp Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUdpGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UdpGroupSettings
UdpGroupSettings' :: Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut -> UdpGroupSettings

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies behavior of last resort when input video is lost, and no
--   more backup inputs are available. When dropTs is selected the entire
--   transport stream will stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected
--   the program can be dropped from the transport stream (and replaced
--   with null packets to meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when
--   emitProgram is chosen the transport stream will continue to be
--   produced normally with repeat frames, black frames, or slate frames
--   substituted for the absent input video.
[$sel:inputLossAction:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut

-- | Create a value of <a>UdpGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame</a> - Indicates ID3 frame
--   that has the timecode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period</a> - Timed Metadata
--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Specifies behavior of last
--   resort when input video is lost, and no more backup inputs are
--   available. When dropTs is selected the entire transport stream will
--   stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected the program can be
--   dropped from the transport stream (and replaced with null packets to
--   meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when emitProgram is chosen the
--   transport stream will continue to be produced normally with repeat
--   frames, black frames, or slate frames substituted for the absent input
--   video.
newUdpGroupSettings :: UdpGroupSettings

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame)

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies behavior of last resort when input video is lost, and no
--   more backup inputs are available. When dropTs is selected the entire
--   transport stream will stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected
--   the program can be dropped from the transport stream (and replaced
--   with null packets to meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when
--   emitProgram is chosen the transport stream will continue to be
--   produced normally with repeat frames, black frames, or slate frames
--   substituted for the absent input video.
udpGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpGroupSettings.UdpGroupSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.UdpGroupSettings.UdpGroupSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.OutputGroup

-- | Output groups for this Live Event. Output groups contain information
--   about where streams should be distributed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputGroup</a> smart constructor.
data OutputGroup
OutputGroup' :: Maybe Text -> [Output] -> OutputGroupSettings -> OutputGroup

-- | Custom output group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters,
--   numbers, and the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters
--   allowed.
[$sel:name:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> Maybe Text
[$sel:outputs:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> [Output]

-- | Settings associated with the output group.
[$sel:outputGroupSettings:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> OutputGroupSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputGroup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OutputGroup'</a>, <a>outputGroup_name</a> - Custom output
--   group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters, numbers, and
--   the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputs:OutputGroup'</a>, <a>outputGroup_outputs</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputGroupSettings:OutputGroup'</a>,
--   <a>outputGroup_outputGroupSettings</a> - Settings associated with the
--   output group.
newOutputGroup :: OutputGroupSettings -> OutputGroup

-- | Custom output group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters,
--   numbers, and the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters
--   allowed.
outputGroup_name :: Lens' OutputGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
outputGroup_outputs :: Lens' OutputGroup [Output]

-- | Settings associated with the output group.
outputGroup_outputGroupSettings :: Lens' OutputGroup OutputGroupSettings
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.OutputGroup.OutputGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.OutputGroup.OutputGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.OutputGroup.OutputGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.OutputGroup.OutputGroup

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | Placeholder documentation for VideoBlackFailoverSettings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VideoBlackFailoverSettings
VideoBlackFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive
--   considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black,
--   every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is
--   calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white.
--   Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula
--   works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1
--   in 10-bit color depth: (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of
--   102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color
--   depth: (255*0.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is
--   'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
[$sel:blackDetectThreshold:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'] :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   black before automatic input failover occurs.
[$sel:videoBlackThresholdMsec:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'] :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackDetectThreshold:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_blackDetectThreshold</a> - A value used
--   in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive considers a pixel
--   to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black, every pixel in a
--   frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is calculated as a
--   percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white. Therefore .1 means 10%
--   white (or 90% black). Note how the formula works for any color depth.
--   For example, if you set this field to 0.1 in 10-bit color depth:
--   (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of 102 or less is 'black'.
--   If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color depth: (255*0.1=25.5),
--   which means a pixel value of 25 or less is 'black'. The range is 0.0
--   to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoBlackThresholdMsec:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_videoBlackThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be black before
--   automatic input failover occurs.
newVideoBlackFailoverSettings :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive
--   considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black,
--   every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is
--   calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white.
--   Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula
--   works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1
--   in 10-bit color depth: (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of
--   102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color
--   depth: (255*0.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is
--   'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
videoBlackFailoverSettings_blackDetectThreshold :: Lens' VideoBlackFailoverSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   black before automatic input failover occurs.
videoBlackFailoverSettings_videoBlackThresholdMsec :: Lens' VideoBlackFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackFailoverSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.FailoverConditionSettings

-- | Settings for one failover condition.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverConditionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverConditionSettings
FailoverConditionSettings' :: Maybe VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe InputLossFailoverSettings -> Maybe AudioSilenceFailoverSettings -> FailoverConditionSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is considered black for
--   the specified period.
[$sel:videoBlackSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'] :: FailoverConditionSettings -> Maybe VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if the specified audio selector is
--   silent for the specified period.

--   period.

--   <a>$sel:inputLossSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_inputLossSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if content is not detected in this input for the
--   specified period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSilenceSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_audioSilenceSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if the specified audio selector is silent for the
--   specified period.

--   the specified period.

--   input for the specified period.

--   silent for the specified period.
failoverConditionSettings_audioSilenceSettings :: Lens' FailoverConditionSettings (Maybe AudioSilenceFailoverSettings)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | The settings for Automatic Input Failover.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomaticInputFailoverSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
AutomaticInputFailoverSettings' :: Maybe [FailoverCondition] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputPreference -> Text -> AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur,
--   MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.
[$sel:failoverConditions:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe [FailoverCondition]

-- | This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to
--   be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
[$sel:errorClearTimeMsec:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered.
[$sel:inputPreference:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe InputPreference

-- | The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover
--   pair.
[$sel:secondaryInputId:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomaticInputFailoverSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failoverConditions:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions</a> - A list of
--   failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur, MediaLive will
--   perform a failover to the other input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorClearTimeMsec:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec</a> - This clear
--   time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to be
--   considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPreference:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference</a> - Input
--   preference when deciding which input to make active when a previously
--   failed input has recovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secondaryInputId:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId</a> - The input ID
--   of the secondary input in the automatic input failover pair.
newAutomaticInputFailoverSettings :: Text -> AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur,
--   MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe [FailoverCondition])

-- | This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to
--   be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe InputPreference)

-- | The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover
--   pair.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoCodecSettings

-- | Video Codec Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoCodecSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VideoCodecSettings
VideoCodecSettings' :: Maybe FrameCaptureSettings -> Maybe Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe H264Settings -> Maybe H265Settings -> VideoCodecSettings
[$sel:frameCaptureSettings:VideoCodecSettings'] :: VideoCodecSettings -> Maybe FrameCaptureSettings
[$sel:mpeg2Settings:VideoCodecSettings'] :: VideoCodecSettings -> Maybe Mpeg2Settings

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription

-- | Video settings for this stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VideoDescription
VideoDescription' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd -> Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoCodecSettings -> Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
[$sel:height:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates how MediaLive will respond to the AFD values that might be
--   in the input video. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if
--   your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH.
--   RESPOND: MediaLive clips the input video using a formula that uses the
--   AFD values (configured in afdSignaling ), the input display aspect
--   ratio, and the output display aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes
--   the AFD values in the output, unless the codec for this encode is
--   FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH: MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does
--   not clip the video. But MediaLive does include the values in the
--   output. NONE: MediaLive does not clip the input video and does not
--   include the AFD values in the output
[$sel:respondToAfd:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd

-- | Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
[$sel:width:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Video codec settings.
[$sel:codecSettings:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoCodecSettings

-- | STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures the output position to stretch the video
--   to the specified output resolution (height and width). This option
--   will override any position value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes
--   (pillar boxes or letter boxes) around the video to provide the
--   specified output resolution.
[$sel:scalingBehavior:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior

-- | Changes the strength of the anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is
--   the softest setting, 100 is the sharpest. A setting of 50 is
--   recommended for most content.
[$sel:sharpness:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this Description. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
[$sel:name:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_height</a> -
--   Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:respondToAfd:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_respondToAfd</a> - Indicates how MediaLive will
--   respond to the AFD values that might be in the input video. If you do
--   not know what AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not
--   given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH. RESPOND: MediaLive clips the
--   input video using a formula that uses the AFD values (configured in
--   afdSignaling ), the input display aspect ratio, and the output display
--   aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes the AFD values in the output,
--   unless the codec for this encode is FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH:
--   MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does not clip the video. But
--   MediaLive does include the values in the output. NONE: MediaLive does
--   not clip the input video and does not include the AFD values in the
--   output
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_width</a> -
--   Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_codecSettings</a> - Video codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingBehavior:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_scalingBehavior</a> - STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures
--   the output position to stretch the video to the specified output
--   resolution (height and width). This option will override any position
--   value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes (pillar boxes or letter boxes)
--   around the video to provide the specified output resolution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sharpness:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_sharpness</a> - Changes the strength of the
--   anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is the softest setting, 100 is
--   the sharpest. A setting of 50 is recommended for most content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this Description. Description names should be unique within
--   this Live Event.
newVideoDescription :: Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
videoDescription_height :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates how MediaLive will respond to the AFD values that might be
--   in the input video. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if
--   your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH.
--   RESPOND: MediaLive clips the input video using a formula that uses the
--   AFD values (configured in afdSignaling ), the input display aspect
--   ratio, and the output display aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes
--   the AFD values in the output, unless the codec for this encode is
--   FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH: MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does
--   not clip the video. But MediaLive does include the values in the
--   output. NONE: MediaLive does not clip the input video and does not
--   include the AFD values in the output
videoDescription_respondToAfd :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd)

-- | Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
videoDescription_width :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | Video codec settings.
videoDescription_codecSettings :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoCodecSettings)

-- | STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures the output position to stretch the video
--   to the specified output resolution (height and width). This option
--   will override any position value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes
--   (pillar boxes or letter boxes) around the video to provide the
--   specified output resolution.
videoDescription_scalingBehavior :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior)

-- | Changes the strength of the anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is
--   the softest setting, 100 is the sharpest. A setting of 50 is
--   recommended for most content.
videoDescription_sharpness :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this Description. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
videoDescription_name :: Lens' VideoDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoDescription.VideoDescription

--   stream. If the program doesn't exist, the first program within the
--   transport stream will be selected by default.

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoSelectorProgramId</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>videoSelectorProgramId_programId</a> - Selects a specific program
--   from within a multi-program transport stream. If the program doesn't
--   exist, the first program within the transport stream will be selected
--   by default.
newVideoSelectorProgramId :: VideoSelectorProgramId

-- | Selects a specific program from within a multi-program transport
--   stream. If the program doesn't exist, the first program within the
--   transport stream will be selected by default.
videoSelectorProgramId_programId :: Lens' VideoSelectorProgramId (Maybe Natural)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelectorSettings

-- | Video Selector Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoSelectorSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VideoSelectorSettings
VideoSelectorSettings' :: Maybe VideoSelectorPid -> Maybe VideoSelectorProgramId -> VideoSelectorSettings
[$sel:videoSelectorPid:VideoSelectorSettings'] :: VideoSelectorSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorPid
[$sel:videoSelectorProgramId:VideoSelectorSettings'] :: VideoSelectorSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorProgramId

newVideoSelectorSettings :: VideoSelectorSettings

videoSelectorSettings_videoSelectorProgramId :: Lens' VideoSelectorSettings (Maybe VideoSelectorProgramId)

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector

-- | Specifies a particular video stream within an input source. An input
--   may have only a single video selector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoSelector</a> smart constructor.
data VideoSelector
VideoSelector' :: Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage -> Maybe VideoSelectorSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace -> VideoSelector

-- | Applies only if colorSpace is a value other than follow. This field
--   controls how the value in the colorSpace field will be used. fallback
--   means that when the input does include color space data, that data
--   will be used, but when the input has no color space data, the value in
--   colorSpace will be used. Choose fallback if your input is sometimes
--   missing color space data, but when it does have color space data, that
--   data is correct. force means to always use the value in colorSpace.
--   Choose force if your input usually has no color space data or might
--   have unreliable color space data.
[$sel:colorSpaceUsage:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage

-- | The video selector settings.
[$sel:selectorSettings:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorSettings

-- | Color space settings
[$sel:colorSpaceSettings:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings

-- | Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
[$sel:colorSpace:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceUsage:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceUsage</a> - Applies only if colorSpace is a
--   value other than follow. This field controls how the value in the
--   colorSpace field will be used. fallback means that when the input does
--   include color space data, that data will be used, but when the input
--   has no color space data, the value in colorSpace will be used. Choose
--   fallback if your input is sometimes missing color space data, but when
--   it does have color space data, that data is correct. force means to
--   always use the value in colorSpace. Choose force if your input usually
--   has no color space data or might have unreliable color space data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectorSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_selectorSettings</a> - The video selector settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceSettings</a> - Color space settings
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpace:VideoSelector'</a>, <a>videoSelector_colorSpace</a>
--   - Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
newVideoSelector :: VideoSelector

-- | Applies only if colorSpace is a value other than follow. This field
--   controls how the value in the colorSpace field will be used. fallback
--   means that when the input does include color space data, that data
--   will be used, but when the input has no color space data, the value in
--   colorSpace will be used. Choose fallback if your input is sometimes
--   missing color space data, but when it does have color space data, that
--   data is correct. force means to always use the value in colorSpace.
--   Choose force if your input usually has no color space data or might
--   have unreliable color space data.
videoSelector_colorSpaceUsage :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage)

-- | The video selector settings.
videoSelector_selectorSettings :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorSettings)

-- | Color space settings
videoSelector_colorSpaceSettings :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings)

-- | Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
videoSelector_colorSpace :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VideoSelector.VideoSelector

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings

-- | Live Event input parameters. There can be multiple inputs in a single
--   Live Event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputSettings
InputSettings' :: Maybe InputDenoiseFilter -> Maybe [AudioSelector] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference -> Maybe VideoSelector -> Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior -> Maybe InputFilter -> Maybe InputDeblockFilter -> Maybe [CaptionSelector] -> Maybe NetworkInputSettings -> InputSettings

-- | Enable or disable the denoise filter when filtering.
[$sel:denoiseFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputDenoiseFilter

-- | Used to select the audio stream to decode for inputs that have
--   multiple available.
[$sel:audioSelectors:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe [AudioSelector]

-- | Adjusts the magnitude of filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
[$sel:filterStrength:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether to extract applicable ancillary data from a
--   SMPTE-2038 source in this input. Applicable data types are captions,
--   timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104 messages. - PREFER: Extract from
--   SMPTE-2038 if present in this input, otherwise extract from another
--   source (if any). - IGNORE: Never extract any ancillary data from
--   SMPTE-2038.
[$sel:smpte2038DataPreference:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference

-- | Informs which video elementary stream to decode for input types that
--   have multiple available.
[$sel:videoSelector:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe VideoSelector

-- | Loop input if it is a file. This allows a file input to be streamed
--   indefinitely.
[$sel:sourceEndBehavior:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior

-- | Turns on the filter for this input. MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking
--   filter enabled by default. 1) auto - filtering will be applied
--   depending on input type/quality 2) disabled - no filtering will be
--   applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will be applied regardless
--   of input type
[$sel:inputFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputFilter

-- | Enable or disable the deblock filter when filtering.
[$sel:deblockFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputDeblockFilter

-- | Used to select the caption input to use for inputs that have multiple
--   available.
[$sel:captionSelectors:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe [CaptionSelector]

-- | Input settings.
[$sel:networkInputSettings:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe NetworkInputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denoiseFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_denoiseFilter</a> - Enable or disable the denoise
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_audioSelectors</a> - Used to select the audio stream
--   to decode for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterStrength:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_filterStrength</a> - Adjusts the magnitude of
--   filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
--   
--   <a>$sel:smpte2038DataPreference:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_smpte2038DataPreference</a> - Specifies whether to
--   extract applicable ancillary data from a SMPTE-2038 source in this
--   input. Applicable data types are captions, timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104
--   messages. - PREFER: Extract from SMPTE-2038 if present in this input,
--   otherwise extract from another source (if any). - IGNORE: Never
--   extract any ancillary data from SMPTE-2038.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoSelector:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_videoSelector</a> - Informs which video elementary
--   stream to decode for input types that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndBehavior:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_sourceEndBehavior</a> - Loop input if it is a file.
--   This allows a file input to be streamed indefinitely.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_inputFilter</a> - Turns on the filter for this input.
--   MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking filter enabled by default. 1) auto -
--   filtering will be applied depending on input type/quality 2) disabled
--   - no filtering will be applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will
--   be applied regardless of input type
--   
--   <a>$sel:deblockFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_deblockFilter</a> - Enable or disable the deblock
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_captionSelectors</a> - Used to select the caption
--   input to use for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInputSettings:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_networkInputSettings</a> - Input settings.
newInputSettings :: InputSettings

-- | Enable or disable the denoise filter when filtering.
inputSettings_denoiseFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputDenoiseFilter)

-- | Used to select the audio stream to decode for inputs that have
--   multiple available.
inputSettings_audioSelectors :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe [AudioSelector])

-- | Adjusts the magnitude of filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
inputSettings_filterStrength :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies whether to extract applicable ancillary data from a
--   SMPTE-2038 source in this input. Applicable data types are captions,
--   timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104 messages. - PREFER: Extract from
--   SMPTE-2038 if present in this input, otherwise extract from another
--   source (if any). - IGNORE: Never extract any ancillary data from
--   SMPTE-2038.
inputSettings_smpte2038DataPreference :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference)

-- | Informs which video elementary stream to decode for input types that
--   have multiple available.
inputSettings_videoSelector :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe VideoSelector)

-- | Loop input if it is a file. This allows a file input to be streamed
--   indefinitely.
inputSettings_sourceEndBehavior :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior)

-- | Turns on the filter for this input. MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking
--   filter enabled by default. 1) auto - filtering will be applied
--   depending on input type/quality 2) disabled - no filtering will be
--   applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will be applied regardless
--   of input type
inputSettings_inputFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputFilter)

-- | Enable or disable the deblock filter when filtering.
inputSettings_deblockFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputDeblockFilter)

-- | Used to select the caption input to use for inputs that have multiple
--   available.
inputSettings_captionSelectors :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe [CaptionSelector])

-- | Input settings.
inputSettings_networkInputSettings :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe NetworkInputSettings)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.InputSettings.InputSettings

data InputAttachment
InputAttachment' :: Maybe InputSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> InputAttachment

-- | Settings of an input (caption selector, etc.)
[$sel:inputSettings:InputAttachment'] :: InputAttachment -> Maybe InputSettings

[$sel:inputId:InputAttachment'] :: InputAttachment -> Maybe Text

-- | User-specified name for the attachment. This is required if the user
--   wants to use this input in an input switch action.

--   declaring the input unhealthy and failing over to a different input.

--   settings for defining what the conditions are for declaring the input
--   unhealthy and failing over to a different input.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings

-- | The properties for a private VPC Output When this property is
--   specified, the output egress addresses will be created in a user
--   specified VPC
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettings
VpcOutputSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> VpcOutputSettings

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Output
--   VPC network interfaces. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | List of public address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will
--   be created in Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two
--   for STANDARD channels
[$sel:publicAddressAllocationIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Output VPC network interfaces. If
--   none are specified then the VPC default security group will be used
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAddressAllocationIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_publicAddressAllocationIds</a> - List of public
--   address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will be created in
--   Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two for STANDARD
--   channels
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique
--   availability zones (AZ).
newVpcOutputSettings :: VpcOutputSettings

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Output
--   VPC network interfaces. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used
vpcOutputSettings_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | List of public address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will
--   be created in Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two
--   for STANDARD channels
vpcOutputSettings_publicAddressAllocationIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
vpcOutputSettings_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettings.VpcOutputSettings


module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | The properties for a private VPC Output
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettingsDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettingsDescription
VpcOutputSettingsDescription' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | A list of up EC2 VPC security group IDs attached to the Output VPC
--   network interfaces.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
[$sel:availabilityZones:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the
--   customer's VPC
[$sel:networkInterfaceIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcOutputSettingsDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   EC2 VPC security group IDs attached to the Output VPC network
--   interfaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_availabilityZones</a> - The
--   Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet
--   IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped
--   to two unique availability zones (AZ).
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_networkInterfaceIds</a> - A list of
--   Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the customer's VPC
newVpcOutputSettingsDescription :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription

--   network interfaces.
vpcOutputSettingsDescription_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettingsDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
vpcOutputSettingsDescription_availabilityZones :: Lens' VpcOutputSettingsDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
vpcOutputSettingsDescription_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettingsDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the
--   customer's VPC
vpcOutputSettingsDescription_networkInterfaceIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettingsDescription (Maybe [Text])

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettingsDescription.VpcOutputSettingsDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.VpcOutputSettingsDescription.VpcOutputSettingsDescription
