module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary

-- | Placeholder documentation for ChannelSummary
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelSummary
ChannelSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> ChannelSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
[$sel:roleArn:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
[$sel:arn:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the channel.
[$sel:id:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
[$sel:channelClass:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
[$sel:name:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
[$sel:destinations:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:state:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe ChannelState

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
[$sel:inputAttachments:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Settings for VPC output
[$sel:vpc:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
[$sel:egressEndpoints:ChannelSummary'] :: ChannelSummary -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint]

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_roleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSpecification:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_inputSpecification</a> - Specification of network
--   and file inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_arn</a> - The
--   unique arn of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_id</a> - The unique
--   id of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_pipelinesRunningCount</a> - The number of currently
--   healthy pipelines.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_channelClass</a> - The class for this channel.
--   STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a
--   channel with one pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_logLevel</a> -
--   The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the channel. (user-mutable)
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_destinations</a> - A list of destinations of the
--   channel. For UDP outputs, there is one destination per output. For
--   other types (HLS, for example), there is one destination per packager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_state</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachments:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_inputAttachments</a> - List of input attachments for
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_tags</a> - A
--   collection of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:ChannelSummary'</a>, <a>channelSummary_vpc</a> - Settings
--   for VPC output
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdiInputSpecification:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_cdiInputSpecification</a> - Specification of CDI
--   inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:egressEndpoints:ChannelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>channelSummary_egressEndpoints</a> - The endpoints where outgoing
--   connections initiate from
newChannelSummary :: ChannelSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
channelSummary_roleArn :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
channelSummary_inputSpecification :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe InputSpecification)

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
channelSummary_arn :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique id of the channel.
channelSummary_id :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
channelSummary_pipelinesRunningCount :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
channelSummary_channelClass :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe ChannelClass)

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
channelSummary_logLevel :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe LogLevel)

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
channelSummary_name :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
channelSummary_destinations :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe [OutputDestination])

-- | Undocumented member.
channelSummary_state :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe ChannelState)

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
channelSummary_inputAttachments :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe [InputAttachment])

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
channelSummary_tags :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Settings for VPC output
channelSummary_vpc :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription)

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
channelSummary_cdiInputSpecification :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe CdiInputSpecification)

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
channelSummary_egressEndpoints :: Lens' ChannelSummary (Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.ChannelSummary.ChannelSummary

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WavSettings

-- | Wav Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWavSettings</a> smart constructor.
data WavSettings
WavSettings' :: Maybe WavCodingMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> WavSettings

-- | The audio coding mode for the WAV audio. The mode determines the
--   number of channels in the audio.
[$sel:codingMode:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe WavCodingMode

-- | Bits per sample.
[$sel:bitDepth:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Sample rate in Hz.
[$sel:sampleRate:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe Double

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   number of channels in the audio.

--   <a>$sel:bitDepth:WavSettings'</a>, <a>wavSettings_bitDepth</a> - Bits
--   per sample.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:WavSettings'</a>, <a>wavSettings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz.
newWavSettings :: WavSettings

--   number of channels in the audio.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription

-- | Audio Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AudioDescription
AudioDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioType -> Maybe AudioCodecSettings -> Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl -> Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl -> Maybe RemixSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output
--   track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is
--   no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
[$sel:languageCode:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for
--   audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.
[$sel:audioType:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioType

-- | Audio codec settings.
[$sel:codecSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioCodecSettings

-- | Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the
--   output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The
--   languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when
--   followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code
--   specified by the input.
[$sel:languageCodeControl:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl

-- | Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input
--   contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to
--   the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. Note that this field and
--   audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
[$sel:audioTypeControl:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl

-- | Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the
--   output audio channels.
[$sel:remixSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe RemixSettings

-- | Advanced audio normalization settings.
[$sel:audioNormalizationSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed
--   by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).
[$sel:streamName:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this
--   AudioDescription.
[$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Text

-- | The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be
--   unique within this Live Event.
[$sel:name:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCode</a> - RFC 5646 language code
--   representing the language of the audio output track. Only used if
--   languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is no ISO 639 language
--   code specified in the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioType:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioType</a> - Applies only if audioTypeControl
--   is useConfigured. The values for audioType are defined in ISO-IEC
--   13818-1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_codecSettings</a> - Audio codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCodeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCodeControl</a> - Choosing followInput
--   will cause the ISO 639 language code of the output to follow the ISO
--   639 language code of the input. The languageCode will be used when
--   useConfigured is set, or when followInput is selected but there is no
--   ISO 639 language code specified by the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTypeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioTypeControl</a> - Determines how audio type
--   is determined. followInput: If the input contains an ISO 639
--   audioType, then that value is passed through to the output. If the
--   input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. useConfigured: The value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. Note that this field and audioType are both
--   ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remixSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_remixSettings</a> - Settings that control how
--   input audio channels are remixed into the output audio channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioNormalizationSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings</a> - Advanced audio
--   normalization settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_streamName</a> - Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS
--   outputs. Indicates the name displayed by the player (eg. English, or
--   Director Commentary).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioSelectorName</a> - The name of the
--   AudioSelector used as the source for this AudioDescription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AudioDescription'</a>, <a>audioDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
newAudioDescription :: Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output
--   track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is
--   no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
audioDescription_languageCode :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for
--   audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.
audioDescription_audioType :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioType)

-- | Audio codec settings.
audioDescription_codecSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioCodecSettings)

-- | Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the
--   output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The
--   languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when
--   followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code
--   specified by the input.
audioDescription_languageCodeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl)

-- | Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input
--   contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to
--   the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. Note that this field and
--   audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
audioDescription_audioTypeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl)

-- | Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the
--   output audio channels.
audioDescription_remixSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe RemixSettings)

-- | Advanced audio normalization settings.
audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings)

-- | Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed
--   by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).
audioDescription_streamName :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this
--   AudioDescription.
audioDescription_audioSelectorName :: Lens' AudioDescription Text

-- | The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be
--   unique within this Live Event.
audioDescription_name :: Lens' AudioDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.AudioDescription.AudioDescription

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings

-- | Webvtt Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebvttDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data WebvttDestinationSettings
WebvttDestinationSettings' :: Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl -> WebvttDestinationSettings

-- | Controls whether the color and position of the source captions is
--   passed through to the WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only
--   if the source captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't
--   pass through the style. The output captions will not contain any font
--   styling information.
[$sel:styleControl:WebvttDestinationSettings'] :: WebvttDestinationSettings -> Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl

-- | Create a value of <a>WebvttDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:styleControl:WebvttDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>webvttDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Controls whether the
--   color and position of the source captions is passed through to the
--   WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only if the source
--   captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't pass through
--   the style. The output captions will not contain any font styling
--   information.
newWebvttDestinationSettings :: WebvttDestinationSettings

-- | Controls whether the color and position of the source captions is
--   passed through to the WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only
--   if the source captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't
--   pass through the style. The output captions will not contain any font
--   styling information.
webvttDestinationSettings_styleControl :: Lens' WebvttDestinationSettings (Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.WebvttDestinationSettings.WebvttDestinationSettings

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.CaptionDescription

-- | Caption Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionDescription
CaptionDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings -> Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

-- | ISO 639-2 three-digit code: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Human readable information to indicate captions available for players
--   (eg. English, or Spanish).
[$sel:languageDescription:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional settings for captions destination that depend on the
--   destination type.
[$sel:destinationSettings:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings

-- | Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when
--   generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector
--   name.
[$sel:captionSelectorName:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Text

-- | Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
[$sel:name:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageCode</a> - ISO 639-2 three-digit code:
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageDescription:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageDescription</a> - Human readable
--   information to indicate captions available for players (eg. English,
--   or Spanish).
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationSettings:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_destinationSettings</a> - Additional settings
--   for captions destination that depend on the destination type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectorName:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_captionSelectorName</a> - Specifies which input
--   caption selector to use as a caption source when generating output
--   captions. This field should match a captionSelector name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CaptionDescription'</a>, <a>captionDescription_name</a> -
--   Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
newCaptionDescription :: Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

-- | ISO 639-2 three-digit code: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
captionDescription_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Human readable information to indicate captions available for players
--   (eg. English, or Spanish).
captionDescription_languageDescription :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional settings for captions destination that depend on the
--   destination type.
captionDescription_destinationSettings :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings)

-- | Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when
--   generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector
--   name.
captionDescription_captionSelectorName :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text

-- | Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
captionDescription_name :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.EncoderSettings

-- | Encoder Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncoderSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EncoderSettings
EncoderSettings' :: Maybe MotionGraphicsConfiguration -> Maybe FeatureActivations -> Maybe GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe AvailConfiguration -> Maybe AvailBlanking -> Maybe NielsenConfiguration -> Maybe BlackoutSlate -> Maybe [CaptionDescription] -> [VideoDescription] -> [AudioDescription] -> [OutputGroup] -> TimecodeConfig -> EncoderSettings

-- | Settings for motion graphics.
[$sel:motionGraphicsConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsConfiguration

-- | Feature Activations
[$sel:featureActivations:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe FeatureActivations

-- | Configuration settings that apply to the event as a whole.
[$sel:globalConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe GlobalConfiguration

-- | Event-wide configuration settings for ad avail insertion.
[$sel:availConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe AvailConfiguration

-- | Settings for ad avail blanking.
[$sel:availBlanking:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe AvailBlanking

-- | Nielsen configuration settings.
[$sel:nielsenConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe NielsenConfiguration

-- | Settings for blackout slate.
[$sel:blackoutSlate:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe BlackoutSlate

-- | Settings for caption decriptions
[$sel:captionDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe [CaptionDescription]
[$sel:videoDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [VideoDescription]
[$sel:audioDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [AudioDescription]
[$sel:outputGroups:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [OutputGroup]

-- | Contains settings used to acquire and adjust timecode information from
--   inputs.
[$sel:timecodeConfig:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EncoderSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>encoderSettings_motionGraphicsConfiguration</a> - Settings for
--   motion graphics.
--

--   <a>encoderSettings_featureActivations</a> - Feature Activations
--   
--   <a>$sel:globalConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_globalConfiguration</a> - Configuration settings
--   that apply to the event as a whole.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availConfiguration</a> - Event-wide configuration
--   settings for ad avail insertion.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availBlanking:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availBlanking</a> - Settings for ad avail blanking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_nielsenConfiguration</a> - Nielsen configuration
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackoutSlate:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_blackoutSlate</a> - Settings for blackout slate.

--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,

--   decriptions

--   <a>encoderSettings_timecodeConfig</a> - Contains settings used to
--   acquire and adjust timecode information from inputs.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types.Channel

-- | Placeholder documentation for Channel
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannel</a> smart constructor.
data Channel
Channel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [PipelineDetail] -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> Channel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
[$sel:roleArn:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encoderSettings:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe EncoderSettings

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
[$sel:arn:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the channel.
[$sel:id:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Int

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
[$sel:channelClass:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
[$sel:name:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
[$sel:destinations:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:state:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe ChannelState

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
[$sel:inputAttachments:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [PipelineDetail]

-- | Settings for VPC output
[$sel:vpc:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
[$sel:egressEndpoints:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint]

-- | Create a value of <a>Channel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_roleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the Channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encoderSettings:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_encoderSettings</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSpecification:Channel'</a>,
--   <a>channel_inputSpecification</a> - Specification of network and file
--   inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_arn</a> - The unique arn of the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_id</a> - The unique id of the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Channel'</a>,
--   <a>channel_pipelinesRunningCount</a> - The number of currently healthy
--   pipelines.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_channelClass</a> - The
--   class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines or
--   SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_logLevel</a> - The log level
--   being written to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_name</a> - The name of the
--   channel. (user-mutable)
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_destinations</a> - A
--   list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_state</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachments:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_inputAttachments</a>
--   - List of input attachments for channel.
--

--   key-value pairs.
--

--   Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
--

--

--   this channel
--

--   The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from

--   Channel.

--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
channel_channelClass :: Lens' Channel (Maybe ChannelClass)

channel_logLevel :: Lens' Channel (Maybe LogLevel)

channel_name :: Lens' Channel (Maybe Text)

--   one destination per packager.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.Types

-- | API version <tt>2017-10-14</tt> of the Amazon Elemental MediaLive SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Placeholder documentation for BadRequestException

pattern AacCodingMode_CODING_MODE_2_0 :: AacCodingMode

-- | Maximum CDI input resolution; SD is 480i and 576i up to 30
--   frames-per-second (fps), HD is 720p up to 60 fps / 1080i up to 30 fps,
--   FHD is 1080p up to 60 fps, UHD is 2160p up to 60 fps
newtype CdiInputResolution
CdiInputResolution' :: Text -> CdiInputResolution
[fromCdiInputResolution] :: CdiInputResolution -> Text
pattern CdiInputResolution_FHD :: CdiInputResolution
pattern CdiInputResolution_HD :: CdiInputResolution
pattern CdiInputResolution_SD :: CdiInputResolution
pattern CdiInputResolution_UHD :: CdiInputResolution

-- | A standard channel has two encoding pipelines and a single pipeline
--   channel only has one.
newtype ChannelClass
ChannelClass' :: Text -> ChannelClass
[fromChannelClass] :: ChannelClass -> Text
pattern ChannelClass_SINGLE_PIPELINE :: ChannelClass
pattern ChannelClass_STANDARD :: ChannelClass

pattern ChannelState_DELETED :: ChannelState
pattern ChannelState_DELETING :: ChannelState

pattern ChannelState_RUNNING :: ChannelState
pattern ChannelState_STARTING :: ChannelState
pattern ChannelState_STOPPING :: ChannelState
pattern ChannelState_UPDATE_FAILED :: ChannelState
pattern ChannelState_UPDATING :: ChannelState

-- | Specifies the media type of the thumbnail.
newtype ContentType
ContentType' :: Text -> ContentType
[fromContentType] :: ContentType -> Text
pattern ContentType_Image_jpeg :: ContentType

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
newtype DeviceSettingsSyncState
DeviceSettingsSyncState' :: Text -> DeviceSettingsSyncState
[fromDeviceSettingsSyncState] :: DeviceSettingsSyncState -> Text
pattern DeviceSettingsSyncState_SYNCED :: DeviceSettingsSyncState
pattern DeviceSettingsSyncState_SYNCING :: DeviceSettingsSyncState

-- | The status of software on the input device.
newtype DeviceUpdateStatus
DeviceUpdateStatus' :: Text -> DeviceUpdateStatus
[fromDeviceUpdateStatus] :: DeviceUpdateStatus -> Text
pattern DeviceUpdateStatus_NOT_UP_TO_DATE :: DeviceUpdateStatus
pattern DeviceUpdateStatus_UP_TO_DATE :: DeviceUpdateStatus

-- | When set to "standard", an I-Frame only playlist will be written out
--   for each video output in the output group. This I-Frame only playlist
--   will contain byte range offsets pointing to the I-frame(s) in each
--   segment.
newtype IFrameOnlyPlaylistType
IFrameOnlyPlaylistType' :: Text -> IFrameOnlyPlaylistType
[fromIFrameOnlyPlaylistType] :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType -> Text
pattern IFrameOnlyPlaylistType_DISABLED :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType
pattern IFrameOnlyPlaylistType_STANDARD :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType

-- | A standard input has two sources and a single pipeline input only has
--   one.
newtype InputClass
InputClass' :: Text -> InputClass
[fromInputClass] :: InputClass -> Text
pattern InputClass_SINGLE_PIPELINE :: InputClass
pattern InputClass_STANDARD :: InputClass

[fromInputCodec] :: InputCodec -> Text
pattern InputCodec_AVC :: InputCodec
pattern InputCodec_HEVC :: InputCodec
pattern InputCodec_MPEG2 :: InputCodec

-- | The state of the connection between the input device and AWS.
newtype InputDeviceConnectionState
InputDeviceConnectionState' :: Text -> InputDeviceConnectionState
[fromInputDeviceConnectionState] :: InputDeviceConnectionState -> Text
pattern InputDeviceConnectionState_CONNECTED :: InputDeviceConnectionState
pattern InputDeviceConnectionState_DISCONNECTED :: InputDeviceConnectionState

-- | Specifies whether the input device has been configured (outside of
--   MediaLive) to use a dynamic IP address assignment (DHCP) or a static
--   IP address.
newtype InputDeviceIpScheme
InputDeviceIpScheme' :: Text -> InputDeviceIpScheme
[fromInputDeviceIpScheme] :: InputDeviceIpScheme -> Text
pattern InputDeviceIpScheme_DHCP :: InputDeviceIpScheme
pattern InputDeviceIpScheme_STATIC :: InputDeviceIpScheme

-- | The scan type of the video source.
newtype InputDeviceScanType
InputDeviceScanType' :: Text -> InputDeviceScanType
[fromInputDeviceScanType] :: InputDeviceScanType -> Text
pattern InputDeviceScanType_INTERLACED :: InputDeviceScanType
pattern InputDeviceScanType_PROGRESSIVE :: InputDeviceScanType

-- | The state of the input device.
newtype InputDeviceState
InputDeviceState' :: Text -> InputDeviceState
[fromInputDeviceState] :: InputDeviceState -> Text
pattern InputDeviceState_IDLE :: InputDeviceState
pattern InputDeviceState_STREAMING :: InputDeviceState

-- | The type of device transfer. INCOMING for an input device that is
--   being transferred to you, OUTGOING for an input device that you are
--   transferring to another AWS account.
newtype InputDeviceTransferType
InputDeviceTransferType' :: Text -> InputDeviceTransferType
[fromInputDeviceTransferType] :: InputDeviceTransferType -> Text
pattern InputDeviceTransferType_INCOMING :: InputDeviceTransferType
pattern InputDeviceTransferType_OUTGOING :: InputDeviceTransferType

-- | The type of the input device. For an AWS Elemental Link device that
--   outputs resolutions up to 1080, choose "HD".
newtype InputDeviceType
InputDeviceType' :: Text -> InputDeviceType
[fromInputDeviceType] :: InputDeviceType -> Text
pattern InputDeviceType_HD :: InputDeviceType

newtype InputFilter
InputFilter' :: Text -> InputFilter
[fromInputFilter] :: InputFilter -> Text
pattern InputFilter_AUTO :: InputFilter
pattern InputFilter_DISABLED :: InputFilter
pattern InputFilter_FORCED :: InputFilter

-- | Maximum input bitrate in megabits per second. Bitrates up to 50 Mbps
--   are supported currently.
newtype InputMaximumBitrate
InputMaximumBitrate' :: Text -> InputMaximumBitrate
[fromInputMaximumBitrate] :: InputMaximumBitrate -> Text
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_10_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_20_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_50_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered. If \"EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE\",
--   then the active input will stay active as long as it is healthy. If
--   \"PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED\", then always switch back to the primary
--   input when it is healthy.
newtype InputPreference
InputPreference' :: Text -> InputPreference
[fromInputPreference] :: InputPreference -> Text
pattern InputPreference_EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE :: InputPreference
pattern InputPreference_PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED :: InputPreference

-- | Input resolution based on lines of vertical resolution in the input;
--   SD is less than 720 lines, HD is 720 to 1080 lines, UHD is greater
--   than 1080 lines
newtype InputResolution
InputResolution' :: Text -> InputResolution
[fromInputResolution] :: InputResolution -> Text
pattern InputResolution_HD :: InputResolution
pattern InputResolution_SD :: InputResolution
pattern InputResolution_UHD :: InputResolution

InputSecurityGroupState' :: Text -> InputSecurityGroupState
[fromInputSecurityGroupState] :: InputSecurityGroupState -> Text
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_DELETED :: InputSecurityGroupState
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_IDLE :: InputSecurityGroupState
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_IN_USE :: InputSecurityGroupState
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_UPDATING :: InputSecurityGroupState

-- | Input Source End Behavior
newtype InputSourceEndBehavior
InputSourceEndBehavior' :: Text -> InputSourceEndBehavior
[fromInputSourceEndBehavior] :: InputSourceEndBehavior -> Text
pattern InputSourceEndBehavior_CONTINUE :: InputSourceEndBehavior
pattern InputSourceEndBehavior_LOOP :: InputSourceEndBehavior

-- | There are two types of input sources, static and dynamic. If an input
--   source is dynamic you can change the source url of the input
--   dynamically using an input switch action. However, the only input type
--   to support a dynamic url at this time is MP4_FILE. By default all
--   input sources are static.
newtype InputSourceType
InputSourceType' :: Text -> InputSourceType
[fromInputSourceType] :: InputSourceType -> Text
pattern InputSourceType_DYNAMIC :: InputSourceType
pattern InputSourceType_STATIC :: InputSourceType

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or
--   include the frame specified by the timecode.

[fromLastFrameClippingBehavior] :: LastFrameClippingBehavior -> Text
pattern LastFrameClippingBehavior_EXCLUDE_LAST_FRAME :: LastFrameClippingBehavior
pattern LastFrameClippingBehavior_INCLUDE_LAST_FRAME :: LastFrameClippingBehavior

-- | Pipeline ID
newtype PipelineId
PipelineId' :: Text -> PipelineId
[fromPipelineId] :: PipelineId -> Text
pattern PipelineId_PIPELINE_0 :: PipelineId
pattern PipelineId_PIPELINE_1 :: PipelineId

-- | Indicates which pipeline is preferred by the multiplex for program
--   ingest. If set to \"PIPELINE_0\" or \"PIPELINE_1\" and an unhealthy
--   ingest causes the multiplex to switch to the non-preferred pipeline,
--   it will switch back once that ingest is healthy again. If set to
--   \"CURRENTLY_ACTIVE\", it will not switch back to the other pipeline
--   based on it recovering to a healthy state, it will only switch if the
--   active pipeline becomes unhealthy.
newtype PreferredChannelPipeline
PreferredChannelPipeline' :: Text -> PreferredChannelPipeline
[fromPreferredChannelPipeline] :: PreferredChannelPipeline -> Text
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_CURRENTLY_ACTIVE :: PreferredChannelPipeline
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_PIPELINE_0 :: PreferredChannelPipeline
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_PIPELINE_1 :: PreferredChannelPipeline

-- | Codec, 'MPEG2', 'AVC', 'HEVC', or 'AUDIO'
newtype ReservationCodec
ReservationCodec' :: Text -> ReservationCodec
[fromReservationCodec] :: ReservationCodec -> Text
pattern ReservationCodec_AUDIO :: ReservationCodec
pattern ReservationCodec_AVC :: ReservationCodec
pattern ReservationCodec_HEVC :: ReservationCodec
pattern ReservationCodec_LINK :: ReservationCodec
pattern ReservationCodec_MPEG2 :: ReservationCodec

[fromReservationMaximumBitrate] :: ReservationMaximumBitrate -> Text
pattern ReservationMaximumBitrate_MAX_10_MBPS :: ReservationMaximumBitrate
pattern ReservationMaximumBitrate_MAX_20_MBPS :: ReservationMaximumBitrate

-- | Corresponds to the archive_allowed parameter. A value of
--   ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED corresponds to 0 (false) in the SCTE-35
--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag' :: Text -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
[fromScte35ArchiveAllowedFlag] :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag -> Text
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

--   segmentation_descriptor. If you include one of the "restriction" flags
--   then you must include all four of them.

-- | Corresponds to the no_regional_blackout_flag parameter. A value of

--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.

pattern Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag_REGIONAL_BLACKOUT :: Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_NOT_CANCELED corresponds to 0 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is an insertion request.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_CANCELED corresponds to 1 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is a cancelation request, in
--   which case complete this field and the existing event ID to cancel.
newtype Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator' :: Text -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
[fromScte35SegmentationCancelIndicator] :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Text
pattern Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator_SEGMENTATION_EVENT_CANCELED :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
pattern Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator_SEGMENTATION_EVENT_NOT_CANCELED :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

-- | Aac Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAacSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AacSettings
AacSettings' :: Maybe AacRateControlMode -> Maybe AacCodingMode -> Maybe AacSpec -> Maybe AacRawFormat -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AacInputType -> Maybe AacProfile -> Maybe AacVbrQuality -> Maybe Double -> AacSettings

-- | Rate Control Mode.
[$sel:rateControlMode:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacRateControlMode

-- | Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
[$sel:codingMode:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacCodingMode

-- | Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2
--   Transport Stream containers.
[$sel:spec:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacSpec

-- | Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
[$sel:rawFormat:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacRawFormat

-- | Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
[$sel:sampleRate:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio +
--   AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will
--   be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
[$sel:inputType:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacInputType

-- | AAC Profile.
[$sel:profile:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacProfile

-- | VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
[$sel:vbrQuality:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe AacVbrQuality

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control
--   mode and profile.
[$sel:bitrate:AacSettings'] :: AacSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>AacSettings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateControlMode:AacSettings'</a>,
--   <a>aacSettings_rateControlMode</a> - Rate Control Mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_codingMode</a> -
--   Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spec:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_spec</a> - Use MPEG-2
--   AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawFormat:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_rawFormat</a> -
--   Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputType:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_inputType</a> - Set
--   to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio + AD
--   (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will be
--   set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profile:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_profile</a> - AAC
--   Profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vbrQuality:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_vbrQuality</a> -
--   VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
newAacSettings :: AacSettings

-- | Rate Control Mode.
aacSettings_rateControlMode :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRateControlMode)

-- | Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
aacSettings_codingMode :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacCodingMode)

-- | Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2
--   Transport Stream containers.
aacSettings_spec :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacSpec)

-- | Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
aacSettings_rawFormat :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRawFormat)

-- | Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
aacSettings_sampleRate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio +
--   AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will
--   be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
aacSettings_inputType :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacInputType)

-- | AAC Profile.
aacSettings_profile :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacProfile)

-- | VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
aacSettings_vbrQuality :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacVbrQuality)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control
--   mode and profile.
aacSettings_bitrate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Ac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAc3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Ac3Settings
Ac3Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Ac3DrcProfile -> Maybe Ac3CodingMode -> Maybe Ac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Ac3MetadataControl -> Ac3Settings

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
[$sel:dialnorm:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
[$sel:drcProfile:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3DrcProfile

-- | Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
[$sel:codingMode:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3CodingMode

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
[$sel:lfeFilter:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3LfeFilter

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See
--   ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.
[$sel:bitstreamMode:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
[$sel:bitrate:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the
--   DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was
--   not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata
--   settings will be used.
[$sel:metadataControl:Ac3Settings'] :: Ac3Settings -> Maybe Ac3MetadataControl

-- | Create a value of <a>Ac3Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_dialnorm</a> - Sets
--   the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcProfile:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_drcProfile</a> -
--   If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 for background
--   on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to "followInput",
--   encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder
--   that supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of
--   these streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newAc3Settings :: Ac3Settings

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
ac3Settings_dialnorm :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
ac3Settings_drcProfile :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3DrcProfile)

-- | Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
ac3Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3CodingMode)

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
ac3Settings_lfeFilter :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3LfeFilter)

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See
--   ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.
ac3Settings_bitstreamMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
ac3Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the
--   DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was
--   not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata
--   settings will be used.
ac3Settings_metadataControl :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3MetadataControl)

-- | Ancillary Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAncillarySourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AncillarySourceSettings
AncillarySourceSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
[$sel:sourceAncillaryChannelNumber:AncillarySourceSettings'] :: AncillarySourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AncillarySourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceAncillaryChannelNumber:AncillarySourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber</a> -
--   Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
newAncillarySourceSettings :: AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber :: Lens' AncillarySourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

data ArchiveOutputSettings

--   the container type.

--   for multiple outputs of the same type.
[$sel:nameModifier:ArchiveOutputSettings'] :: ArchiveOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

[$sel:containerSettings:ArchiveOutputSettings'] :: ArchiveOutputSettings -> ArchiveContainerSettings

-- | Settings specific to the container type of the file.
archiveOutputSettings_containerSettings :: Lens' ArchiveOutputSettings ArchiveContainerSettings

-- | Audio Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AudioDescription
AudioDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioType -> Maybe AudioCodecSettings -> Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl -> Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl -> Maybe RemixSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output
--   track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is
--   no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
[$sel:languageCode:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for
--   audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.
[$sel:audioType:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioType

-- | Audio codec settings.
[$sel:codecSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioCodecSettings

-- | Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the
--   output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The
--   languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when
--   followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code
--   specified by the input.
[$sel:languageCodeControl:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl

-- | Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input
--   contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to
--   the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. Note that this field and
--   audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
[$sel:audioTypeControl:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl

-- | Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the
--   output audio channels.
[$sel:remixSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe RemixSettings

-- | Advanced audio normalization settings.
[$sel:audioNormalizationSettings:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed
--   by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).
[$sel:streamName:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this
--   AudioDescription.
[$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Text

-- | The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be
--   unique within this Live Event.
[$sel:name:AudioDescription'] :: AudioDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCode</a> - RFC 5646 language code
--   representing the language of the audio output track. Only used if
--   languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is no ISO 639 language
--   code specified in the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioType:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioType</a> - Applies only if audioTypeControl
--   is useConfigured. The values for audioType are defined in ISO-IEC
--   13818-1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_codecSettings</a> - Audio codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCodeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCodeControl</a> - Choosing followInput
--   will cause the ISO 639 language code of the output to follow the ISO
--   639 language code of the input. The languageCode will be used when
--   useConfigured is set, or when followInput is selected but there is no
--   ISO 639 language code specified by the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTypeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioTypeControl</a> - Determines how audio type
--   is determined. followInput: If the input contains an ISO 639
--   audioType, then that value is passed through to the output. If the
--   input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. useConfigured: The value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. Note that this field and audioType are both
--   ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remixSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_remixSettings</a> - Settings that control how
--   input audio channels are remixed into the output audio channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioNormalizationSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings</a> - Advanced audio
--   normalization settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_streamName</a> - Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS
--   outputs. Indicates the name displayed by the player (eg. English, or
--   Director Commentary).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioSelectorName</a> - The name of the
--   AudioSelector used as the source for this AudioDescription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AudioDescription'</a>, <a>audioDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
newAudioDescription :: Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output
--   track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is
--   no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
audioDescription_languageCode :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for
--   audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.
audioDescription_audioType :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioType)

-- | Audio codec settings.
audioDescription_codecSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioCodecSettings)

-- | Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the
--   output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The
--   languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when
--   followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code
--   specified by the input.
audioDescription_languageCodeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl)

-- | Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input
--   contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to
--   the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. Note that this field and
--   audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
audioDescription_audioTypeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl)

-- | Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the
--   output audio channels.
audioDescription_remixSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe RemixSettings)

-- | Advanced audio normalization settings.
audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings)

-- | Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed
--   by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).
audioDescription_streamName :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this
--   AudioDescription.
audioDescription_audioSelectorName :: Lens' AudioDescription Text

-- | The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be
--   unique within this Live Event.
audioDescription_name :: Lens' AudioDescription Text

-- | Audio Language Selection
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioLanguageSelection</a> smart constructor.
data AudioLanguageSelection
AudioLanguageSelection' :: Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy -> Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies
--   audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs
--   such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is
--   no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language
--   returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose
--   another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it
--   can't find one with the same language.
[$sel:languageSelectionPolicy:AudioLanguageSelection'] :: AudioLanguageSelection -> Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy

-- | Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio
--   source.
[$sel:languageCode:AudioLanguageSelection'] :: AudioLanguageSelection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioLanguageSelection</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageSelectionPolicy:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy</a> - When set to
--   "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies audio streams
--   by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs such that an
--   audio stream matching the initially selected language is no longer
--   present then mute will be encoded until the language returns. If
--   "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose another audio
--   stream in the program with the same stream type if it can't find one
--   with the same language.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageCode</a> - Selects a specific
--   three-letter language code from within an audio source.
newAudioLanguageSelection :: Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies
--   audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs
--   such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is
--   no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language
--   returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose
--   another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it
--   can't find one with the same language.
audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection (Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy)

-- | Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio
--   source.
audioLanguageSelection_languageCode :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection Text

-- | Audio Normalization Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioNormalizationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioNormalizationSettings
AudioNormalizationSettings' :: Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl -> AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM
--   Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
[$sel:algorithm:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm

-- | Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a
--   default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM
--   Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128
--   specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
[$sel:targetLkfs:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the
--   chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured
--   but not adjusted.
[$sel:algorithmControl:AudioNormalizationSettings'] :: AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioNormalizationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithm:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm</a> - Audio normalization
--   algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM Act specification,
--   itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetLkfs:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs</a> - Target LKFS(loudness)
--   to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a default value will be
--   used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM Act (1770-1)
--   recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128 specification (1770-2)
--   recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithmControl:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl</a> - When set to
--   correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the chosen algorithm.
--   If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured but not adjusted.
newAudioNormalizationSettings :: AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM
--   Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm)

-- | Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a
--   default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM
--   Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128
--   specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the
--   chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured
--   but not adjusted.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl)

-- | Audio Only Hls Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioOnlyHlsSettings
AudioOnlyHlsSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType -> Maybe InputLocation -> AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.
[$sel:audioGroupId:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Four types of audio-only tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant
--   Stream The client can play back this audio-only stream instead of
--   video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   in the HLS manifest. Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client should try to play back by default.
--   Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES,
--   AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented
--   as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client
--   will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in
--   the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
[$sel:audioTrackType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType

-- | Specifies the segment type.
[$sel:segmentType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType

-- | Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for
--   an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the
--   image increases the output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to
--   the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per
--   the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
[$sel:audioOnlyImage:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'] :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioGroupId:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId</a> - Specifies the group to
--   which the audio Rendition belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTrackType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType</a> - Four types of audio-only
--   tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant Stream The client can play
--   back this audio-only stream instead of video in low-bandwidth
--   scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF in the HLS manifest.
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client should try to play back by default. Represented as an
--   EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client may try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA
--   in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio,
--   not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client will not try to
--   play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS
--   manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType</a> - Specifies the segment type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioOnlyImage:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage</a> - Optional. Specifies the
--   .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for an audio-only output.
--   We recommend a low bit-size file because the image increases the
--   output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to the audio as an ID3
--   tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per the "ID3 tag version
--   2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
newAudioOnlyHlsSettings :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Four types of audio-only tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant
--   Stream The client can play back this audio-only stream instead of
--   video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   in the HLS manifest. Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client should try to play back by default.
--   Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES,
--   AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented
--   as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client
--   will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in
--   the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType)

-- | Specifies the segment type.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType)

-- | Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for
--   an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the
--   image increases the output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to
--   the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per
--   the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe InputLocation)
