-- | Placeholder documentation for AudioSilenceFailoverSettings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioSilenceFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioSilenceFailoverSettings
AudioSilenceFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> AudioSilenceFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   silent before automatic input failover occurs. Silence is defined as
--   audio loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.
[$sel:audioSilenceThresholdMsec:AudioSilenceFailoverSettings'] :: AudioSilenceFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the audio selector in the input that MediaLive should
--   monitor to detect silence. Select your most important rendition. If
--   you didn't create an audio selector in this input, leave blank.
[$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioSilenceFailoverSettings'] :: AudioSilenceFailoverSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioSilenceFailoverSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSilenceThresholdMsec:AudioSilenceFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioSilenceFailoverSettings_audioSilenceThresholdMsec</a> - The
--   amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be silent
--   before automatic input failover occurs. Silence is defined as audio
--   loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioSilenceFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioSilenceFailoverSettings_audioSelectorName</a> - The name of
--   the audio selector in the input that MediaLive should monitor to
--   detect silence. Select your most important rendition. If you didn't
--   create an audio selector in this input, leave blank.
newAudioSilenceFailoverSettings :: Text -> AudioSilenceFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   silent before automatic input failover occurs. Silence is defined as
--   audio loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.

--   you didn't create an audio selector in this input, leave blank.

-- | The settings for Automatic Input Failover.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomaticInputFailoverSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
AutomaticInputFailoverSettings' :: Maybe [FailoverCondition] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputPreference -> Text -> AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur,
--   MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.
[$sel:failoverConditions:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe [FailoverCondition]

-- | This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to
--   be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
[$sel:errorClearTimeMsec:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered.
[$sel:inputPreference:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Maybe InputPreference

-- | The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover
--   pair.
[$sel:secondaryInputId:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'] :: AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomaticInputFailoverSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failoverConditions:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions</a> - A list of
--   failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur, MediaLive will
--   perform a failover to the other input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorClearTimeMsec:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec</a> - This clear
--   time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to be
--   considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPreference:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference</a> - Input
--   preference when deciding which input to make active when a previously
--   failed input has recovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secondaryInputId:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId</a> - The input ID
--   of the secondary input in the automatic input failover pair.
newAutomaticInputFailoverSettings :: Text -> AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur,
--   MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe [FailoverCondition])

-- | This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to
--   be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe InputPreference)

-- | The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover
--   pair.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings Text

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAvailBlanking</a> smart constructor.
data AvailBlanking
AvailBlanking' :: Maybe AvailBlankingState -> Maybe InputLocation -> AvailBlanking

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when insertion metadata is added.
[$sel:state:AvailBlanking'] :: AvailBlanking -> Maybe AvailBlankingState

-- | Blanking image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and
--   png images are supported.
[$sel:availBlankingImage:AvailBlanking'] :: AvailBlanking -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>AvailBlanking</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when
--   insertion metadata is added.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availBlankingImage:AvailBlanking'</a>,
--   <a>availBlanking_availBlankingImage</a> - Blanking image to be used.
--   Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are supported.
newAvailBlanking :: AvailBlanking

--   when insertion metadata is added.

--   png images are supported.

-- | Details from a failed operation
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchFailedResultModel</a> smart constructor.
data BatchFailedResultModel
BatchFailedResultModel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BatchFailedResultModel

-- | Error message for the failed operation
[$sel:message:BatchFailedResultModel'] :: BatchFailedResultModel -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of the resource
[$sel:arn:BatchFailedResultModel'] :: BatchFailedResultModel -> Maybe Text

-- | ID of the resource
[$sel:id:BatchFailedResultModel'] :: BatchFailedResultModel -> Maybe Text

-- | Error code for the failed operation
[$sel:code:BatchFailedResultModel'] :: BatchFailedResultModel -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchFailedResultModel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:BatchFailedResultModel'</a>,
--   <a>batchFailedResultModel_message</a> - Error message for the failed
--   operation
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:BatchFailedResultModel'</a>,
--   <a>batchFailedResultModel_arn</a> - ARN of the resource
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:BatchFailedResultModel'</a>,
--   <a>batchFailedResultModel_id</a> - ID of the resource
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:BatchFailedResultModel'</a>,
--   <a>batchFailedResultModel_code</a> - Error code for the failed
--   operation
newBatchFailedResultModel :: BatchFailedResultModel

-- | Error message for the failed operation
batchFailedResultModel_message :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the resource
batchFailedResultModel_arn :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | ID of the resource
batchFailedResultModel_id :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | Error code for the failed operation
batchFailedResultModel_code :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | Blackout Slate
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlackoutSlate</a> smart constructor.
data BlackoutSlate
BlackoutSlate' :: Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BlackoutSlateState -> Maybe Text -> BlackoutSlate

-- | Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp
--   and png images are supported.
[$sel:blackoutSlateImage:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio,
--   and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an
--   SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor
--   is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must
--   contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
[$sel:networkEndBlackout:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout

-- | Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be
--   scaled to fill the entire output raster.
[$sel:networkEndBlackoutImage:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when indicated by program metadata.
[$sel:state:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe BlackoutSlateState

-- | Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
[$sel:networkId:BlackoutSlate'] :: BlackoutSlate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlackoutSlate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackoutSlateImage:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_blackoutSlateImage</a> - Blackout slate image to be
--   used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are
--   supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkEndBlackout:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout</a> - Setting to enabled causes
--   the encoder to blackout the video, audio, and captions, and raise the
--   "Network Blackout Image" slate when an SCTE104/35 Network End
--   Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The blackout will be lifted
--   when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   Network End and Network Start descriptors must contain a network ID
--   that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkEndBlackoutImage:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage</a> - Path to local file to
--   use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be scaled to fill the
--   entire output raster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_state</a> - When
--   set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when
--   indicated by program metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkId:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_networkId</a> -
--   Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
newBlackoutSlate :: BlackoutSlate

-- | Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp
--   and png images are supported.
blackoutSlate_blackoutSlateImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio,
--   and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an
--   SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor
--   is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must
--   contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout)

-- | Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be
--   scaled to fill the entire output raster.
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when indicated by program metadata.
blackoutSlate_state :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateState)

-- | Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
blackoutSlate_networkId :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe Text)

-- | Burn In Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBurnInDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data BurnInDestinationSettings
BurnInDestinationSettings' :: Maybe BurnInAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInShadowColor -> Maybe BurnInOutlineColor -> Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
[$sel:alignment:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInAlignment

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInShadowColor

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInOutlineColor

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
[$sel:teletextGridControl:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to
--   0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
[$sel:xPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInFontColor

-- | When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowXOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:font:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must
--   match.
[$sel:yPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontResolution:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowYOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'] :: BurnInDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BurnInDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to 'auto'
--   fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a
--   positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newBurnInDestinationSettings :: BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_alignment :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInAlignment)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInShadowColor)

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to
--   0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_font :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor)

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must
--   match.
burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Caption Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionDescription
CaptionDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings -> Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

-- | ISO 639-2 three-digit code: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Human readable information to indicate captions available for players
--   (eg. English, or Spanish).
[$sel:languageDescription:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional settings for captions destination that depend on the
--   destination type.
[$sel:destinationSettings:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings

-- | Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when
--   generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector
--   name.
[$sel:captionSelectorName:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Text

-- | Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
[$sel:name:CaptionDescription'] :: CaptionDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageCode</a> - ISO 639-2 three-digit code:
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageDescription:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageDescription</a> - Human readable
--   information to indicate captions available for players (eg. English,
--   or Spanish).
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationSettings:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_destinationSettings</a> - Additional settings
--   for captions destination that depend on the destination type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectorName:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_captionSelectorName</a> - Specifies which input
--   caption selector to use as a caption source when generating output
--   captions. This field should match a captionSelector name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CaptionDescription'</a>, <a>captionDescription_name</a> -
--   Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
newCaptionDescription :: Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

-- | ISO 639-2 three-digit code: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
captionDescription_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Human readable information to indicate captions available for players
--   (eg. English, or Spanish).
captionDescription_languageDescription :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional settings for captions destination that depend on the
--   destination type.
captionDescription_destinationSettings :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings)

-- | Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when
--   generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector
--   name.
captionDescription_captionSelectorName :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text

-- | Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
captionDescription_name :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text

CaptionDestinationSettings' :: Maybe EmbeddedDestinationSettings -> Maybe WebvttDestinationSettings -> Maybe AribDestinationSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedPlusScte20DestinationSettings -> Maybe Scte20PlusEmbeddedDestinationSettings -> Maybe Scte27DestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe TeletextDestinationSettings -> Maybe SmpteTtDestinationSettings -> Maybe TtmlDestinationSettings -> Maybe BurnInDestinationSettings -> CaptionDestinationSettings

-- | Maps a caption channel to an ISO 693-2 language code
--   (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2), with an optional description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionLanguageMapping</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionLanguageMapping
CaptionLanguageMapping' :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> CaptionLanguageMapping

-- | Three character ISO 639-2 language code (see
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Text

-- | Textual description of language
[$sel:languageDescription:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Text

-- | The closed caption channel being described by this
--   CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel mapping must have a unique
--   channel number (maximum of 4)
[$sel:captionChannel:CaptionLanguageMapping'] :: CaptionLanguageMapping -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionLanguageMapping</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   language code (see http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageDescription:CaptionLanguageMapping'</a>,
--   <a>captionLanguageMapping_languageDescription</a> - Textual
--   description of language
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionChannel:CaptionLanguageMapping'</a>,
--   <a>captionLanguageMapping_captionChannel</a> - The closed caption
--   channel being described by this CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel
--   mapping must have a unique channel number (maximum of 4)

--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)

--   CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel mapping must have a unique
--   channel number (maximum of 4)

-- | Caption Rectangle
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionRectangle</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionRectangle
CaptionRectangle' :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For topOffset, specify the position
--   of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height.
--   The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of
--   the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
[$sel:topOffset:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
[$sel:height:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
[$sel:width:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don't
--   have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display
--   rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video
--   frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left
--   edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all
--   within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are
--   percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must
--   specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position
--   of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The
--   rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the
--   frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
[$sel:leftOffset:CaptionRectangle'] :: CaptionRectangle -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionRectangle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_topOffset</a> - See the description in leftOffset.
--   For topOffset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle,
--   as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the
--   top edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the measurement is
--   10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at
--   that position from the top edge of the frame. This field corresponds
--   to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_height</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_width</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:leftOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_leftOffset</a> - Applies only if you plan to
--   convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make
--   sure to leave the default if you don't have either of these formats in
--   the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that
--   is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle
--   by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge,
--   and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video
--   frame. The units for the measurements are percentages. If you specify
--   a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of
--   them. For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the
--   rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative
--   to the left edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the
--   measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left
--   edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame. This
--   field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
newCaptionRectangle :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For topOffset, specify the position
--   of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height.
--   The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of
--   the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
captionRectangle_topOffset :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
captionRectangle_height :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
captionRectangle_width :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don't
--   have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display
--   rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video
--   frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left
--   edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all
--   within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are
--   percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must
--   specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position
--   of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying
--   frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example,
--   \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The
--   rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the
--   frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
captionRectangle_leftOffset :: Lens' CaptionRectangle Double

-- | Output groups for this Live Event. Output groups contain information
--   about where streams should be distributed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionSelector</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionSelector
CaptionSelector' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings -> Text -> CaptionSelector

-- | When specified this field indicates the three letter language code of
--   the caption track to extract from the source.
[$sel:languageCode:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Maybe Text

-- | Caption selector settings.
[$sel:selectorSettings:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings

-- | Name identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate
--   this caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names
--   must be unique within an event.
[$sel:name:CaptionSelector'] :: CaptionSelector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionSelector'</a>,
--   <a>captionSelector_languageCode</a> - When specified this field
--   indicates the three letter language code of the caption track to
--   extract from the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectorSettings:CaptionSelector'</a>,
--   <a>captionSelector_selectorSettings</a> - Caption selector settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CaptionSelector'</a>, <a>captionSelector_name</a> - Name
--   identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate this
--   caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names must be
--   unique within an event.
newCaptionSelector :: Text -> CaptionSelector

-- | When specified this field indicates the three letter language code of
--   the caption track to extract from the source.
captionSelector_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionSelector (Maybe Text)

-- | Caption selector settings.
captionSelector_selectorSettings :: Lens' CaptionSelector (Maybe CaptionSelectorSettings)

-- | Name identifier for a caption selector. This name is used to associate
--   this caption selector with one or more caption descriptions. Names
--   must be unique within an event.
captionSelector_name :: Lens' CaptionSelector Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for CdiInputSpecification
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCdiInputSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data CdiInputSpecification
CdiInputSpecification' :: Maybe CdiInputResolution -> CdiInputSpecification

[$sel:resolution:CdiInputSpecification'] :: CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe CdiInputResolution

-- | Placeholder documentation for Channel
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannel</a> smart constructor.
data Channel
Channel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [PipelineDetail] -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> Channel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
[$sel:roleArn:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encoderSettings:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe EncoderSettings

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
[$sel:arn:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the channel.
[$sel:id:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Int

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
[$sel:channelClass:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
[$sel:name:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
[$sel:destinations:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:state:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe ChannelState

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
[$sel:inputAttachments:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [PipelineDetail]

-- | Settings for VPC output
[$sel:vpc:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
[$sel:egressEndpoints:Channel'] :: Channel -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint]

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | DVB Network Information Table (NIT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbNitSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbNitSettings
DvbNitSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> Natural -> DvbNitSettings

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
[$sel:repInterval:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The network name text placed in the networkNameDescriptor inside the
--   Network Information Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:networkName:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Text

-- | The numeric value placed in the Network Information Table (NIT).
[$sel:networkId:DvbNitSettings'] :: DvbNitSettings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbNitSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   the networkNameDescriptor inside the Network Information Table.
