-- | DVB Service Description Table (SDT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSdtSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSdtSettings
DvbSdtSettings' :: Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSdtSettings

-- | Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
[$sel:outputSdt:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt

-- | The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service
--   Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:serviceName:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the
--   Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
[$sel:serviceProviderName:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
[$sel:repInterval:DvbSdtSettings'] :: DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSdtSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSdt:DvbSdtSettings'</a>, <a>dvbSdtSettings_outputSdt</a>
--   - Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceName</a> - The service name placed in the
--   serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is
--   256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceProviderName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceProviderName</a> - The service provider name
--   placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table.
--   Maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repInterval:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_repInterval</a> - The number of milliseconds between
--   instances of this table in the output transport stream.
newDvbSdtSettings :: DvbSdtSettings

-- | Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
dvbSdtSettings_outputSdt :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt)

-- | The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service
--   Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
dvbSdtSettings_serviceName :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the
--   Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
dvbSdtSettings_serviceProviderName :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
dvbSdtSettings_repInterval :: Lens' DvbSdtSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Dvb Sub Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSubDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSubDestinationSettings
DvbSubDestinationSettings' :: Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings
--   are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
[$sel:alignment:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
[$sel:teletextGridControl:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it
--   to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:xPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor

-- | When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowXOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:font:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:backgroundColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
[$sel:yPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:outlineSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontResolution:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:shadowYOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
[$sel:fontOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'] :: DvbSubDestinationSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSubDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These
--   source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL,
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to auto fontSize
--   will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive
--   integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newDvbSubDestinationSettings :: DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings
--   are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_alignment :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor)

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor)

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it
--   to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_xPosition :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor)

-- | When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontSize :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_font :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundColor :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor)

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_yPosition :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineSize :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontResolution :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontOpacity :: Lens' DvbSubDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Dvb Sub Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSubSourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSubSourceSettings
DvbSubSourceSettings' :: Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSubSourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
[$sel:ocrLanguage:DvbSubSourceSettings'] :: DvbSubSourceSettings -> Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage

-- | When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
[$sel:pid:DvbSubSourceSettings'] :: DvbSubSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSubSourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ocrLanguage:DvbSubSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubSourceSettings_ocrLanguage</a> - If you will configure a
--   WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use
--   this field to provide the language to consider when translating the
--   image-based source to text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pid:DvbSubSourceSettings'</a>, <a>dvbSubSourceSettings_pid</a>
--   - When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
newDvbSubSourceSettings :: DvbSubSourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
dvbSubSourceSettings_ocrLanguage :: Lens' DvbSubSourceSettings (Maybe DvbSubOcrLanguage)

-- | When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the
--   source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is
--   passed through, regardless of selectors.
dvbSubSourceSettings_pid :: Lens' DvbSubSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | DVB Time and Date Table (SDT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbTdtSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbTdtSettings
DvbTdtSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> DvbTdtSettings

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
[$sel:repInterval:DvbTdtSettings'] :: DvbTdtSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbTdtSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repInterval:DvbTdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbTdtSettings_repInterval</a> - The number of milliseconds between
--   instances of this table in the output transport stream.
newDvbTdtSettings :: DvbTdtSettings

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream.
dvbTdtSettings_repInterval :: Lens' DvbTdtSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Eac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEac3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Eac3Settings
Eac3Settings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Eac3CodingMode -> Maybe Eac3LfeControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3DcFilter -> Maybe Eac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix -> Maybe Eac3DrcRf -> Maybe Eac3DrcLine -> Maybe Eac3PhaseControl -> Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode -> Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3SurroundMode -> Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl -> Maybe Eac3MetadataControl -> Eac3Settings

-- | Left only/Right only center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:loRoCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Left total/Right total center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:ltRtCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
[$sel:dialnorm:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
[$sel:codingMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3CodingMode

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
[$sel:lfeControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3LfeControl

-- | Left only/Right only surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:loRoSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Left total/Right total surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
[$sel:ltRtSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
[$sel:dcFilter:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DcFilter

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
[$sel:lfeFilter:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3LfeFilter

-- | Stereo downmix preference. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:stereoDownmix:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix

-- | Sets the profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures
--   that the instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
[$sel:drcRf:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DrcRf

-- | Sets the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
[$sel:drcLine:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3DrcLine

-- | When set to shift90Degrees, applies a 90-degree phase shift to the
--   surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:phaseControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3PhaseControl

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, sets whether an extra center back surround
--   channel is matrix encoded into the left and right surround channels.
[$sel:surroundExMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream.
--   See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E) for background on these values.
[$sel:bitstreamMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode

-- | When set to attenuate3Db, applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround
--   channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
[$sel:attenuationControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
[$sel:bitrate:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | When encoding 2/0 audio, sets whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded
--   into the two channels.
[$sel:surroundMode:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3SurroundMode

-- | When set to whenPossible, input DD+ audio will be passed through if it
--   is present on the input. This detection is dynamic over the life of
--   the transcode. Inputs that alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content
--   will have a consistent DD+ output as the system alternates between
--   passthrough and encoding.
[$sel:passthroughControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl

-- | When set to followInput, encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD,
--   DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not
--   supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings
--   will be used.
[$sel:metadataControl:Eac3Settings'] :: Eac3Settings -> Maybe Eac3MetadataControl

-- | Create a value of <a>Eac3Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoCenterMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtCenterMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dialnorm</a> -
--   Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeControl:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeControl</a> -
--   When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dcFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dcFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stereoDownmix:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_stereoDownmix</a> - Stereo downmix preference. Only
--   used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcRf:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcRf</a> - Sets the
--   profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures that the
--   instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcLine:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcLine</a> - Sets
--   the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phaseControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_phaseControl</a> - When set to shift90Degrees, applies
--   a 90-degree phase shift to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundExMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundExMode</a> - When encoding 3/2 audio, sets
--   whether an extra center back surround channel is matrix encoded into
--   the left and right surround channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E)
--   for background on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attenuationControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_attenuationControl</a> - When set to attenuate3Db,
--   applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_bitrate</a> -
--   Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundMode</a> - When encoding 2/0 audio, sets
--   whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded into the two channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passthroughControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_passthroughControl</a> - When set to whenPossible,
--   input DD+ audio will be passed through if it is present on the input.
--   This detection is dynamic over the life of the transcode. Inputs that
--   alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content will have a consistent DD+
--   output as the system alternates between passthrough and encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to followInput, encoder
--   metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that
--   supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of these
--   streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newEac3Settings :: Eac3Settings

-- | Left only/Right only center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_loRoCenterMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Left total/Right total center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_ltRtCenterMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
eac3Settings_dialnorm :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
eac3Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3CodingMode)

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
eac3Settings_lfeControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3LfeControl)

-- | Left only/Right only surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_loRoSurroundMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Left total/Right total surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_ltRtSurroundMixLevel :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
eac3Settings_dcFilter :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DcFilter)

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
eac3Settings_lfeFilter :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3LfeFilter)

-- | Stereo downmix preference. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_stereoDownmix :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix)

-- | Sets the profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures
--   that the instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
eac3Settings_drcRf :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DrcRf)

-- | Sets the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
eac3Settings_drcLine :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3DrcLine)

-- | When set to shift90Degrees, applies a 90-degree phase shift to the
--   surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_phaseControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3PhaseControl)

-- | When encoding 3/2 audio, sets whether an extra center back surround
--   channel is matrix encoded into the left and right surround channels.
eac3Settings_surroundExMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode)

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream.
--   See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E) for background on these values.
eac3Settings_bitstreamMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode)

-- | When set to attenuate3Db, applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround
--   channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
eac3Settings_attenuationControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
eac3Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When encoding 2/0 audio, sets whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded
--   into the two channels.
eac3Settings_surroundMode :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3SurroundMode)

-- | When set to whenPossible, input DD+ audio will be passed through if it
--   is present on the input. This detection is dynamic over the life of
--   the transcode. Inputs that alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content
--   will have a consistent DD+ output as the system alternates between
--   passthrough and encoding.
eac3Settings_passthroughControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl)

-- | When set to followInput, encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD,
--   DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not
--   supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings
--   will be used.
eac3Settings_metadataControl :: Lens' Eac3Settings (Maybe Eac3MetadataControl)

-- | Ebu Tt DDestination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EbuTtDDestinationSettings
EbuTtDDestinationSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl -> Maybe Text -> EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. Complete this field if you want to include the
--   name of the copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
[$sel:copyrightHolder:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies how to handle the gap between the lines (in multi-line
--   captions). - enabled: Fill with the captions background color (as
--   specified in the input captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
[$sel:fillLineGap:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl

-- | Specifies the style information (font color, font position, and so on)
--   to include in the font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. -
--   include: Take the style information (font color, font position, and so
--   on) from the source captions and include that information in the font
--   data attached to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the
--   source captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
[$sel:styleControl:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl

-- | Specifies the font family to include in the font data attached to the
--   EBU-TT captions. Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you
--   leave this field empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If
--   styleControl is set to exclude, the font family is always set to
--   "monospaced".) You specify only the font family. All other style
--   information (color, bold, position and so on) is copied from the input
--   captions. The size is always set to 100% to allow the downstream
--   player to choose the size. - Enter a list of font families, as a
--   comma-separated list of font names, in order of preference. The name
--   can be a font family (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such
--   as serif), or default (to let the downstream player choose the
--   font). - Leave blank to set the family to monospace.
[$sel:fontFamily:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'] :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyrightHolder:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_copyrightHolder</a> - Applies only if you
--   plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an
--   output. Complete this field if you want to include the name of the
--   copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
--   
--   <a>$sel:fillLineGap:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fillLineGap</a> - Specifies how to handle
--   the gap between the lines (in multi-line captions). - enabled: Fill
--   with the captions background color (as specified in the input
--   captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:styleControl:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Specifies the style
--   information (font color, font position, and so on) to include in the
--   font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. - include: Take the
--   style information (font color, font position, and so on) from the
--   source captions and include that information in the font data attached
--   to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the source
--   captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontFamily:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fontFamily</a> - Specifies the font
--   family to include in the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions.
--   Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you leave this field
--   empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If styleControl is set
--   to exclude, the font family is always set to "monospaced".) You
--   specify only the font family. All other style information (color,
--   bold, position and so on) is copied from the input captions. The size
--   is always set to 100% to allow the downstream player to choose the
--   size. - Enter a list of font families, as a comma-separated list of
--   font names, in order of preference. The name can be a font family
--   (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such as serif), or
--   default (to let the downstream player choose the font). - Leave
--   blank to set the family to monospace.
newEbuTtDDestinationSettings :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D
--   or TTML in an output. Complete this field if you want to include the
--   name of the copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_copyrightHolder :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how to handle the gap between the lines (in multi-line
--   captions). - enabled: Fill with the captions background color (as
--   specified in the input captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fillLineGap :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl)

-- | Specifies the style information (font color, font position, and so on)
--   to include in the font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. -
--   include: Take the style information (font color, font position, and so
--   on) from the source captions and include that information in the font
--   data attached to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the
--   source captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_styleControl :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl)

-- | Specifies the font family to include in the font data attached to the
--   EBU-TT captions. Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you
--   leave this field empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If
--   styleControl is set to exclude, the font family is always set to
--   "monospaced".) You specify only the font family. All other style
--   information (color, bold, position and so on) is copied from the input
--   captions. The size is always set to 100% to allow the downstream
--   player to choose the size. - Enter a list of font families, as a
--   comma-separated list of font names, in order of preference. The name
--   can be a font family (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such
--   as serif), or default (to let the downstream player choose the
--   font). - Leave blank to set the family to monospace.
ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fontFamily :: Lens' EbuTtDDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Embedded Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmbeddedSourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EmbeddedSourceSettings
EmbeddedSourceSettings' :: Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection -> Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708 -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> EmbeddedSourceSettings

-- | Set to "auto" to handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned
--   SCTE-20 and Embedded captions.
[$sel:scte20Detection:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
[$sel:convert608To708:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
[$sel:source608TrackNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
[$sel:source608ChannelNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'] :: EmbeddedSourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>EmbeddedSourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte20Detection:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_scte20Detection</a> - Set to "auto" to
--   handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned SCTE-20 and
--   Embedded captions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:convert608To708:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_convert608To708</a> - If upconvert, 608 data
--   is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the
--   708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the
--   source content will be discarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608TrackNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_source608TrackNumber</a> - This field is
--   unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608ChannelNumber:EmbeddedSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>embeddedSourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber</a> - Specifies the
--   608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract
--   captions. Unused for passthrough.
newEmbeddedSourceSettings :: EmbeddedSourceSettings

-- | Set to "auto" to handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned
--   SCTE-20 and Embedded captions.
embeddedSourceSettings_scte20Detection :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe EmbeddedScte20Detection)

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
embeddedSourceSettings_convert608To708 :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe EmbeddedConvert608To708)

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
embeddedSourceSettings_source608TrackNumber :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
embeddedSourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber :: Lens' EmbeddedSourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Encoder Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncoderSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EncoderSettings
EncoderSettings' :: Maybe MotionGraphicsConfiguration -> Maybe FeatureActivations -> Maybe GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe AvailConfiguration -> Maybe AvailBlanking -> Maybe NielsenConfiguration -> Maybe BlackoutSlate -> Maybe [CaptionDescription] -> [VideoDescription] -> [AudioDescription] -> [OutputGroup] -> TimecodeConfig -> EncoderSettings

-- | Settings for motion graphics.
[$sel:motionGraphicsConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsConfiguration

-- | Feature Activations
[$sel:featureActivations:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe FeatureActivations

-- | Configuration settings that apply to the event as a whole.
[$sel:globalConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe GlobalConfiguration

-- | Event-wide configuration settings for ad avail insertion.
[$sel:availConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe AvailConfiguration

-- | Settings for ad avail blanking.
[$sel:availBlanking:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe AvailBlanking

-- | Nielsen configuration settings.
[$sel:nielsenConfiguration:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe NielsenConfiguration

-- | Settings for blackout slate.
[$sel:blackoutSlate:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe BlackoutSlate

-- | Settings for caption decriptions
[$sel:captionDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> Maybe [CaptionDescription]
[$sel:videoDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [VideoDescription]
[$sel:audioDescriptions:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [AudioDescription]
[$sel:outputGroups:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> [OutputGroup]

-- | Contains settings used to acquire and adjust timecode information from
--   inputs.
[$sel:timecodeConfig:EncoderSettings'] :: EncoderSettings -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EncoderSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:motionGraphicsConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_motionGraphicsConfiguration</a> - Settings for
--   motion graphics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureActivations:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_featureActivations</a> - Feature Activations
--   
--   <a>$sel:globalConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_globalConfiguration</a> - Configuration settings
--   that apply to the event as a whole.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availConfiguration</a> - Event-wide configuration
--   settings for ad avail insertion.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availBlanking:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availBlanking</a> - Settings for ad avail blanking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_nielsenConfiguration</a> - Nielsen configuration
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackoutSlate:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_blackoutSlate</a> - Settings for blackout slate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_captionDescriptions</a> - Settings for caption
--   decriptions
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_videoDescriptions</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_audioDescriptions</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputGroups:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_outputGroups</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeConfig:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_timecodeConfig</a> - Contains settings used to
--   acquire and adjust timecode information from inputs.
newEncoderSettings :: TimecodeConfig -> EncoderSettings

-- | Settings for motion graphics.
encoderSettings_motionGraphicsConfiguration :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe MotionGraphicsConfiguration)

-- | Feature Activations
encoderSettings_featureActivations :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe FeatureActivations)

-- | Configuration settings that apply to the event as a whole.
encoderSettings_globalConfiguration :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe GlobalConfiguration)

-- | Event-wide configuration settings for ad avail insertion.
encoderSettings_availConfiguration :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe AvailConfiguration)

-- | Settings for ad avail blanking.
encoderSettings_availBlanking :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe AvailBlanking)

-- | Nielsen configuration settings.
encoderSettings_nielsenConfiguration :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe NielsenConfiguration)

-- | Settings for blackout slate.
encoderSettings_blackoutSlate :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe BlackoutSlate)

-- | Settings for caption decriptions
encoderSettings_captionDescriptions :: Lens' EncoderSettings (Maybe [CaptionDescription])

-- | Undocumented member.
encoderSettings_videoDescriptions :: Lens' EncoderSettings [VideoDescription]

-- | Undocumented member.
encoderSettings_audioDescriptions :: Lens' EncoderSettings [AudioDescription]

-- | Undocumented member.
encoderSettings_outputGroups :: Lens' EncoderSettings [OutputGroup]

-- | Contains settings used to acquire and adjust timecode information from
--   inputs.
encoderSettings_timecodeConfig :: Lens' EncoderSettings TimecodeConfig

-- | Failover Condition settings. There can be multiple failover conditions
--   inside AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverCondition</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverCondition
FailoverCondition' :: Maybe FailoverConditionSettings -> FailoverCondition

-- | Failover condition type-specific settings.
[$sel:failoverConditionSettings:FailoverCondition'] :: FailoverCondition -> Maybe FailoverConditionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>FailoverCondition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failoverConditionSettings:FailoverCondition'</a>,
--   <a>failoverCondition_failoverConditionSettings</a> - Failover
--   condition type-specific settings.
newFailoverCondition :: FailoverCondition

-- | Failover condition type-specific settings.
failoverCondition_failoverConditionSettings :: Lens' FailoverCondition (Maybe FailoverConditionSettings)

-- | Settings for one failover condition.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverConditionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverConditionSettings
FailoverConditionSettings' :: Maybe VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe InputLossFailoverSettings -> Maybe AudioSilenceFailoverSettings -> FailoverConditionSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is considered black for
--   the specified period.
[$sel:videoBlackSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'] :: FailoverConditionSettings -> Maybe VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.
[$sel:inputLossSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'] :: FailoverConditionSettings -> Maybe InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if the specified audio selector is
--   silent for the specified period.
[$sel:audioSilenceSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'] :: FailoverConditionSettings -> Maybe AudioSilenceFailoverSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>FailoverConditionSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoBlackSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_videoBlackSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if content is considered black for the specified
--   period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_inputLossSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if content is not detected in this input for the
--   specified period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSilenceSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_audioSilenceSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if the specified audio selector is silent for the
--   specified period.
newFailoverConditionSettings :: FailoverConditionSettings

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is considered black for
--   the specified period.
failoverConditionSettings_videoBlackSettings :: Lens' FailoverConditionSettings (Maybe VideoBlackFailoverSettings)

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.
failoverConditionSettings_inputLossSettings :: Lens' FailoverConditionSettings (Maybe InputLossFailoverSettings)

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if the specified audio selector is
--   silent for the specified period.
failoverConditionSettings_audioSilenceSettings :: Lens' FailoverConditionSettings (Maybe AudioSilenceFailoverSettings)

-- | Feature Activations
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFeatureActivations</a> smart constructor.
data FeatureActivations
FeatureActivations' :: Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions -> FeatureActivations

-- | Enables the Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare
--   actions in the schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you
--   disable the feature on an existing schedule, make sure that you first
--   delete all input prepare actions from the schedule.
[$sel:inputPrepareScheduleActions:FeatureActivations'] :: FeatureActivations -> Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions

-- | Create a value of <a>FeatureActivations</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPrepareScheduleActions:FeatureActivations'</a>,
--   <a>featureActivations_inputPrepareScheduleActions</a> - Enables the
--   Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare actions in the
--   schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you disable the feature
--   on an existing schedule, make sure that you first delete all input
--   prepare actions from the schedule.
newFeatureActivations :: FeatureActivations

-- | Enables the Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare
--   actions in the schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you
--   disable the feature on an existing schedule, make sure that you first
--   delete all input prepare actions from the schedule.
featureActivations_inputPrepareScheduleActions :: Lens' FeatureActivations (Maybe FeatureActivationsInputPrepareScheduleActions)

-- | Fec Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFecOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FecOutputSettings
FecOutputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec -> FecOutputSettings

-- | Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1. The width of the FEC protection matrix.
--   Must be between 1 and 20, inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then
--   larger values increase robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is
--   the number of transport stream packets per row error correction
--   packet, and the value must be between 4 and 20, inclusive, if
--   includeFec is columnAndRow. If includeFec is column, this value must
--   be 1 to 20, inclusive.
[$sel:rowLength:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1. The height of the FEC protection
--   matrix. The number of transport stream packets per column error
--   correction packet. Must be between 4 and 20, inclusive.
[$sel:columnDepth:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Enables column only or column and row based FEC
[$sel:includeFec:FecOutputSettings'] :: FecOutputSettings -> Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec

-- | Create a value of <a>FecOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowLength:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_rowLength</a> - Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The width of the FEC protection matrix. Must be between 1 and 20,
--   inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then larger values increase
--   robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is the number of transport
--   stream packets per row error correction packet, and the value must be
--   between 4 and 20, inclusive, if includeFec is columnAndRow. If
--   includeFec is column, this value must be 1 to 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnDepth:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_columnDepth</a> - Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The height of the FEC protection matrix. The number of transport
--   stream packets per column error correction packet. Must be between 4
--   and 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeFec:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_includeFec</a> - Enables column only or column
--   and row based FEC
newFecOutputSettings :: FecOutputSettings

-- | Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1. The width of the FEC protection matrix.
--   Must be between 1 and 20, inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then
--   larger values increase robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is
--   the number of transport stream packets per row error correction
--   packet, and the value must be between 4 and 20, inclusive, if
--   includeFec is columnAndRow. If includeFec is column, this value must
--   be 1 to 20, inclusive.
fecOutputSettings_rowLength :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1. The height of the FEC protection
--   matrix. The number of transport stream packets per column error
--   correction packet. Must be between 4 and 20, inclusive.
fecOutputSettings_columnDepth :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Enables column only or column and row based FEC
fecOutputSettings_includeFec :: Lens' FecOutputSettings (Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec)

-- | Start time for the action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings' :: Text -> FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for
--   the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to
--   the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All
--   the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the
--   two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
[$sel:time:FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings_time</a> - Start time for the
--   action to start in the channel. (Not the time for the action to be
--   added to the schedule: actions are always added to the schedule
--   immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All the letters
--   are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the two constants
--   "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Text -> FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for
--   the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to
--   the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All
--   the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the
--   two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings_time :: Lens' FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings Text

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFmp4HlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Fmp4HlsSettings
Fmp4HlsSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Fmp4NielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe Fmp4TimedMetadataBehavior -> Fmp4HlsSettings

-- | List all the audio groups that are used with the video output stream.
--   Input all the audio GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video,
--   separate by ','.
[$sel:audioRenditionSets:Fmp4HlsSettings'] :: Fmp4HlsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
[$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'] :: Fmp4HlsSettings -> Maybe Fmp4NielsenId3Behavior

--   to output.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that are used with the video output stream. Input all the audio
--   GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video, separate by ','.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fmp4HlsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:Fmp4HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fmp4HlsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to
--   passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input to output.

--   to output.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFrameCaptureGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FrameCaptureGroupSettings

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
[$sel:frameCaptureCdnSettings:FrameCaptureGroupSettings'] :: FrameCaptureGroupSettings -> Maybe FrameCaptureCdnSettings

-- | The destination for the frame capture files. Either the URI for an
--   Amazon S3 bucket and object, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   s3ssl://sportsDelivery/highlights/20180820/curling-) or the URI for a
--   MediaStore container, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   mediastoressl://sportsDelivery/20180820/curling-). The final file
--   names consist of the prefix from the destination field (for example,
--   "curling-") + name modifier + the counter (5 digits, starting from
--   00001) + extension (which is always .jpg). For example,
--   curling-low.00001.jpg
[$sel:destination:FrameCaptureGroupSettings'] :: FrameCaptureGroupSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>FrameCaptureGroupSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>frameCaptureGroupSettings_frameCaptureCdnSettings</a> - Parameters
--   that control interactions with the CDN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:FrameCaptureGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>frameCaptureGroupSettings_destination</a> - The destination for the
--   frame capture files. Either the URI for an Amazon S3 bucket and
--   object, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   s3ssl://sportsDelivery/highlights/20180820/curling-) or the URI for a
--   MediaStore container, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   mediastoressl://sportsDelivery/20180820/curling-). The final file
--   names consist of the prefix from the destination field (for example,
--   "curling-") + name modifier + the counter (5 digits, starting from
--   00001) + extension (which is always .jpg). For example,
--   curling-low.00001.jpg
newFrameCaptureGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> FrameCaptureGroupSettings

-- | Global Configuration
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlobalConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data GlobalConfiguration
GlobalConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs -> Maybe InputLossBehavior -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource -> GlobalConfiguration

-- | Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.
[$sel:initialAudioGain:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g.
--   end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will
--   restart at the beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured
--   the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user
--   specified slate images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration
--   until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the
--   Channel Schedule API).
[$sel:inputEndAction:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction

-- | Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING -
--   MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the other. EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the
--   output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.
[$sel:outputLockingMode:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode

-- | Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates.
--   This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one
--   video frame per second.
[$sel:supportLowFramerateInputs:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs

-- | Settings for system actions when input is lost.
[$sel:inputLossBehavior:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe InputLossBehavior

-- | Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder
--   should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to
--   another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source
--   that is providing the input stream.
[$sel:outputTimingSource:GlobalConfiguration'] :: GlobalConfiguration -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource

-- | Create a value of <a>GlobalConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialAudioGain:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_initialAudioGain</a> - Value to set the initial
--   audio gain for the Live Event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputEndAction:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputEndAction</a> - Indicates the action to
--   take when the current input completes (e.g. end-of-file). When
--   switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will restart at the
--   beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured the encoder
--   will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user specified slate
--   images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration until the next
--   input switch occurs (which is controlled through the Channel Schedule
--   API).
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLockingMode:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputLockingMode</a> - Indicates how MediaLive
--   pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt
--   to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the other. EPOCH_LOCKING
--   - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the Unix epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportLowFramerateInputs:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_supportLowFramerateInputs</a> - Adjusts video
--   input buffer for streams with very low video framerates. This is
--   commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one video
--   frame per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossBehavior:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputLossBehavior</a> - Settings for system
--   actions when input is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputTimingSource:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputTimingSource</a> - Indicates whether the
--   rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder should be paced by its
--   system clock (which optionally may be locked to another source via
--   NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source that is providing
--   the input stream.
newGlobalConfiguration :: GlobalConfiguration

-- | Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.
globalConfiguration_initialAudioGain :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g.
--   end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will
--   restart at the beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured
--   the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user
--   specified slate images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration
--   until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the
--   Channel Schedule API).
globalConfiguration_inputEndAction :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction)

-- | Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING -
--   MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the other. EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the
--   output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.
globalConfiguration_outputLockingMode :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode)

-- | Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates.
--   This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one
--   video frame per second.
globalConfiguration_supportLowFramerateInputs :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs)

-- | Settings for system actions when input is lost.
globalConfiguration_inputLossBehavior :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe InputLossBehavior)

-- | Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder
--   should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to
--   another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source
--   that is providing the input stream.
globalConfiguration_outputTimingSource :: Lens' GlobalConfiguration (Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource)

data H264FilterSettings

[$sel:temporalFilterSettings:H264FilterSettings'] :: H264FilterSettings -> Maybe TemporalFilterSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>H264FilterSettings</a> with all optional fields
