-- | Hls Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsGroupSettings
HlsGroupSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame -> Maybe HlsIvInManifest -> Maybe HlsOutputSelection -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsEncryptionType -> Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [HlsAdMarkers] -> Maybe HlsManifestCompression -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsCodecSpecification -> Maybe HlsCdnSettings -> Maybe HlsMode -> Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsRedundantManifest -> Maybe HlsSegmentationMode -> Maybe HlsProgramDateTime -> Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType -> Maybe HlsTsFileMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut -> Maybe KeyProviderSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsClientCache -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsIvSource -> Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting -> Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat -> OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

-- | Length of MPEG-2 Transport Stream segments to create (in seconds).
--   Note that segments will end on the next keyframe after this number of
--   seconds, so actual segment length may be longer.
[$sel:segmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If set to "include", IV is listed in the manifest, otherwise the IV is
--   not in the manifest.
[$sel:ivInManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIvInManifest

-- | MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates manifests (master manifest, if
--   applicable, and media manifests) for this output group.
--   VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates media manifests for this
--   output group, but not a master manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not
--   generate any manifests for this output group.
[$sel:outputSelection:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsOutputSelection

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Encrypts the segments with the given encryption scheme. Exclude this
--   parameter if no encryption is desired.
[$sel:encryptionType:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsEncryptionType

-- | Place segments in subdirectories.
[$sel:directoryStructure:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure

-- | The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource
--   identified by the URI. If parameter is absent, an implicit value of
--   "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string can also be given.
[$sel:keyFormat:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Choose one or more ad marker types to pass SCTE35 signals through to
--   this group of Apple HLS outputs.
[$sel:adMarkers:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe [HlsAdMarkers]

-- | When set to gzip, compresses HLS playlist.
[$sel:manifestCompression:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsManifestCompression

-- | For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value
--   represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to
--   "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for
--   encryption.
[$sel:constantIv:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specification to use (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8
--   playlist generation.
[$sel:codecSpecification:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCodecSpecification

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
[$sel:hlsCdnSettings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCdnSettings

-- | If "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
[$sel:mode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsMode

-- | Include or exclude RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   tag of variant manifest.
[$sel:streamInfResolution:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of
--   segments in the media manifest file. After this maximum, older
--   segments are removed from the media manifest. This number must be
--   smaller than the number in the Keep Segments field.
[$sel:indexNSegments:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | ENABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes
--   information about both pipelines: first its own media files, then the
--   media files of the other pipeline. This feature allows playout device
--   that support stale manifest detection to switch from one manifest to
--   the other, when the current manifest seems to be stale. There are
--   still two destinations and two master manifests, but both master
--   manifests reference the media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The
--   master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information
--   about its own pipeline only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage
--   as the destination, the DISABLED behavior is always followed.
--   MediaPackage regenerates the manifests it serves to players so a
--   redundant manifest from MediaLive is irrelevant.
[$sel:redundantManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsRedundantManifest

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
[$sel:segmentationMode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsSegmentationMode

-- | Includes or excludes EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest
--   files. The value is calculated as follows: either the program date and
--   time are initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
[$sel:programDateTime:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsProgramDateTime

-- | DISABLED: Do not create an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the
--   master and media manifests (according to the Output Selection field).
--   STANDARD: Create an I-frame-only manifest for each output that
--   contains video, as well as the other manifests (according to the
--   Output Selection field). The I-frame manifest contains a
--   #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is I-frame only, and one or
--   more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the I-frame position. For
--   example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
[$sel:iFrameOnlyPlaylists:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType

-- | SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program as segments - multiple .ts media
--   files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if Mode field is VOD. Emit the
--   program as a single .ts media file. The media manifest includes
--   #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for playback. A typical use
--   for this value is when sending the output to AWS Elemental
--   MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file. Playback
--   while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP server
--   caching.
[$sel:tsFileMode:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsTsFileMode

-- | Number of segments to write to a subdirectory before starting a new
--   one. directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting
--   to have an effect.
[$sel:segmentsPerSubdirectory:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether to insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child
--   manifests for this output group. Typically, choose Insert because
--   these tags are required in the manifest (according to the HLS
--   specification) and serve an important purpose. Choose Never Insert
--   only if the downstream system is doing real-time failover (without
--   using the MediaLive automatic failover feature) and only if that
--   downstream system has advised you to exclude the tags.
[$sel:discontinuityTags:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
[$sel:baseUrlContent:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | State of HLS ID3 Segment Tagging
[$sel:hlsId3SegmentTagging:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
[$sel:baseUrlManifest:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to include the final (incomplete) segment in the
--   media output when the pipeline stops producing output because of a
--   channel stop, a channel pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto
--   means that MediaLive decides whether to include the final segment,
--   depending on the channel class and the types of output groups.
--   Suppress means to never include the incomplete segment. We recommend
--   you choose Auto and let MediaLive control the behavior.
[$sel:incompleteSegmentBehavior:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior

-- | Optional. One value per output group. This field is required only if
--   you are completing Base URL content A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in
--   a location different from the media files for pipeline 0.
[$sel:baseUrlContent1:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
[$sel:inputLossAction:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut

-- | The key provider settings.
[$sel:keyProviderSettings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe KeyProviderSettings

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the number of media
--   segments to retain in the destination directory. This number should be
--   bigger than indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
[$sel:keepSegments:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Mapping of up to 4 caption channels to caption languages. Is only
--   meaningful if captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
[$sel:captionLanguageMappings:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping]

-- | Provides an extra millisecond delta offset to fine tune the
--   timestamps.
[$sel:timestampDeltaMilliseconds:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Optional. One value per output group. Complete this field only if you
--   are completing Base URL manifest A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the child manifest files for pipeline 1 of all
--   outputs are in a location different from the child manifest files for
--   pipeline 0.
[$sel:baseUrlManifest1:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Period of insertion of EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
[$sel:programDateTimePeriod:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When set to "disabled", sets the #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the
--   manifest, which prevents clients from saving media segments for later
--   replay.
[$sel:clientCache:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsClientCache

-- | Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited
--   list of version values (1/2/3).
[$sel:keyFormatVersions:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set, minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back
--   within the specified range for a nearby avail and extending the
--   segment size if needed.
[$sel:minSegmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If this setting is "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to
--   change every segment (to match the segment number). If this is set to
--   "explicit", you must enter a constantIv value.
[$sel:ivSource:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsIvSource

-- | Applies only to 608 Embedded output captions. insert: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the manifest. Specify at least one language
--   in the CC1 Language Code field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for
--   each Language Code you specify. Make sure to specify the languages in
--   the order in which they appear in the original source (if the source
--   is embedded format) or the order of the caption selectors (if the
--   source is other than embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest
--   will not match up properly with the output captions. none: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE line in the manifest. omit: Omit any
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the manifest.
[$sel:captionLanguageSetting:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting

-- | Indicates whether the output manifest should use floating point or
--   integer values for segment duration.
[$sel:manifestDurationFormat:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat

-- | A directory or HTTP destination for the HLS segments, manifest files,
--   and encryption keys (if enabled).
[$sel:destination:HlsGroupSettings'] :: HlsGroupSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentLength</a> - Length of MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream segments to create (in seconds). Note that segments will end on
--   the next keyframe after this number of seconds, so actual segment
--   length may be longer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame</a> - Indicates ID3 frame
--   that has the timecode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivInManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivInManifest</a> - For use with encryptionType.
--   The IV (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction
--   with the key for encrypting blocks. If set to "include", IV is listed
--   in the manifest, otherwise the IV is not in the manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSelection:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_outputSelection</a> - MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates manifests (master manifest, if applicable, and media
--   manifests) for this output group. VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates media manifests for this output group, but not a master
--   manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not generate any manifests for this
--   output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period</a> - Timed Metadata
--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_encryptionType</a> - Encrypts the segments with
--   the given encryption scheme. Exclude this parameter if no encryption
--   is desired.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryStructure:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_directoryStructure</a> - Place segments in
--   subdirectories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormat</a> - The value specifies how the key is
--   represented in the resource identified by the URI. If parameter is
--   absent, an implicit value of "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string
--   can also be given.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adMarkers:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_adMarkers</a> - Choose one or more ad marker types
--   to pass SCTE35 signals through to this group of Apple HLS outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestCompression:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestCompression</a> - When set to gzip,
--   compresses HLS playlist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constantIv:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_constantIv</a> - For use with encryptionType. This
--   is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character text
--   string. If ivSource is set to "explicit" then this parameter is
--   required and is used as the IV for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSpecification:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_codecSpecification</a> - Specification to use
--   (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8 playlist generation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsCdnSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsCdnSettings</a> - Parameters that control
--   interactions with the CDN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>, <a>hlsGroupSettings_mode</a> - If
--   "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamInfResolution:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_streamInfResolution</a> - Include or exclude
--   RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF tag of variant
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexNSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_indexNSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of segments in the media manifest
--   file. After this maximum, older segments are removed from the media
--   manifest. This number must be smaller than the number in the Keep
--   Segments field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redundantManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_redundantManifest</a> - ENABLED: The master
--   manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information about
--   both pipelines: first its own media files, then the media files of the
--   other pipeline. This feature allows playout device that support stale
--   manifest detection to switch from one manifest to the other, when the
--   current manifest seems to be stale. There are still two destinations
--   and two master manifests, but both master manifests reference the
--   media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8
--   file) for each pipeline includes information about its own pipeline
--   only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage as the destination,
--   the DISABLED behavior is always followed. MediaPackage regenerates the
--   manifests it serves to players so a redundant manifest from MediaLive
--   is irrelevant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentationMode</a> - useInputSegmentation has
--   been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTime:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTime</a> - Includes or excludes
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest files. The value is
--   calculated as follows: either the program date and time are
--   initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iFrameOnlyPlaylists:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_iFrameOnlyPlaylists</a> - DISABLED: Do not create
--   an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the master and media manifests
--   (according to the Output Selection field). STANDARD: Create an
--   I-frame-only manifest for each output that contains video, as well as
--   the other manifests (according to the Output Selection field). The
--   I-frame manifest contains a #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is
--   I-frame only, and one or more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the
--   I-frame position. For example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
--   
--   <a>$sel:tsFileMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_tsFileMode</a> - SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program
--   as segments - multiple .ts media files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if
--   Mode field is VOD. Emit the program as a single .ts media file. The
--   media manifest includes #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for
--   playback. A typical use for this value is when sending the output to
--   AWS Elemental MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file.
--   Playback while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP
--   server caching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentsPerSubdirectory:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentsPerSubdirectory</a> - Number of segments
--   to write to a subdirectory before starting a new one.
--   directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting to
--   have an effect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:discontinuityTags:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_discontinuityTags</a> - Specifies whether to
--   insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child manifests for this
--   output group. Typically, choose Insert because these tags are required
--   in the manifest (according to the HLS specification) and serve an
--   important purpose. Choose Never Insert only if the downstream system
--   is doing real-time failover (without using the MediaLive automatic
--   failover feature) and only if that downstream system has advised you
--   to exclude the tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsId3SegmentTagging:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsId3SegmentTagging</a> - State of HLS ID3
--   Segment Tagging
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incompleteSegmentBehavior:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_incompleteSegmentBehavior</a> - Specifies whether
--   to include the final (incomplete) segment in the media output when the
--   pipeline stops producing output because of a channel stop, a channel
--   pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto means that MediaLive
--   decides whether to include the final segment, depending on the channel
--   class and the types of output groups. Suppress means to never include
--   the incomplete segment. We recommend you choose Auto and let MediaLive
--   control the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. This field is required only if you are completing Base
--   URL content A, and the downstream system has notified you that the
--   media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location different
--   from the media files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Parameter that control
--   output group behavior on input loss.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyProviderSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyProviderSettings</a> - The key provider
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keepSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the number of media segments to retain in the
--   destination directory. This number should be bigger than
--   indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageMappings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageMappings</a> - Mapping of up to 4
--   caption channels to caption languages. Is only meaningful if
--   captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampDeltaMilliseconds:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timestampDeltaMilliseconds</a> - Provides an extra
--   millisecond delta offset to fine tune the timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. Complete this field only if you are completing Base URL
--   manifest A, and the downstream system has notified you that the child
--   manifest files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location
--   different from the child manifest files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTimePeriod:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTimePeriod</a> - Period of insertion of
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientCache:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_clientCache</a> - When set to "disabled", sets the
--   #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the manifest, which prevents clients from
--   saving media segments for later replay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormatVersions:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormatVersions</a> - Either a single positive
--   integer version value or a slash delimited list of version values
--   (1/2/3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minSegmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_minSegmentLength</a> - When set,
--   minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back within the
--   specified range for a nearby avail and extending the segment size if
--   needed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivSource:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivSource</a> - For use with encryptionType. The IV
--   (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction with
--   the key for encrypting blocks. If this setting is
--   "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to change every segment
--   (to match the segment number). If this is set to "explicit", you must
--   enter a constantIv value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageSetting:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageSetting</a> - Applies only to 608
--   Embedded output captions. insert: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the
--   manifest. Specify at least one language in the CC1 Language Code
--   field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for each Language Code you
--   specify. Make sure to specify the languages in the order in which they
--   appear in the original source (if the source is embedded format) or
--   the order of the caption selectors (if the source is other than
--   embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest will not match up
--   properly with the output captions. none: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE
--   line in the manifest. omit: Omit any CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestDurationFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestDurationFormat</a> - Indicates whether the
--   output manifest should use floating point or integer values for
--   segment duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_destination</a> - A directory or HTTP destination
--   for the HLS segments, manifest files, and encryption keys (if
--   enabled).
newHlsGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

-- | Length of MPEG-2 Transport Stream segments to create (in seconds).
--   Note that segments will end on the next keyframe after this number of
--   seconds, so actual segment length may be longer.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentLength :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame)

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If set to "include", IV is listed in the manifest, otherwise the IV is
--   not in the manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_ivInManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIvInManifest)

-- | MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates manifests (master manifest, if
--   applicable, and media manifests) for this output group.
--   VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates media manifests for this
--   output group, but not a master manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not
--   generate any manifests for this output group.
hlsGroupSettings_outputSelection :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsOutputSelection)

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Encrypts the segments with the given encryption scheme. Exclude this
--   parameter if no encryption is desired.
hlsGroupSettings_encryptionType :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsEncryptionType)

-- | Place segments in subdirectories.
hlsGroupSettings_directoryStructure :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure)

-- | The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource
--   identified by the URI. If parameter is absent, an implicit value of
--   "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string can also be given.
hlsGroupSettings_keyFormat :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Choose one or more ad marker types to pass SCTE35 signals through to
--   this group of Apple HLS outputs.
hlsGroupSettings_adMarkers :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe [HlsAdMarkers])

-- | When set to gzip, compresses HLS playlist.
hlsGroupSettings_manifestCompression :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsManifestCompression)

-- | For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value
--   represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to
--   "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for
--   encryption.
hlsGroupSettings_constantIv :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specification to use (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8
--   playlist generation.
hlsGroupSettings_codecSpecification :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCodecSpecification)

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
hlsGroupSettings_hlsCdnSettings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCdnSettings)

-- | If "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
hlsGroupSettings_mode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsMode)

-- | Include or exclude RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   tag of variant manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_streamInfResolution :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution)

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of
--   segments in the media manifest file. After this maximum, older
--   segments are removed from the media manifest. This number must be
--   smaller than the number in the Keep Segments field.
hlsGroupSettings_indexNSegments :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | ENABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes
--   information about both pipelines: first its own media files, then the
--   media files of the other pipeline. This feature allows playout device
--   that support stale manifest detection to switch from one manifest to
--   the other, when the current manifest seems to be stale. There are
--   still two destinations and two master manifests, but both master
--   manifests reference the media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The
--   master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information
--   about its own pipeline only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage
--   as the destination, the DISABLED behavior is always followed.
--   MediaPackage regenerates the manifests it serves to players so a
--   redundant manifest from MediaLive is irrelevant.
hlsGroupSettings_redundantManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsRedundantManifest)

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentationMode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsSegmentationMode)

-- | Includes or excludes EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest
--   files. The value is calculated as follows: either the program date and
--   time are initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
hlsGroupSettings_programDateTime :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsProgramDateTime)

-- | DISABLED: Do not create an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the
--   master and media manifests (according to the Output Selection field).
--   STANDARD: Create an I-frame-only manifest for each output that
--   contains video, as well as the other manifests (according to the
--   Output Selection field). The I-frame manifest contains a
--   #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is I-frame only, and one or
--   more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the I-frame position. For
--   example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
hlsGroupSettings_iFrameOnlyPlaylists :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType)

-- | SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program as segments - multiple .ts media
--   files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if Mode field is VOD. Emit the
--   program as a single .ts media file. The media manifest includes
--   #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for playback. A typical use
--   for this value is when sending the output to AWS Elemental
--   MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file. Playback
--   while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP server
--   caching.
hlsGroupSettings_tsFileMode :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsTsFileMode)

-- | Number of segments to write to a subdirectory before starting a new
--   one. directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting
--   to have an effect.
hlsGroupSettings_segmentsPerSubdirectory :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies whether to insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child
--   manifests for this output group. Typically, choose Insert because
--   these tags are required in the manifest (according to the HLS
--   specification) and serve an important purpose. Choose Never Insert
--   only if the downstream system is doing real-time failover (without
--   using the MediaLive automatic failover feature) and only if that
--   downstream system has advised you to exclude the tags.
hlsGroupSettings_discontinuityTags :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags)

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | State of HLS ID3 Segment Tagging
hlsGroupSettings_hlsId3SegmentTagging :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState)

-- | A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the
--   media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a
--   different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to include the final (incomplete) segment in the
--   media output when the pipeline stops producing output because of a
--   channel stop, a channel pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto
--   means that MediaLive decides whether to include the final segment,
--   depending on the channel class and the types of output groups.
--   Suppress means to never include the incomplete segment. We recommend
--   you choose Auto and let MediaLive control the behavior.
hlsGroupSettings_incompleteSegmentBehavior :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior)

-- | Optional. One value per output group. This field is required only if
--   you are completing Base URL content A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in
--   a location different from the media files for pipeline 0.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent1 :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
hlsGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut)

-- | The key provider settings.
hlsGroupSettings_keyProviderSettings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe KeyProviderSettings)

-- | Applies only if Mode field is LIVE. Specifies the number of media
--   segments to retain in the destination directory. This number should be
--   bigger than indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
hlsGroupSettings_keepSegments :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Mapping of up to 4 caption channels to caption languages. Is only
--   meaningful if captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageMappings :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping])

-- | Provides an extra millisecond delta offset to fine tune the
--   timestamps.
hlsGroupSettings_timestampDeltaMilliseconds :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Optional. One value per output group. Complete this field only if you
--   are completing Base URL manifest A, and the downstream system has
--   notified you that the child manifest files for pipeline 1 of all
--   outputs are in a location different from the child manifest files for
--   pipeline 0.
hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest1 :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Period of insertion of EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
hlsGroupSettings_programDateTimePeriod :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When set to "disabled", sets the #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the
--   manifest, which prevents clients from saving media segments for later
--   replay.
hlsGroupSettings_clientCache :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsClientCache)

-- | Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited
--   list of version values (1/2/3).
hlsGroupSettings_keyFormatVersions :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set, minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back
--   within the specified range for a nearby avail and extending the
--   segment size if needed.
hlsGroupSettings_minSegmentLength :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a
--   128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks.
--   If this setting is "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to
--   change every segment (to match the segment number). If this is set to
--   "explicit", you must enter a constantIv value.
hlsGroupSettings_ivSource :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsIvSource)

-- | Applies only to 608 Embedded output captions. insert: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the manifest. Specify at least one language
--   in the CC1 Language Code field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for
--   each Language Code you specify. Make sure to specify the languages in
--   the order in which they appear in the original source (if the source
--   is embedded format) or the order of the caption selectors (if the
--   source is other than embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest
--   will not match up properly with the output captions. none: Include
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE line in the manifest. omit: Omit any
--   CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the manifest.
hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageSetting :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting)

-- | Indicates whether the output manifest should use floating point or
--   integer values for segment duration.
hlsGroupSettings_manifestDurationFormat :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings (Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat)

-- | A directory or HTTP destination for the HLS segments, manifest files,
--   and encryption keys (if enabled).
hlsGroupSettings_destination :: Lens' HlsGroupSettings OutputLocationRef

-- | Settings for the action to insert a user-defined ID3 tag in each HLS
--   segment
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings
HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings' :: Text -> HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | ID3 tag to insert into each segment. Supports special keyword
--   identifiers to substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported
--   keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
[$sel:tag:HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings'] :: HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings_tag</a> - ID3 tag to
--   insert into each segment. Supports special keyword identifiers to
--   substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
newHlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings :: Text -> HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | ID3 tag to insert into each segment. Supports special keyword
--   identifiers to substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported
--   keyword identifiers:
--   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html
hlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings_tag :: Lens' HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings Text

-- | Hls Input Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsInputSettings
HlsInputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsScte35SourceType -> HlsInputSettings

-- | The number of seconds between retries when an attempt to read a
--   manifest or segment fails.
[$sel:retryInterval:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified the HLS stream with the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most
--   closely matches this value will be chosen, otherwise the highest
--   bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be chosen. The bitrate is specified
--   in bits per second, as in an HLS manifest.
[$sel:bandwidth:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
[$sel:retries:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When specified, reading of the HLS input will begin this many buffer
--   segments from the end (most recently written segment). When not
--   specified, the HLS input will begin with the first segment specified
--   in the m3u8.
[$sel:bufferSegments:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the source for the SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will
--   ingest. Messages can be ingested from the content segments (in the
--   stream) or from tags in the playlist (the HLS manifest). MediaLive
--   ignores SCTE-35 information in the source that is not selected.
[$sel:scte35Source:HlsInputSettings'] :: HlsInputSettings -> Maybe HlsScte35SourceType

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsInputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryInterval:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_retryInterval</a> - The number of seconds between
--   retries when an attempt to read a manifest or segment fails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bandwidth:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bandwidth</a> - When specified the HLS stream with
--   the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most closely matches this value will be
--   chosen, otherwise the highest bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be
--   chosen. The bitrate is specified in bits per second, as in an HLS
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retries:HlsInputSettings'</a>, <a>hlsInputSettings_retries</a>
--   - The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferSegments:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bufferSegments</a> - When specified, reading of
--   the HLS input will begin this many buffer segments from the end (most
--   recently written segment). When not specified, the HLS input will
--   begin with the first segment specified in the m3u8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Source:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_scte35Source</a> - Identifies the source for the
--   SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will ingest. Messages can be ingested
--   from the content segments (in the stream) or from tags in the playlist
--   (the HLS manifest). MediaLive ignores SCTE-35 information in the
--   source that is not selected.
newHlsInputSettings :: HlsInputSettings

-- | The number of seconds between retries when an attempt to read a
--   manifest or segment fails.
hlsInputSettings_retryInterval :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified the HLS stream with the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most
--   closely matches this value will be chosen, otherwise the highest
--   bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be chosen. The bitrate is specified
--   in bits per second, as in an HLS manifest.
hlsInputSettings_bandwidth :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
hlsInputSettings_retries :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When specified, reading of the HLS input will begin this many buffer
--   segments from the end (most recently written segment). When not
--   specified, the HLS input will begin with the first segment specified
--   in the m3u8.
hlsInputSettings_bufferSegments :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Identifies the source for the SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will
--   ingest. Messages can be ingested from the content segments (in the
--   stream) or from tags in the playlist (the HLS manifest). MediaLive
--   ignores SCTE-35 information in the source that is not selected.
hlsInputSettings_scte35Source :: Lens' HlsInputSettings (Maybe HlsScte35SourceType)

-- | Hls Media Store Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsMediaStoreSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsMediaStoreSettings
HlsMediaStoreSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HlsMediaStoreSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When set to temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory
--   for faster reading and writing.
[$sel:mediaStoreStorageClass:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsMediaStoreSettings'] :: HlsMediaStoreSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsMediaStoreSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of
--   file cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts
--   that will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaStoreStorageClass:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_mediaStoreStorageClass</a> - When set to
--   temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory for faster
--   reading and writing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of
--   seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsMediaStoreSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsMediaStoreSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output
--   fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value
--   of 0 means never restart.
newHlsMediaStoreSettings :: HlsMediaStoreSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_filecacheDuration :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_numRetries :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When set to temporal, output files are stored in non-persistent memory
--   for faster reading and writing.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_mediaStoreStorageClass :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe HlsMediaStoreStorageClass)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsMediaStoreSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsMediaStoreSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Hls Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsOutputSettings
HlsOutputSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsH265PackagingType -> Maybe Text -> HlsSettings -> HlsOutputSettings

-- | String concatenated to end of segment filenames.
[$sel:segmentModifier:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video
--   description. Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1
--   or HVC1.
[$sel:h265PackagingType:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe HlsH265PackagingType

-- | String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Accepts
--   \"Format Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.
[$sel:nameModifier:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings regarding the underlying stream. These settings are different
--   for audio-only outputs.
[$sel:hlsSettings:HlsOutputSettings'] :: HlsOutputSettings -> HlsSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentModifier:HlsOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsOutputSettings_segmentModifier</a> - String concatenated to end
--   of segment filenames.
--   
--   <a>$sel:h265PackagingType:HlsOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsOutputSettings_h265PackagingType</a> - Only applicable when this
--   output is referencing an H.265 video description. Specifies whether
--   MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1 or HVC1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameModifier:HlsOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsOutputSettings_nameModifier</a> - String concatenated to the end
--   of the destination filename. Accepts \"Format
--   Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsSettings:HlsOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsOutputSettings_hlsSettings</a> - Settings regarding the
--   underlying stream. These settings are different for audio-only
--   outputs.
newHlsOutputSettings :: HlsSettings -> HlsOutputSettings

-- | String concatenated to end of segment filenames.
hlsOutputSettings_segmentModifier :: Lens' HlsOutputSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video
--   description. Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1
--   or HVC1.
hlsOutputSettings_h265PackagingType :: Lens' HlsOutputSettings (Maybe HlsH265PackagingType)

-- | String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Accepts
--   \"Format Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.
hlsOutputSettings_nameModifier :: Lens' HlsOutputSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings regarding the underlying stream. These settings are different
--   for audio-only outputs.
hlsOutputSettings_hlsSettings :: Lens' HlsOutputSettings HlsSettings

-- | Hls S3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsS3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsS3Settings
HlsS3Settings' :: Maybe S3CannedAcl -> HlsS3Settings

[$sel:cannedAcl:HlsS3Settings'] :: HlsS3Settings -> Maybe S3CannedAcl

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:cannedAcl:HlsS3Settings'</a>, <a>hlsS3Settings_cannedAcl</a> -
--   Specify the canned ACL to apply to each S3 request. Defaults to none.
newHlsS3Settings :: HlsS3Settings

hlsS3Settings_cannedAcl :: Lens' HlsS3Settings (Maybe S3CannedAcl)

-- | Hls Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsSettings
HlsSettings' :: Maybe StandardHlsSettings -> Maybe FrameCaptureHlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSettings -> Maybe Fmp4HlsSettings -> HlsSettings
[$sel:standardHlsSettings:HlsSettings'] :: HlsSettings -> Maybe StandardHlsSettings
[$sel:frameCaptureHlsSettings:HlsSettings'] :: HlsSettings -> Maybe FrameCaptureHlsSettings
[$sel:audioOnlyHlsSettings:HlsSettings'] :: HlsSettings -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSettings
[$sel:fmp4HlsSettings:HlsSettings'] :: HlsSettings -> Maybe Fmp4HlsSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsSettings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:standardHlsSettings:HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsSettings_standardHlsSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameCaptureHlsSettings:HlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsSettings_frameCaptureHlsSettings</a> - Undocumented member.

-- | Hls Webdav Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsWebdavSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsWebdavSettings
HlsWebdavSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HlsWebdavSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to WebDAV.
[$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode

-- | Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is
--   put into an error state.
[$sel:numRetries:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the
--   connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:HlsWebdavSettings'] :: HlsWebdavSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsWebdavSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of file
--   cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpTransferMode:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_httpTransferMode</a> - Specify whether or not to
--   use chunked transfer encoding to WebDAV.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts that
--   will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the connection is
--   lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:HlsWebdavSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsWebdavSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
newHlsWebdavSettings :: HlsWebdavSettings

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.

hlsWebdavSettings_httpTransferMode :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe HlsWebdavHttpTransferMode)

--   put into an error state.

--   connection is lost.
hlsWebdavSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)

--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
hlsWebdavSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' HlsWebdavSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Placeholder documentation for Input
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInput</a> smart constructor.
data Input
Input' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [InputSource] -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlow] -> Maybe InputSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputDestination] -> Maybe InputState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe InputClass -> Maybe InputType -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings] -> Maybe [Text] -> Input

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during
--   and after creation.
[$sel:roleArn:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IDs for all Inputs which are partners of this one.
[$sel:inputPartnerIds:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of the sources of the input (PULL-type).
[$sel:sources:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [InputSource]

-- | A list of MediaConnect Flows for this input.
[$sel:mediaConnectFlows:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlow]

-- | Certain pull input sources can be dynamic, meaning that they can have
--   their URL's dynamically changes during input switch actions.
--   Presently, this functionality only works with MP4_FILE inputs.
[$sel:inputSourceType:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe InputSourceType

-- | The Unique ARN of the input (generated, immutable).
[$sel:arn:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe Text

-- | The generated ID of the input (unique for user account, immutable).
[$sel:id:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IDs for all the Input Security Groups attached to the input.
[$sel:securityGroups:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The user-assigned name (This is a mutable value).
[$sel:name:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the destinations of the input (PUSH-type).
[$sel:destinations:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [InputDestination]
[$sel:state:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe InputState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | STANDARD - MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this
--   input. If the channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested.
--   If the channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be
--   ingested; the second source will always be ignored, even if the first
--   source fails. SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to
--   this input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is
--   valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid
--   because the channel requires two sources in the input.
[$sel:inputClass:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe InputClass
[$sel:type':Input'] :: Input -> Maybe InputType

-- | Settings for the input devices.
[$sel:inputDevices:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings]

-- | A list of channel IDs that that input is attached to (currently an
--   input can only be attached to one channel).
[$sel:attachedChannels:Input'] :: Input -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Input</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:Input'</a>, <a>input_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during and after creation.

--   <a>$sel:inputPartnerIds:Input'</a>, <a>input_inputPartnerIds</a> - A
--   list of IDs for all Inputs which are partners of this one.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sources:Input'</a>, <a>input_sources</a> - A list of the
--   sources of the input (PULL-type).
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaConnectFlows:Input'</a>, <a>input_mediaConnectFlows</a> -

--

--   list of IDs for all the Input Security Groups attached to the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Input'</a>, <a>input_name</a> - The user-assigned name
--   (This is a mutable value).

--   channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested. If the
--   channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be ingested;
--   the second source will always be ignored, even if the first source
--   fails. SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to this
--   input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is

-- | Input Channel Level
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputChannelLevel</a> smart constructor.
data InputChannelLevel

-- | The index of the input channel used as a source.
[$sel:inputChannel:InputChannelLevel'] :: InputChannelLevel -> Natural

-- | Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.
[$sel:gain:InputChannelLevel'] :: InputChannelLevel -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InputChannelLevel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   used as a source.

--   Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.

--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.

-- | Configurable settings for the input device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceConfigurableSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputDeviceConfigurableSettings
InputDeviceConfigurableSettings' :: Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput -> Maybe Int -> InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

-- | The input source that you want to use. If the device has a source
--   connected to only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which
--   source the device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources
--   connected to both its input ports, and you want to use a specific
--   source, specify the source.
[$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'] :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput

-- | The maximum bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle
--   the bitrate of the source video.
[$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'] :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDeviceConfigurableSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuredInput:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_configuredInput</a> - The input
--   source that you want to use. If the device has a source connected to
--   only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which source the
--   device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources connected to
--   both its input ports, and you want to use a specific source, specify
--   the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_maxBitrate</a> - The maximum
--   bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle the bitrate
--   of the source video.
newInputDeviceConfigurableSettings :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

-- | The input source that you want to use. If the device has a source
--   connected to only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which
--   source the device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources
--   connected to both its input ports, and you want to use a specific
--   source, specify the source.
inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_configuredInput :: Lens' InputDeviceConfigurableSettings (Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput)

-- | The maximum bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle
--   the bitrate of the source video.
inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_maxBitrate :: Lens' InputDeviceConfigurableSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Settings that describe the active source from the input device, and
--   the video characteristics of that source.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceHdSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputDeviceHdSettings
InputDeviceHdSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceScanType -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput -> Maybe Double -> Maybe InputDeviceState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceActiveInput -> InputDeviceHdSettings

-- | The height of the video source, in pixels.
[$sel:height:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The scan type of the video source.
[$sel:scanType:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceScanType

-- | The width of the video source, in pixels.

--   specify this source.

-- | The frame rate of the video source.
[$sel:framerate:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The state of the input device.
[$sel:deviceState:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceState

-- | The current maximum bitrate for ingesting this source, in bits per
--   second. You can specify this maximum.
[$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | If you specified Auto as the configured input, specifies which of the
--   sources is currently active (SDI or HDMI).
[$sel:activeInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'] :: InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceActiveInput

-- | The network settings for the input device.
--

data InputDeviceNetworkSettings

[$sel:dnsAddresses:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'] :: InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The subnet mask of the input device.
[$sel:subnetMask:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'] :: InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address of the input device.
[$sel:ipAddress:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'] :: InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe Text

--   MediaLive) to use a dynamic IP address assignment (DHCP) or a static
--   IP address.
[$sel:ipScheme:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'] :: InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceIpScheme

[$sel:gateway:InputDeviceNetworkSettings'] :: InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe Text

--   the input device.

--   input device.

--   input device.

-- | Details of the input device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDeviceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data InputDeviceSummary
InputDeviceSummary' :: Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings -> Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState -> Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings -> Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputDeviceType -> Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState -> InputDeviceSummary

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type UHD.
[$sel:uhdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings

-- | The network MAC address of the input device.
[$sel:macAddress:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type HD.
[$sel:hdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings

-- | The state of the connection between the input device and AWS.
[$sel:connectionState:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState

-- | Network settings for the input device.
[$sel:networkSettings:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings

-- | The status of software on the input device.
[$sel:deviceUpdateStatus:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus

-- | The unique ARN of the input device.
[$sel:arn:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the input device.
[$sel:id:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A name that you specify for the input device.
[$sel:name:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique serial number of the input device.
[$sel:serialNumber:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the input device.
[$sel:type':InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe InputDeviceType

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
[$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:InputDeviceSummary'] :: InputDeviceSummary -> Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDeviceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uhdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_uhdDeviceSettings</a> - Settings that describe
--   an input device that is type UHD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_macAddress</a> - The network MAC address of the
--   input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hdDeviceSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_hdDeviceSettings</a> - Settings that describe an
--   input device that is type HD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionState:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_connectionState</a> - The state of the
--   connection between the input device and AWS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkSettings:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_networkSettings</a> - Network settings for the
--   input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceUpdateStatus:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_deviceUpdateStatus</a> - The status of software
--   on the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_arn</a> -
--   The unique ARN of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique ID of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_name</a> -
--   A name that you specify for the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_serialNumber</a> - The unique serial number of
--   the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_type</a>
--   - The type of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_deviceSettingsSyncState</a> - The status of the
--   action to synchronize the device configuration. If you change the
--   configuration of the input device (for example, the maximum bitrate),
--   MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The device might not
--   update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device has updated its
--   configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated its
--   configuration.
newInputDeviceSummary :: InputDeviceSummary

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type UHD.
inputDeviceSummary_uhdDeviceSettings :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceUhdSettings)

-- | The network MAC address of the input device.

-- | Settings that describe an input device that is type HD.

inputDeviceSummary_connectionState :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceConnectionState)

-- | Network settings for the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_networkSettings :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceNetworkSettings)

-- | The status of software on the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_deviceUpdateStatus :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe DeviceUpdateStatus)

-- | The unique ARN of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_arn :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_id :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

inputDeviceSummary_name :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique serial number of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_serialNumber :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the input device.
inputDeviceSummary_type :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe InputDeviceType)

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
inputDeviceSummary_deviceSettingsSyncState :: Lens' InputDeviceSummary (Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState)
