-- | Input Location
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLocation</a> smart constructor.
data InputLocation
InputLocation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> InputLocation

-- | key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
[$sel:passwordParam:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:username:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniform Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file
--   accessible to the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the
--   output type. For example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar
--   to: "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
[$sel:uri:InputLocation'] :: InputLocation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLocation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordParam:InputLocation'</a>,
--   <a>inputLocation_passwordParam</a> - key used to extract the password
--   from EC2 Parameter store
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:InputLocation'</a>, <a>inputLocation_username</a> -
--   Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:uri:InputLocation'</a>, <a>inputLocation_uri</a> - Uniform
--   Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file accessible to
--   the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the output type. For
--   example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar to:
--   "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
newInputLocation :: Text -> InputLocation

-- | key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
inputLocation_passwordParam :: Lens' InputLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLocation_username :: Lens' InputLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniform Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file
--   accessible to the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the
--   output type. For example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar
--   to: "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
inputLocation_uri :: Lens' InputLocation Text

-- | Input Loss Behavior
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossBehavior
InputLossBehavior' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossImageType -> InputLossBehavior

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:blackFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Natural

-- | When input loss image type is "color" this field specifies the color
--   to use. Value: 6 hex characters representing the values of RGB.
[$sel:inputLossImageColor:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Text

-- | When input loss image type is "slate" these fields specify the
--   parameters for accessing the slate.
[$sel:inputLossImageSlate:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe InputLocation

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:repeatFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether to substitute a solid color or a slate into the
--   output after input loss exceeds blackFrameMsec.
[$sel:inputLossImageType:InputLossBehavior'] :: InputLossBehavior -> Maybe InputLossImageType

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLossBehavior</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_blackFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageColor:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageColor</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "color" this field specifies the color to use. Value: 6 hex
--   characters representing the values of RGB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageSlate:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageSlate</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "slate" these fields specify the parameters for accessing the
--   slate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repeatFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_repeatFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageType:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageType</a> - Indicates whether to
--   substitute a solid color or a slate into the output after input loss
--   exceeds blackFrameMsec.
newInputLossBehavior :: InputLossBehavior

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLossBehavior_blackFrameMsec :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Natural)

-- | When input loss image type is "color" this field specifies the color
--   to use. Value: 6 hex characters representing the values of RGB.
inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageColor :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Text)

-- | When input loss image type is "slate" these fields specify the
--   parameters for accessing the slate.
inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageSlate :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Documentation update needed
inputLossBehavior_repeatFrameMsec :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether to substitute a solid color or a slate into the
--   output after input loss exceeds blackFrameMsec.
inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageType :: Lens' InputLossBehavior (Maybe InputLossImageType)

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossFailoverSettings
InputLossFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After
--   that time, an input failover will occur.
[$sel:inputLossThresholdMsec:InputLossFailoverSettings'] :: InputLossFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLossFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossThresholdMsec:InputLossFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossFailoverSettings_inputLossThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After that time,
--   an input failover will occur.
newInputLossFailoverSettings :: InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After
--   that time, an input failover will occur.
inputLossFailoverSettings_inputLossThresholdMsec :: Lens' InputLossFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Action to prepare an input for a future immediate input switch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings
InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
[$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
[$sel:urlPath:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
[$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputClippingSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference</a>
--   - The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlPath:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_urlPath</a> - The value for the
--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_urlPath :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings :: Lens' InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings (Maybe InputClippingSettings)

-- | An Input Security Group
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InputSecurityGroup
InputSecurityGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputSecurityGroupState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [InputWhitelistRule] -> Maybe [Text] -> InputSecurityGroup

-- | Unique ARN of Input Security Group
[$sel:arn:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The Id of the Input Security Group
[$sel:id:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the Input Security Group.
[$sel:state:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe InputSecurityGroupState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Whitelist rules and their sync status
[$sel:whitelistRules:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe [InputWhitelistRule]

-- | The list of inputs currently using this Input Security Group.
[$sel:inputs:InputSecurityGroup'] :: InputSecurityGroup -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_arn</a> -
--   Unique ARN of Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_id</a> - The
--   Id of the Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_state</a>
--   - The current state of the Input Security Group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_tags</a> -
--   A collection of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:whitelistRules:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_whitelistRules</a> - Whitelist rules and their
--   sync status
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputs:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_inputs</a> - The list of inputs currently using
--   this Input Security Group.
newInputSecurityGroup :: InputSecurityGroup

-- | Unique ARN of Input Security Group
inputSecurityGroup_arn :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The Id of the Input Security Group
inputSecurityGroup_id :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the Input Security Group.
inputSecurityGroup_state :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe InputSecurityGroupState)

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
inputSecurityGroup_tags :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Whitelist rules and their sync status
inputSecurityGroup_whitelistRules :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe [InputWhitelistRule])

-- | The list of inputs currently using this Input Security Group.
inputSecurityGroup_inputs :: Lens' InputSecurityGroup (Maybe [Text])

-- | Live Event input parameters. There can be multiple inputs in a single
--   Live Event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputSettings
InputSettings' :: Maybe InputDenoiseFilter -> Maybe [AudioSelector] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference -> Maybe VideoSelector -> Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior -> Maybe InputFilter -> Maybe InputDeblockFilter -> Maybe [CaptionSelector] -> Maybe NetworkInputSettings -> InputSettings

-- | Enable or disable the denoise filter when filtering.
[$sel:denoiseFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputDenoiseFilter

-- | Used to select the audio stream to decode for inputs that have
--   multiple available.
[$sel:audioSelectors:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe [AudioSelector]

-- | Adjusts the magnitude of filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
[$sel:filterStrength:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether to extract applicable ancillary data from a
--   SMPTE-2038 source in this input. Applicable data types are captions,
--   timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104 messages. - PREFER: Extract from
--   SMPTE-2038 if present in this input, otherwise extract from another
--   source (if any). - IGNORE: Never extract any ancillary data from
--   SMPTE-2038.
[$sel:smpte2038DataPreference:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference

-- | Informs which video elementary stream to decode for input types that
--   have multiple available.
[$sel:videoSelector:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe VideoSelector

-- | Loop input if it is a file. This allows a file input to be streamed
--   indefinitely.
[$sel:sourceEndBehavior:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior

-- | Turns on the filter for this input. MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking
--   filter enabled by default. 1) auto - filtering will be applied
--   depending on input type/quality 2) disabled - no filtering will be
--   applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will be applied regardless
--   of input type
[$sel:inputFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputFilter

-- | Enable or disable the deblock filter when filtering.
[$sel:deblockFilter:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe InputDeblockFilter

-- | Used to select the caption input to use for inputs that have multiple
--   available.
[$sel:captionSelectors:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe [CaptionSelector]

-- | Input settings.
[$sel:networkInputSettings:InputSettings'] :: InputSettings -> Maybe NetworkInputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denoiseFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_denoiseFilter</a> - Enable or disable the denoise
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_audioSelectors</a> - Used to select the audio stream
--   to decode for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterStrength:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_filterStrength</a> - Adjusts the magnitude of
--   filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
--   
--   <a>$sel:smpte2038DataPreference:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_smpte2038DataPreference</a> - Specifies whether to
--   extract applicable ancillary data from a SMPTE-2038 source in this
--   input. Applicable data types are captions, timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104
--   messages. - PREFER: Extract from SMPTE-2038 if present in this input,
--   otherwise extract from another source (if any). - IGNORE: Never
--   extract any ancillary data from SMPTE-2038.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoSelector:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_videoSelector</a> - Informs which video elementary
--   stream to decode for input types that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndBehavior:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_sourceEndBehavior</a> - Loop input if it is a file.
--   This allows a file input to be streamed indefinitely.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_inputFilter</a> - Turns on the filter for this input.
--   MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking filter enabled by default. 1) auto -
--   filtering will be applied depending on input type/quality 2) disabled
--   - no filtering will be applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will
--   be applied regardless of input type
--   
--   <a>$sel:deblockFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_deblockFilter</a> - Enable or disable the deblock
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_captionSelectors</a> - Used to select the caption
--   input to use for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInputSettings:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_networkInputSettings</a> - Input settings.
newInputSettings :: InputSettings

-- | Enable or disable the denoise filter when filtering.
inputSettings_denoiseFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputDenoiseFilter)

-- | Used to select the audio stream to decode for inputs that have
--   multiple available.
inputSettings_audioSelectors :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe [AudioSelector])

-- | Adjusts the magnitude of filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
inputSettings_filterStrength :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies whether to extract applicable ancillary data from a
--   SMPTE-2038 source in this input. Applicable data types are captions,
--   timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104 messages. - PREFER: Extract from
--   SMPTE-2038 if present in this input, otherwise extract from another
--   source (if any). - IGNORE: Never extract any ancillary data from
--   SMPTE-2038.
inputSettings_smpte2038DataPreference :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference)

-- | Informs which video elementary stream to decode for input types that
--   have multiple available.
inputSettings_videoSelector :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe VideoSelector)

-- | Loop input if it is a file. This allows a file input to be streamed
--   indefinitely.
inputSettings_sourceEndBehavior :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior)

-- | Turns on the filter for this input. MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking
--   filter enabled by default. 1) auto - filtering will be applied
--   depending on input type/quality 2) disabled - no filtering will be
--   applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will be applied regardless
--   of input type
inputSettings_inputFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputFilter)

-- | Enable or disable the deblock filter when filtering.
inputSettings_deblockFilter :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe InputDeblockFilter)

-- | Used to select the caption input to use for inputs that have multiple
--   available.
inputSettings_captionSelectors :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe [CaptionSelector])

-- | Input settings.
inputSettings_networkInputSettings :: Lens' InputSettings (Maybe NetworkInputSettings)

-- | The settings for a PULL type input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSource</a> smart constructor.
data InputSource
InputSource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InputSource

-- | The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
[$sel:passwordParam:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The username for the input source.
[$sel:username:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | This represents the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
[$sel:url:InputSource'] :: InputSource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>inputSource_passwordParam</a> - The key used to extract the
--   password from EC2 Parameter store.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:InputSource'</a>, <a>inputSource_username</a> - The
--   username for the input source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:InputSource'</a>, <a>inputSource_url</a> - This represents
--   the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
newInputSource :: InputSource

-- | The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
inputSource_passwordParam :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The username for the input source.
inputSource_username :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)

-- | This represents the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
inputSource_url :: Lens' InputSource (Maybe Text)

InputSourceRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InputSourceRequest

-- | Settings for the "switch input" action: to switch from ingesting one
--   input to ingesting another input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input,
--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
[$sel:urlPath:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
[$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputClippingSettings

-- | The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
[$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'] :: InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set

--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings :: Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

--   for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic
--   input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in
--   order to connect the input to a different content source.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_urlPath :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings (Maybe [Text])

--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings (Maybe InputClippingSettings)

-- | The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference :: Lens' InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings Text

-- | Settings for a private VPC Input. When this property is specified, the
--   input destination addresses will be created in a VPC rather than with
--   public Internet addresses. This property requires setting the roleArn
--   property on Input creation. Not compatible with the
--   inputSecurityGroups property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputVpcRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InputVpcRequest
InputVpcRequest' :: Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> InputVpcRequest

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Input
--   VPC network interfaces. Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then
--   the VPC default security group will be used.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:InputVpcRequest'] :: InputVpcRequest -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. Subnet IDs must be
--   mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:InputVpcRequest'] :: InputVpcRequest -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>InputVpcRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Input VPC network interfaces.
--   Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_subnetIds</a> - A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. Subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones
--   (AZ).
newInputVpcRequest :: InputVpcRequest

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Input
--   VPC network interfaces. Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then
--   the VPC default security group will be used.
inputVpcRequest_securityGroupIds :: Lens' InputVpcRequest (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. Subnet IDs must be
--   mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
inputVpcRequest_subnetIds :: Lens' InputVpcRequest [Text]

-- | Whitelist rule
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputWhitelistRule</a> smart constructor.
data InputWhitelistRule
InputWhitelistRule' :: Maybe Text -> InputWhitelistRule
