-- | An IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputWhitelistRuleCidr</a> smart constructor.
data InputWhitelistRuleCidr
InputWhitelistRuleCidr' :: Maybe Text -> InputWhitelistRuleCidr

-- | The IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.
[$sel:cidr:InputWhitelistRuleCidr'] :: InputWhitelistRuleCidr -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputWhitelistRuleCidr</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidr:InputWhitelistRuleCidr'</a>,
--   <a>inputWhitelistRuleCidr_cidr</a> - The IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.
newInputWhitelistRuleCidr :: InputWhitelistRuleCidr

-- | The IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.
inputWhitelistRuleCidr_cidr :: Lens' InputWhitelistRuleCidr (Maybe Text)

-- | Key Provider Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyProviderSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KeyProviderSettings
KeyProviderSettings' :: Maybe StaticKeySettings -> KeyProviderSettings
[$sel:staticKeySettings:KeyProviderSettings'] :: KeyProviderSettings -> Maybe StaticKeySettings

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyProviderSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:staticKeySettings:KeyProviderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>keyProviderSettings_staticKeySettings</a> - Undocumented member.
newKeyProviderSettings :: KeyProviderSettings

-- | Undocumented member.
keyProviderSettings_staticKeySettings :: Lens' KeyProviderSettings (Maybe StaticKeySettings)

-- | M2ts Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newM2tsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data M2tsSettings
M2tsSettings' :: Maybe M2tsSegmentationMarkers -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsNielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe M2tsSegmentationStyle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsAudioBufferModel -> Maybe M2tsPcrControl -> Maybe M2tsEbpPlacement -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbNitSettings -> Maybe M2tsAudioInterval -> Maybe Double -> Maybe M2tsCcDescriptor -> Maybe M2tsScte35Control -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsAudioStreamType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsBufferModel -> Maybe M2tsAribCaptionsPidControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsKlv -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsRateMode -> Maybe DvbTdtSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe M2tsAbsentInputAudioBehavior -> Maybe Double -> Maybe M2tsEbifControl -> Maybe M2tsArib -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsTimedMetadataBehavior -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsEsRateInPes -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> M2tsSettings

-- | Inserts segmentation markers at each segmentationTime period.
--   raiSegstart sets the Random Access Indicator bit in the adaptation
--   field. raiAdapt sets the RAI bit and adds the current timecode in the
--   private data bytes. psiSegstart inserts PAT and PMT tables at the
--   start of segments. ebp adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the
--   adaptation field as per OpenCable specification OC-SP-EBP-I01-130118.
--   ebpLegacy adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the adaptation
--   field using a legacy proprietary format.
[$sel:segmentationMarkers:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsSegmentationMarkers

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
[$sel:klvDataPids:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Signal data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:etvSignalPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock Reference (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
[$sel:pcrPeriod:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:pmtPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:videoPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
[$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsNielsenId3Behavior

-- | The segmentation style parameter controls how segmentation markers are
--   inserted into the transport stream. With avails, it is possible that
--   segments may be truncated, which can influence where future
--   segmentation markers are inserted. When a segmentation style of
--   "resetCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an avail,
--   we will reset the segmentation cadence. This means the subsequent
--   segment will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds. When a
--   segmentation style of "maintainCadence" is selected and a segment is
--   truncated due to an avail, we will not reset the segmentation cadence.
--   This means the subsequent segment will likely be truncated as well.
--   However, all segments after that will have a duration of
--   $segmentationTime seconds. Note that EBP lookahead is a slight
--   exception to this rule.
[$sel:segmentationStyle:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsSegmentationStyle

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:timedMetadataPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to dvb, uses DVB buffer model for Dolby Digital audio. When
--   set to atsc, the ATSC model is used.
[$sel:audioBufferModel:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsAudioBufferModel

-- | When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
[$sel:pcrControl:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsPcrControl

-- | Controls placement of EBP on Audio PIDs. If set to videoAndAudioPids,
--   EBP markers will be placed on the video PID and all audio PIDs. If set
--   to videoPid, EBP markers will be placed on only the video PID.
[$sel:ebpPlacement:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsEbpPlacement

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
[$sel:pmtInterval:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Inserts DVB Network Information Table (NIT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
[$sel:dvbNitSettings:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe DvbNitSettings

-- | When videoAndFixedIntervals is selected, audio EBP markers will be
--   added to partitions 3 and 4. The interval between these additional
--   markers will be fixed, and will be slightly shorter than the video EBP
--   marker interval. Only available when EBP Cablelabs segmentation
--   markers are selected. Partitions 1 and 2 will always follow the video
--   interval.
[$sel:ebpAudioInterval:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsAudioInterval

-- | Value in bits per second of extra null packets to insert into the
--   transport stream. This can be used if a downstream encryption system
--   requires periodic null packets.
[$sel:nullPacketBitrate:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | When set to enabled, generates captionServiceDescriptor in PMT.
[$sel:ccDescriptor:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsCcDescriptor

-- | Optionally pass SCTE-35 signals from the input source to this output.
[$sel:scte35Control:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsScte35Control

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB Captions in the transport stream. Can
--   be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:aribCaptionsPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:audioPids:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Platform data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:etvPlatformPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
[$sel:patInterval:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When set to atsc, uses stream type = 0x81 for AC3 and stream type =
--   0x87 for EAC3. When set to dvb, uses stream type = 0x06.
[$sel:audioStreamType:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsAudioStreamType

-- | The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
[$sel:programNum:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Controls the timing accuracy for output network traffic. Leave as
--   MULTIPLEX to ensure accurate network packet timing. Or set to NONE,
--   which might result in lower latency but will result in more
--   variability in output network packet timing. This variability might
--   cause interruptions, jitter, or bursty behavior in your playback or
--   receiving devices.
[$sel:bufferModel:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsBufferModel

-- | If set to auto, pid number used for ARIB Captions will be
--   auto-selected from unused pids. If set to useConfigured, ARIB Captions
--   will be on the configured pid number.
[$sel:aribCaptionsPidControl:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsAribCaptionsPidControl

-- | When set, enforces that Encoder Boundary Points do not come within the
--   specified time interval of each other by looking ahead at input video.
--   If another EBP is going to come in within the specified time interval,
--   the current EBP is not emitted, and the segment is "stretched" to the
--   next marker. The lookahead value does not add latency to the system.
--   The Live Event must be configured elsewhere to create sufficient
--   latency to make the lookahead accurate.
[$sel:ebpLookaheadMs:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the
--   transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the
--   same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:pcrPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any KLV data from the input source to
--   this output.
[$sel:klv:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsKlv

-- | The number of audio frames to insert for each PES packet.
[$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | When vbr, does not insert null packets into transport stream to fill
--   specified bitrate. The bitrate setting acts as the maximum bitrate
--   when vbr is set.
[$sel:rateMode:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsRateMode

-- | Inserts DVB Time and Date Table (TDT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
[$sel:dvbTdtSettings:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe DvbTdtSettings

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
[$sel:ecmPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Inserts DVB Service Description Table (SDT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
[$sel:dvbSdtSettings:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe DvbSdtSettings

-- | When set to drop, output audio streams will be removed from the
--   program if the selected input audio stream is removed from the input.
--   This allows the output audio configuration to dynamically change based
--   on input configuration. If this is set to encodeSilence, all output
--   audio streams will output encoded silence when not connected to an
--   active input stream.
[$sel:absentInputAudioBehavior:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsAbsentInputAudioBehavior

-- | The length in seconds of each segment. Required unless markers is set
--   to _none_.
[$sel:segmentationTime:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any EBIF data from the input source to
--   this output.
[$sel:ebif:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsEbifControl

-- | When set to enabled, uses ARIB-compliant field muxing and removes
--   video descriptor.
[$sel:arib:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsArib

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Teletext data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:dvbTeletextPid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata will be passed through from
--   input to output.
[$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsTimedMetadataBehavior

-- | The length in seconds of each fragment. Only used with EBP markers.
[$sel:fragmentTime:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The output bitrate of the transport stream in bits per second. Setting
--   to 0 lets the muxer automatically determine the appropriate bitrate.
[$sel:bitrate:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Include or exclude the ES Rate field in the PES header.
[$sel:esRateInPes:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe M2tsEsRateInPes

-- | The value of the transport stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
[$sel:transportStreamId:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this
--   output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges
--   and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal
--   values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182
--   (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:dvbSubPids:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32
--   (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:scte35Pid:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
[$sel:scte27Pids:M2tsSettings'] :: M2tsSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>M2tsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMarkers:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationMarkers</a> - Inserts segmentation markers
--   at each segmentationTime period. raiSegstart sets the Random Access
--   Indicator bit in the adaptation field. raiAdapt sets the RAI bit and
--   adds the current timecode in the private data bytes. psiSegstart
--   inserts PAT and PMT tables at the start of segments. ebp adds Encoder
--   Boundary Point information to the adaptation field as per OpenCable
--   specification OC-SP-EBP-I01-130118. ebpLegacy adds Encoder Boundary
--   Point information to the adaptation field using a legacy proprietary
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:klvDataPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_klvDataPids</a>
--   - Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:etvSignalPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_etvSignalPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source ETV Signal data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPeriod:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrPeriod</a> -
--   Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock Reference (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pmtPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_videoPid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationStyle:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationStyle</a> - The segmentation style
--   parameter controls how segmentation markers are inserted into the
--   transport stream. With avails, it is possible that segments may be
--   truncated, which can influence where future segmentation markers are
--   inserted. When a segmentation style of "resetCadence" is selected and
--   a segment is truncated due to an avail, we will reset the segmentation
--   cadence. This means the subsequent segment will have a duration of
--   $segmentationTime seconds. When a segmentation style of
--   "maintainCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an
--   avail, we will not reset the segmentation cadence. This means the
--   subsequent segment will likely be truncated as well. However, all
--   segments after that will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds.
--   Note that EBP lookahead is a slight exception to this rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_timedMetadataPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) of the
--   timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a
--   decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioBufferModel:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioBufferModel</a> - When set to dvb, uses DVB
--   buffer model for Dolby Digital audio. When set to atsc, the ATSC model
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrControl:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrControl</a> -
--   When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpPlacement:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpPlacement</a> - Controls placement of EBP on Audio
--   PIDs. If set to videoAndAudioPids, EBP markers will be placed on the
--   video PID and all audio PIDs. If set to videoPid, EBP markers will be
--   placed on only the video PID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pmtInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbNitSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbNitSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Network Information
--   Table (NIT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpAudioInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpAudioInterval</a> - When videoAndFixedIntervals is
--   selected, audio EBP markers will be added to partitions 3 and 4. The
--   interval between these additional markers will be fixed, and will be
--   slightly shorter than the video EBP marker interval. Only available
--   when EBP Cablelabs segmentation markers are selected. Partitions 1 and
--   2 will always follow the video interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nullPacketBitrate:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_nullPacketBitrate</a> - Value in bits per second of
--   extra null packets to insert into the transport stream. This can be
--   used if a downstream encryption system requires periodic null packets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccDescriptor:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ccDescriptor</a> - When set to enabled, generates
--   captionServiceDescriptor in PMT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Control:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_scte35Control</a> - Optionally pass SCTE-35 signals
--   from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aribCaptionsPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB
--   Captions in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_audioPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:etvPlatformPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_etvPlatformPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source ETV Platform data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal
--   or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:patInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_patInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioStreamType:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioStreamType</a> - When set to atsc, uses stream
--   type = 0x81 for AC3 and stream type = 0x87 for EAC3. When set to dvb,
--   uses stream type = 0x06.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programNum:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_programNum</a> -
--   The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferModel:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_bufferModel</a>
--   - Controls the timing accuracy for output network traffic. Leave as
--   MULTIPLEX to ensure accurate network packet timing. Or set to NONE,
--   which might result in lower latency but will result in more
--   variability in output network packet timing. This variability might
--   cause interruptions, jitter, or bursty behavior in your playback or
--   receiving devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aribCaptionsPidControl:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPidControl</a> - If set to auto, pid
--   number used for ARIB Captions will be auto-selected from unused pids.
--   If set to useConfigured, ARIB Captions will be on the configured pid
--   number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpLookaheadMs:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpLookaheadMs</a> - When set, enforces that Encoder
--   Boundary Points do not come within the specified time interval of each
--   other by looking ahead at input video. If another EBP is going to come
--   in within the specified time interval, the current EBP is not emitted,
--   and the segment is "stretched" to the next marker. The lookahead value
--   does not add latency to the system. The Live Event must be configured
--   elsewhere to create sufficient latency to make the lookahead accurate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport
--   stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value
--   as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:klv:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_klv</a> - If set to
--   passthrough, passes any KLV data from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioFramesPerPes</a> - The number of audio frames to
--   insert for each PES packet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateMode:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_rateMode</a> -
--   When vbr, does not insert null packets into transport stream to fill
--   specified bitrate. The bitrate setting acts as the maximum bitrate
--   when vbr is set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbTdtSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbTdtSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Time and Date Table
--   (TDT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecmPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_ecmPid</a> - This
--   field is unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbSdtSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbSdtSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Service Description
--   Table (SDT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absentInputAudioBehavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_absentInputAudioBehavior</a> - When set to drop,
--   output audio streams will be removed from the program if the selected
--   input audio stream is removed from the input. This allows the output
--   audio configuration to dynamically change based on input
--   configuration. If this is set to encodeSilence, all output audio
--   streams will output encoded silence when not connected to an active
--   input stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationTime:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationTime</a> - The length in seconds of each
--   segment. Required unless markers is set to _none_.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebif:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_ebif</a> - If set to
--   passthrough, passes any EBIF data from the input source to this
--   output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arib:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_arib</a> - When set to
--   enabled, uses ARIB-compliant field muxing and removes video
--   descriptor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbTeletextPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbTeletextPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source DVB Teletext data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal
--   or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to passthrough,
--   timed metadata will be passed through from input to output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fragmentTime:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_fragmentTime</a> - The length in seconds of each
--   fragment. Only used with EBP markers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_bitrate</a> - The
--   output bitrate of the transport stream in bits per second. Setting to
--   0 lets the muxer automatically determine the appropriate bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:esRateInPes:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_esRateInPes</a>
--   - Include or exclude the ES Rate field in the PES header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transportStreamId:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_transportStreamId</a> - The value of the transport
--   stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbSubPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_dvbSubPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this
--   output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges
--   and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal
--   values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182
--   (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Pid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_scte35Pid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32
--   (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte27Pids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_scte27Pids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
newM2tsSettings :: M2tsSettings

-- | Inserts segmentation markers at each segmentationTime period.
--   raiSegstart sets the Random Access Indicator bit in the adaptation
--   field. raiAdapt sets the RAI bit and adds the current timecode in the
--   private data bytes. psiSegstart inserts PAT and PMT tables at the
--   start of segments. ebp adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the
--   adaptation field as per OpenCable specification OC-SP-EBP-I01-130118.
--   ebpLegacy adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the adaptation
--   field using a legacy proprietary format.
m2tsSettings_segmentationMarkers :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsSegmentationMarkers)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_klvDataPids :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Signal data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_etvSignalPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock Reference (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
m2tsSettings_pcrPeriod :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_pmtPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_videoPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
m2tsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsNielsenId3Behavior)

-- | The segmentation style parameter controls how segmentation markers are
--   inserted into the transport stream. With avails, it is possible that
--   segments may be truncated, which can influence where future
--   segmentation markers are inserted. When a segmentation style of
--   "resetCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an avail,
--   we will reset the segmentation cadence. This means the subsequent
--   segment will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds. When a
--   segmentation style of "maintainCadence" is selected and a segment is
--   truncated due to an avail, we will not reset the segmentation cadence.
--   This means the subsequent segment will likely be truncated as well.
--   However, all segments after that will have a duration of
--   $segmentationTime seconds. Note that EBP lookahead is a slight
--   exception to this rule.
m2tsSettings_segmentationStyle :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsSegmentationStyle)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_timedMetadataPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to dvb, uses DVB buffer model for Dolby Digital audio. When
--   set to atsc, the ATSC model is used.
m2tsSettings_audioBufferModel :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsAudioBufferModel)

-- | When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
m2tsSettings_pcrControl :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsPcrControl)

-- | Controls placement of EBP on Audio PIDs. If set to videoAndAudioPids,
--   EBP markers will be placed on the video PID and all audio PIDs. If set
--   to videoPid, EBP markers will be placed on only the video PID.
m2tsSettings_ebpPlacement :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsEbpPlacement)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
m2tsSettings_pmtInterval :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Inserts DVB Network Information Table (NIT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
m2tsSettings_dvbNitSettings :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe DvbNitSettings)

-- | When videoAndFixedIntervals is selected, audio EBP markers will be
--   added to partitions 3 and 4. The interval between these additional
--   markers will be fixed, and will be slightly shorter than the video EBP
--   marker interval. Only available when EBP Cablelabs segmentation
--   markers are selected. Partitions 1 and 2 will always follow the video
--   interval.
m2tsSettings_ebpAudioInterval :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsAudioInterval)

-- | Value in bits per second of extra null packets to insert into the
--   transport stream. This can be used if a downstream encryption system
--   requires periodic null packets.
m2tsSettings_nullPacketBitrate :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to enabled, generates captionServiceDescriptor in PMT.
m2tsSettings_ccDescriptor :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsCcDescriptor)

-- | Optionally pass SCTE-35 signals from the input source to this output.
m2tsSettings_scte35Control :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsScte35Control)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB Captions in the transport stream. Can
--   be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_audioPids :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Platform data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_etvPlatformPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
m2tsSettings_patInterval :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When set to atsc, uses stream type = 0x81 for AC3 and stream type =
--   0x87 for EAC3. When set to dvb, uses stream type = 0x06.
m2tsSettings_audioStreamType :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsAudioStreamType)

-- | The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
m2tsSettings_programNum :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Controls the timing accuracy for output network traffic. Leave as
--   MULTIPLEX to ensure accurate network packet timing. Or set to NONE,
--   which might result in lower latency but will result in more
--   variability in output network packet timing. This variability might
--   cause interruptions, jitter, or bursty behavior in your playback or
--   receiving devices.
m2tsSettings_bufferModel :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsBufferModel)

-- | If set to auto, pid number used for ARIB Captions will be
--   auto-selected from unused pids. If set to useConfigured, ARIB Captions
--   will be on the configured pid number.
m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPidControl :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsAribCaptionsPidControl)

-- | When set, enforces that Encoder Boundary Points do not come within the
--   specified time interval of each other by looking ahead at input video.
--   If another EBP is going to come in within the specified time interval,
--   the current EBP is not emitted, and the segment is "stretched" to the
--   next marker. The lookahead value does not add latency to the system.
--   The Live Event must be configured elsewhere to create sufficient
--   latency to make the lookahead accurate.
m2tsSettings_ebpLookaheadMs :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the
--   transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the
--   same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_pcrPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any KLV data from the input source to
--   this output.
m2tsSettings_klv :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsKlv)

-- | The number of audio frames to insert for each PES packet.
m2tsSettings_audioFramesPerPes :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | When vbr, does not insert null packets into transport stream to fill
--   specified bitrate. The bitrate setting acts as the maximum bitrate
--   when vbr is set.
m2tsSettings_rateMode :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsRateMode)

-- | Inserts DVB Time and Date Table (TDT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
m2tsSettings_dvbTdtSettings :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe DvbTdtSettings)

-- | This field is unused and deprecated.
m2tsSettings_ecmPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Inserts DVB Service Description Table (SDT) at the specified table
--   repetition interval.
m2tsSettings_dvbSdtSettings :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe DvbSdtSettings)

-- | When set to drop, output audio streams will be removed from the
--   program if the selected input audio stream is removed from the input.
--   This allows the output audio configuration to dynamically change based
--   on input configuration. If this is set to encodeSilence, all output
--   audio streams will output encoded silence when not connected to an
--   active input stream.
m2tsSettings_absentInputAudioBehavior :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsAbsentInputAudioBehavior)

-- | The length in seconds of each segment. Required unless markers is set
--   to _none_.
m2tsSettings_segmentationTime :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any EBIF data from the input source to
--   this output.
m2tsSettings_ebif :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsEbifControl)

-- | When set to enabled, uses ARIB-compliant field muxing and removes
--   video descriptor.
m2tsSettings_arib :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsArib)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Teletext data to this
--   output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_dvbTeletextPid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata will be passed through from
--   input to output.
m2tsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsTimedMetadataBehavior)

-- | The length in seconds of each fragment. Only used with EBP markers.
m2tsSettings_fragmentTime :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | The output bitrate of the transport stream in bits per second. Setting
--   to 0 lets the muxer automatically determine the appropriate bitrate.
m2tsSettings_bitrate :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Include or exclude the ES Rate field in the PES header.
m2tsSettings_esRateInPes :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe M2tsEsRateInPes)

-- | The value of the transport stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
m2tsSettings_transportStreamId :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this
--   output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges
--   and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal
--   values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182
--   (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_dvbSubPids :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32
--   (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_scte35Pid :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
m2tsSettings_scte27Pids :: Lens' M2tsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings information for the .m3u8 container
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newM3u8Settings</a> smart constructor.
data M3u8Settings
M3u8Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8NielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8PcrControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8Scte35Behavior -> Maybe M3u8TimedMetadataBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> M3u8Settings

-- | Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock References (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
[$sel:pcrPeriod:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
[$sel:pmtPid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
[$sel:videoPid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
[$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe M3u8NielsenId3Behavior

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
[$sel:timedMetadataPid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
[$sel:pcrControl:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe M3u8PcrControl

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
[$sel:pmtInterval:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values.
[$sel:audioPids:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
[$sel:patInterval:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
[$sel:programNum:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the
--   transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the
--   same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value.
[$sel:pcrPid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of audio frames to insert for each PES packet.
[$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | This parameter is unused and deprecated.
[$sel:ecmPid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any SCTE-35 signals from the input
--   source to this output.
[$sel:scte35Behavior:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe M3u8Scte35Behavior

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input
--   to output.
[$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe M3u8TimedMetadataBehavior

-- | The value of the transport stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
[$sel:transportStreamId:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
[$sel:scte35Pid:M3u8Settings'] :: M3u8Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>M3u8Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPeriod:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrPeriod</a> -
--   Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock References (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pmtPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_videoPid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataPid:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_timedMetadataPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) of the
--   timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a
--   decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrControl:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrControl</a> -
--   When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtInterval:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pmtInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioPids:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_audioPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:patInterval:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_patInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programNum:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_programNum</a> -
--   The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport
--   stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value
--   as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_audioFramesPerPes</a> - The number of audio frames to
--   insert for each PES packet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecmPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_ecmPid</a> - This
--   parameter is unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Behavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_scte35Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough, passes any
--   SCTE-35 signals from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to passthrough,
--   timed metadata is passed through from input to output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transportStreamId:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_transportStreamId</a> - The value of the transport
--   stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Pid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_scte35Pid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
newM3u8Settings :: M3u8Settings

-- | Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock References (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
m3u8Settings_pcrPeriod :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
m3u8Settings_pmtPid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
m3u8Settings_videoPid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will
--   be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be
--   inserted in the output.
m3u8Settings_nielsenId3Behavior :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe M3u8NielsenId3Behavior)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
m3u8Settings_timedMetadataPid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
m3u8Settings_pcrControl :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe M3u8PcrControl)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
m3u8Settings_pmtInterval :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values.
m3u8Settings_audioPids :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
m3u8Settings_patInterval :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
m3u8Settings_programNum :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the
--   transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the
--   same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value.
m3u8Settings_pcrPid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of audio frames to insert for each PES packet.
m3u8Settings_audioFramesPerPes :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | This parameter is unused and deprecated.
m3u8Settings_ecmPid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | If set to passthrough, passes any SCTE-35 signals from the input
--   source to this output.
m3u8Settings_scte35Behavior :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe M3u8Scte35Behavior)

-- | When set to passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input
--   to output.
m3u8Settings_timedMetadataBehavior :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe M3u8TimedMetadataBehavior)

-- | The value of the transport stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
m3u8Settings_transportStreamId :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
m3u8Settings_scte35Pid :: Lens' M3u8Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings to specify the rendering of motion graphics into the video
--   stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   smart constructor.
data MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings
MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Duration (in milliseconds) that motion graphics should render on to
--   the video stream. Leaving out this property or setting to 0 will
--   result in rendering continuing until a deactivate action is processed.
[$sel:duration:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
[$sel:passwordParam:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Documentation update needed
[$sel:username:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | URI of the HTML5 content to be rendered into the live stream.
[$sel:url:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> -
--   Duration (in milliseconds) that motion graphics should render on to
--   the video stream. Leaving out this property or setting to 0 will
--   result in rendering continuing until a deactivate action is processed.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordParam:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_passwordParam</a> -
--   Key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_username</a> -
--   Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_url</a> - URI of the
--   HTML5 content to be rendered into the live stream.
newMotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings :: MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Duration (in milliseconds) that motion graphics should render on to
--   the video stream. Leaving out this property or setting to 0 will
--   result in rendering continuing until a deactivate action is processed.
motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_duration :: Lens' MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_username :: Lens' MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Text)

motionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings_url :: Lens' MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Mp2 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMp2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Mp2Settings
Mp2Settings' :: Maybe Mp2CodingMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Mp2Settings

-- | The MPEG2 Audio coding mode. Valid values are codingMode10 (for mono)
--   or codingMode20 (for stereo).
[$sel:codingMode:Mp2Settings'] :: Mp2Settings -> Maybe Mp2CodingMode

-- | Sample rate in Hz.
[$sel:sampleRate:Mp2Settings'] :: Mp2Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second.
[$sel:bitrate:Mp2Settings'] :: Mp2Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>Mp2Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Mp2Settings'</a>, <a>mp2Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   The MPEG2 Audio coding mode. Valid values are codingMode10 (for mono)
--   or codingMode20 (for stereo).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:Mp2Settings'</a>, <a>mp2Settings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Mp2Settings'</a>, <a>mp2Settings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second.
newMp2Settings :: Mp2Settings

--   or codingMode20 (for stereo).
mp2Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Mp2Settings (Maybe Mp2CodingMode)

mp2Settings_sampleRate :: Lens' Mp2Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second.
mp2Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Mp2Settings (Maybe Double)

--

data Mpeg2FilterSettings

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
