-- | Mpeg2 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMpeg2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Mpeg2Settings
Mpeg2Settings' :: Maybe Mpeg2ScanType -> Maybe Mpeg2DisplayRatio -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorMetadata -> Maybe Mpeg2GopSizeUnits -> Maybe Mpeg2SubGopLength -> Maybe FixedAfd -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Mpeg2FilterSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Mpeg2TimecodeInsertionBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorSpace -> Maybe Mpeg2AdaptiveQuantization -> Maybe AfdSignaling -> Natural -> Natural -> Mpeg2Settings

-- | Set the scan type of the output to PROGRESSIVE or INTERLACED (top
--   field first).
[$sel:scanType:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2ScanType

-- | Sets the pixel aspect ratio for the encode.
[$sel:displayAspectRatio:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2DisplayRatio

-- | Specifies whether to include the color space metadata. The metadata
--   describes the color space that applies to the video (the colorSpace
--   field). We recommend that you insert the metadata.
[$sel:colorMetadata:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorMetadata

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. Specifies whether the gopSize is
--   specified in frames or seconds. If you do not plan to change the
--   default gopSize, leave the default. If you specify SECONDS, MediaLive
--   will internally convert the gop size to a frame count.
[$sel:gopSizeUnits:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2GopSizeUnits

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. If you do not know what GOP is, use the
--   default. FIXED: Set the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP to the
--   value in gopNumBFrames. DYNAMIC: Let MediaLive optimize the number of
--   B-frames in each sub-GOP, to improve visual quality.
[$sel:subgopLength:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2SubGopLength

-- | Complete this field only when afdSignaling is set to FIXED. Enter the
--   AFD value (4 bits) to write on all frames of the video encode.
[$sel:fixedAfd:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe FixedAfd

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. The GOP size (keyframe interval) in the
--   units specified in gopSizeUnits. If you do not know what GOP is, use
--   the default. If gopSizeUnits is frames, then the gopSize must be an
--   integer and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is
--   seconds, the gopSize must be greater than 0, but does not need to be
--   an integer.
[$sel:gopSize:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Double

-- | Optionally specify a noise reduction filter, which can improve quality
--   of compressed content. If you do not choose a filter, no filter will
--   be applied. TEMPORAL: This filter is useful for both source content
--   that is noisy (when it has excessive digital artifacts) and source
--   content that is clean. When the content is noisy, the filter cleans up
--   the source content before the encoding phase, with these two effects:
--   First, it improves the output video quality because the content has
--   been cleaned up. Secondly, it decreases the bandwidth because
--   MediaLive does not waste bits on encoding noise. When the content is
--   reasonably clean, the filter tends to decrease the bitrate.
[$sel:filterSettings:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2FilterSettings

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. The number of B-frames between reference
--   frames. If you do not know what a B-frame is, use the default.
[$sel:gopNumBFrames:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines how MediaLive inserts timecodes in the output video. For
--   detailed information about setting up the input and the output for a
--   timecode, see the section on \"MediaLive Features - Timecode
--   configuration\" in the MediaLive User Guide. DISABLED: do not include
--   timecodes. GOP_TIMECODE: Include timecode metadata in the GOP header.
[$sel:timecodeInsertion:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2TimecodeInsertionBehavior

-- | MPEG2: default is open GOP.
[$sel:gopClosedCadence:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Choose the type of color space conversion to apply to the output. For
--   detailed information on setting up both the input and the output to
--   obtain the desired color space in the output, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Video - color space\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. PASSTHROUGH: Keep the color space of the input content - do not
--   convert it. AUTO:Convert all content that is SD to rec 601, and
--   convert all content that is HD to rec 709.
[$sel:colorSpace:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorSpace

-- | Choose Off to disable adaptive quantization. Or choose another value
--   to enable the quantizer and set its strength. The strengths are: Auto,
--   Off, Low, Medium, High. When you enable this field, MediaLive allows
--   intra-frame quantizers to vary, which might improve visual quality.
[$sel:adaptiveQuantization:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe Mpeg2AdaptiveQuantization

-- | Indicates the AFD values that MediaLive will write into the video
--   encode. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if your
--   downstream system has not given you guidance, choose AUTO. AUTO:
--   MediaLive will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where
--   multiple AFD values are valid). FIXED: MediaLive will use the value
--   you specify in fixedAFD.
[$sel:afdSignaling:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe AfdSignaling

-- | The framerate numerator. For example, 24000. The framerate is the
--   numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 =
--   23.976 FPS.
[$sel:framerateNumerator:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Natural

-- | description": "The framerate denominator. For example, 1001. The
--   framerate is the numerator divided by the denominator. For example,
--   24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.
[$sel:framerateDenominator:Mpeg2Settings'] :: Mpeg2Settings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Mpeg2Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scanType:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_scanType</a> -
--   Set the scan type of the output to PROGRESSIVE or INTERLACED (top
--   field first).
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayAspectRatio:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_displayAspectRatio</a> - Sets the pixel aspect ratio
--   for the encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorMetadata:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_colorMetadata</a> - Specifies whether to include the
--   color space metadata. The metadata describes the color space that
--   applies to the video (the colorSpace field). We recommend that you
--   insert the metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSizeUnits:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopSizeUnits</a> - Relates to the GOP structure.
--   Specifies whether the gopSize is specified in frames or seconds. If
--   you do not plan to change the default gopSize, leave the default. If
--   you specify SECONDS, MediaLive will internally convert the gop size to
--   a frame count.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subgopLength:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_subgopLength</a> - Relates to the GOP structure. If
--   you do not know what GOP is, use the default. FIXED: Set the number of
--   B-frames in each sub-GOP to the value in gopNumBFrames. DYNAMIC: Let
--   MediaLive optimize the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP, to improve
--   visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedAfd:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_fixedAfd</a> -
--   Complete this field only when afdSignaling is set to FIXED. Enter the
--   AFD value (4 bits) to write on all frames of the video encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSize:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_gopSize</a> -
--   Relates to the GOP structure. The GOP size (keyframe interval) in the
--   units specified in gopSizeUnits. If you do not know what GOP is, use
--   the default. If gopSizeUnits is frames, then the gopSize must be an
--   integer and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is
--   seconds, the gopSize must be greater than 0, but does not need to be
--   an integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterSettings:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_filterSettings</a> - Optionally specify a noise
--   reduction filter, which can improve quality of compressed content. If
--   you do not choose a filter, no filter will be applied. TEMPORAL: This
--   filter is useful for both source content that is noisy (when it has
--   excessive digital artifacts) and source content that is clean. When
--   the content is noisy, the filter cleans up the source content before
--   the encoding phase, with these two effects: First, it improves the
--   output video quality because the content has been cleaned up.
--   Secondly, it decreases the bandwidth because MediaLive does not waste
--   bits on encoding noise. When the content is reasonably clean, the
--   filter tends to decrease the bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopNumBFrames:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopNumBFrames</a> - Relates to the GOP structure. The
--   number of B-frames between reference frames. If you do not know what a
--   B-frame is, use the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeInsertion:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_timecodeInsertion</a> - Determines how MediaLive
--   inserts timecodes in the output video. For detailed information about
--   setting up the input and the output for a timecode, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Timecode configuration\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. DISABLED: do not include timecodes. GOP_TIMECODE: Include
--   timecode metadata in the GOP header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopClosedCadence:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopClosedCadence</a> - MPEG2: default is open GOP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpace:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_colorSpace</a>
--   - Choose the type of color space conversion to apply to the output.
--   For detailed information on setting up both the input and the output
--   to obtain the desired color space in the output, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Video - color space\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. PASSTHROUGH: Keep the color space of the input content - do not
--   convert it. AUTO:Convert all content that is SD to rec 601, and
--   convert all content that is HD to rec 709.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adaptiveQuantization:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_adaptiveQuantization</a> - Choose Off to disable
--   adaptive quantization. Or choose another value to enable the quantizer
--   and set its strength. The strengths are: Auto, Off, Low, Medium, High.
--   When you enable this field, MediaLive allows intra-frame quantizers to
--   vary, which might improve visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afdSignaling:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_afdSignaling</a> - Indicates the AFD values that
--   MediaLive will write into the video encode. If you do not know what
--   AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not given you
--   guidance, choose AUTO. AUTO: MediaLive will try to preserve the input
--   AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid). FIXED:
--   MediaLive will use the value you specify in fixedAFD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateNumerator:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_framerateNumerator</a> - The framerate numerator. For
--   example, 24000. The framerate is the numerator divided by the
--   denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateDenominator:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_framerateDenominator</a> - description": "The
--   framerate denominator. For example, 1001. The framerate is the
--   numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 =
--   23.976 FPS.
newMpeg2Settings :: Natural -> Natural -> Mpeg2Settings

-- | Set the scan type of the output to PROGRESSIVE or INTERLACED (top
--   field first).
mpeg2Settings_scanType :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2ScanType)

-- | Sets the pixel aspect ratio for the encode.
mpeg2Settings_displayAspectRatio :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2DisplayRatio)

-- | Specifies whether to include the color space metadata. The metadata
--   describes the color space that applies to the video (the colorSpace
--   field). We recommend that you insert the metadata.
mpeg2Settings_colorMetadata :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2ColorMetadata)

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. Specifies whether the gopSize is
--   specified in frames or seconds. If you do not plan to change the
--   default gopSize, leave the default. If you specify SECONDS, MediaLive
--   will internally convert the gop size to a frame count.
mpeg2Settings_gopSizeUnits :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2GopSizeUnits)

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. If you do not know what GOP is, use the
--   default. FIXED: Set the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP to the
--   value in gopNumBFrames. DYNAMIC: Let MediaLive optimize the number of
--   B-frames in each sub-GOP, to improve visual quality.
mpeg2Settings_subgopLength :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2SubGopLength)

-- | Complete this field only when afdSignaling is set to FIXED. Enter the
--   AFD value (4 bits) to write on all frames of the video encode.
mpeg2Settings_fixedAfd :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe FixedAfd)

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. The GOP size (keyframe interval) in the
--   units specified in gopSizeUnits. If you do not know what GOP is, use
--   the default. If gopSizeUnits is frames, then the gopSize must be an
--   integer and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is
--   seconds, the gopSize must be greater than 0, but does not need to be
--   an integer.
mpeg2Settings_gopSize :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | Optionally specify a noise reduction filter, which can improve quality
--   of compressed content. If you do not choose a filter, no filter will
--   be applied. TEMPORAL: This filter is useful for both source content
--   that is noisy (when it has excessive digital artifacts) and source
--   content that is clean. When the content is noisy, the filter cleans up
--   the source content before the encoding phase, with these two effects:
--   First, it improves the output video quality because the content has
--   been cleaned up. Secondly, it decreases the bandwidth because
--   MediaLive does not waste bits on encoding noise. When the content is
--   reasonably clean, the filter tends to decrease the bitrate.
mpeg2Settings_filterSettings :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2FilterSettings)

-- | Relates to the GOP structure. The number of B-frames between reference
--   frames. If you do not know what a B-frame is, use the default.
mpeg2Settings_gopNumBFrames :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines how MediaLive inserts timecodes in the output video. For
--   detailed information about setting up the input and the output for a
--   timecode, see the section on \"MediaLive Features - Timecode
--   configuration\" in the MediaLive User Guide. DISABLED: do not include
--   timecodes. GOP_TIMECODE: Include timecode metadata in the GOP header.
mpeg2Settings_timecodeInsertion :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2TimecodeInsertionBehavior)

-- | MPEG2: default is open GOP.
mpeg2Settings_gopClosedCadence :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Choose the type of color space conversion to apply to the output. For
--   detailed information on setting up both the input and the output to
--   obtain the desired color space in the output, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Video - color space\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. PASSTHROUGH: Keep the color space of the input content - do not
--   convert it. AUTO:Convert all content that is SD to rec 601, and
--   convert all content that is HD to rec 709.
mpeg2Settings_colorSpace :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2ColorSpace)

-- | Choose Off to disable adaptive quantization. Or choose another value
--   to enable the quantizer and set its strength. The strengths are: Auto,
--   Off, Low, Medium, High. When you enable this field, MediaLive allows
--   intra-frame quantizers to vary, which might improve visual quality.
mpeg2Settings_adaptiveQuantization :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe Mpeg2AdaptiveQuantization)

-- | Indicates the AFD values that MediaLive will write into the video
--   encode. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if your
--   downstream system has not given you guidance, choose AUTO. AUTO:
--   MediaLive will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where
--   multiple AFD values are valid). FIXED: MediaLive will use the value
--   you specify in fixedAFD.
mpeg2Settings_afdSignaling :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings (Maybe AfdSignaling)

-- | The framerate numerator. For example, 24000. The framerate is the
--   numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 =
--   23.976 FPS.
mpeg2Settings_framerateNumerator :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings Natural

-- | description": "The framerate denominator. For example, 1001. The
--   framerate is the numerator divided by the denominator. For example,
--   24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.
mpeg2Settings_framerateDenominator :: Lens' Mpeg2Settings Natural

-- | Ms Smooth Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMsSmoothGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MsSmoothGroupSettings
MsSmoothGroupSettings' :: Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode -> Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior -> Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode -> Maybe Natural -> OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | When set to send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't
--   start until all streams start.
[$sel:streamManifestBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior

-- | Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.
[$sel:filecacheDuration:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Length of mp4 fragments to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must
--   be compatible with GOP size and framerate.
[$sel:fragmentLength:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | MS Smooth event ID to be sent to the IIS server. Should only be
--   specified if eventIdMode is set to useConfigured.
[$sel:eventId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a
--   trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
[$sel:certificateMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode

-- | The ID to include in each message in the sparse track. Ignored if
--   sparseTrackType is NONE.
[$sel:acquisitionPointId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Number of retry attempts.
[$sel:numRetries:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size
--   is always used.
[$sel:segmentationMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode

-- | If set to passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment
--   absolute time will be set to the current timecode. This option does
--   not write timecodes to the audio elementary stream.
[$sel:audioOnlyTimecodeControl:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl

-- | Specifies whether or not to send an event ID to the IIS server. If no
--   event ID is sent and the same Live Event is used without changing the
--   publishing point, clients might see cached video from the previous
--   run. Options: - "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId -
--   "useTimestamp" - generate and send an event ID based on the current
--   timestamp - "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.
[$sel:eventIdMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode

-- | Number of milliseconds to delay the output from the second pipeline.
[$sel:sendDelayMs:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the type of data to place in the sparse track: - SCTE35:
--   Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source content. With each message,
--   insert an IDR frame to start a new segment. -
--   SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source
--   content. With each message, insert an IDR frame but don't start a new
--   segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse track for any outputs in this
--   output group.
[$sel:sparseTrackType:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server
--   if the connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and
--   the cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection
--   is re-established.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.
[$sel:inputLossAction:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut

-- | Timestamp offset for the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is
--   set to useConfiguredOffset.
[$sel:timestampOffset:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to sendEos, send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the
--   event
[$sel:eventStopBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior

-- | Type of timestamp date offset to use. - useEventStartDate: Use the
--   date the event was started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an
--   explicitly configured date as the offset
[$sel:timestampOffsetMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode

-- | Number of seconds before initiating a restart due to output failure,
--   due to exhausting the numRetries on one segment, or exceeding
--   filecacheDuration.
[$sel:restartDelay:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Smooth Streaming publish point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts
--   as a "Push" encoder to IIS.
[$sel:destination:MsSmoothGroupSettings'] :: MsSmoothGroupSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>MsSmoothGroupSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId - "useTimestamp" -

--   start a new segment. - SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35
--   messages from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR
--   frame but don't start a new segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse
--   track for any outputs in this output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of
--   seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server if the
--   connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and the
--   cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection is
--   re-established.

--   started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an explicitly
--   configured date as the offset
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_restartDelay</a> - Number of seconds before

--   numRetries on one segment, or exceeding filecacheDuration.

--   point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts as a "Push" encoder to
--   IIS.
newMsSmoothGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | Ms Smooth Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMsSmoothOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MsSmoothOutputSettings
MsSmoothOutputSettings' :: Maybe MsSmoothH265PackagingType -> Maybe Text -> MsSmoothOutputSettings

-- | Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video
--   description. Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1
--   or HVC1.
[$sel:h265PackagingType:MsSmoothOutputSettings'] :: MsSmoothOutputSettings -> Maybe MsSmoothH265PackagingType

-- | String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Required
--   for multiple outputs of the same type.
[$sel:nameModifier:MsSmoothOutputSettings'] :: MsSmoothOutputSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MsSmoothOutputSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:h265PackagingType:MsSmoothOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothOutputSettings_h265PackagingType</a> - Only applicable when
--   this output is referencing an H.265 video description. Specifies
--   whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1 or HVC1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameModifier:MsSmoothOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothOutputSettings_nameModifier</a> - String concatenated to
--   the end of the destination filename. Required for multiple outputs of
--   the same type.
newMsSmoothOutputSettings :: MsSmoothOutputSettings

-- | Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video
--   description. Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1
--   or HVC1.
msSmoothOutputSettings_h265PackagingType :: Lens' MsSmoothOutputSettings (Maybe MsSmoothH265PackagingType)

--   for multiple outputs of the same type.
msSmoothOutputSettings_nameModifier :: Lens' MsSmoothOutputSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The multiplex object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplex</a> smart constructor.
data Multiplex
Multiplex' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MultiplexOutputDestination] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe MultiplexState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe MultiplexSettings -> Multiplex

-- | A list of availability zones for the multiplex.
[$sel:availabilityZones:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique arn of the multiplex.
[$sel:arn:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the multiplex.
[$sel:id:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the multiplex.
[$sel:name:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the multiplex output destinations.
[$sel:destinations:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe [MultiplexOutputDestination]

-- | The number of programs in the multiplex.
[$sel:programCount:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe Int

-- | The current state of the multiplex.
[$sel:state:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe MultiplexState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Configuration for a multiplex event.
[$sel:multiplexSettings:Multiplex'] :: Multiplex -> Maybe MultiplexSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>Multiplex</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:Multiplex'</a>,
--   <a>multiplex_availabilityZones</a> - A list of availability zones for
--   the multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_arn</a> - The unique arn of
--   the multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_id</a> - The unique id of the
--   multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Multiplex'</a>,
--   <a>multiplex_pipelinesRunningCount</a> - The number of currently
--   healthy pipelines.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_name</a> - The name of the
--   multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_destinations</a> - A
--   list of the multiplex output destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programCount:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_programCount</a> -
--   The number of programs in the multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_state</a> - The current
--   state of the multiplex.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Multiplex'</a>, <a>multiplex_tags</a> - A collection of
--   key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiplexSettings:Multiplex'</a>,
--   <a>multiplex_multiplexSettings</a> - Configuration for a multiplex
--   event.
newMultiplex :: Multiplex

-- | A list of availability zones for the multiplex.
multiplex_availabilityZones :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique arn of the multiplex.
multiplex_arn :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique id of the multiplex.
multiplex_id :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
multiplex_pipelinesRunningCount :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the multiplex.
multiplex_name :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the multiplex output destinations.
multiplex_destinations :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe [MultiplexOutputDestination])

-- | The number of programs in the multiplex.
multiplex_programCount :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe Int)

-- | The current state of the multiplex.
multiplex_state :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe MultiplexState)

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
multiplex_tags :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Configuration for a multiplex event.
multiplex_multiplexSettings :: Lens' Multiplex (Maybe MultiplexSettings)

-- | The multiplex program object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplexProgram</a> smart constructor.
data MultiplexProgram
MultiplexProgram' :: Maybe MultiplexProgramPacketIdentifiersMap -> Maybe MultiplexProgramSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MultiplexProgramPipelineDetail] -> MultiplexProgram

-- | The packet identifier map for this multiplex program.
[$sel:packetIdentifiersMap:MultiplexProgram'] :: MultiplexProgram -> Maybe MultiplexProgramPacketIdentifiersMap

-- | The settings for this multiplex program.
[$sel:multiplexProgramSettings:MultiplexProgram'] :: MultiplexProgram -> Maybe MultiplexProgramSettings

-- | The MediaLive channel associated with the program.
[$sel:channelId:MultiplexProgram'] :: MultiplexProgram -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the multiplex program.
[$sel:programName:MultiplexProgram'] :: MultiplexProgram -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the current sources for the specified
--   program in the specified multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex
--   pipeline connects to both pipelines in a given source channel (the
--   channel identified by the program). But only one of those channel
--   pipelines is ever active at one time.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:MultiplexProgram'] :: MultiplexProgram -> Maybe [MultiplexProgramPipelineDetail]

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiplexProgram</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   map for this multiplex program.

--   <a>$sel:multiplexProgramSettings:MultiplexProgram'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexProgram_multiplexProgramSettings</a> - The settings for
--   this multiplex program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:MultiplexProgram'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexProgram_channelId</a> - The MediaLive channel associated
--   with the program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programName:MultiplexProgram'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexProgram_programName</a> - The name of the multiplex
--   program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelineDetails:MultiplexProgram'</a>,

--   the current sources for the specified program in the specified
--   multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex pipeline connects to both
--   pipelines in a given source channel (the channel identified by the
--   program). But only one of those channel pipelines is ever active at
--   one time.
newMultiplexProgram :: MultiplexProgram

multiplexProgram_packetIdentifiersMap :: Lens' MultiplexProgram (Maybe MultiplexProgramPacketIdentifiersMap)

multiplexProgram_channelId :: Lens' MultiplexProgram (Maybe Text)

multiplexProgram_programName :: Lens' MultiplexProgram (Maybe Text)

--   program in the specified multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex

--   channel identified by the program). But only one of those channel
--   pipelines is ever active at one time.

-- | Multiplex Program Input Destination Settings for outputting a Channel
--   to a Multiplex
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings
MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings

-- | The ID of the Multiplex that the encoder is providing output to. You
--   do not need to specify the individual inputs to the Multiplex;
--   MediaLive will handle the connection of the two MediaLive pipelines to
--   the two Multiplex instances. The Multiplex must be in the same region
--   as the Channel.
[$sel:multiplexId:MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings'] :: MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The program name of the Multiplex program that the encoder is
--   providing output to.
[$sel:programName:MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings'] :: MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiplexId:MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings_multiplexId</a> - The ID
--   of the Multiplex that the encoder is providing output to. You do not
--   need to specify the individual inputs to the Multiplex; MediaLive will
--   handle the connection of the two MediaLive pipelines to the two
--   Multiplex instances. The Multiplex must be in the same region as the
--   Channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programName:MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings_programName</a> - The
--   program name of the Multiplex program that the encoder is providing
--   output to.
newMultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings :: MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings

-- | The ID of the Multiplex that the encoder is providing output to. You
--   do not need to specify the individual inputs to the Multiplex;
--   MediaLive will handle the connection of the two MediaLive pipelines to
--   the two Multiplex instances. The Multiplex must be in the same region
--   as the Channel.

--   providing output to.

-- | Statmux rate control settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings
MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings

-- | Minimum statmux bitrate.
[$sel:minimumBitrate:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'] :: MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Maximum statmux bitrate.
[$sel:maximumBitrate:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'] :: MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The purpose of the priority is to use a combination of the\nmultiplex
--   rate control algorithm and the QVBR capability of the\nencoder to
--   prioritize the video quality of some channels in a\nmultiplex over
--   others. Channels that have a higher priority will\nget higher video
--   quality at the expense of the video quality of\nother channels in the
--   multiplex with lower priority.
[$sel:priority:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'] :: MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumBitrate:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_minimumBitrate</a> - Minimum statmux
--   bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumBitrate:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_maximumBitrate</a> - Maximum statmux
--   bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_priority</a> - The purpose of the
--   priority is to use a combination of the\nmultiplex rate control
--   algorithm and the QVBR capability of the\nencoder to prioritize the
--   video quality of some channels in a\nmultiplex over others. Channels
--   that have a higher priority will\nget higher video quality at the
--   expense of the video quality of\nother channels in the multiplex with
--   lower priority.
newMultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings :: MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings

-- | Minimum statmux bitrate.
multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_minimumBitrate :: Lens' MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Maximum statmux bitrate.
multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_maximumBitrate :: Lens' MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The purpose of the priority is to use a combination of the\nmultiplex
--   rate control algorithm and the QVBR capability of the\nencoder to
--   prioritize the video quality of some channels in a\nmultiplex over
--   others. Channels that have a higher priority will\nget higher video
--   quality at the expense of the video quality of\nother channels in the
--   multiplex with lower priority.
multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_priority :: Lens' MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The video configuration for each program in a multiplex.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplexVideoSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MultiplexVideoSettings
MultiplexVideoSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings -> MultiplexVideoSettings

-- | The constant bitrate configuration for the video encode. When this
--   field is defined, StatmuxSettings must be undefined.
[$sel:constantBitrate:MultiplexVideoSettings'] :: MultiplexVideoSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Statmux rate control settings. When this field is defined,
--   ConstantBitrate must be undefined.
[$sel:statmuxSettings:MultiplexVideoSettings'] :: MultiplexVideoSettings -> Maybe MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiplexVideoSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:constantBitrate:MultiplexVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexVideoSettings_constantBitrate</a> - The constant bitrate
--   configuration for the video encode. When this field is defined,
--   StatmuxSettings must be undefined.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statmuxSettings:MultiplexVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexVideoSettings_statmuxSettings</a> - Statmux rate control
--   settings. When this field is defined, ConstantBitrate must be
--   undefined.
newMultiplexVideoSettings :: MultiplexVideoSettings

-- | The constant bitrate configuration for the video encode. When this
--   field is defined, StatmuxSettings must be undefined.
multiplexVideoSettings_constantBitrate :: Lens' MultiplexVideoSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Statmux rate control settings. When this field is defined,
--   ConstantBitrate must be undefined.
multiplexVideoSettings_statmuxSettings :: Lens' MultiplexVideoSettings (Maybe MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings)

-- | Network source to transcode. Must be accessible to the Elemental Live
--   node that is running the live event through a network connection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkInputSettings
NetworkInputSettings' :: Maybe HlsInputSettings -> Maybe NetworkInputServerValidation -> NetworkInputSettings

-- | Specifies HLS input settings when the uri is for a HLS manifest.
[$sel:hlsInputSettings:NetworkInputSettings'] :: NetworkInputSettings -> Maybe HlsInputSettings

-- | Check HTTPS server certificates. When set to checkCryptographyOnly,
--   cryptography in the certificate will be checked, but not the server's
--   name. Certain subdomains (notably S3 buckets that use dots in the
--   bucket name) do not strictly match the corresponding certificate's
--   wildcard pattern and would otherwise cause the event to error. This
--   setting is ignored for protocols that do not use https.
[$sel:serverValidation:NetworkInputSettings'] :: NetworkInputSettings -> Maybe NetworkInputServerValidation

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkInputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsInputSettings:NetworkInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>networkInputSettings_hlsInputSettings</a> - Specifies HLS input
--   settings when the uri is for a HLS manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverValidation:NetworkInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>networkInputSettings_serverValidation</a> - Check HTTPS server
--   certificates. When set to checkCryptographyOnly, cryptography in the
--   certificate will be checked, but not the server's name. Certain
--   subdomains (notably S3 buckets that use dots in the bucket name) do
--   not strictly match the corresponding certificate's wildcard pattern
--   and would otherwise cause the event to error. This setting is ignored
--   for protocols that do not use https.
newNetworkInputSettings :: NetworkInputSettings

-- | Specifies HLS input settings when the uri is for a HLS manifest.
networkInputSettings_hlsInputSettings :: Lens' NetworkInputSettings (Maybe HlsInputSettings)

-- | Check HTTPS server certificates. When set to checkCryptographyOnly,
--   cryptography in the certificate will be checked, but not the server's
--   name. Certain subdomains (notably S3 buckets that use dots in the
--   bucket name) do not strictly match the corresponding certificate's
--   wildcard pattern and would otherwise cause the event to error. This
--   setting is ignored for protocols that do not use https.
networkInputSettings_serverValidation :: Lens' NetworkInputSettings (Maybe NetworkInputServerValidation)

-- | Reserved resources available for purchase
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOffering</a> smart constructor.
data Offering
Offering' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe OfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Offering

-- | Lease duration, e.g. '12'
[$sel:duration:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Int

-- | Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
[$sel:durationUnits:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits

-- | Unique offering ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:offering:87654321'
[$sel:arn:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
[$sel:offeringId:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Text

-- | Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
[$sel:currencyCode:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Text

-- | Resource configuration details
[$sel:resourceSpecification:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification

-- | Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and
--   standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
[$sel:offeringDescription:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Text

-- | One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
[$sel:fixedPrice:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Double

-- | Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
[$sel:usagePrice:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Double

-- | Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
[$sel:offeringType:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe OfferingType

-- | AWS region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
[$sel:region:Offering'] :: Offering -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Offering</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_duration</a> - Lease
--   duration, e.g. '12'
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationUnits:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_durationUnits</a> -
--   Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_arn</a> - Unique offering ARN,
--   e.g. 'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:offering:87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringId:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_offeringId</a> - Unique
--   offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_currencyCode</a> -
--   Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecification:Offering'</a>,
--   <a>offering_resourceSpecification</a> - Resource configuration details
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringDescription:Offering'</a>,
--   <a>offering_offeringDescription</a> - Offering description, e.g. 'HD
--   AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_fixedPrice</a> -
--   One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_usagePrice</a> -
--   Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_offeringType</a> -
--   Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_region</a> - AWS region,
--   e.g. 'us-west-2'
newOffering :: Offering

-- | Lease duration, e.g. '12'
offering_duration :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Int)

-- | Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
offering_durationUnits :: Lens' Offering (Maybe OfferingDurationUnits)

-- | Unique offering ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:offering:87654321'
offering_arn :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
offering_offeringId :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Text)

-- | Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
offering_currencyCode :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Text)

-- | Resource configuration details
offering_resourceSpecification :: Lens' Offering (Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification)

-- | Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and
--   standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
offering_offeringDescription :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Text)

-- | One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
offering_fixedPrice :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Double)

-- | Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
offering_usagePrice :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Double)

-- | Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
offering_offeringType :: Lens' Offering (Maybe OfferingType)

-- | AWS region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
offering_region :: Lens' Offering (Maybe Text)

-- | Output settings. There can be multiple outputs within a group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutput</a> smart constructor.
data Output
Output' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> OutputSettings -> Output

-- | The names of the AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this
--   output.
[$sel:audioDescriptionNames:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the VideoDescription used as the source for this output.
[$sel:videoDescriptionName:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The name used to identify an output.
[$sel:outputName:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The names of the CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this
--   output.
[$sel:captionDescriptionNames:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Output type-specific settings.
[$sel:outputSettings:Output'] :: Output -> OutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>Output</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_audioDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoDescriptionName:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_videoDescriptionName</a> - The name of the VideoDescription
--   used as the source for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputName:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputName</a> - The name
--   used to identify an output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_captionDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSettings:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputSettings</a> -
--   Output type-specific settings.
newOutput :: OutputSettings -> Output

-- | The names of the AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this
--   output.
output_audioDescriptionNames :: Lens' Output (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the VideoDescription used as the source for this output.
output_videoDescriptionName :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The name used to identify an output.
output_outputName :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The names of the CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this
--   output.
output_captionDescriptionNames :: Lens' Output (Maybe [Text])

-- | Output type-specific settings.
output_outputSettings :: Lens' Output OutputSettings

-- | Placeholder documentation for OutputDestination
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputDestination</a> smart constructor.
data OutputDestination
OutputDestination' :: Maybe [MediaPackageOutputDestinationSettings] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings -> Maybe [OutputDestinationSettings] -> OutputDestination

-- | Destination settings for a MediaPackage output; one destination for
--   both encoders.
[$sel:mediaPackageSettings:OutputDestination'] :: OutputDestination -> Maybe [MediaPackageOutputDestinationSettings]

-- | User-specified id. This is used in an output group or an output.
[$sel:id:OutputDestination'] :: OutputDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Destination settings for a Multiplex output; one destination for both
--   encoders.
[$sel:multiplexSettings:OutputDestination'] :: OutputDestination -> Maybe MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings

-- | Destination settings for a standard output; one destination for each
--   redundant encoder.
[$sel:settings:OutputDestination'] :: OutputDestination -> Maybe [OutputDestinationSettings]

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--

--   User-specified id. This is used in an output group or an output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiplexSettings:OutputDestination'</a>,
--   <a>outputDestination_multiplexSettings</a> - Destination settings for
--   a Multiplex output; one destination for both encoders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:OutputDestination'</a>,
--   <a>outputDestination_settings</a> - Destination settings for a
--   standard output; one destination for each redundant encoder.
newOutputDestination :: OutputDestination

-- | Destination settings for a MediaPackage output; one destination for
--   both encoders.
outputDestination_mediaPackageSettings :: Lens' OutputDestination (Maybe [MediaPackageOutputDestinationSettings])

outputDestination_id :: Lens' OutputDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | Destination settings for a Multiplex output; one destination for both
--   encoders.
outputDestination_multiplexSettings :: Lens' OutputDestination (Maybe MultiplexProgramChannelDestinationSettings)

-- | Destination settings for a standard output; one destination for each
--   redundant encoder.
outputDestination_settings :: Lens' OutputDestination (Maybe [OutputDestinationSettings])

-- | Output groups for this Live Event. Output groups contain information
--   about where streams should be distributed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputGroup</a> smart constructor.
data OutputGroup
OutputGroup' :: Maybe Text -> [Output] -> OutputGroupSettings -> OutputGroup

-- | Custom output group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters,
--   numbers, and the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters
--   allowed.
[$sel:name:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> Maybe Text
[$sel:outputs:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> [Output]

-- | Settings associated with the output group.
[$sel:outputGroupSettings:OutputGroup'] :: OutputGroup -> OutputGroupSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputGroup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OutputGroup'</a>, <a>outputGroup_name</a> - Custom output
--   group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters, numbers, and
--   the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputs:OutputGroup'</a>, <a>outputGroup_outputs</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputGroupSettings:OutputGroup'</a>,
--   <a>outputGroup_outputGroupSettings</a> - Settings associated with the
--   output group.
newOutputGroup :: OutputGroupSettings -> OutputGroup

-- | Custom output group name optionally defined by the user. Only letters,
--   numbers, and the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters
--   allowed.
outputGroup_name :: Lens' OutputGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
outputGroup_outputs :: Lens' OutputGroup [Output]

-- | Settings associated with the output group.
outputGroup_outputGroupSettings :: Lens' OutputGroup OutputGroupSettings

-- | Output Group Settings
--

-- | Runtime details of a pipeline when a channel is running.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPipelineDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PipelineDetail
PipelineDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PipelineDetail

-- | Pipeline ID
[$sel:pipelineId:PipelineDetail'] :: PipelineDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the active input attachment currently being ingested by
--   this pipeline.
[$sel:activeInputAttachmentName:PipelineDetail'] :: PipelineDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the motion graphics activate action that occurred most
--   recently and that resulted in the current graphics URI for this
--   pipeline.
[$sel:activeMotionGraphicsActionName:PipelineDetail'] :: PipelineDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The current URI being used for HTML5 motion graphics for this
--   pipeline.
[$sel:activeMotionGraphicsUri:PipelineDetail'] :: PipelineDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the input switch schedule action that occurred most
--   recently and that resulted in the switch to the current input
--   attachment for this pipeline.
[$sel:activeInputSwitchActionName:PipelineDetail'] :: PipelineDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PipelineDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelineId:PipelineDetail'</a>,
--   <a>pipelineDetail_pipelineId</a> - Pipeline ID
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeInputAttachmentName:PipelineDetail'</a>,
--   <a>pipelineDetail_activeInputAttachmentName</a> - The name of the
--   active input attachment currently being ingested by this pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeMotionGraphicsActionName:PipelineDetail'</a>,
--   <a>pipelineDetail_activeMotionGraphicsActionName</a> - The name of the
--   motion graphics activate action that occurred most recently and that
--   resulted in the current graphics URI for this pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeMotionGraphicsUri:PipelineDetail'</a>,
--   <a>pipelineDetail_activeMotionGraphicsUri</a> - The current URI being
--   used for HTML5 motion graphics for this pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeInputSwitchActionName:PipelineDetail'</a>,
--   <a>pipelineDetail_activeInputSwitchActionName</a> - The name of the
--   input switch schedule action that occurred most recently and that
--   resulted in the switch to the current input attachment for this
--   pipeline.

--   this pipeline.

-- | Remix Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemixSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RemixSettings
RemixSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> [AudioChannelMapping] -> RemixSettings

-- | Number of input channels to be used.
[$sel:channelsIn:RemixSettings'] :: RemixSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of output channels to be produced. Valid values: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8
[$sel:channelsOut:RemixSettings'] :: RemixSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Mapping of input channels to output channels, with appropriate gain
--   adjustments.
[$sel:channelMappings:RemixSettings'] :: RemixSettings -> [AudioChannelMapping]

-- | Create a value of <a>RemixSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelsIn:RemixSettings'</a>, <a>remixSettings_channelsIn</a>
--   - Number of input channels to be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelsOut:RemixSettings'</a>,
--   <a>remixSettings_channelsOut</a> - Number of output channels to be
--   produced. Valid values: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelMappings:RemixSettings'</a>,
--   <a>remixSettings_channelMappings</a> - Mapping of input channels to
--   output channels, with appropriate gain adjustments.
newRemixSettings :: RemixSettings

-- | Number of input channels to be used.
remixSettings_channelsIn :: Lens' RemixSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of output channels to be produced. Valid values: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8
remixSettings_channelsOut :: Lens' RemixSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Mapping of input channels to output channels, with appropriate gain
--   adjustments.
remixSettings_channelMappings :: Lens' RemixSettings [AudioChannelMapping]

-- | Reserved resources available to use
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservation</a> smart constructor.
data Reservation
Reservation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe OfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Reservation

-- | Reservation UTC end date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g.
--   '2019-03-01T00:00:00'
[$sel:end:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Lease duration, e.g. '12'
[$sel:duration:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Int

-- | Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
[$sel:durationUnits:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits

-- | Unique reservation ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:reservation:1234567'
[$sel:arn:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
[$sel:offeringId:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
[$sel:currencyCode:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | User specified reservation name
[$sel:name:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Resource configuration details
[$sel:resourceSpecification:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification

-- | Current state of reservation, e.g. 'ACTIVE'
[$sel:state:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe ReservationState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs
[$sel:tags:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and
--   standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
[$sel:offeringDescription:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
[$sel:fixedPrice:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Double

-- | Number of reserved resources
[$sel:count:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Int

-- | Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
[$sel:usagePrice:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Double

-- | Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
[$sel:offeringType:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe OfferingType

-- | AWS region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
[$sel:region:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Reservation UTC start date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g.
--   '2018-03-01T00:00:00'
[$sel:start:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique reservation ID, e.g. '1234567'
[$sel:reservationId:Reservation'] :: Reservation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Reservation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_end</a> - Reservation UTC
--   end date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2019-03-01T00:00:00'
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_duration</a> - Lease
--   duration, e.g. '12'
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationUnits:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_durationUnits</a> - Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_arn</a> - Unique
--   reservation ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:reservation:1234567'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringId:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_offeringId</a> -
--   Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_currencyCode</a>
--   - Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_name</a> - User
--   specified reservation name
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecification:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_resourceSpecification</a> - Resource configuration
--   details
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_state</a> - Current
--   state of reservation, e.g. 'ACTIVE'
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_tags</a> - A collection
--   of key-value pairs
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringDescription:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_offeringDescription</a> - Offering description, e.g.
--   'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West
--   (Oregon)'
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_fixedPrice</a> -
--   One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_count</a> - Number of
--   reserved resources
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_usagePrice</a> -
--   Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_offeringType</a>
--   - Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_region</a> - AWS
--   region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_start</a> - Reservation
--   UTC start date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2018-03-01T00:00:00'
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservationId:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_reservationId</a> - Unique reservation ID, e.g.
--   '1234567'
newReservation :: Reservation

-- | Reservation UTC end date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g.
--   '2019-03-01T00:00:00'
reservation_end :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Lease duration, e.g. '12'
reservation_duration :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Int)

-- | Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
reservation_durationUnits :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe OfferingDurationUnits)

-- | Unique reservation ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:reservation:1234567'
reservation_arn :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
reservation_offeringId :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
reservation_currencyCode :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | User specified reservation name
reservation_name :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Resource configuration details
reservation_resourceSpecification :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification)

-- | Current state of reservation, e.g. 'ACTIVE'
reservation_state :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe ReservationState)

-- | A collection of key-value pairs
reservation_tags :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and
--   standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
reservation_offeringDescription :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
reservation_fixedPrice :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Double)

-- | Number of reserved resources
reservation_count :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Int)

-- | Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
reservation_usagePrice :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Double)

-- | Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
reservation_offeringType :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe OfferingType)

-- | AWS region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
reservation_region :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Reservation UTC start date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g.
--   '2018-03-01T00:00:00'
reservation_start :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique reservation ID, e.g. '1234567'
reservation_reservationId :: Lens' Reservation (Maybe Text)

-- | Resource configuration (codec, resolution, bitrate, ...)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationResourceSpecification</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReservationResourceSpecification
ReservationResourceSpecification' :: Maybe ReservationMaximumFramerate -> Maybe ReservationVideoQuality -> Maybe ReservationCodec -> Maybe ReservationMaximumBitrate -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe ReservationSpecialFeature -> Maybe ReservationResourceType -> Maybe ReservationResolution -> ReservationResourceSpecification

-- | Maximum framerate, e.g. 'MAX_30_FPS' (Outputs only)
[$sel:maximumFramerate:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationMaximumFramerate

-- | Video quality, e.g. 'STANDARD' (Outputs only)
[$sel:videoQuality:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationVideoQuality

-- | Codec, e.g. 'AVC'
[$sel:codec:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationCodec

-- | Maximum bitrate, e.g. 'MAX_20_MBPS'
[$sel:maximumBitrate:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationMaximumBitrate

-- | Channel class, e.g. 'STANDARD'
[$sel:channelClass:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | Special feature, e.g. 'AUDIO_NORMALIZATION' (Channels only)
[$sel:specialFeature:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationSpecialFeature

-- | Resource type, 'INPUT', 'OUTPUT', 'MULTIPLEX', or 'CHANNEL'
[$sel:resourceType:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationResourceType

-- | Resolution, e.g. 'HD'
[$sel:resolution:ReservationResourceSpecification'] :: ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationResolution

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservationResourceSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumFramerate:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_maximumFramerate</a> - Maximum
--   framerate, e.g. 'MAX_30_FPS' (Outputs only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoQuality:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_videoQuality</a> - Video quality,
--   e.g. 'STANDARD' (Outputs only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:codec:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_codec</a> - Codec, e.g. 'AVC'
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumBitrate:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_maximumBitrate</a> - Maximum
--   bitrate, e.g. 'MAX_20_MBPS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_channelClass</a> - Channel class,
--   e.g. 'STANDARD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialFeature:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_specialFeature</a> - Special
--   feature, e.g. 'AUDIO_NORMALIZATION' (Channels only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_resourceType</a> - Resource type,
--   'INPUT', 'OUTPUT', 'MULTIPLEX', or 'CHANNEL'
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolution:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_resolution</a> - Resolution, e.g.
--   'HD'
newReservationResourceSpecification :: ReservationResourceSpecification

-- | Maximum framerate, e.g. 'MAX_30_FPS' (Outputs only)
reservationResourceSpecification_maximumFramerate :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationMaximumFramerate)

-- | Video quality, e.g. 'STANDARD' (Outputs only)
reservationResourceSpecification_videoQuality :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationVideoQuality)

-- | Codec, e.g. 'AVC'
reservationResourceSpecification_codec :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationCodec)

-- | Maximum bitrate, e.g. 'MAX_20_MBPS'
reservationResourceSpecification_maximumBitrate :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationMaximumBitrate)

-- | Channel class, e.g. 'STANDARD'
reservationResourceSpecification_channelClass :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ChannelClass)

-- | Special feature, e.g. 'AUDIO_NORMALIZATION' (Channels only)
reservationResourceSpecification_specialFeature :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationSpecialFeature)

-- | Resource type, 'INPUT', 'OUTPUT', 'MULTIPLEX', or 'CHANNEL'
reservationResourceSpecification_resourceType :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationResourceType)

-- | Resolution, e.g. 'HD'
reservationResourceSpecification_resolution :: Lens' ReservationResourceSpecification (Maybe ReservationResolution)

-- | Rtmp Caption Info Destination Settings
