data RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings
RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings' :: RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newRtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings :: RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings

-- | Rtmp Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRtmpGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RtmpGroupSettings
RtmpGroupSettings' :: Maybe [RtmpAdMarkers] -> Maybe RtmpCaptionData -> Maybe RtmpCacheFullBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe AuthenticationScheme -> Maybe InputLossActionForRtmpOut -> Maybe Natural -> RtmpGroupSettings

-- | Choose the ad marker type for this output group. MediaLive will create
--   a message based on the content of each SCTE-35 message, format it for
--   that marker type, and insert it in the datastream.
[$sel:adMarkers:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe [RtmpAdMarkers]

-- | Controls the types of data that passes to onCaptionInfo outputs. If
--   set to 'all' then 608 and 708 carried DTVCC data will be passed. If
--   set to 'field1AndField2608' then DTVCC data will be stripped out, but
--   608 data from both fields will be passed. If set to 'field1608' then
--   only the data carried in 608 from field 1 video will be passed.
[$sel:captionData:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe RtmpCaptionData

-- | Controls behavior when content cache fills up. If remote origin server
--   stalls the RTMP connection and does not accept content fast enough the
--   'Media Cache' will fill up. When the cache reaches the duration
--   specified by cacheLength the cache will stop accepting new content. If
--   set to disconnectImmediately, the RTMP output will force a disconnect.
--   Clear the media cache, and reconnect after restartDelay seconds. If
--   set to waitForServer, the RTMP output will wait up to 5 minutes to
--   allow the origin server to begin accepting data again.
[$sel:cacheFullBehavior:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe RtmpCacheFullBehavior

-- | Cache length, in seconds, is used to calculate buffer size.
[$sel:cacheLength:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Authentication scheme to use when connecting with CDN
[$sel:authenticationScheme:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe AuthenticationScheme

-- | Controls the behavior of this RTMP group if input becomes unavailable.
--   - emitOutput: Emit a slate until input returns. - pauseOutput: Stop
--   transmitting data until input returns. This does not close the
--   underlying RTMP connection.
[$sel:inputLossAction:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForRtmpOut

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
[$sel:restartDelay:RtmpGroupSettings'] :: RtmpGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RtmpGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:adMarkers:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_adMarkers</a> - Choose the ad marker type for
--   this output group. MediaLive will create a message based on the
--   content of each SCTE-35 message, format it for that marker type, and
--   insert it in the datastream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionData:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_captionData</a> - Controls the types of data that
--   passes to onCaptionInfo outputs. If set to 'all' then 608 and 708
--   carried DTVCC data will be passed. If set to 'field1AndField2608' then
--   DTVCC data will be stripped out, but 608 data from both fields will be
--   passed. If set to 'field1608' then only the data carried in 608 from
--   field 1 video will be passed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheFullBehavior:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_cacheFullBehavior</a> - Controls behavior when
--   content cache fills up. If remote origin server stalls the RTMP
--   connection and does not accept content fast enough the 'Media Cache'
--   will fill up. When the cache reaches the duration specified by
--   cacheLength the cache will stop accepting new content. If set to
--   disconnectImmediately, the RTMP output will force a disconnect. Clear
--   the media cache, and reconnect after restartDelay seconds. If set to
--   waitForServer, the RTMP output will wait up to 5 minutes to allow the
--   origin server to begin accepting data again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheLength:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_cacheLength</a> - Cache length, in seconds, is
--   used to calculate buffer size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationScheme:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_authenticationScheme</a> - Authentication scheme
--   to use when connecting with CDN
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Controls the behavior of
--   this RTMP group if input becomes unavailable. - emitOutput: Emit a
--   slate until input returns. - pauseOutput: Stop transmitting data until
--   input returns. This does not close the underlying RTMP connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
newRtmpGroupSettings :: RtmpGroupSettings

-- | Choose the ad marker type for this output group. MediaLive will create
--   a message based on the content of each SCTE-35 message, format it for
--   that marker type, and insert it in the datastream.
rtmpGroupSettings_adMarkers :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe [RtmpAdMarkers])

-- | Controls the types of data that passes to onCaptionInfo outputs. If
--   set to 'all' then 608 and 708 carried DTVCC data will be passed. If
--   set to 'field1AndField2608' then DTVCC data will be stripped out, but
--   608 data from both fields will be passed. If set to 'field1608' then
--   only the data carried in 608 from field 1 video will be passed.
rtmpGroupSettings_captionData :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe RtmpCaptionData)

-- | Controls behavior when content cache fills up. If remote origin server
--   stalls the RTMP connection and does not accept content fast enough the
--   'Media Cache' will fill up. When the cache reaches the duration
--   specified by cacheLength the cache will stop accepting new content. If
--   set to disconnectImmediately, the RTMP output will force a disconnect.
--   Clear the media cache, and reconnect after restartDelay seconds. If
--   set to waitForServer, the RTMP output will wait up to 5 minutes to
--   allow the origin server to begin accepting data again.
rtmpGroupSettings_cacheFullBehavior :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe RtmpCacheFullBehavior)

-- | Cache length, in seconds, is used to calculate buffer size.
rtmpGroupSettings_cacheLength :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Authentication scheme to use when connecting with CDN
rtmpGroupSettings_authenticationScheme :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe AuthenticationScheme)

-- | Controls the behavior of this RTMP group if input becomes unavailable.
--   - emitOutput: Emit a slate until input returns. - pauseOutput: Stop
--   transmitting data until input returns. This does not close the
--   underlying RTMP connection.
rtmpGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForRtmpOut)

-- | If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart
--   is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.
rtmpGroupSettings_restartDelay :: Lens' RtmpGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Rtmp Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRtmpOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RtmpOutputSettings
RtmpOutputSettings' :: Maybe RtmpOutputCertificateMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> OutputLocationRef -> RtmpOutputSettings

-- | If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the tls certificate chain to a
--   trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause rtmps outputs with
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
[$sel:certificateMode:RtmpOutputSettings'] :: RtmpOutputSettings -> Maybe RtmpOutputCertificateMode

-- | Number of retry attempts.
[$sel:numRetries:RtmpOutputSettings'] :: RtmpOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying a connection to the Flash
--   Media server if the connection is lost.
[$sel:connectionRetryInterval:RtmpOutputSettings'] :: RtmpOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The RTMP endpoint excluding the stream name (eg. rtmp://host/appname).
--   For connection to Akamai, a username and password must be supplied.
--   URI fields accept format identifiers.
[$sel:destination:RtmpOutputSettings'] :: RtmpOutputSettings -> OutputLocationRef

-- | Create a value of <a>RtmpOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_certificateMode</a> - If set to
--   verifyAuthenticity, verify the tls certificate chain to a trusted
--   Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause rtmps outputs with
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying a connection to the Flash Media server if the
--   connection is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_destination</a> - The RTMP endpoint excluding
--   the stream name (eg. rtmp://host/appname). For connection to Akamai, a
--   username and password must be supplied. URI fields accept format
--   identifiers.
newRtmpOutputSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> RtmpOutputSettings

-- | If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the tls certificate chain to a
--   trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause rtmps outputs with
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
rtmpOutputSettings_certificateMode :: Lens' RtmpOutputSettings (Maybe RtmpOutputCertificateMode)

-- | Number of retry attempts.
rtmpOutputSettings_numRetries :: Lens' RtmpOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Number of seconds to wait before retrying a connection to the Flash
--   Media server if the connection is lost.
rtmpOutputSettings_connectionRetryInterval :: Lens' RtmpOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The RTMP endpoint excluding the stream name (eg. rtmp://host/appname).
--   For connection to Akamai, a username and password must be supplied.
--   URI fields accept format identifiers.
rtmpOutputSettings_destination :: Lens' RtmpOutputSettings OutputLocationRef

-- | Contains information on a single schedule action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleAction
ScheduleAction' :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

-- | The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name
--   provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the
--   schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The
--   schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start
--   time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name
--   can be reused.
[$sel:actionName:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> Text

-- | The time for the action to start in the channel.
[$sel:scheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Settings for this schedule action.
[$sel:scheduleActionSettings:ScheduleAction'] :: ScheduleAction -> ScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_actionName</a> - The name of the action, must be
--   unique within the schedule. This name provides the main reference to
--   an action once it is added to the schedule. A name is unique if it is
--   no longer in the schedule. The schedule is automatically cleaned up to
--   remove actions with a start time of more than 1 hour ago
--   (approximately) so at that point a name can be reused.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionStartSettings</a> - The time for the
--   action to start in the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionSettings</a> - Settings for this
--   schedule action.
newScheduleAction :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

-- | The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name
--   provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the
--   schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The
--   schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start
--   time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name
--   can be reused.
scheduleAction_actionName :: Lens' ScheduleAction Text

-- | The time for the action to start in the channel.
scheduleAction_scheduleActionStartSettings :: Lens' ScheduleAction ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Settings for this schedule action.
scheduleAction_scheduleActionSettings :: Lens' ScheduleAction ScheduleActionSettings

-- | Holds the settings for a single schedule action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleActionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleActionSettings
ScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Scte35TimeSignalScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsDeactivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe PauseStateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35ReturnToNetworkScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings

[$sel:motionGraphicsImageActivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe MotionGraphicsActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to deactivate a static image overlay
[$sel:staticImageDeactivateSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to prepare an input for a future immediate input switch
[$sel:inputPrepareSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | Action to insert HLS ID3 segment tagging
[$sel:hlsId3SegmentTaggingSettings:ScheduleActionSettings'] :: ScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleActionSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Settings to specify when an action should occur. Only one of the
--   options must be selected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleActionStartSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleActionStartSettings
ScheduleActionStartSettings' :: Maybe FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> Maybe ImmediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> Maybe FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Option for specifying an action as relative to another action.
[$sel:followModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: ScheduleActionStartSettings -> Maybe FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Option for specifying an action that should be applied immediately.
[$sel:immediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: ScheduleActionStartSettings -> Maybe ImmediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Option for specifying the start time for an action.
[$sel:fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'] :: ScheduleActionStartSettings -> Maybe FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleActionStartSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:followModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActionStartSettings_followModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a>
--   - Option for specifying an action as relative to another action.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:immediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActionStartSettings_immediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a>
--   - Option for specifying an action that should be applied immediately.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActionStartSettings_fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a>
--   - Option for specifying the start time for an action.
newScheduleActionStartSettings :: ScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Option for specifying an action as relative to another action.
scheduleActionStartSettings_followModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Lens' ScheduleActionStartSettings (Maybe FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings)

-- | Option for specifying an action that should be applied immediately.
scheduleActionStartSettings_immediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Lens' ScheduleActionStartSettings (Maybe ImmediateModeScheduleActionStartSettings)

-- | Option for specifying the start time for an action.
scheduleActionStartSettings_fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Lens' ScheduleActionStartSettings (Maybe FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings)

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte20PlusEmbeddedDestinationSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data Scte20PlusEmbeddedDestinationSettings

--   all optional fields omitted.

newScte20PlusEmbeddedDestinationSettings :: Scte20PlusEmbeddedDestinationSettings

-- | Scte20 Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte20SourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Scte20SourceSettings
Scte20SourceSettings' :: Maybe Scte20Convert608To708 -> Maybe Natural -> Scte20SourceSettings

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
[$sel:convert608To708:Scte20SourceSettings'] :: Scte20SourceSettings -> Maybe Scte20Convert608To708

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
[$sel:source608ChannelNumber:Scte20SourceSettings'] :: Scte20SourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte20SourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:convert608To708:Scte20SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte20SourceSettings_convert608To708</a> - If upconvert, 608 data
--   is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the
--   708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the
--   source content will be discarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source608ChannelNumber:Scte20SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte20SourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber</a> - Specifies the
--   608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract
--   captions. Unused for passthrough.
newScte20SourceSettings :: Scte20SourceSettings

-- | If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608
--   compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated
--   into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.
scte20SourceSettings_convert608To708 :: Lens' Scte20SourceSettings (Maybe Scte20Convert608To708)

-- | Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which
--   to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.
scte20SourceSettings_source608ChannelNumber :: Lens' Scte20SourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Scte27 Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte27SourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Scte27SourceSettings
Scte27SourceSettings' :: Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage -> Maybe Natural -> Scte27SourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
[$sel:ocrLanguage:Scte27SourceSettings'] :: Scte27SourceSettings -> Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage

-- | The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
[$sel:pid:Scte27SourceSettings'] :: Scte27SourceSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte27SourceSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ocrLanguage:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte27SourceSettings_ocrLanguage</a> - If you will configure a
--   WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use
--   this field to provide the language to consider when translating the
--   image-based source to text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pid:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>, <a>scte27SourceSettings_pid</a>
--   - The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
newScte27SourceSettings :: Scte27SourceSettings

-- | If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references
--   this caption selector, use this field to provide the language to
--   consider when translating the image-based source to text.
scte27SourceSettings_ocrLanguage :: Lens' Scte27SourceSettings (Maybe Scte27OcrLanguage)

-- | The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
scte27SourceSettings_pid :: Lens' Scte27SourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 delivery_not_restricted_flag parameter. To
--   declare delivery restrictions, include this element and its four
--   "restriction" flags. To declare that there are no restrictions, omit
--   this element.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35DeliveryRestrictions</a> smart constructor.

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_descriptor.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
Scte35SegmentationDescriptor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:subSegmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing
--   the hexadecimal representation of the characters that make up the
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
[$sel:segmentationUpid:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Text

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:segmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid
--   for the specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:subSegmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter
--   one of the types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a
--   decimal. For example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in
--   decimal. In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in
--   the SCTE-35 specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in
--   decimal (for example, "12").
[$sel:segmentationUpidType:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for
--   the specified segmentation_type_id.
[$sel:segmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the
--   segmentation_type_id values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On
--   the console, enter the ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI,
--   API, or an SDK, enter the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal
--   (for example, "52").
[$sel:segmentationTypeId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Holds the four SCTE-35 delivery restriction parameters.
[$sel:deliveryRestrictions:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration
--   for the time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks,
--   multiple the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If
--   you do not enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you
--   insert a cancellation message.
[$sel:segmentationDuration:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Maybe Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
[$sel:segmentationEventId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Natural

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
[$sel:segmentationCancelIndicator:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'] :: Scte35SegmentationDescriptor -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpid:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpid</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing the hexadecimal
--   representation of the characters that make up the SCTE-35
--   segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
--

--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentsExpected</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpidType:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpidType</a> - Corresponds

--   enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you insert a
--   cancellation message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationEventId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationEventId</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationCancelIndicator:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationCancelIndicator</a> -
--   Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.

-- | Scte35 Splice Insert
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsert</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsert
Scte35SpliceInsert' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior -> Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | When specified, this offset (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad
--   Avail PTS time. This only applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and
--   does not apply to OOB messages.
[$sel:adAvailOffset:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Int

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
[$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
[$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'] :: Scte35SpliceInsert -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsert</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:adAvailOffset:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_adAvailOffset</a> - When specified, this offset
--   (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad Avail PTS time. This only
--   applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and does not apply to OOB
--   messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_noRegionalBlackoutFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
--   
--   <a>$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_webDeliveryAllowedFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
newScte35SpliceInsert :: Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | When specified, this offset (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad
--   Avail PTS time. This only applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and
--   does not apply to OOB messages.
scte35SpliceInsert_adAvailOffset :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
scte35SpliceInsert_noRegionalBlackoutFlag :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior)

-- | When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag
--   set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
scte35SpliceInsert_webDeliveryAllowedFlag :: Lens' Scte35SpliceInsert (Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior)

-- | Settings for a SCTE-35 splice_insert message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings
Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Optional, the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To
--   convert seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter
--   a duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can
--   read the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a
--   duration, the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.
[$sel:duration:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'] :: Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in
--   SCTE-35.
[$sel:spliceEventId:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'] :: Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert
--   seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter a
--   duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can read
--   the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a duration,
--   the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spliceEventId:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings_spliceEventId</a> - The
--   splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in SCTE-35.
newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings :: Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings to identify the start of the clip.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTimecode</a> smart constructor.
data StartTimecode
StartTimecode' :: Maybe Text -> StartTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to start the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter
--   the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
[$sel:timecode:StartTimecode'] :: StartTimecode -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartTimecode</a> with all optional fields

--   if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter
--   the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
newStartTimecode :: StartTimecode

-- | Settings for the action to activate a static image.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings
StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | The height of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank
--   to use the native height of the overlay.
[$sel:height:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Placement of the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   right.
[$sel:imageX:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The width of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank
--   to use the native width of the overlay.
[$sel:width:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Placement of the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   bottom.
[$sel:imageY:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If
--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.
[$sel:duration:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be
--   overlaid on the video, each layer with a different image. The layers
--   are in Z order, which means that overlays with higher values of layer
--   are inserted on top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is
--   0.
[$sel:layer:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Opacity of image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque.
--   Default is 100.
[$sel:opacity:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The time in milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts
--   at the start time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
[$sel:fadeIn:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Applies only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for
--   the image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is
--   hit, so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no
--   fade-out).
[$sel:fadeOut:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | The location and filename of the image file to overlay on the video.
--   The file must be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be
--   larger (in pixels) than the input video.
[$sel:image:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'] :: StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings -> InputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_height</a> - The height
--   of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will
--   be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank to use the
--   native height of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageX:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageX</a> - Placement of
--   the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the frame. If
--   the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right edge of
--   the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the right.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_width</a> - The width of
--   the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will be
--   scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank to use the
--   native width of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageY:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageY</a> - Placement of
--   the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the frame. If the
--   placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom edge of the
--   underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the bottom.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> - The
--   duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If
--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layer:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_layer</a> - The number of

--   time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fadeOut:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeOut</a> - Applies
--   only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for the
--   image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is hit,
--   so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no fade-out).
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_image</a> - The location
--   and filename of the image file to overlay on the video. The file must
--   be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be larger (in pixels)
--   than the input video.
newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings :: InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | The height of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The
--   overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank
--   to use the native height of the overlay.

-- | Placement of the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of
--   the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the
--   frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right
--   edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the
--   right.

staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_width :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeIn :: Lens' StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Settings to identify the end of the clip.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopTimecode</a> smart constructor.
data StopTimecode
StopTimecode' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior -> StopTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
[$sel:timecode:StopTimecode'] :: StopTimecode -> Maybe Text

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or
--   include the frame specified by the timecode.
[$sel:lastFrameClippingBehavior:StopTimecode'] :: StopTimecode -> Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>StopTimecode</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecode:StopTimecode'</a>, <a>stopTimecode_timecode</a> - The
--   timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional; if
--   not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFrameClippingBehavior:StopTimecode'</a>,
--   <a>stopTimecode_lastFrameClippingBehavior</a> - If you specify a
--   StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file), you can specify
--   if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or include the frame
--   specified by the timecode.
newStopTimecode :: StopTimecode

-- | The timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional;
--   if not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the
--   timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.
stopTimecode_timecode :: Lens' StopTimecode (Maybe Text)

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or
--   include the frame specified by the timecode.
stopTimecode_lastFrameClippingBehavior :: Lens' StopTimecode (Maybe LastFrameClippingBehavior)

data TeletextSourceSettings

-- | Optionally defines a region where TTML style captions will be
--   displayed
[$sel:outputRectangle:TeletextSourceSettings'] :: TeletextSourceSettings -> Maybe CaptionRectangle

-- | Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which
--   to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for
--   passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x"
--   prefix.
[$sel:pageNumber:TeletextSourceSettings'] :: TeletextSourceSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TeletextSourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   region where TTML style captions will be displayed
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageNumber:TeletextSourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>teletextSourceSettings_pageNumber</a> - Specifies the teletext page
--   number within the data stream from which to extract captions. Range of
--   0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for passthrough. Should be
--   specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x" prefix.
newTeletextSourceSettings :: TeletextSourceSettings

-- | Optionally defines a region where TTML style captions will be
--   displayed
teletextSourceSettings_outputRectangle :: Lens' TeletextSourceSettings (Maybe CaptionRectangle)

-- | Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which
--   to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for
--   passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x"
--   prefix.
teletextSourceSettings_pageNumber :: Lens' TeletextSourceSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Temporal Filter Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemporalFilterSettings</a> smart constructor.
data TemporalFilterSettings
TemporalFilterSettings' :: Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening -> Maybe TemporalFilterStrength -> TemporalFilterSettings

-- | If you enable this filter, the results are the following: - If the
--   source content is noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the
--   filter cleans up the source. - If the source content is already clean,
--   the filter tends to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate
--   control mode is QVBR.
[$sel:postFilterSharpening:TemporalFilterSettings'] :: TemporalFilterSettings -> Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening

-- | Choose a filter strength. We recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher
--   strength might take out good information, resulting in an image that
--   is overly soft.
[$sel:strength:TemporalFilterSettings'] :: TemporalFilterSettings -> Maybe TemporalFilterStrength

-- | Create a value of <a>TemporalFilterSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:postFilterSharpening:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_postFilterSharpening</a> - If you enable
--   this filter, the results are the following: - If the source content is
--   noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the filter cleans up
--   the source. - If the source content is already clean, the filter tends
--   to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate control mode is
--   QVBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strength:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_strength</a> - Choose a filter strength. We
--   recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher strength might take out good
--   information, resulting in an image that is overly soft.
newTemporalFilterSettings :: TemporalFilterSettings

-- | If you enable this filter, the results are the following: - If the
--   source content is noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the
--   filter cleans up the source. - If the source content is already clean,
--   the filter tends to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate
--   control mode is QVBR.
temporalFilterSettings_postFilterSharpening :: Lens' TemporalFilterSettings (Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening)

-- | Choose a filter strength. We recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher
--   strength might take out good information, resulting in an image that
--   is overly soft.
temporalFilterSettings_strength :: Lens' TemporalFilterSettings (Maybe TemporalFilterStrength)

-- | Timecode Config
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimecodeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TimecodeConfig
TimecodeConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Threshold in frames beyond which output timecode is resynchronized to
--   the input timecode. Discrepancies below this threshold are permitted
--   to avoid unnecessary discontinuities in the output timecode. No
--   timecode sync when this is not specified.
[$sel:syncThreshold:TimecodeConfig'] :: TimecodeConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
[$sel:source:TimecodeConfig'] :: TimecodeConfig -> TimecodeConfigSource

-- | Create a value of <a>TimecodeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncThreshold:TimecodeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>timecodeConfig_syncThreshold</a> - Threshold in frames beyond which
--   output timecode is resynchronized to the input timecode. Discrepancies
--   below this threshold are permitted to avoid unnecessary
--   discontinuities in the output timecode. No timecode sync when this is
--   not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:TimecodeConfig'</a>, <a>timecodeConfig_source</a> -
--   Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
newTimecodeConfig :: TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Threshold in frames beyond which output timecode is resynchronized to
--   the input timecode. Discrepancies below this threshold are permitted
--   to avoid unnecessary discontinuities in the output timecode. No
--   timecode sync when this is not specified.
timecodeConfig_syncThreshold :: Lens' TimecodeConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
timecodeConfig_source :: Lens' TimecodeConfig TimecodeConfigSource

-- | Udp Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUdpGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UdpGroupSettings
UdpGroupSettings' :: Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut -> UdpGroupSettings

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
[$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies behavior of last resort when input video is lost, and no
--   more backup inputs are available. When dropTs is selected the entire
--   transport stream will stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected
--   the program can be dropped from the transport stream (and replaced
--   with null packets to meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when
--   emitProgram is chosen the transport stream will continue to be
--   produced normally with repeat frames, black frames, or slate frames
--   substituted for the absent input video.
[$sel:inputLossAction:UdpGroupSettings'] :: UdpGroupSettings -> Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut

-- | Create a value of <a>UdpGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame</a> - Indicates ID3 frame
--   that has the timecode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period</a> - Timed Metadata
--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Specifies behavior of last
--   resort when input video is lost, and no more backup inputs are
--   available. When dropTs is selected the entire transport stream will
--   stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected the program can be
--   dropped from the transport stream (and replaced with null packets to
--   meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when emitProgram is chosen the
--   transport stream will continue to be produced normally with repeat
--   frames, black frames, or slate frames substituted for the absent input
--   video.
newUdpGroupSettings :: UdpGroupSettings

-- | Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.
udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe UdpTimedMetadataId3Frame)

-- | Timed Metadata interval in seconds.
udpGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies behavior of last resort when input video is lost, and no
--   more backup inputs are available. When dropTs is selected the entire
--   transport stream will stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected
--   the program can be dropped from the transport stream (and replaced
--   with null packets to meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when
--   emitProgram is chosen the transport stream will continue to be
--   produced normally with repeat frames, black frames, or slate frames
--   substituted for the absent input video.
udpGroupSettings_inputLossAction :: Lens' UdpGroupSettings (Maybe InputLossActionForUdpOut)

-- | Udp Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUdpOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UdpOutputSettings
UdpOutputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe FecOutputSettings -> OutputLocationRef -> UdpContainerSettings -> UdpOutputSettings

-- | UDP output buffering in milliseconds. Larger values increase latency
--   through the transcoder but simultaneously assist the transcoder in
--   maintaining a constant, low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating
--   clock recovery, input switching, input disruptions, picture
--   reordering, etc.
[$sel:bufferMsec:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Settings for enabling and adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP
--   outputs.
[$sel:fecOutputSettings:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> Maybe FecOutputSettings

-- | Destination address and port number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be
--   unicast or multicast RTP or UDP (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or
--   udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
[$sel:destination:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> OutputLocationRef
[$sel:containerSettings:UdpOutputSettings'] :: UdpOutputSettings -> UdpContainerSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>UdpOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferMsec:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_bufferMsec</a> - UDP output buffering in
--   milliseconds. Larger values increase latency through the transcoder
--   but simultaneously assist the transcoder in maintaining a constant,
--   low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating clock recovery, input
--   switching, input disruptions, picture reordering, etc.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fecOutputSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_fecOutputSettings</a> - Settings for enabling and
--   adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_destination</a> - Destination address and port
--   number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be unicast or multicast RTP or UDP
--   (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_containerSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
newUdpOutputSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> UdpContainerSettings -> UdpOutputSettings

-- | UDP output buffering in milliseconds. Larger values increase latency
--   through the transcoder but simultaneously assist the transcoder in
--   maintaining a constant, low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating
--   clock recovery, input switching, input disruptions, picture
--   reordering, etc.
udpOutputSettings_bufferMsec :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Settings for enabling and adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP
--   outputs.
udpOutputSettings_fecOutputSettings :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings (Maybe FecOutputSettings)

-- | Destination address and port number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be
--   unicast or multicast RTP or UDP (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or
--   udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
udpOutputSettings_destination :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings OutputLocationRef

-- | Undocumented member.
udpOutputSettings_containerSettings :: Lens' UdpOutputSettings UdpContainerSettings

-- | Placeholder documentation for VideoBlackFailoverSettings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VideoBlackFailoverSettings
VideoBlackFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive
--   considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black,
--   every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is
--   calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white.
--   Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula
--   works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1
--   in 10-bit color depth: (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of
--   102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color
--   depth: (255*0.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is
--   'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
[$sel:blackDetectThreshold:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'] :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   black before automatic input failover occurs.
[$sel:videoBlackThresholdMsec:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'] :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackDetectThreshold:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_blackDetectThreshold</a> - A value used
--   in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive considers a pixel
--   to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black, every pixel in a
--   frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is calculated as a
--   percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white. Therefore .1 means 10%
--   white (or 90% black). Note how the formula works for any color depth.
--   For example, if you set this field to 0.1 in 10-bit color depth:
--   (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of 102 or less is 'black'.
--   If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color depth: (255*0.1=25.5),
--   which means a pixel value of 25 or less is 'black'. The range is 0.0
--   to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoBlackThresholdMsec:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_videoBlackThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be black before
--   automatic input failover occurs.
newVideoBlackFailoverSettings :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive
--   considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black,
--   every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is
--   calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white.
--   Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula
--   works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1
--   in 10-bit color depth: (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of
--   102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color
--   depth: (255*0.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is
--   'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
videoBlackFailoverSettings_blackDetectThreshold :: Lens' VideoBlackFailoverSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   black before automatic input failover occurs.
videoBlackFailoverSettings_videoBlackThresholdMsec :: Lens' VideoBlackFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Video settings for this stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VideoDescription
VideoDescription' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd -> Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoCodecSettings -> Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
[$sel:height:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates how MediaLive will respond to the AFD values that might be
--   in the input video. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if
--   your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH.
--   RESPOND: MediaLive clips the input video using a formula that uses the
--   AFD values (configured in afdSignaling ), the input display aspect
--   ratio, and the output display aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes
--   the AFD values in the output, unless the codec for this encode is
--   FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH: MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does
--   not clip the video. But MediaLive does include the values in the
--   output. NONE: MediaLive does not clip the input video and does not
--   include the AFD values in the output
[$sel:respondToAfd:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd

-- | Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
[$sel:width:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Video codec settings.
[$sel:codecSettings:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoCodecSettings

-- | STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures the output position to stretch the video
--   to the specified output resolution (height and width). This option
--   will override any position value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes
--   (pillar boxes or letter boxes) around the video to provide the
--   specified output resolution.
[$sel:scalingBehavior:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior

-- | Changes the strength of the anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is
--   the softest setting, 100 is the sharpest. A setting of 50 is
--   recommended for most content.
[$sel:sharpness:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this Description. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
[$sel:name:VideoDescription'] :: VideoDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_height</a> -
--   Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:respondToAfd:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_respondToAfd</a> - Indicates how MediaLive will
--   respond to the AFD values that might be in the input video. If you do
--   not know what AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not
--   given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH. RESPOND: MediaLive clips the
--   input video using a formula that uses the AFD values (configured in
--   afdSignaling ), the input display aspect ratio, and the output display
--   aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes the AFD values in the output,
--   unless the codec for this encode is FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH:
--   MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does not clip the video. But
--   MediaLive does include the values in the output. NONE: MediaLive does
--   not clip the input video and does not include the AFD values in the
--   output
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_width</a> -
--   Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_codecSettings</a> - Video codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingBehavior:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_scalingBehavior</a> - STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures
--   the output position to stretch the video to the specified output
--   resolution (height and width). This option will override any position
--   value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes (pillar boxes or letter boxes)
--   around the video to provide the specified output resolution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sharpness:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_sharpness</a> - Changes the strength of the
--   anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is the softest setting, 100 is
--   the sharpest. A setting of 50 is recommended for most content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this Description. Description names should be unique within
--   this Live Event.
newVideoDescription :: Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
videoDescription_height :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates how MediaLive will respond to the AFD values that might be
--   in the input video. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if
--   your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH.
--   RESPOND: MediaLive clips the input video using a formula that uses the
--   AFD values (configured in afdSignaling ), the input display aspect
--   ratio, and the output display aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes
--   the AFD values in the output, unless the codec for this encode is
--   FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH: MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does
--   not clip the video. But MediaLive does include the values in the
--   output. NONE: MediaLive does not clip the input video and does not
--   include the AFD values in the output
videoDescription_respondToAfd :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd)

-- | Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
videoDescription_width :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | Video codec settings.
videoDescription_codecSettings :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoCodecSettings)

-- | STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures the output position to stretch the video
--   to the specified output resolution (height and width). This option
--   will override any position value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes
--   (pillar boxes or letter boxes) around the video to provide the
--   specified output resolution.
videoDescription_scalingBehavior :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior)

-- | Changes the strength of the anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is
--   the softest setting, 100 is the sharpest. A setting of 50 is
--   recommended for most content.
videoDescription_sharpness :: Lens' VideoDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this Description. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
videoDescription_name :: Lens' VideoDescription Text

-- | Specifies a particular video stream within an input source. An input
--   may have only a single video selector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoSelector</a> smart constructor.
data VideoSelector
VideoSelector' :: Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage -> Maybe VideoSelectorSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace -> VideoSelector

-- | Applies only if colorSpace is a value other than follow. This field
--   controls how the value in the colorSpace field will be used. fallback
--   means that when the input does include color space data, that data
--   will be used, but when the input has no color space data, the value in
--   colorSpace will be used. Choose fallback if your input is sometimes
--   missing color space data, but when it does have color space data, that
--   data is correct. force means to always use the value in colorSpace.
--   Choose force if your input usually has no color space data or might
--   have unreliable color space data.
[$sel:colorSpaceUsage:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage

-- | The video selector settings.
[$sel:selectorSettings:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorSettings

-- | Color space settings
[$sel:colorSpaceSettings:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings

-- | Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
[$sel:colorSpace:VideoSelector'] :: VideoSelector -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceUsage:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceUsage</a> - Applies only if colorSpace is a
--   value other than follow. This field controls how the value in the
--   colorSpace field will be used. fallback means that when the input does
--   include color space data, that data will be used, but when the input
--   has no color space data, the value in colorSpace will be used. Choose
--   fallback if your input is sometimes missing color space data, but when
--   it does have color space data, that data is correct. force means to
--   always use the value in colorSpace. Choose force if your input usually
--   has no color space data or might have unreliable color space data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectorSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_selectorSettings</a> - The video selector settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceSettings</a> - Color space settings
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpace:VideoSelector'</a>, <a>videoSelector_colorSpace</a>
--   - Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
newVideoSelector :: VideoSelector

-- | Applies only if colorSpace is a value other than follow. This field
--   controls how the value in the colorSpace field will be used. fallback
--   means that when the input does include color space data, that data
--   will be used, but when the input has no color space data, the value in
--   colorSpace will be used. Choose fallback if your input is sometimes
--   missing color space data, but when it does have color space data, that
--   data is correct. force means to always use the value in colorSpace.
--   Choose force if your input usually has no color space data or might
--   have unreliable color space data.
videoSelector_colorSpaceUsage :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage)

-- | The video selector settings.
videoSelector_selectorSettings :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorSettings)

-- | Color space settings
videoSelector_colorSpaceSettings :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings)

-- | Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
videoSelector_colorSpace :: Lens' VideoSelector (Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace)
