-- | The properties for a private VPC Output When this property is
--   specified, the output egress addresses will be created in a user
--   specified VPC
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettings
VpcOutputSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> VpcOutputSettings

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Output
--   VPC network interfaces. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | List of public address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will
--   be created in Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two
--   for STANDARD channels
[$sel:publicAddressAllocationIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettings'] :: VpcOutputSettings -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Output VPC network interfaces. If
--   none are specified then the VPC default security group will be used
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAddressAllocationIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_publicAddressAllocationIds</a> - List of public
--   address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will be created in
--   Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two for STANDARD
--   channels
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique
--   availability zones (AZ).
newVpcOutputSettings :: VpcOutputSettings

-- | A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Output
--   VPC network interfaces. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used
vpcOutputSettings_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | List of public address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will
--   be created in Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two
--   for STANDARD channels
vpcOutputSettings_publicAddressAllocationIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel,
--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
vpcOutputSettings_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcOutputSettings [Text]

-- | The properties for a private VPC Output
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettingsDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettingsDescription
VpcOutputSettingsDescription' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | A list of up EC2 VPC security group IDs attached to the Output VPC
--   network interfaces.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
[$sel:availabilityZones:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

--   subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the
--   customer's VPC
[$sel:networkInterfaceIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'] :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe [Text]

--   EC2 VPC security group IDs attached to the Output VPC network
--   interfaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_availabilityZones</a> - The
--   Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet
--   IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped
--   to two unique availability zones (AZ).
--

--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_networkInterfaceIds</a> - A list of
--   Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the customer's VPC

-- | Wav Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWavSettings</a> smart constructor.
data WavSettings
WavSettings' :: Maybe WavCodingMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> WavSettings

-- | The audio coding mode for the WAV audio. The mode determines the
--   number of channels in the audio.
[$sel:codingMode:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe WavCodingMode

-- | Bits per sample.
[$sel:bitDepth:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Sample rate in Hz.
[$sel:sampleRate:WavSettings'] :: WavSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>WavSettings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:WavSettings'</a>, <a>wavSettings_codingMode</a> -
--   The audio coding mode for the WAV audio. The mode determines the
--   number of channels in the audio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitDepth:WavSettings'</a>, <a>wavSettings_bitDepth</a> - Bits
--   per sample.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:WavSettings'</a>, <a>wavSettings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz.
newWavSettings :: WavSettings

--   number of channels in the audio.

wavSettings_bitDepth :: Lens' WavSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Sample rate in Hz.
wavSettings_sampleRate :: Lens' WavSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Webvtt Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebvttDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data WebvttDestinationSettings
WebvttDestinationSettings' :: Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl -> WebvttDestinationSettings

-- | Controls whether the color and position of the source captions is
--   passed through to the WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only
--   if the source captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't
--   pass through the style. The output captions will not contain any font
--   styling information.
[$sel:styleControl:WebvttDestinationSettings'] :: WebvttDestinationSettings -> Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl

-- | Create a value of <a>WebvttDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:styleControl:WebvttDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>webvttDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Controls whether the
--   color and position of the source captions is passed through to the
--   WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only if the source
--   captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't pass through
--   the style. The output captions will not contain any font styling
--   information.
newWebvttDestinationSettings :: WebvttDestinationSettings

-- | Controls whether the color and position of the source captions is
--   passed through to the WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only
--   if the source captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't
--   pass through the style. The output captions will not contain any font
--   styling information.
webvttDestinationSettings_styleControl :: Lens' WebvttDestinationSettings (Maybe WebvttDestinationStyleControl)


-- | Start an input device transfer to another AWS account. After you make
--   the request, the other account must accept or reject the transfer.
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.TransferInputDevice

-- | A request to transfer an input device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferInputDevice'</a> smart constructor.
data TransferInputDevice'
TransferInputDevice'' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> TransferInputDevice'

-- | The target AWS region to transfer the device.
[$sel:targetRegion:TransferInputDevice''] :: TransferInputDevice' -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional message for the recipient. Maximum 280 characters.
[$sel:transferMessage:TransferInputDevice''] :: TransferInputDevice' -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS account ID (12 digits) for the recipient of the device
--   transfer.
[$sel:targetCustomerId:TransferInputDevice''] :: TransferInputDevice' -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of this input device. For example, hd-123456789abcdef.
[$sel:inputDeviceId:TransferInputDevice''] :: TransferInputDevice' -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferInputDevice'</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetRegion:TransferInputDevice''</a>,
--   <a>transferInputDevice'_targetRegion</a> - The target AWS region to
--   transfer the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferMessage:TransferInputDevice''</a>,
--   <a>transferInputDevice'_transferMessage</a> - An optional message for
--   the recipient. Maximum 280 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCustomerId:TransferInputDevice''</a>,
--   <a>transferInputDevice'_targetCustomerId</a> - The AWS account ID (12
--   digits) for the recipient of the device transfer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDeviceId:TransferInputDevice''</a>,
--   <a>transferInputDevice'_inputDeviceId</a> - The unique ID of this
--   input device. For example, hd-123456789abcdef.
newTransferInputDevice' :: Text -> TransferInputDevice'

-- | The target AWS region to transfer the device.
transferInputDevice'_targetRegion :: Lens' TransferInputDevice' (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional message for the recipient. Maximum 280 characters.
transferInputDevice'_transferMessage :: Lens' TransferInputDevice' (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS account ID (12 digits) for the recipient of the device
--   transfer.
transferInputDevice'_targetCustomerId :: Lens' TransferInputDevice' (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of this input device. For example, hd-123456789abcdef.
transferInputDevice'_inputDeviceId :: Lens' TransferInputDevice' Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for TransferInputDeviceResponse
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferInputDeviceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TransferInputDeviceResponse
TransferInputDeviceResponse' :: Int -> TransferInputDeviceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TransferInputDeviceResponse'] :: TransferInputDeviceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferInputDeviceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TransferInputDeviceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>transferInputDeviceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newTransferInputDeviceResponse :: Int -> TransferInputDeviceResponse

-- | Stops a running multiplex. If the multiplex isn't running, this action
--   has no effect.
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.StopMultiplex

-- | Placeholder documentation for StopMultiplexRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopMultiplex</a> smart constructor.

-- | Stops a running channel
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.StopChannel

-- | Placeholder documentation for StopChannelRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopChannel</a> smart constructor.
data StopChannel
StopChannel' :: Text -> StopChannel

-- | A request to stop a running channel
[$sel:channelId:StopChannel'] :: StopChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopChannel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:StopChannel'</a>, <a>stopChannel_channelId</a> - A
--   request to stop a running channel
newStopChannel :: Text -> StopChannel

-- | A request to stop a running channel
stopChannel_channelId :: Lens' StopChannel Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for StopChannelResponse
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StopChannelResponse
StopChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [PipelineDetail] -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> Int -> StopChannelResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
[$sel:roleArn:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encoderSettings:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe EncoderSettings

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
[$sel:arn:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the channel.
[$sel:id:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
[$sel:channelClass:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
[$sel:name:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
[$sel:destinations:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:state:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe ChannelState

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
[$sel:inputAttachments:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe [PipelineDetail]

-- | Settings for VPC output
[$sel:vpc:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
[$sel:egressEndpoints:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StopChannelResponse'] :: StopChannelResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

-- | Start (run) the multiplex. Starting the multiplex does not start the
--   channels. You must explicitly start each channel.
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.StartMultiplex

-- | Placeholder documentation for StartMultiplexRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartMultiplex</a> smart constructor.
data StartMultiplex

--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.

module Network.AWS.MediaLive.PurchaseOffering

-- | Placeholder documentation for PurchaseOfferingRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPurchaseOffering'</a> smart constructor.
data PurchaseOffering'
PurchaseOffering'' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Natural -> PurchaseOffering'

-- | Name for the new reservation
[$sel:name:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique request ID to be specified. This is needed to prevent retries
--   from creating multiple resources.
[$sel:requestId:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Maybe Text

-- | A collection of key-value pairs
[$sel:tags:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Requested reservation start time (UTC) in ISO-8601 format. The
--   specified time must be between the first day of the current month and
--   one year from now. If no value is given, the default is now.
[$sel:start:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Maybe Text

-- | Offering to purchase, e.g. '87654321'
[$sel:offeringId:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Text

-- | Number of resources
[$sel:count:PurchaseOffering''] :: PurchaseOffering' -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>PurchaseOffering'</a> with all optional fields

-- | List purchased reservations.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.ListReservations

-- | Placeholder documentation for ListReservationsRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListReservations</a> smart constructor.
data ListReservations

-- | Filter by framerate, 'MAX_30_FPS' or 'MAX_60_FPS'

--   <a>describeMultiplexProgram_multiplexId</a> - The ID of the multiplex
--   that the program belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programName:DescribeMultiplexProgram'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgram_programName</a> - The name of the program.
newDescribeMultiplexProgram :: Text -> Text -> DescribeMultiplexProgram

-- | The ID of the multiplex that the program belongs to.
describeMultiplexProgram_multiplexId :: Lens' DescribeMultiplexProgram Text

-- | The name of the program.
describeMultiplexProgram_programName :: Lens' DescribeMultiplexProgram Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeMultiplexProgramResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse
DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse' :: Maybe MultiplexProgramPacketIdentifiersMap -> Maybe MultiplexProgramSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MultiplexProgramPipelineDetail] -> Int -> DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse

-- | The packet identifier map for this multiplex program.
[$sel:packetIdentifiersMap:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe MultiplexProgramPacketIdentifiersMap

-- | The settings for this multiplex program.
[$sel:multiplexProgramSettings:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe MultiplexProgramSettings

-- | The MediaLive channel associated with the program.
[$sel:channelId:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the multiplex program.
[$sel:programName:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the current sources for the specified
--   program in the specified multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex
--   pipeline connects to both pipelines in a given source channel (the
--   channel identified by the program). But only one of those channel
--   pipelines is ever active at one time.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe [MultiplexProgramPipelineDetail]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:packetIdentifiersMap:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_packetIdentifiersMap</a> - The
--   packet identifier map for this multiplex program.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiplexProgramSettings:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_multiplexProgramSettings</a> - The
--   settings for this multiplex program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_channelId</a> - The MediaLive
--   channel associated with the program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programName:DescribeMultiplexProgram'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_programName</a> - The name of the
--   multiplex program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelineDetails:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_pipelineDetails</a> - Contains
--   information about the current sources for the specified program in the
--   specified multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex pipeline
--   connects to both pipelines in a given source channel (the channel
--   identified by the program). But only one of those channel pipelines is
--   ever active at one time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeMultiplexProgramResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeMultiplexProgramResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.

--   recently sent to MediaLive.

[$sel:type':DescribeInputDeviceResponse'] :: DescribeInputDeviceResponse -> Maybe InputDeviceType

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
[$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:DescribeInputDeviceResponse'] :: DescribeInputDeviceResponse -> Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeInputDeviceResponse'] :: DescribeInputDeviceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeInput</a> with all optional fields

--   fields.

describeInput_inputId :: Lens' DescribeInput Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for DescribeInputResponse
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeInputResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeInputResponse
DescribeInputResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [InputSource] -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlow] -> Maybe InputSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputDestination] -> Maybe InputState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe InputClass -> Maybe InputType -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings] -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> DescribeInputResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during
--   and after creation.
[$sel:roleArn:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IDs for all Inputs which are partners of this one.
[$sel:inputPartnerIds:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of the sources of the input (PULL-type).
[$sel:sources:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [InputSource]

-- | A list of MediaConnect Flows for this input.
[$sel:mediaConnectFlows:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlow]

-- | Certain pull input sources can be dynamic, meaning that they can have
--   their URL's dynamically changes during input switch actions.
--   Presently, this functionality only works with MP4_FILE inputs.
[$sel:inputSourceType:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe InputSourceType

-- | The Unique ARN of the input (generated, immutable).
[$sel:arn:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The generated ID of the input (unique for user account, immutable).
[$sel:id:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IDs for all the Input Security Groups attached to the input.
[$sel:securityGroups:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The user-assigned name (This is a mutable value).
[$sel:name:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the destinations of the input (PUSH-type).
[$sel:destinations:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [InputDestination]
[$sel:state:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe InputState

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | STANDARD - MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this
--   input. If the channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested.
--   If the channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be
--   ingested; the second source will always be ignored, even if the first
--   source fails. SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to
--   this input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is
--   valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid
--   because the channel requires two sources in the input.
[$sel:inputClass:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe InputClass
[$sel:type':DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe InputType

-- | Settings for the input devices.
[$sel:inputDevices:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings]

-- | A list of channel IDs that that input is attached to (currently an
--   input can only be attached to one channel).
[$sel:attachedChannels:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeInputResponse'] :: DescribeInputResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeInputResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   input (PULL-type).
--

--   MediaConnect Flows for this input.

--   the Input Security Groups attached to the input.
--

--   mutable value).

--   of the input (PUSH-type).

-- | Gets details about a channel
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.DescribeChannel

-- | Placeholder documentation for DescribeChannelRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeChannel</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeChannel
DescribeChannel' :: Text -> DescribeChannel

-- | channel ID
[$sel:channelId:DescribeChannel'] :: DescribeChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelId:DescribeChannel'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannel_channelId</a> - channel ID
newDescribeChannel :: Text -> DescribeChannel

-- | channel ID
describeChannel_channelId :: Lens' DescribeChannel Text

-- | Placeholder documentation for DescribeChannelResponse
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeChannelResponse
DescribeChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [PipelineDetail] -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> Int -> DescribeChannelResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
[$sel:roleArn:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encoderSettings:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe EncoderSettings

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
[$sel:arn:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique id of the channel.
[$sel:id:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
[$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
[$sel:channelClass:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe ChannelClass

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
[$sel:name:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
[$sel:destinations:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:state:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe ChannelState

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
[$sel:inputAttachments:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe [PipelineDetail]

-- | Settings for VPC output
[$sel:vpc:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
[$sel:egressEndpoints:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeChannelResponse'] :: DescribeChannelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeChannelResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the role assumed when running the Channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encoderSettings:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_encoderSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSpecification:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_inputSpecification</a> - Specification of
--   network and file inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_arn</a> - The unique arn of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_id</a> - The unique id of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_pipelinesRunningCount</a> - The number of
--   currently healthy pipelines.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_channelClass</a> - The class for this
--   channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines or SINGLE_PIPELINE
--   for a channel with one pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_logLevel</a> - The log level being written
--   to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_name</a> - The name of the channel.
--   (user-mutable)
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_destinations</a> - A list of destinations
--   of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one destination per output.
--   For other types (HLS, for example), there is one destination per
--   packager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_state</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachments:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_inputAttachments</a> - List of input
--   attachments for channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_tags</a> - A collection of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelineDetails:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_pipelineDetails</a> - Runtime details for
--   the pipelines of a running channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_vpc</a> - Settings for VPC output
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdiInputSpecification:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_cdiInputSpecification</a> - Specification
--   of CDI inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:egressEndpoints:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_egressEndpoints</a> - The endpoints where
--   outgoing connections initiate from
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeChannelResponse :: Int -> DescribeChannelResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the
--   Channel.
describeChannelResponse_roleArn :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
describeChannelResponse_encoderSettings :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe EncoderSettings)

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
describeChannelResponse_inputSpecification :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe InputSpecification)

-- | The unique arn of the channel.
describeChannelResponse_arn :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique id of the channel.
describeChannelResponse_id :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of currently healthy pipelines.
describeChannelResponse_pipelinesRunningCount :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines
--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
describeChannelResponse_channelClass :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe ChannelClass)

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
describeChannelResponse_logLevel :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe LogLevel)

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
describeChannelResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
describeChannelResponse_destinations :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [OutputDestination])

-- | Undocumented member.
describeChannelResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe ChannelState)

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
describeChannelResponse_inputAttachments :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [InputAttachment])

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
describeChannelResponse_tags :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
describeChannelResponse_pipelineDetails :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [PipelineDetail])

-- | Settings for VPC output
describeChannelResponse_vpc :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription)

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
describeChannelResponse_cdiInputSpecification :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe CdiInputSpecification)

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
describeChannelResponse_egressEndpoints :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse Int

[$sel:programName:DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the current sources for the specified
--   program in the specified multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex
--   pipeline connects to both pipelines in a given source channel (the
--   channel identified by the program). But only one of those channel
--   pipelines is ever active at one time.
[$sel:pipelineDetails:DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse -> Maybe [MultiplexProgramPipelineDetail]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse'] :: DeleteMultiplexProgramResponse -> Int

--   one destination per packager.

-- | Create an input
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.CreateInput

-- | The name of the input
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInput'</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInput'
CreateInput'' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputSourceRequest] -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlowRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputDestinationRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe InputType -> Maybe InputVpcRequest -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings] -> CreateInput'

-- | A list of security groups referenced by IDs to attach to the input.
[$sel:inputSecurityGroups:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during
--   and after creation.
[$sel:roleArn:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe Text

-- | The source URLs for a PULL-type input. Every PULL type input needs
--   exactly two source URLs for redundancy. Only specify sources for PULL
--   type Inputs. Leave Destinations empty.
[$sel:sources:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe [InputSourceRequest]

-- | A list of the MediaConnect Flows that you want to use in this input.
--   You can specify as few as one Flow and presently, as many as two. The
--   only requirement is when you have more than one is that each Flow is
--   in a separate Availability Zone as this ensures your EML input is
--   redundant to AZ issues.
[$sel:mediaConnectFlows:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlowRequest]

-- | Name of the input.
[$sel:name:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe Text

-- | Destination settings for PUSH type inputs.
[$sel:destinations:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe [InputDestinationRequest]

-- | Unique identifier of the request to ensure the request is handled
--   exactly once in case of retries.
[$sel:requestId:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe Text

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
[$sel:tags:CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)
[$sel:type':CreateInput''] :: CreateInput' -> Maybe InputType

--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during and
--   after creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sources:CreateInput''</a>, <a>createInput'_sources</a> - The
--   source URLs for a PULL-type input. Every PULL type input needs exactly
--   two source URLs for redundancy. Only specify sources for PULL type
--   Inputs. Leave Destinations empty.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaConnectFlows:CreateInput''</a>,
--   <a>createInput'_mediaConnectFlows</a> - A list of the MediaConnect
--   Flows that you want to use in this input. You can specify as few as
--   one Flow and presently, as many as two. The only requirement is when
--   you have more than one is that each Flow is in a separate Availability
--   Zone as this ensures your EML input is redundant to AZ issues.

--   input.

--   exactly once in case of retries.

-- | Stops running resources
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.BatchStop

-- | A request to stop resources
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchStop'</a> smart constructor.
data BatchStop'

--   List of channel IDs
newBatchStop' :: BatchStop'

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchStopResponse</a> smart constructor.
data BatchStopResponse

[$sel:successful:BatchStopResponse'] :: BatchStopResponse -> Maybe [BatchSuccessfulResultModel]

-- | List of failed operations
[$sel:failed:BatchStopResponse'] :: BatchStopResponse -> Maybe [BatchFailedResultModel]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:BatchStopResponse'] :: BatchStopResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchStopResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:successful:BatchStopResponse'</a>,
--   <a>batchStopResponse_successful</a> - List of successful operations
--   
--   <a>$sel:failed:BatchStopResponse'</a>, <a>batchStopResponse_failed</a>
--   - List of failed operations

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateChannel'</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateChannel'
UpdateChannel'' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Text -> UpdateChannel'

-- | An optional Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume when
--   running the Channel. If you do not specify this on an update call but
--   the role was previously set that role will be removed.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe Text

-- | The encoder settings for this channel.
[$sel:encoderSettings:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe EncoderSettings

-- | Specification of network and file inputs for this channel
[$sel:inputSpecification:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe InputSpecification

-- | The log level to write to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logLevel:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | The name of the channel.
[$sel:name:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of output destinations for this channel.
[$sel:destinations:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe [OutputDestination]
[$sel:inputAttachments:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe [InputAttachment]

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
[$sel:cdiInputSpecification:UpdateChannel''] :: UpdateChannel' -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification

--   the role was previously set that role will be removed.

-- | Updates an input.
module Network.AWS.MediaLive.UpdateInput

-- | A request to update an input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInput'</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInput'
UpdateInput'' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputSourceRequest] -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlowRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputDestinationRequest] -> Maybe [InputDeviceRequest] -> Text -> UpdateInput'

-- | A list of security groups referenced by IDs to attach to the input.
[$sel:inputSecurityGroups:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during
--   and after creation.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe Text

-- | The source URLs for a PULL-type input. Every PULL type input needs
--   exactly two source URLs for redundancy. Only specify sources for PULL
--   type Inputs. Leave Destinations empty.
[$sel:sources:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe [InputSourceRequest]

-- | A list of the MediaConnect Flow ARNs that you want to use as the
--   source of the input. You can specify as few as one Flow and presently,
--   as many as two. The only requirement is when you have more than one is
--   that each Flow is in a separate Availability Zone as this ensures your
--   EML input is redundant to AZ issues.
[$sel:mediaConnectFlows:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlowRequest]

-- | Name of the input.
[$sel:name:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe Text

-- | Destination settings for PUSH type inputs.
[$sel:destinations:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe [InputDestinationRequest]

-- | Settings for the devices.
[$sel:inputDevices:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Maybe [InputDeviceRequest]

-- | Unique ID of the input.
[$sel:inputId:UpdateInput''] :: UpdateInput' -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateInput'</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.

--   type Inputs. Leave Destinations empty.
updateInput'_sources :: Lens' UpdateInput' (Maybe [InputSourceRequest])

-- | A list of the MediaConnect Flow ARNs that you want to use as the
--   source of the input. You can specify as few as one Flow and presently,
--   as many as two. The only requirement is when you have more than one is
--   that each Flow is in a separate Availability Zone as this ensures your
--   EML input is redundant to AZ issues.

startChannelResponse_vpc :: Lens' StartChannelResponse (Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription)

startChannelResponse_egressEndpoints :: Lens' StartChannelResponse (Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
startChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartChannelResponse Int

describeInputDeviceResponse_macAddress :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse (Maybe Text)

describeInputDeviceResponse_hdDeviceSettings :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse (Maybe InputDeviceHdSettings)

describeInputDeviceResponse_serialNumber :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the input device.
describeInputDeviceResponse_type :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse (Maybe InputDeviceType)

-- | The status of the action to synchronize the device configuration. If
--   you change the configuration of the input device (for example, the
--   maximum bitrate), MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The
--   device might not update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device
--   has updated its configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated
--   its configuration.
describeInputDeviceResponse_deviceSettingsSyncState :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse (Maybe DeviceSettingsSyncState)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeInputDeviceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeInputDeviceResponse Int

--   Channel.

stopChannelResponse_pipelinesRunningCount :: Lens' StopChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

--   or SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
stopChannelResponse_channelClass :: Lens' StopChannelResponse (Maybe ChannelClass)

-- | The log level being written to CloudWatch Logs.
stopChannelResponse_logLevel :: Lens' StopChannelResponse (Maybe LogLevel)

-- | The name of the channel. (user-mutable)
stopChannelResponse_name :: Lens' StopChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
stopChannelResponse_destinations :: Lens' StopChannelResponse (Maybe [OutputDestination])

--   Presently, this functionality only works with MP4_FILE inputs.

describeInputResponse_securityGroups :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe [Text])

describeInputResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the destinations of the input (PUSH-type).
describeInputResponse_destinations :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe [InputDestination])

-- | Undocumented member.
describeInputResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe InputState)

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
describeInputResponse_tags :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | STANDARD - MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this
--   input. If the channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested.
--   If the channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be
--   ingested; the second source will always be ignored, even if the first
--   source fails. SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to
--   this input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is
--   valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid
--   because the channel requires two sources in the input.
describeInputResponse_inputClass :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe InputClass)

-- | Undocumented member.
describeInputResponse_type :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe InputType)

-- | Settings for the input devices.
describeInputResponse_inputDevices :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe [InputDeviceSettings])

-- | A list of channel IDs that that input is attached to (currently an
--   input can only be attached to one channel).
describeInputResponse_attachedChannels :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeInputResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeInputResponse Int

--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
describeChannelResponse_destinations :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [OutputDestination])

-- | Undocumented member.
describeChannelResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe ChannelState)

-- | List of input attachments for channel.
describeChannelResponse_inputAttachments :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [InputAttachment])

-- | A collection of key-value pairs.
describeChannelResponse_tags :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
describeChannelResponse_pipelineDetails :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [PipelineDetail])

-- | Specification of CDI inputs for this channel
describeChannelResponse_cdiInputSpecification :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe CdiInputSpecification)

-- | The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
describeChannelResponse_egressEndpoints :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse (Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeChannelResponse Int

--   hd-123456789abcdef.

--   specified time must be between the first day of the current month and
--   one year from now. If no value is given, the default is now.

-- | Rate Control Mode.
aacSettings_rateControlMode :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRateControlMode)

-- | Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
aacSettings_codingMode :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacCodingMode)

-- | Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2
--   Transport Stream containers.
aacSettings_spec :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacSpec)

-- | Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
aacSettings_rawFormat :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacRawFormat)

-- | Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
aacSettings_sampleRate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio +
--   AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will
--   be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
aacSettings_inputType :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacInputType)

-- | AAC Profile.
aacSettings_profile :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacProfile)

-- | VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
aacSettings_vbrQuality :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe AacVbrQuality)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control
--   mode and profile.
aacSettings_bitrate :: Lens' AacSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
ac3Settings_dialnorm :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Natural)

-- | If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
ac3Settings_drcProfile :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3DrcProfile)

-- | Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
ac3Settings_codingMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3CodingMode)

-- | When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
ac3Settings_lfeFilter :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3LfeFilter)

-- | Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See
--   ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.
ac3Settings_bitstreamMode :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode)

-- | Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
ac3Settings_bitrate :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the
--   DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was
--   not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata
--   settings will be used.
ac3Settings_metadataControl :: Lens' Ac3Settings (Maybe Ac3MetadataControl)

-- | Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber :: Lens' AncillarySourceSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Undocumented member.
archiveCdnSettings_archiveS3Settings :: Lens' ArchiveCdnSettings (Maybe ArchiveS3Settings)

-- | Undocumented member.
archiveContainerSettings_rawSettings :: Lens' ArchiveContainerSettings (Maybe RawSettings)

-- | Undocumented member.
archiveContainerSettings_m2tsSettings :: Lens' ArchiveContainerSettings (Maybe M2tsSettings)

--   a new one.
archiveGroupSettings_rolloverInterval :: Lens' ArchiveGroupSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.
archiveGroupSettings_archiveCdnSettings :: Lens' ArchiveGroupSettings (Maybe ArchiveCdnSettings)

-- | A directory and base filename where archive files should be written.
archiveGroupSettings_destination :: Lens' ArchiveGroupSettings OutputLocationRef

-- | Output file extension. If excluded, this will be auto-selected from
--   the container type.
archiveOutputSettings_extension :: Lens' ArchiveOutputSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Required
--   for multiple outputs of the same type.
archiveOutputSettings_nameModifier :: Lens' ArchiveOutputSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings specific to the container type of the file.
archiveOutputSettings_containerSettings :: Lens' ArchiveOutputSettings ArchiveContainerSettings

-- | Specify the canned ACL to apply to each S3 request. Defaults to none.
archiveS3Settings_cannedAcl :: Lens' ArchiveS3Settings (Maybe S3CannedAcl)

-- | The index of the output channel being produced.
audioChannelMapping_outputChannel :: Lens' AudioChannelMapping Natural

-- | Indices and gain values for each input channel that should be remixed
--   into this output channel.
audioChannelMapping_inputChannelLevels :: Lens' AudioChannelMapping [InputChannelLevel]

-- | Undocumented member.

-- | Undocumented member.
audioCodecSettings_mp2Settings :: Lens' AudioCodecSettings (Maybe Mp2Settings)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioCodecSettings_passThroughSettings :: Lens' AudioCodecSettings (Maybe PassThroughSettings)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioCodecSettings_eac3Settings :: Lens' AudioCodecSettings (Maybe Eac3Settings)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioCodecSettings_aacSettings :: Lens' AudioCodecSettings (Maybe AacSettings)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioCodecSettings_wavSettings :: Lens' AudioCodecSettings (Maybe WavSettings)

-- | RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output
--   track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is
--   no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
audioDescription_languageCode :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for
--   audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.
audioDescription_audioType :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioType)

-- | Audio codec settings.
audioDescription_codecSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioCodecSettings)

-- | Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the
--   output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The
--   languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when
--   followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code
--   specified by the input.
audioDescription_languageCodeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl)

-- | Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input
--   contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to
--   the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in
--   Audio Type is included in the output. Note that this field and
--   audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
audioDescription_audioTypeControl :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl)

-- | Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the
--   output audio channels.
audioDescription_remixSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe RemixSettings)

-- | Advanced audio normalization settings.
audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings)

-- | Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed
--   by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).
audioDescription_streamName :: Lens' AudioDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this
--   AudioDescription.
audioDescription_audioSelectorName :: Lens' AudioDescription Text

-- | The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to
--   uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be
--   unique within this Live Event.
audioDescription_name :: Lens' AudioDescription Text

-- | Specifies the NAME in the #EXT-X-MEDIA tag of the target HLS audio
--   rendition.
audioHlsRenditionSelection_name :: Lens' AudioHlsRenditionSelection Text

-- | Specifies the GROUP-ID in the #EXT-X-MEDIA tag of the target HLS audio
--   rendition.
audioHlsRenditionSelection_groupId :: Lens' AudioHlsRenditionSelection Text

-- | When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies
--   audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs
--   such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is
--   no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language
--   returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose
--   another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it
--   can't find one with the same language.
audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection (Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy)

-- | Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio
--   source.
audioLanguageSelection_languageCode :: Lens' AudioLanguageSelection Text

-- | Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM
--   Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm)

-- | Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a
--   default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM
--   Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128
--   specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe Double)

-- | When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the
--   chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured
--   but not adjusted.
audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl :: Lens' AudioNormalizationSettings (Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl)

-- | Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Four types of audio-only tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant
--   Stream The client can play back this audio-only stream instead of
--   video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF
--   in the HLS manifest. Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client should try to play back by default.
--   Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES,
--   AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate
--   rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented
--   as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client
--   will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in
--   the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType)

-- | Specifies the segment type.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType)

-- | Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for
--   an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the
--   image increases the output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to
--   the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per
--   the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage :: Lens' AudioOnlyHlsSettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Selects a specific PID from within a source.
audioPidSelection_pid :: Lens' AudioPidSelection Natural

-- | The audio selector settings.
audioSelector_selectorSettings :: Lens' AudioSelector (Maybe AudioSelectorSettings)

-- | The name of this AudioSelector. AudioDescriptions will use this name
--   to uniquely identify this Selector. Selector names should be unique
--   per input.
audioSelector_name :: Lens' AudioSelector Text

-- | Undocumented member.
audioSelectorSettings_audioLanguageSelection :: Lens' AudioSelectorSettings (Maybe AudioLanguageSelection)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioSelectorSettings_audioHlsRenditionSelection :: Lens' AudioSelectorSettings (Maybe AudioHlsRenditionSelection)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioSelectorSettings_audioPidSelection :: Lens' AudioSelectorSettings (Maybe AudioPidSelection)

-- | Undocumented member.
audioSelectorSettings_audioTrackSelection :: Lens' AudioSelectorSettings (Maybe AudioTrackSelection)

-- | The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be
--   silent before automatic input failover occurs. Silence is defined as
--   audio loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.
audioSilenceFailoverSettings_audioSilenceThresholdMsec :: Lens' AudioSilenceFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the audio selector in the input that MediaLive should
--   monitor to detect silence. Select your most important rendition. If
--   you didn't create an audio selector in this input, leave blank.
audioSilenceFailoverSettings_audioSelectorName :: Lens' AudioSilenceFailoverSettings Text

-- | 1-based integer value that maps to a specific audio track
audioTrack_track :: Lens' AudioTrack Natural

-- | Selects one or more unique audio tracks from within a source.
audioTrackSelection_tracks :: Lens' AudioTrackSelection [AudioTrack]

-- | A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur,
--   MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe [FailoverCondition])

-- | This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to
--   be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings (Maybe InputPreference)

-- | The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover
--   pair.
automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId :: Lens' AutomaticInputFailoverSettings Text

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when insertion metadata is added.
availBlanking_state :: Lens' AvailBlanking (Maybe AvailBlankingState)

-- | Blanking image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and
--   png images are supported.
availBlanking_availBlankingImage :: Lens' AvailBlanking (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Ad avail settings.
availConfiguration_availSettings :: Lens' AvailConfiguration (Maybe AvailSettings)

-- | Undocumented member.
availSettings_scte35TimeSignalApos :: Lens' AvailSettings (Maybe Scte35TimeSignalApos)

-- | Undocumented member.
availSettings_scte35SpliceInsert :: Lens' AvailSettings (Maybe Scte35SpliceInsert)

-- | Error message for the failed operation
batchFailedResultModel_message :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the resource
batchFailedResultModel_arn :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | ID of the resource
batchFailedResultModel_id :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | Error code for the failed operation
batchFailedResultModel_code :: Lens' BatchFailedResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of schedule actions to create.
batchScheduleActionCreateRequest_scheduleActions :: Lens' BatchScheduleActionCreateRequest [ScheduleAction]

-- | List of actions that have been created in the schedule.
batchScheduleActionCreateResult_scheduleActions :: Lens' BatchScheduleActionCreateResult [ScheduleAction]

-- | A list of schedule actions to delete.
batchScheduleActionDeleteRequest_actionNames :: Lens' BatchScheduleActionDeleteRequest [Text]

-- | List of actions that have been deleted from the schedule.
batchScheduleActionDeleteResult_scheduleActions :: Lens' BatchScheduleActionDeleteResult [ScheduleAction]

-- | ARN of the resource
batchSuccessfulResultModel_arn :: Lens' BatchSuccessfulResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | ID of the resource
batchSuccessfulResultModel_id :: Lens' BatchSuccessfulResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | Current state of the resource
batchSuccessfulResultModel_state :: Lens' BatchSuccessfulResultModel (Maybe Text)

-- | Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp
--   and png images are supported.
blackoutSlate_blackoutSlateImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio,
--   and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an
--   SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor
--   is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must
--   contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateNetworkEndBlackout)

-- | Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be
--   scaled to fill the entire output raster.
blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked
--   when indicated by program metadata.
blackoutSlate_state :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe BlackoutSlateState)

-- | Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
blackoutSlate_networkId :: Lens' BlackoutSlate (Maybe Text)

-- | If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment
--   to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the
--   output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the
--   bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in
--   conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified
--   (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting
--   "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and
--   center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_alignment :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInAlignment)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInShadowColor)

-- | Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source
--   captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_outlineColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInOutlineColor)

-- | Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
burnInDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to
--   0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left
--   side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the
--   captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no
--   explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will
--   be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not
--   valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInFontColor)

-- | When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the
--   output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in
--   points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontSize :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to
--   the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be
--   'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many
--   different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources
--   use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption
--   sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_font :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe InputLocation)

-- | Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor)

-- | Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of
--   the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions
--   starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit
--   yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the
--   bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must
--   match.
burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for
--   source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source
--   settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in
--   and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions
--   in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels
--   above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is
--   transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity :: Lens' BurnInDestinationSettings (Maybe Natural)

-- | ISO 639-2 three-digit code: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
captionDescription_languageCode :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Human readable information to indicate captions available for players
--   (eg. English, or Spanish).
captionDescription_languageDescription :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional settings for captions destination that depend on the
--   destination type.
captionDescription_destinationSettings :: Lens' CaptionDescription (Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings)

-- | Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when
--   generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector
--   name.
captionDescription_captionSelectorName :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text

-- | Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
captionDescription_name :: Lens' CaptionDescription Text
