[fromIFrameOnlyPlaylistType] :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType -> Text
pattern IFrameOnlyPlaylistType_DISABLED :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType
pattern IFrameOnlyPlaylistType_STANDARD :: IFrameOnlyPlaylistType

-- | A standard input has two sources and a single pipeline input only has
--   one.
newtype InputClass
InputClass' :: Text -> InputClass
[fromInputClass] :: InputClass -> Text
pattern InputClass_SINGLE_PIPELINE :: InputClass
pattern InputClass_STANDARD :: InputClass

--   outputs resolutions up to 1080, choose "HD".

-- | Maximum input bitrate in megabits per second. Bitrates up to 50 Mbps
--   are supported currently.
newtype InputMaximumBitrate
InputMaximumBitrate' :: Text -> InputMaximumBitrate
[fromInputMaximumBitrate] :: InputMaximumBitrate -> Text
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_10_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_20_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate
pattern InputMaximumBitrate_MAX_50_MBPS :: InputMaximumBitrate

-- | Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a
--   previously failed input has recovered. If \"EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE\",
--   then the active input will stay active as long as it is healthy. If
--   \"PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED\", then always switch back to the primary
--   input when it is healthy.
newtype InputPreference
InputPreference' :: Text -> InputPreference
[fromInputPreference] :: InputPreference -> Text
pattern InputPreference_EQUAL_INPUT_PREFERENCE :: InputPreference
pattern InputPreference_PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED :: InputPreference

-- | Input resolution based on lines of vertical resolution in the input;
--   SD is less than 720 lines, HD is 720 to 1080 lines, UHD is greater
--   than 1080 lines
newtype InputResolution
InputResolution' :: Text -> InputResolution
[fromInputResolution] :: InputResolution -> Text
pattern InputResolution_HD :: InputResolution
pattern InputResolution_SD :: InputResolution
pattern InputResolution_UHD :: InputResolution

pattern InputSecurityGroupState_IDLE :: InputSecurityGroupState
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_IN_USE :: InputSecurityGroupState
pattern InputSecurityGroupState_UPDATING :: InputSecurityGroupState

pattern InputSourceEndBehavior_CONTINUE :: InputSourceEndBehavior
pattern InputSourceEndBehavior_LOOP :: InputSourceEndBehavior

-- | There are two types of input sources, static and dynamic. If an input
--   source is dynamic you can change the source url of the input
--   dynamically using an input switch action. However, the only input type
--   to support a dynamic url at this time is MP4_FILE. By default all
--   input sources are static.
newtype InputSourceType
InputSourceType' :: Text -> InputSourceType
[fromInputSourceType] :: InputSourceType -> Text
pattern InputSourceType_DYNAMIC :: InputSourceType
pattern InputSourceType_STATIC :: InputSourceType

-- | If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file),
--   you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or

-- | Pipeline ID
newtype PipelineId
PipelineId' :: Text -> PipelineId
[fromPipelineId] :: PipelineId -> Text
pattern PipelineId_PIPELINE_0 :: PipelineId
pattern PipelineId_PIPELINE_1 :: PipelineId

-- | Indicates which pipeline is preferred by the multiplex for program
--   ingest. If set to \"PIPELINE_0\" or \"PIPELINE_1\" and an unhealthy
--   ingest causes the multiplex to switch to the non-preferred pipeline,
--   it will switch back once that ingest is healthy again. If set to
--   \"CURRENTLY_ACTIVE\", it will not switch back to the other pipeline
--   based on it recovering to a healthy state, it will only switch if the
--   active pipeline becomes unhealthy.
newtype PreferredChannelPipeline
PreferredChannelPipeline' :: Text -> PreferredChannelPipeline
[fromPreferredChannelPipeline] :: PreferredChannelPipeline -> Text
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_CURRENTLY_ACTIVE :: PreferredChannelPipeline
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_PIPELINE_0 :: PreferredChannelPipeline
pattern PreferredChannelPipeline_PIPELINE_1 :: PreferredChannelPipeline

-- | Corresponds to the archive_allowed parameter. A value of
--   ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED corresponds to 0 (false) in the SCTE-35
--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag' :: Text -> Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
[fromScte35ArchiveAllowedFlag] :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag -> Text
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag
pattern Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag_ARCHIVE_NOT_ALLOWED :: Scte35ArchiveAllowedFlag

-- | Corresponds to the device_restrictions parameter in a
--   segmentation_descriptor. If you include one of the "restriction" flags
--   then you must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35DeviceRestrictions
Scte35DeviceRestrictions' :: Text -> Scte35DeviceRestrictions
[fromScte35DeviceRestrictions] :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions -> Text
pattern Scte35DeviceRestrictions_NONE :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions
pattern Scte35DeviceRestrictions_RESTRICT_GROUP0 :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions
pattern Scte35DeviceRestrictions_RESTRICT_GROUP1 :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions
pattern Scte35DeviceRestrictions_RESTRICT_GROUP2 :: Scte35DeviceRestrictions

-- | Corresponds to the no_regional_blackout_flag parameter. A value of
--   REGIONAL_BLACKOUT corresponds to 0 (false) in the SCTE-35
--   specification. If you include one of the "restriction" flags then you
--   must include all four of them.
newtype Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag
Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag' :: Text -> Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag
[fromScte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag] :: Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag -> Text
pattern Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag_NO_REGIONAL_BLACKOUT :: Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag
pattern Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag_REGIONAL_BLACKOUT :: Scte35NoRegionalBlackoutFlag

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_NOT_CANCELED corresponds to 0 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is an insertion request.
--   SEGMENTATION_EVENT_CANCELED corresponds to 1 in the SCTE-35
--   specification and indicates that this is a cancelation request, in
--   which case complete this field and the existing event ID to cancel.
newtype Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator' :: Text -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
[fromScte35SegmentationCancelIndicator] :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Text
pattern Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator_SEGMENTATION_EVENT_CANCELED :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator
pattern Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator_SEGMENTATION_EVENT_NOT_CANCELED :: Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator

pattern SmoothGroupSegmentationMode_USE_INPUT_SEGMENTATION :: SmoothGroupSegmentationMode

-- | Aac Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAacSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AacSettings
AacSettings' :: Maybe AacRateControlMode -> Maybe AacCodingMode -> Maybe AacSpec -> Maybe AacRawFormat -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AacInputType -> Maybe AacProfile -> Maybe AacVbrQuality -> Maybe Double -> AacSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>AacSettings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateControlMode:AacSettings'</a>,
--   <a>aacSettings_rateControlMode</a> - Rate Control Mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_codingMode</a> -
--   Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate
--   control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo
--   description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the
--   description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per
--   ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spec:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_spec</a> - Use MPEG-2
--   AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawFormat:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_rawFormat</a> -
--   Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sampleRate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_sampleRate</a> -
--   Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputType:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_inputType</a> - Set
--   to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio + AD
--   (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will be
--   set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream
--   contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the
--   encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the
--   mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in
--   AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd. Leave
--   set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profile:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_profile</a> - AAC
--   Profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vbrQuality:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_vbrQuality</a> -
--   VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:AacSettings'</a>, <a>aacSettings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control mode and
--   profile.
newAacSettings :: AacSettings

-- | Ac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAc3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Ac3Settings
Ac3Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Ac3DrcProfile -> Maybe Ac3CodingMode -> Maybe Ac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Ac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Ac3MetadataControl -> Ac3Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>Ac3Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_dialnorm</a> - Sets
--   the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcProfile:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_drcProfile</a> -
--   If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to
--   the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 for background
--   on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Ac3Settings'</a>, <a>ac3Settings_bitrate</a> - Average
--   bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Ac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>ac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to "followInput",
--   encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder
--   that supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of
--   these streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newAc3Settings :: Ac3Settings

-- | Ancillary Source Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAncillarySourceSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AncillarySourceSettings
AncillarySourceSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>AncillarySourceSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceAncillaryChannelNumber:AncillarySourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ancillarySourceSettings_sourceAncillaryChannelNumber</a> -
--   Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to
--   extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the
--   ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan
--   to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass
--   through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field
--   blank because MediaLive ignores the field.
newAncillarySourceSettings :: AncillarySourceSettings

-- | Audio Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AudioDescription
AudioDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioType -> Maybe AudioCodecSettings -> Maybe AudioDescriptionLanguageCodeControl -> Maybe AudioDescriptionAudioTypeControl -> Maybe RemixSettings -> Maybe AudioNormalizationSettings -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCode</a> - RFC 5646 language code
--   representing the language of the audio output track. Only used if
--   languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is no ISO 639 language
--   code specified in the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioType:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioType</a> - Applies only if audioTypeControl
--   is useConfigured. The values for audioType are defined in ISO-IEC
--   13818-1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_codecSettings</a> - Audio codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCodeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_languageCodeControl</a> - Choosing followInput
--   will cause the ISO 639 language code of the output to follow the ISO
--   639 language code of the input. The languageCode will be used when
--   useConfigured is set, or when followInput is selected but there is no
--   ISO 639 language code specified by the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTypeControl:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioTypeControl</a> - Determines how audio type
--   is determined. followInput: If the input contains an ISO 639
--   audioType, then that value is passed through to the output. If the
--   input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. useConfigured: The value in Audio Type is
--   included in the output. Note that this field and audioType are both
--   ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remixSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_remixSettings</a> - Settings that control how
--   input audio channels are remixed into the output audio channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioNormalizationSettings:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioNormalizationSettings</a> - Advanced audio
--   normalization settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_streamName</a> - Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS
--   outputs. Indicates the name displayed by the player (eg. English, or
--   Director Commentary).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectorName:AudioDescription'</a>,
--   <a>audioDescription_audioSelectorName</a> - The name of the
--   AudioSelector used as the source for this AudioDescription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AudioDescription'</a>, <a>audioDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be unique
--   within this Live Event.
newAudioDescription :: Text -> Text -> AudioDescription

-- | Audio Language Selection
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioLanguageSelection</a> smart constructor.
data AudioLanguageSelection
AudioLanguageSelection' :: Maybe AudioLanguageSelectionPolicy -> Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioLanguageSelection</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageSelectionPolicy:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageSelectionPolicy</a> - When set to
--   "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies audio streams
--   by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs such that an
--   audio stream matching the initially selected language is no longer
--   present then mute will be encoded until the language returns. If
--   "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose another audio
--   stream in the program with the same stream type if it can't find one
--   with the same language.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:AudioLanguageSelection'</a>,
--   <a>audioLanguageSelection_languageCode</a> - Selects a specific
--   three-letter language code from within an audio source.
newAudioLanguageSelection :: Text -> AudioLanguageSelection

-- | Audio Normalization Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioNormalizationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioNormalizationSettings
AudioNormalizationSettings' :: Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithm -> Maybe Double -> Maybe AudioNormalizationAlgorithmControl -> AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioNormalizationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithm:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithm</a> - Audio normalization
--   algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM Act specification,
--   itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetLkfs:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_targetLkfs</a> - Target LKFS(loudness)
--   to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a default value will be
--   used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM Act (1770-1)
--   recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128 specification (1770-2)
--   recommends a target of -23 LKFS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithmControl:AudioNormalizationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioNormalizationSettings_algorithmControl</a> - When set to
--   correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the chosen algorithm.
--   If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured but not adjusted.
newAudioNormalizationSettings :: AudioNormalizationSettings

-- | Audio Only Hls Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data AudioOnlyHlsSettings
AudioOnlyHlsSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsTrackType -> Maybe AudioOnlyHlsSegmentType -> Maybe InputLocation -> AudioOnlyHlsSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>AudioOnlyHlsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioGroupId:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioGroupId</a> - Specifies the group to
--   which the audio Rendition belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioTrackType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioTrackType</a> - Four types of audio-only
--   tracks are supported: Audio-Only Variant Stream The client can play
--   back this audio-only stream instead of video in low-bandwidth
--   scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF in the HLS manifest.
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client should try to play back by default. Represented as an
--   EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES, AUTOSELECT=YES
--   Alternate Audio, Auto Select, Not Default Alternate rendition that the
--   client may try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA
--   in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YES Alternate Audio,
--   not Auto Select Alternate rendition that the client will not try to
--   play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS
--   manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentType:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_segmentType</a> - Specifies the segment type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioOnlyImage:AudioOnlyHlsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>audioOnlyHlsSettings_audioOnlyImage</a> - Optional. Specifies the
--   .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for an audio-only output.
--   We recommend a low bit-size file because the image increases the
--   output audio bandwidth. The image is attached to the audio as an ID3
--   tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per the "ID3 tag version
--   2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.
newAudioOnlyHlsSettings :: AudioOnlyHlsSettings

--

--   constructor.
data AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomaticInputFailoverSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failoverConditions:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_failoverConditions</a> - A list of
--   failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur, MediaLive will
--   perform a failover to the other input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorClearTimeMsec:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_errorClearTimeMsec</a> - This clear
--   time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to be
--   considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for
--   this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is
--   particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair
--   is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive
--   will switch back to the primary input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPreference:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_inputPreference</a> - Input
--   preference when deciding which input to make active when a previously
--   failed input has recovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secondaryInputId:AutomaticInputFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>automaticInputFailoverSettings_secondaryInputId</a> - The input ID
--   of the secondary input in the automatic input failover pair.
newAutomaticInputFailoverSettings :: Text -> AutomaticInputFailoverSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>BlackoutSlate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   supported.
--

--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackout</a> - Setting to enabled causes
--   the encoder to blackout the video, audio, and captions, and raise the
--   "Network Blackout Image" slate when an SCTE104/35 Network End
--   Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The blackout will be lifted
--   when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The
--   Network End and Network Start descriptors must contain a network ID
--   that matches the value entered in "Network ID".
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkEndBlackoutImage:BlackoutSlate'</a>,
--   <a>blackoutSlate_networkEndBlackoutImage</a> - Path to local file to
--   use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be scaled to fill the
--   entire output raster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_state</a> - When
--   set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when
--   indicated by program metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkId:BlackoutSlate'</a>, <a>blackoutSlate_networkId</a> -
--   Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g.,
--   "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").
newBlackoutSlate :: BlackoutSlate

-- | Burn In Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBurnInDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data BurnInDestinationSettings
BurnInDestinationSettings' :: Maybe BurnInAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInShadowColor -> Maybe BurnInOutlineColor -> Maybe BurnInTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe BurnInFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe BurnInBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>BurnInDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to 'auto'
--   fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a
--   positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:BurnInDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>burnInDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newBurnInDestinationSettings :: BurnInDestinationSettings

-- | Caption Description
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionDescription
CaptionDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaptionDestinationSettings -> Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageCode</a> - ISO 639-2 three-digit code:
--   http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageDescription:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_languageDescription</a> - Human readable
--   information to indicate captions available for players (eg. English,
--   or Spanish).
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationSettings:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_destinationSettings</a> - Additional settings
--   for captions destination that depend on the destination type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectorName:CaptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>captionDescription_captionSelectorName</a> - Specifies which input
--   caption selector to use as a caption source when generating output
--   captions. This field should match a captionSelector name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CaptionDescription'</a>, <a>captionDescription_name</a> -
--   Name of the caption description. Used to associate a caption
--   description with an output. Names must be unique within an event.
newCaptionDescription :: Text -> Text -> CaptionDescription

newCaptionLanguageMapping :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> CaptionLanguageMapping

-- | Caption Rectangle
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCaptionRectangle</a> smart constructor.
data CaptionRectangle
CaptionRectangle' :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

-- | Create a value of <a>CaptionRectangle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_topOffset</a> - See the description in leftOffset.
--   For topOffset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle,
--   as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the
--   top edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the measurement is
--   10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at
--   that position from the top edge of the frame. This field corresponds
--   to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_height</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For height, specify the entire
--   height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame
--   height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the
--   underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up
--   to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML
--   standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:CaptionRectangle'</a>, <a>captionRectangle_width</a> -
--   See the description in leftOffset. For width, specify the entire width
--   of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For
--   example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying
--   frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or
--   less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:leftOffset:CaptionRectangle'</a>,
--   <a>captionRectangle_leftOffset</a> - Applies only if you plan to
--   convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make
--   sure to leave the default if you don't have either of these formats in
--   the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that
--   is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle
--   by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge,
--   and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video
--   frame. The units for the measurements are percentages. If you specify
--   a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of
--   them. For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the
--   rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative
--   to the left edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the
--   measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left
--   edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame. This
--   field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
newCaptionRectangle :: Double -> Double -> Double -> Double -> CaptionRectangle

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannel</a> smart constructor.
data Channel
Channel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncoderSettings -> Maybe InputSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OutputDestination] -> Maybe ChannelState -> Maybe [InputAttachment] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [PipelineDetail] -> Maybe VpcOutputSettingsDescription -> Maybe CdiInputSpecification -> Maybe [ChannelEgressEndpoint] -> Channel

-- | Create a value of <a>Channel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_roleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the Channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encoderSettings:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_encoderSettings</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSpecification:Channel'</a>,
--   <a>channel_inputSpecification</a> - Specification of network and file
--   inputs for this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_arn</a> - The unique arn of the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_id</a> - The unique id of the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelinesRunningCount:Channel'</a>,
--   <a>channel_pipelinesRunningCount</a> - The number of currently healthy
--   pipelines.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_channelClass</a> - The
--   class for this channel. STANDARD for a channel with two pipelines or
--   SINGLE_PIPELINE for a channel with one pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_logLevel</a> - The log level
--   being written to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_name</a> - The name of the
--   channel. (user-mutable)
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_destinations</a> - A
--   list of destinations of the channel. For UDP outputs, there is one
--   destination per output. For other types (HLS, for example), there is
--   one destination per packager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_state</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachments:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_inputAttachments</a>
--   - List of input attachments for channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_tags</a> - A collection of
--   key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pipelineDetails:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_pipelineDetails</a> -
--   Runtime details for the pipelines of a running channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_vpc</a> - Settings for VPC output
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdiInputSpecification:Channel'</a>,
--   <a>channel_cdiInputSpecification</a> - Specification of CDI inputs for
--   this channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:egressEndpoints:Channel'</a>, <a>channel_egressEndpoints</a> -
--   The endpoints where outgoing connections initiate from
newChannel :: Channel

-- | DVB Service Description Table (SDT)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSdtSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSdtSettings
DvbSdtSettings' :: Maybe DvbSdtOutputSdt -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSdtSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSdtSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSdt:DvbSdtSettings'</a>, <a>dvbSdtSettings_outputSdt</a>
--   - Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The
--   sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output
--   stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from
--   input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the
--   input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The
--   sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The
--   sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceName</a> - The service name placed in the
--   serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is
--   256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceProviderName:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_serviceProviderName</a> - The service provider name
--   placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table.
--   Maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repInterval:DvbSdtSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSdtSettings_repInterval</a> - The number of milliseconds between
--   instances of this table in the output transport stream.
newDvbSdtSettings :: DvbSdtSettings

-- | Dvb Sub Destination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDvbSubDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DvbSubDestinationSettings
DvbSubDestinationSettings' :: Maybe DvbSubDestinationAlignment -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationShadowColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationOutlineColor -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationTeletextGridControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationFontColor -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputLocation -> Maybe DvbSubDestinationBackgroundColor -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>DvbSubDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignment:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_alignment</a> - If no explicit xPosition
--   or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the
--   captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left
--   alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x
--   and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter,
--   the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those
--   coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live
--   subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These
--   source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter
--   blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineColor</a> - Specifies font outline
--   color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teletextGridControl:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_teletextGridControl</a> - Controls
--   whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output
--   subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and
--   DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundOpacity</a> - Specifies the
--   opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent.
--   Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0
--   (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_xPosition</a> - Specifies the horizontal
--   position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in
--   pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels
--   from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the
--   horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment
--   parameter. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL,
--   608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontColor</a> - Specifies the color of
--   the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions
--   that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are
--   already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub
--   font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontSize</a> - When set to auto fontSize
--   will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive
--   integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and
--   DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowXOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowXOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:font:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_font</a> - External font file used for
--   caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the
--   user can select output fonts for many different types of input
--   captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system.
--   Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected
--   display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings
--   must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_backgroundColor</a> - Specifies the color
--   of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:yPosition:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_yPosition</a> - Specifies the vertical
--   position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A
--   value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the
--   top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption
--   will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. This option is
--   not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext.
--   These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outlineSize:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_outlineSize</a> - Specifies font outline
--   size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are
--   either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already
--   pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontResolution:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontResolution</a> - Font resolution in
--   DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font
--   settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowYOffset:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_shadowYOffset</a> - Specifies the
--   vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A
--   value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text.
--   All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontOpacity:DvbSubDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dvbSubDestinationSettings_fontOpacity</a> - Specifies the opacity
--   of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All
--   burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
newDvbSubDestinationSettings :: DvbSubDestinationSettings

-- | Eac3 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEac3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Eac3Settings
Eac3Settings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Eac3CodingMode -> Maybe Eac3LfeControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3DcFilter -> Maybe Eac3LfeFilter -> Maybe Eac3StereoDownmix -> Maybe Eac3DrcRf -> Maybe Eac3DrcLine -> Maybe Eac3PhaseControl -> Maybe Eac3SurroundExMode -> Maybe Eac3BitstreamMode -> Maybe Eac3AttenuationControl -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Eac3SurroundMode -> Maybe Eac3PassthroughControl -> Maybe Eac3MetadataControl -> Eac3Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>Eac3Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoCenterMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtCenterMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtCenterMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total center
--   mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dialnorm:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dialnorm</a> -
--   Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby
--   Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codingMode:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_codingMode</a> -
--   Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeControl:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeControl</a> -
--   When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:loRoSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_loRoSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left only/Right only
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ltRtSurroundMixLevel:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_ltRtSurroundMixLevel</a> - Left total/Right total
--   surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dcFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_dcFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input
--   channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lfeFilter:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_lfeFilter</a> -
--   When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel
--   prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stereoDownmix:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_stereoDownmix</a> - Stereo downmix preference. Only
--   used for 3/2 coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcRf:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcRf</a> - Sets the
--   profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures that the
--   instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:drcLine:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_drcLine</a> - Sets
--   the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phaseControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_phaseControl</a> - When set to shift90Degrees, applies
--   a 90-degree phase shift to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundExMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundExMode</a> - When encoding 3/2 audio, sets
--   whether an extra center back surround channel is matrix encoded into
--   the left and right surround channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitstreamMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_bitstreamMode</a> - Specifies the bitstream mode
--   (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E)
--   for background on these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attenuationControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_attenuationControl</a> - When set to attenuate3Db,
--   applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2
--   coding mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:Eac3Settings'</a>, <a>eac3Settings_bitrate</a> -
--   Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding
--   mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:surroundMode:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_surroundMode</a> - When encoding 2/0 audio, sets
--   whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded into the two channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passthroughControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_passthroughControl</a> - When set to whenPossible,
--   input DD+ audio will be passed through if it is present on the input.
--   This detection is dynamic over the life of the transcode. Inputs that
--   alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content will have a consistent DD+
--   output as the system alternates between passthrough and encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataControl:Eac3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>eac3Settings_metadataControl</a> - When set to followInput, encoder
--   metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that
--   supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of these
--   streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.
newEac3Settings :: Eac3Settings

-- | Ebu Tt DDestination Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EbuTtDDestinationSettings
EbuTtDDestinationSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EbuTtDFillLineGapControl -> Maybe EbuTtDDestinationStyleControl -> Maybe Text -> EbuTtDDestinationSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>EbuTtDDestinationSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyrightHolder:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_copyrightHolder</a> - Applies only if you
--   plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an
--   output. Complete this field if you want to include the name of the
--   copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML
--   
--   <a>$sel:fillLineGap:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fillLineGap</a> - Specifies how to handle
--   the gap between the lines (in multi-line captions). - enabled: Fill
--   with the captions background color (as specified in the input
--   captions). - disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:styleControl:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Specifies the style
--   information (font color, font position, and so on) to include in the
--   font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions. - include: Take the
--   style information (font color, font position, and so on) from the
--   source captions and include that information in the font data attached
--   to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the source
--   captions are Embedded or Teletext. - exclude: In the font data
--   attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced".
--   Do not include any other style information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fontFamily:EbuTtDDestinationSettings'</a>,
--   <a>ebuTtDDestinationSettings_fontFamily</a> - Specifies the font
--   family to include in the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions.
--   Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you leave this field
--   empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If styleControl is set
--   to exclude, the font family is always set to "monospaced".) You
--   specify only the font family. All other style information (color,
--   bold, position and so on) is copied from the input captions. The size
--   is always set to 100% to allow the downstream player to choose the
--   size. - Enter a list of font families, as a comma-separated list of
--   font names, in order of preference. The name can be a font family
--   (such as Arial), or a generic font family (such as serif), or
--   default (to let the downstream player choose the font). - Leave
--   blank to set the family to monospace.
newEbuTtDDestinationSettings :: EbuTtDDestinationSettings

--   Embedded captions.

--   708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the
--   source content will be discarded.

--   608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract

data EncoderSettings

--   <a>$sel:motionGraphicsConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_motionGraphicsConfiguration</a> - Settings for
--   motion graphics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureActivations:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_featureActivations</a> - Feature Activations
--   
--   <a>$sel:globalConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_globalConfiguration</a> - Configuration settings
--   that apply to the event as a whole.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availConfiguration</a> - Event-wide configuration
--   settings for ad avail insertion.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availBlanking:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_availBlanking</a> - Settings for ad avail blanking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenConfiguration:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_nielsenConfiguration</a> - Nielsen configuration
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackoutSlate:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_blackoutSlate</a> - Settings for blackout slate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_captionDescriptions</a> - Settings for caption
--   decriptions
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_videoDescriptions</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioDescriptions:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_audioDescriptions</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputGroups:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_outputGroups</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeConfig:EncoderSettings'</a>,
--   <a>encoderSettings_timecodeConfig</a> - Contains settings used to
--   acquire and adjust timecode information from inputs.
newEncoderSettings :: TimecodeConfig -> EncoderSettings

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverConditionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverConditionSettings

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_videoBlackSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if content is considered black for the specified
--   period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_inputLossSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if content is not detected in this input for the
--   specified period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSilenceSettings:FailoverConditionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>failoverConditionSettings_audioSilenceSettings</a> - MediaLive will
--   perform a failover if the specified audio selector is silent for the
--   specified period.
newFailoverConditionSettings :: FailoverConditionSettings

data FeatureActivations

-- | Create a value of <a>FeatureActivations</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPrepareScheduleActions:FeatureActivations'</a>,
--   <a>featureActivations_inputPrepareScheduleActions</a> - Enables the
--   Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare actions in the
--   schedule only if this feature is enabled. If you disable the feature
--   on an existing schedule, make sure that you first delete all input
--   prepare actions from the schedule.
newFeatureActivations :: FeatureActivations

-- | Fec Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFecOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data FecOutputSettings
FecOutputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe FecOutputIncludeFec -> FecOutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>FecOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowLength:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_rowLength</a> - Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The width of the FEC protection matrix. Must be between 1 and 20,
--   inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then larger values increase
--   robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is the number of transport
--   stream packets per row error correction packet, and the value must be
--   between 4 and 20, inclusive, if includeFec is columnAndRow. If
--   includeFec is column, this value must be 1 to 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnDepth:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_columnDepth</a> - Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1.
--   The height of the FEC protection matrix. The number of transport
--   stream packets per column error correction packet. Must be between 4
--   and 20, inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeFec:FecOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fecOutputSettings_includeFec</a> - Enables column only or column
--   and row based FEC
newFecOutputSettings :: FecOutputSettings

-- | Start time for the action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:time:FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings'</a>,
--   <a>fixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings_time</a> - Start time for the
--   action to start in the channel. (Not the time for the action to be
--   added to the schedule: actions are always added to the schedule
--   immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All the letters
--   are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the two constants
--   "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
newFixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings :: Text -> FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   that control interactions with the CDN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:FrameCaptureGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>frameCaptureGroupSettings_destination</a> - The destination for the
--   frame capture files. Either the URI for an Amazon S3 bucket and
--   object, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   s3ssl://sportsDelivery/highlights/20180820/curling-) or the URI for a
--   MediaStore container, plus a file name prefix (for example,
--   mediastoressl://sportsDelivery/20180820/curling-). The final file
--   names consist of the prefix from the destination field (for example,
--   "curling-") + name modifier + the counter (5 digits, starting from
--   00001) + extension (which is always .jpg). For example,
--   curling-low.00001.jpg
newFrameCaptureGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> FrameCaptureGroupSettings

-- | Global Configuration
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlobalConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data GlobalConfiguration
GlobalConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationInputEndAction -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputLockingMode -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationLowFramerateInputs -> Maybe InputLossBehavior -> Maybe GlobalConfigurationOutputTimingSource -> GlobalConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>GlobalConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialAudioGain:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_initialAudioGain</a> - Value to set the initial
--   audio gain for the Live Event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputEndAction:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputEndAction</a> - Indicates the action to
--   take when the current input completes (e.g. end-of-file). When
--   switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will restart at the
--   beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured the encoder
--   will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user specified slate
--   images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration until the next
--   input switch occurs (which is controlled through the Channel Schedule
--   API).
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLockingMode:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputLockingMode</a> - Indicates how MediaLive
--   pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt
--   to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the other. EPOCH_LOCKING
--   - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to
--   the Unix epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportLowFramerateInputs:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_supportLowFramerateInputs</a> - Adjusts video
--   input buffer for streams with very low video framerates. This is
--   commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one video
--   frame per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossBehavior:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_inputLossBehavior</a> - Settings for system
--   actions when input is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputTimingSource:GlobalConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>globalConfiguration_outputTimingSource</a> - Indicates whether the
--   rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder should be paced by its
--   system clock (which optionally may be locked to another source via
--   NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source that is providing
--   the input stream.
newGlobalConfiguration :: GlobalConfiguration
