-- | H264 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newH264Settings</a> smart constructor.
data H264Settings
H264Settings' :: Maybe H264ScanType -> Maybe H264TemporalAq -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264FlickerAq -> Maybe H264GopBReference -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264RateControlMode -> Maybe H264QualityLevel -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264ColorMetadata -> Maybe H264EntropyEncoding -> Maybe H264GopSizeUnits -> Maybe H264SubGopLength -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe FixedAfd -> Maybe Double -> Maybe H264FilterSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264SpatialAq -> Maybe H264TimecodeInsertionBehavior -> Maybe H264SceneChangeDetect -> Maybe H264ParControl -> Maybe H264ColorSpaceSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264Syntax -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H264Level -> Maybe H264LookAheadRateControl -> Maybe H264Profile -> Maybe H264AdaptiveQuantization -> Maybe H264FramerateControl -> Maybe H264ForceFieldPictures -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe AfdSignaling -> H264Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>H264Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scanType:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_scanType</a> -
--   Sets the scan type of the output to progressive or top-field-first
--   interlaced.
--   
--   <a>$sel:temporalAq:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_temporalAq</a> -
--   Temporal makes adjustments within each frame based on temporal
--   variation of content complexity. The value to enter in this field
--   depends on the value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have
--   set the Adaptive quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any
--   value in this field. MediaLive will determine if temporal AQ is
--   appropriate and will apply the appropriate strength. If you have set
--   the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field
--   to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply temporal AQ
--   using the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply temporal
--   AQ. If you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive
--   ignores any value in this field and doesn't apply temporal AQ.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufSize:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_bufSize</a> - Size
--   of buffer (HRD buffer model) in bits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:flickerAq:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_flickerAq</a> -
--   Flicker AQ makes adjustments within each frame to reduce flicker or
--   'pop' on I-frames. The value to enter in this field depends on the
--   value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have set the Adaptive
--   quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any value in this field.
--   MediaLive will determine if flicker AQ is appropriate and will apply
--   the appropriate strength. If you have set the Adaptive quantization
--   field to a strength, you can set this field to Enabled or Disabled.
--   Enabled: MediaLive will apply flicker AQ using the specified strength.
--   Disabled: MediaLive won't apply flicker AQ. If you have set the
--   Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores any value in this
--   field and doesn't apply flicker AQ.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopBReference:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_gopBReference</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateNumerator:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_framerateNumerator</a> - Framerate numerator -
--   framerate is a fraction, e.g. 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 fps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateControlMode:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_rateControlMode</a> - Rate control mode. QVBR: Quality
--   will match the specified quality level except when it is constrained
--   by the maximum bitrate. Recommended if you or your viewers pay for
--   bandwidth. VBR: Quality and bitrate vary, depending on the video
--   complexity. Recommended instead of QVBR if you want to maintain a
--   specific average bitrate over the duration of the channel. CBR:
--   Quality varies, depending on the video complexity. Recommended only if
--   you distribute your assets to devices that cannot handle variable
--   bitrates. Multiplex: This rate control mode is only supported (and is
--   required) when the video is being delivered to a MediaLive Multiplex
--   in which case the rate control configuration is controlled by the
--   properties within the Multiplex Program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qualityLevel:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_qualityLevel</a> - Leave as STANDARD_QUALITY or choose
--   a different value (which might result in additional costs to run the
--   channel). - ENHANCED_QUALITY: Produces a slightly better video quality
--   without an increase in the bitrate. Has an effect only when the Rate
--   control mode is QVBR or CBR. If this channel is in a MediaLive
--   multiplex, the value must be ENHANCED_QUALITY. - STANDARD_QUALITY:
--   Valid for any Rate control mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:slices:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_slices</a> - Number
--   of slices per picture. Must be less than or equal to the number of
--   macroblock rows for progressive pictures, and less than or equal to
--   half the number of macroblock rows for interlaced pictures. This field
--   is optional; when no value is specified the encoder will choose the
--   number of slices based on encode resolution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorMetadata:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_colorMetadata</a> - Includes colorspace metadata in
--   the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entropyEncoding:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_entropyEncoding</a> - Entropy encoding mode. Use cabac
--   (must be in Main or High profile) or cavlc.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSizeUnits:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_gopSizeUnits</a> - Indicates if the gopSize is
--   specified in frames or seconds. If seconds the system will convert the
--   gopSize into a frame count at run time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subgopLength:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_subgopLength</a> - If set to fixed, use gopNumBFrames
--   B-frames per sub-GOP. If set to dynamic, optimize the number of
--   B-frames used for each sub-GOP to improve visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:softness:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_softness</a> -
--   Softness. Selects quantizer matrix, larger values reduce
--   high-frequency content in the encoded image. If not set to zero, must
--   be greater than 15.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateDenominator:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_framerateDenominator</a> - Framerate denominator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedAfd:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_fixedAfd</a> -
--   Four bit AFD value to write on all frames of video in the output
--   stream. Only valid when afdSignaling is set to 'Fixed'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSize:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_gopSize</a> - GOP
--   size (keyframe interval) in units of either frames or seconds per
--   gopSizeUnits. If gopSizeUnits is frames, gopSize must be an integer
--   and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is seconds,
--   gopSize must be greater than 0, but need not be an integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterSettings:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_filterSettings</a> - Optional filters that you can
--   apply to an encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parNumerator:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_parNumerator</a> - Pixel Aspect Ratio numerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopNumBFrames:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_gopNumBFrames</a> - Number of B-frames between
--   reference frames.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spatialAq:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_spatialAq</a> -
--   Spatial AQ makes adjustments within each frame based on spatial
--   variation of content complexity. The value to enter in this field
--   depends on the value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have
--   set the Adaptive quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any
--   value in this field. MediaLive will determine if spatial AQ is
--   appropriate and will apply the appropriate strength. If you have set
--   the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field
--   to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply spatial AQ using
--   the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply spatial AQ. If
--   you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores
--   any value in this field and doesn't apply spatial AQ.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeInsertion:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_timecodeInsertion</a> - Determines how timecodes
--   should be inserted into the video elementary stream. - 'disabled': Do
--   not include timecodes - 'picTimingSei': Pass through picture timing
--   SEI messages from the source specified in Timecode Config
--   
--   <a>$sel:sceneChangeDetect:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_sceneChangeDetect</a> - Scene change detection. - On:
--   inserts I-frames when scene change is detected. - Off: does not force
--   an I-frame when scene change is detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parControl:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_parControl</a> -
--   This field indicates how the output pixel aspect ratio is specified.
--   If "specified" is selected then the output video pixel aspect ratio is
--   determined by parNumerator and parDenominator, else if
--   "initializeFromSource" is selected then the output pixsel aspect ratio
--   will be set equal to the input video pixel aspect ratio of the first
--   input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceSettings:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_colorSpaceSettings</a> - Color Space settings
--   
--   <a>$sel:minIInterval:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_minIInterval</a> - Only meaningful if
--   sceneChangeDetect is set to enabled. Defaults to 5 if multiplex rate
--   control is used. Enforces separation between repeated (cadence)
--   I-frames and I-frames inserted by Scene Change Detection. If a scene
--   change I-frame is within I-interval frames of a cadence I-frame, the
--   GOP is shrunk and/or stretched to the scene change I-frame. GOP
--   stretch requires enabling lookahead as well as setting I-interval. The
--   normal cadence resumes for the next GOP. Note: Maximum GOP stretch =
--   GOP size + Min-I-interval - 1
--   
--   <a>$sel:qvbrQualityLevel:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_qvbrQualityLevel</a> - Controls the target quality for
--   the video encode. Applies only when the rate control mode is QVBR. You
--   can set a target quality or you can let MediaLive determine the best
--   quality. To set a target quality, enter values in the QVBR quality
--   level field and the Max bitrate field. Enter values that suit your
--   most important viewing devices. Recommended values are: - Primary
--   screen: Quality level: 8 to 10. Max bitrate: 4M - PC or tablet:
--   Quality level: 7. Max bitrate: 1.5M to 3M - Smartphone: Quality level:
--   6. Max bitrate: 1M to 1.5M To let MediaLive decide, leave the QVBR
--   quality level field empty, and in Max bitrate enter the maximum rate
--   you want in the video. For more information, see the section called
--   "Video - rate control mode" in the MediaLive user guide
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopClosedCadence:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_gopClosedCadence</a> - Frequency of closed GOPs. In
--   streaming applications, it is recommended that this be set to 1 so a
--   decoder joining mid-stream will receive an IDR frame as quickly as
--   possible. Setting this value to 0 will break output segmenting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parDenominator:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_parDenominator</a> - Pixel Aspect Ratio denominator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufFillPct:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_bufFillPct</a> -
--   Percentage of the buffer that should initially be filled (HRD buffer
--   model).
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_maxBitrate</a> -
--   For QVBR: See the tooltip for Quality level For VBR: Set the maximum
--   bitrate in order to accommodate expected spikes in the complexity of
--   the video.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syntax:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_syntax</a> -
--   Produces a bitstream compliant with SMPTE RP-2027.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRefFrames:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_numRefFrames</a> - Number of reference frames to use.
--   The encoder may use more than requested if using B-frames and/or
--   interlaced encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_level</a> - H.264
--   Level.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookAheadRateControl:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_lookAheadRateControl</a> - Amount of lookahead. A
--   value of low can decrease latency and memory usage, while high can
--   produce better quality for certain content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profile:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_profile</a> - H.264
--   Profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adaptiveQuantization:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_adaptiveQuantization</a> - Enables or disables
--   adaptive quantization, which is a technique MediaLive can apply to
--   video on a frame-by-frame basis to produce more compression without
--   losing quality. There are three types of adaptive quantization:
--   flicker, spatial, and temporal. Set the field in one of these ways:
--   Set to Auto. Recommended. For each type of AQ, MediaLive will
--   determine if AQ is needed, and if so, the appropriate strength. Set a
--   strength (a value other than Auto or Disable). This strength will
--   apply to any of the AQ fields that you choose to enable. Set to
--   Disabled to disable all types of adaptive quantization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateControl:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_framerateControl</a> - This field indicates how the
--   output video frame rate is specified. If "specified" is selected then
--   the output video frame rate is determined by framerateNumerator and
--   framerateDenominator, else if "initializeFromSource" is selected then
--   the output video frame rate will be set equal to the input video frame
--   rate of the first input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceFieldPictures:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_forceFieldPictures</a> - This setting applies only
--   when scan type is "interlaced." It controls whether coding is
--   performed on a field basis or on a frame basis. (When the video is
--   progressive, the coding is always performed on a frame basis.)
--   enabled: Force MediaLive to code on a field basis, so that odd and
--   even sets of fields are coded separately. disabled: Code the two sets
--   of fields separately (on a field basis) or together (on a frame basis
--   using PAFF), depending on what is most appropriate for the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:H264Settings'</a>, <a>h264Settings_bitrate</a> -
--   Average bitrate in bits/second. Required when the rate control mode is
--   VBR or CBR. Not used for QVBR. In an MS Smooth output group, each
--   output must have a unique value when its bitrate is rounded down to
--   the nearest multiple of 1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afdSignaling:H264Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h264Settings_afdSignaling</a> - Indicates that AFD values will be
--   written into the output stream. If afdSignaling is "auto", the system
--   will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD
--   values are valid). If set to "fixed", the AFD value will be the value
--   configured in the fixedAfd parameter.
newH264Settings :: H264Settings

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--

--   <a>h265ColorSpaceSettings_rec709Settings</a> - Undocumented member.

-- | H265 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newH265Settings</a> smart constructor.
data H265Settings
H265Settings' :: Maybe H265ScanType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H265FlickerAq -> Maybe H265RateControlMode -> Maybe H265AlternativeTransferFunction -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H265ColorMetadata -> Maybe H265GopSizeUnits -> Maybe FixedAfd -> Maybe Double -> Maybe H265FilterSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H265TimecodeInsertionBehavior -> Maybe H265SceneChangeDetect -> Maybe H265ColorSpaceSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe H265Level -> Maybe H265LookAheadRateControl -> Maybe H265Profile -> Maybe H265AdaptiveQuantization -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe AfdSignaling -> Maybe H265Tier -> Natural -> Natural -> H265Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>H265Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scanType:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_scanType</a> -
--   Sets the scan type of the output to progressive or top-field-first
--   interlaced.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufSize:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_bufSize</a> - Size
--   of buffer (HRD buffer model) in bits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:flickerAq:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_flickerAq</a> -
--   If set to enabled, adjust quantization within each frame to reduce
--   flicker or 'pop' on I-frames.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateControlMode:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_rateControlMode</a> - Rate control mode. QVBR: Quality
--   will match the specified quality level except when it is constrained
--   by the maximum bitrate. Recommended if you or your viewers pay for
--   bandwidth. CBR: Quality varies, depending on the video complexity.
--   Recommended only if you distribute your assets to devices that cannot
--   handle variable bitrates. Multiplex: This rate control mode is only
--   supported (and is required) when the video is being delivered to a
--   MediaLive Multiplex in which case the rate control configuration is
--   controlled by the properties within the Multiplex Program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alternativeTransferFunction:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_alternativeTransferFunction</a> - Whether or not EML
--   should insert an Alternative Transfer Function SEI message to support
--   backwards compatibility with non-HDR decoders and displays.
--   
--   <a>$sel:slices:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_slices</a> - Number
--   of slices per picture. Must be less than or equal to the number of
--   macroblock rows for progressive pictures, and less than or equal to
--   half the number of macroblock rows for interlaced pictures. This field
--   is optional; when no value is specified the encoder will choose the
--   number of slices based on encode resolution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorMetadata:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_colorMetadata</a> - Includes colorspace metadata in
--   the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSizeUnits:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_gopSizeUnits</a> - Indicates if the gopSize is
--   specified in frames or seconds. If seconds the system will convert the
--   gopSize into a frame count at run time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedAfd:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_fixedAfd</a> -
--   Four bit AFD value to write on all frames of video in the output
--   stream. Only valid when afdSignaling is set to 'Fixed'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSize:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_gopSize</a> - GOP
--   size (keyframe interval) in units of either frames or seconds per
--   gopSizeUnits. If gopSizeUnits is frames, gopSize must be an integer
--   and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is seconds,
--   gopSize must be greater than 0, but need not be an integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterSettings:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_filterSettings</a> - Optional filters that you can
--   apply to an encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parNumerator:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_parNumerator</a> - Pixel Aspect Ratio numerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeInsertion:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_timecodeInsertion</a> - Determines how timecodes
--   should be inserted into the video elementary stream. - 'disabled': Do
--   not include timecodes - 'picTimingSei': Pass through picture timing
--   SEI messages from the source specified in Timecode Config
--   
--   <a>$sel:sceneChangeDetect:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_sceneChangeDetect</a> - Scene change detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceSettings:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_colorSpaceSettings</a> - Color Space settings
--   
--   <a>$sel:minIInterval:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_minIInterval</a> - Only meaningful if
--   sceneChangeDetect is set to enabled. Defaults to 5 if multiplex rate
--   control is used. Enforces separation between repeated (cadence)
--   I-frames and I-frames inserted by Scene Change Detection. If a scene
--   change I-frame is within I-interval frames of a cadence I-frame, the
--   GOP is shrunk and/or stretched to the scene change I-frame. GOP
--   stretch requires enabling lookahead as well as setting I-interval. The
--   normal cadence resumes for the next GOP. Note: Maximum GOP stretch =
--   GOP size + Min-I-interval - 1
--   
--   <a>$sel:qvbrQualityLevel:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_qvbrQualityLevel</a> - Controls the target quality for
--   the video encode. Applies only when the rate control mode is QVBR. Set
--   values for the QVBR quality level field and Max bitrate field that
--   suit your most important viewing devices. Recommended values are: -
--   Primary screen: Quality level: 8 to 10. Max bitrate: 4M - PC or
--   tablet: Quality level: 7. Max bitrate: 1.5M to 3M - Smartphone:
--   Quality level: 6. Max bitrate: 1M to 1.5M
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopClosedCadence:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_gopClosedCadence</a> - Frequency of closed GOPs. In
--   streaming applications, it is recommended that this be set to 1 so a
--   decoder joining mid-stream will receive an IDR frame as quickly as
--   possible. Setting this value to 0 will break output segmenting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parDenominator:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_parDenominator</a> - Pixel Aspect Ratio denominator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_maxBitrate</a> -
--   For QVBR: See the tooltip for Quality level
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_level</a> - H.265
--   Level.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookAheadRateControl:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_lookAheadRateControl</a> - Amount of lookahead. A
--   value of low can decrease latency and memory usage, while high can
--   produce better quality for certain content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:profile:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_profile</a> - H.265
--   Profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adaptiveQuantization:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_adaptiveQuantization</a> - Adaptive quantization.
--   Allows intra-frame quantizers to vary to improve visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_bitrate</a> -
--   Average bitrate in bits/second. Required when the rate control mode is
--   VBR or CBR. Not used for QVBR. In an MS Smooth output group, each
--   output must have a unique value when its bitrate is rounded down to
--   the nearest multiple of 1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afdSignaling:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_afdSignaling</a> - Indicates that AFD values will be
--   written into the output stream. If afdSignaling is "auto", the system
--   will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD
--   values are valid). If set to "fixed", the AFD value will be the value
--   configured in the fixedAfd parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:H265Settings'</a>, <a>h265Settings_tier</a> - H.265 Tier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateNumerator:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_framerateNumerator</a> - Framerate numerator -
--   framerate is a fraction, e.g. 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 fps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateDenominator:H265Settings'</a>,
--   <a>h265Settings_framerateDenominator</a> - Framerate denominator.
newH265Settings :: Natural -> Natural -> H265Settings

-- | Hls Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHlsGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data HlsGroupSettings
HlsGroupSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsTimedMetadataId3Frame -> Maybe HlsIvInManifest -> Maybe HlsOutputSelection -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsEncryptionType -> Maybe HlsDirectoryStructure -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [HlsAdMarkers] -> Maybe HlsManifestCompression -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsCodecSpecification -> Maybe HlsCdnSettings -> Maybe HlsMode -> Maybe HlsStreamInfResolution -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsRedundantManifest -> Maybe HlsSegmentationMode -> Maybe HlsProgramDateTime -> Maybe IFrameOnlyPlaylistType -> Maybe HlsTsFileMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsDiscontinuityTags -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsId3SegmentTaggingState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HlsIncompleteSegmentBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputLossActionForHlsOut -> Maybe KeyProviderSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [CaptionLanguageMapping] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsClientCache -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsIvSource -> Maybe HlsCaptionLanguageSetting -> Maybe HlsManifestDurationFormat -> OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentLength</a> - Length of MPEG-2 Transport
--   Stream segments to create (in seconds). Note that segments will end on
--   the next keyframe after this number of seconds, so actual segment
--   length may be longer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Frame:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Frame</a> - Indicates ID3 frame
--   that has the timecode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivInManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivInManifest</a> - For use with encryptionType.
--   The IV (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction
--   with the key for encrypting blocks. If set to "include", IV is listed
--   in the manifest, otherwise the IV is not in the manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSelection:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_outputSelection</a> - MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates manifests (master manifest, if applicable, and media
--   manifests) for this output group. VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS:
--   Generates media manifests for this output group, but not a master
--   manifest. SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not generate any manifests for this
--   output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataId3Period:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timedMetadataId3Period</a> - Timed Metadata
--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_encryptionType</a> - Encrypts the segments with
--   the given encryption scheme. Exclude this parameter if no encryption
--   is desired.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryStructure:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_directoryStructure</a> - Place segments in
--   subdirectories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormat</a> - The value specifies how the key is
--   represented in the resource identified by the URI. If parameter is
--   absent, an implicit value of "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string
--   can also be given.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adMarkers:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_adMarkers</a> - Choose one or more ad marker types
--   to pass SCTE35 signals through to this group of Apple HLS outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestCompression:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestCompression</a> - When set to gzip,
--   compresses HLS playlist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constantIv:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_constantIv</a> - For use with encryptionType. This
--   is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character text
--   string. If ivSource is set to "explicit" then this parameter is
--   required and is used as the IV for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSpecification:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_codecSpecification</a> - Specification to use
--   (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8 playlist generation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsCdnSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsCdnSettings</a> - Parameters that control
--   interactions with the CDN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>, <a>hlsGroupSettings_mode</a> - If
--   "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the
--   destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments
--   specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments
--   replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all
--   the way to the beginning of the event. VOD mode uses HLS
--   EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting
--   it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamInfResolution:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_streamInfResolution</a> - Include or exclude
--   RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF tag of variant
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexNSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_indexNSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the maximum number of segments in the media manifest
--   file. After this maximum, older segments are removed from the media
--   manifest. This number must be smaller than the number in the Keep
--   Segments field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redundantManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_redundantManifest</a> - ENABLED: The master
--   manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information about
--   both pipelines: first its own media files, then the media files of the
--   other pipeline. This feature allows playout device that support stale
--   manifest detection to switch from one manifest to the other, when the
--   current manifest seems to be stale. There are still two destinations
--   and two master manifests, but both master manifests reference the
--   media files from both pipelines. DISABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8
--   file) for each pipeline includes information about its own pipeline
--   only. For an HLS output group with MediaPackage as the destination,
--   the DISABLED behavior is always followed. MediaPackage regenerates the
--   manifests it serves to players so a redundant manifest from MediaLive
--   is irrelevant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentationMode</a> - useInputSegmentation has
--   been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTime:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTime</a> - Includes or excludes
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest files. The value is
--   calculated as follows: either the program date and time are
--   initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is
--   initialized using the input timecode source and the date is
--   initialized using the timestampOffset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iFrameOnlyPlaylists:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_iFrameOnlyPlaylists</a> - DISABLED: Do not create
--   an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the master and media manifests
--   (according to the Output Selection field). STANDARD: Create an
--   I-frame-only manifest for each output that contains video, as well as
--   the other manifests (according to the Output Selection field). The
--   I-frame manifest contains a #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is
--   I-frame only, and one or more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the
--   I-frame position. For example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"
--   
--   <a>$sel:tsFileMode:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_tsFileMode</a> - SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program
--   as segments - multiple .ts media files. SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if
--   Mode field is VOD. Emit the program as a single .ts media file. The
--   media manifest includes #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for
--   playback. A typical use for this value is when sending the output to
--   AWS Elemental MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file.
--   Playback while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP
--   server caching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentsPerSubdirectory:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_segmentsPerSubdirectory</a> - Number of segments
--   to write to a subdirectory before starting a new one.
--   directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting to
--   have an effect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:discontinuityTags:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_discontinuityTags</a> - Specifies whether to
--   insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child manifests for this
--   output group. Typically, choose Insert because these tags are required
--   in the manifest (according to the HLS specification) and serve an
--   important purpose. Choose Never Insert only if the downstream system
--   is doing real-time failover (without using the MediaLive automatic
--   failover feature) and only if that downstream system has advised you
--   to exclude the tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsId3SegmentTagging:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_hlsId3SegmentTagging</a> - State of HLS ID3
--   Segment Tagging
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest</a> - A partial URI prefix that
--   will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used
--   if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incompleteSegmentBehavior:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_incompleteSegmentBehavior</a> - Specifies whether
--   to include the final (incomplete) segment in the media output when the
--   pipeline stops producing output because of a channel stop, a channel
--   pause or a loss of input to the pipeline. Auto means that MediaLive
--   decides whether to include the final segment, depending on the channel
--   class and the types of output groups. Suppress means to never include
--   the incomplete segment. We recommend you choose Auto and let MediaLive
--   control the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlContent1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlContent1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. This field is required only if you are completing Base
--   URL content A, and the downstream system has notified you that the
--   media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location different
--   from the media files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Parameter that control
--   output group behavior on input loss.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyProviderSettings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyProviderSettings</a> - The key provider
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepSegments:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keepSegments</a> - Applies only if Mode field is
--   LIVE. Specifies the number of media segments to retain in the
--   destination directory. This number should be bigger than
--   indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x
--   indexNsegments) + 1). If this "keep segments" number is too low, the
--   following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest
--   file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from
--   the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This
--   situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageMappings:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageMappings</a> - Mapping of up to 4
--   caption channels to caption languages. Is only meaningful if
--   captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampDeltaMilliseconds:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_timestampDeltaMilliseconds</a> - Provides an extra
--   millisecond delta offset to fine tune the timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseUrlManifest1:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_baseUrlManifest1</a> - Optional. One value per
--   output group. Complete this field only if you are completing Base URL
--   manifest A, and the downstream system has notified you that the child
--   manifest files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location
--   different from the child manifest files for pipeline 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programDateTimePeriod:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_programDateTimePeriod</a> - Period of insertion of
--   EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientCache:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_clientCache</a> - When set to "disabled", sets the
--   #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the manifest, which prevents clients from
--   saving media segments for later replay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyFormatVersions:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_keyFormatVersions</a> - Either a single positive
--   integer version value or a slash delimited list of version values
--   (1/2/3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minSegmentLength:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_minSegmentLength</a> - When set,
--   minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back within the
--   specified range for a nearby avail and extending the segment size if
--   needed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ivSource:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_ivSource</a> - For use with encryptionType. The IV
--   (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction with
--   the key for encrypting blocks. If this setting is
--   "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to change every segment
--   (to match the segment number). If this is set to "explicit", you must
--   enter a constantIv value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionLanguageSetting:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_captionLanguageSetting</a> - Applies only to 608
--   Embedded output captions. insert: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the
--   manifest. Specify at least one language in the CC1 Language Code
--   field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for each Language Code you
--   specify. Make sure to specify the languages in the order in which they
--   appear in the original source (if the source is embedded format) or
--   the order of the caption selectors (if the source is other than
--   embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest will not match up
--   properly with the output captions. none: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE
--   line in the manifest. omit: Omit any CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manifestDurationFormat:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_manifestDurationFormat</a> - Indicates whether the
--   output manifest should use floating point or integer values for
--   segment duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:HlsGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsGroupSettings_destination</a> - A directory or HTTP destination
--   for the HLS segments, manifest files, and encryption keys (if
--   enabled).
newHlsGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> HlsGroupSettings

data HlsInputSettings
HlsInputSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe HlsScte35SourceType -> HlsInputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>HlsInputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryInterval:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_retryInterval</a> - The number of seconds between
--   retries when an attempt to read a manifest or segment fails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bandwidth:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bandwidth</a> - When specified the HLS stream with
--   the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most closely matches this value will be
--   chosen, otherwise the highest bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be
--   chosen. The bitrate is specified in bits per second, as in an HLS
--   manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retries:HlsInputSettings'</a>, <a>hlsInputSettings_retries</a>
--   - The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or
--   segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferSegments:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_bufferSegments</a> - When specified, reading of
--   the HLS input will begin this many buffer segments from the end (most
--   recently written segment). When not specified, the HLS input will
--   begin with the first segment specified in the m3u8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Source:HlsInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>hlsInputSettings_scte35Source</a> - Identifies the source for the
--   SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will ingest. Messages can be ingested
--   from the content segments (in the stream) or from tags in the playlist
--   (the HLS manifest). MediaLive ignores SCTE-35 information in the
--   source that is not selected.
newHlsInputSettings :: HlsInputSettings

-- | Placeholder documentation for Input
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInput</a> smart constructor.
data Input
Input' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [InputSource] -> Maybe [MediaConnectFlow] -> Maybe InputSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InputDestination] -> Maybe InputState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe InputClass -> Maybe InputType -> Maybe [InputDeviceSettings] -> Maybe [Text] -> Input

-- | Create a value of <a>Input</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:Input'</a>, <a>input_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during and after creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputPartnerIds:Input'</a>, <a>input_inputPartnerIds</a> - A
--   list of IDs for all Inputs which are partners of this one.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sources:Input'</a>, <a>input_sources</a> - A list of the
--   sources of the input (PULL-type).
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaConnectFlows:Input'</a>, <a>input_mediaConnectFlows</a> -
--   A list of MediaConnect Flows for this input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSourceType:Input'</a>, <a>input_inputSourceType</a> -
--   Certain pull input sources can be dynamic, meaning that they can have
--   their URL's dynamically changes during input switch actions.
--   Presently, this functionality only works with MP4_FILE inputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Input'</a>, <a>input_arn</a> - The Unique ARN of the input
--   (generated, immutable).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Input'</a>, <a>input_id</a> - The generated ID of the input
--   (unique for user account, immutable).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroups:Input'</a>, <a>input_securityGroups</a> - A
--   list of IDs for all the Input Security Groups attached to the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Input'</a>, <a>input_name</a> - The user-assigned name
--   (This is a mutable value).
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:Input'</a>, <a>input_destinations</a> - A list of
--   the destinations of the input (PUSH-type).
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Input'</a>, <a>input_state</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Input'</a>, <a>input_tags</a> - A collection of key-value
--   pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClass:Input'</a>, <a>input_inputClass</a> - STANDARD -
--   MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this input. If the
--   channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested. If the
--   channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be ingested;
--   the second source will always be ignored, even if the first source
--   fails. SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to this
--   input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is
--   valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid
--   because the channel requires two sources in the input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Input'</a>, <a>input_type</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDevices:Input'</a>, <a>input_inputDevices</a> - Settings
--   for the input devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedChannels:Input'</a>, <a>input_attachedChannels</a> - A
--   list of channel IDs that that input is attached to (currently an input
--   can only be attached to one channel).
newInput :: Input

-- | Placeholder documentation for InputAttachment
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputAttachment</a> smart constructor.
data InputAttachment
InputAttachment' :: Maybe InputSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutomaticInputFailoverSettings -> InputAttachment

-- | Create a value of <a>InputAttachment</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSettings:InputAttachment'</a>,
--   <a>inputAttachment_inputSettings</a> - Settings of an input (caption
--   selector, etc.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputId:InputAttachment'</a>, <a>inputAttachment_inputId</a> -
--   The ID of the input
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentName:InputAttachment'</a>,
--   <a>inputAttachment_inputAttachmentName</a> - User-specified name for
--   the attachment. This is required if the user wants to use this input
--   in an input switch action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:automaticInputFailoverSettings:InputAttachment'</a>,
--   <a>inputAttachment_automaticInputFailoverSettings</a> - User-specified
--   settings for defining what the conditions are for declaring the input
--   unhealthy and failing over to a different input.
newInputAttachment :: InputAttachment

--   <a>$sel:gain:InputChannelLevel'</a>, <a>inputChannelLevel_gain</a> -
--   Remixing value. Units are in dB and acceptable values are within the
--   range from -60 (mute) and 6 dB.
newInputChannelLevel :: Natural -> Int -> InputChannelLevel

--   <a>inputDeviceConfigurableSettings_configuredInput</a> - The input
--   source that you want to use. If the device has a source connected to
--   only one of its input ports, or if you don't care which source the
--   device sends, specify Auto. If the device has sources connected to
--   both its input ports, and you want to use a specific source, specify
--   the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBitrate:InputDeviceConfigurableSettings'</a>,

--   bitrate in bits per second. Set a value here to throttle the bitrate
--   of the source video.
newInputDeviceConfigurableSettings :: InputDeviceConfigurableSettings

data InputDeviceHdSettings
InputDeviceHdSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceScanType -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceConfiguredInput -> Maybe Double -> Maybe InputDeviceState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InputDeviceActiveInput -> InputDeviceHdSettings

--   in pixels.

--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_scanType</a> - The scan type of the video
--   source.

--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_width</a> - The width of the video source, in
--   pixels.
--

--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_configuredInput</a> - The source at the input
--   device that is currently active. You can specify this source.
--

--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_framerate</a> - The frame rate of the video
--   source.
--

--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_deviceState</a> - The state of the input
--   device.

--   for ingesting this source, in bits per second. You can specify this
--   maximum.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeInput:InputDeviceHdSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceHdSettings_activeInput</a> - If you specified Auto as
--   the configured input, specifies which of the sources is currently
--   active (SDI or HDMI).
newInputDeviceHdSettings :: InputDeviceHdSettings

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   an input device that is type UHD.

--   input device.

--   input device that is type HD.
--

--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_connectionState</a> - The state of the
--   connection between the input device and AWS.

--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_networkSettings</a> - Network settings for the
--   input device.

--   unique ID of the input device.
--

--   A name that you specify for the input device.
--

--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_serialNumber</a> - The unique serial number of
--   the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':InputDeviceSummary'</a>, <a>inputDeviceSummary_type</a>
--   - The type of the input device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceSettingsSyncState:InputDeviceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>inputDeviceSummary_deviceSettingsSyncState</a> - The status of the
--   action to synchronize the device configuration. If you change the
--   configuration of the input device (for example, the maximum bitrate),
--   MediaLive sends the new data to the device. The device might not
--   update itself immediately. SYNCED means the device has updated its
--   configuration. SYNCING means that it has not updated its
--   configuration.
newInputDeviceSummary :: InputDeviceSummary

-- | Input Loss Behavior
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossBehavior

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>inputLossBehavior_blackFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageColor:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageColor</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "color" this field specifies the color to use. Value: 6 hex
--   characters representing the values of RGB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageSlate:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageSlate</a> - When input loss image
--   type is "slate" these fields specify the parameters for accessing the
--   slate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:repeatFrameMsec:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_repeatFrameMsec</a> - Documentation update needed
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossImageType:InputLossBehavior'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossBehavior_inputLossImageType</a> - Indicates whether to
--   substitute a solid color or a slate into the output after input loss
--   exceeds blackFrameMsec.
newInputLossBehavior :: InputLossBehavior

-- | MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this
--   input for the specified period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLossFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputLossFailoverSettings
InputLossFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLossFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossThresholdMsec:InputLossFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputLossFailoverSettings_inputLossThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that no input is detected. After that time,
--   an input failover will occur.
newInputLossFailoverSettings :: InputLossFailoverSettings

-- | Action to prepare an input for a future immediate input switch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings
InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference</a>
--   - The name of the input attachment that should be prepared by this
--   action. If no name is provided, the action will stop the most recent
--   prepare (if any) when activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlPath:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_urlPath</a> - The value for the
--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputPrepareScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
newInputPrepareScheduleActionSettings :: InputPrepareScheduleActionSettings

-- | An Input Security Group
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InputSecurityGroup
InputSecurityGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InputSecurityGroupState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [InputWhitelistRule] -> Maybe [Text] -> InputSecurityGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_arn</a> -
--   Unique ARN of Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_id</a> - The
--   Id of the Input Security Group
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_state</a>
--   - The current state of the Input Security Group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InputSecurityGroup'</a>, <a>inputSecurityGroup_tags</a> -
--   A collection of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:whitelistRules:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_whitelistRules</a> - Whitelist rules and their
--   sync status
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputs:InputSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>inputSecurityGroup_inputs</a> - The list of inputs currently using
--   this Input Security Group.
newInputSecurityGroup :: InputSecurityGroup

-- | Live Event input parameters. There can be multiple inputs in a single
--   Live Event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data InputSettings
InputSettings' :: Maybe InputDenoiseFilter -> Maybe [AudioSelector] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Smpte2038DataPreference -> Maybe VideoSelector -> Maybe InputSourceEndBehavior -> Maybe InputFilter -> Maybe InputDeblockFilter -> Maybe [CaptionSelector] -> Maybe NetworkInputSettings -> InputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denoiseFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_denoiseFilter</a> - Enable or disable the denoise
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_audioSelectors</a> - Used to select the audio stream
--   to decode for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterStrength:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_filterStrength</a> - Adjusts the magnitude of
--   filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).
--   
--   <a>$sel:smpte2038DataPreference:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_smpte2038DataPreference</a> - Specifies whether to
--   extract applicable ancillary data from a SMPTE-2038 source in this
--   input. Applicable data types are captions, timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104
--   messages. - PREFER: Extract from SMPTE-2038 if present in this input,
--   otherwise extract from another source (if any). - IGNORE: Never
--   extract any ancillary data from SMPTE-2038.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoSelector:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_videoSelector</a> - Informs which video elementary
--   stream to decode for input types that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndBehavior:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_sourceEndBehavior</a> - Loop input if it is a file.
--   This allows a file input to be streamed indefinitely.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_inputFilter</a> - Turns on the filter for this input.
--   MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking filter enabled by default. 1) auto -
--   filtering will be applied depending on input type/quality 2) disabled
--   - no filtering will be applied to the input 3) forced - filtering will
--   be applied regardless of input type
--   
--   <a>$sel:deblockFilter:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_deblockFilter</a> - Enable or disable the deblock
--   filter when filtering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionSelectors:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_captionSelectors</a> - Used to select the caption
--   input to use for inputs that have multiple available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInputSettings:InputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSettings_networkInputSettings</a> - Input settings.
newInputSettings :: InputSettings

-- | The settings for a PULL type input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSource</a> smart constructor.
data InputSource

--   password from EC2 Parameter store.

--   username for the input source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:InputSource'</a>, <a>inputSource_url</a> - This represents
--   the customer's source URL where stream is pulled from.
newInputSource :: InputSource

-- | Settings for the "switch input" action: to switch from ingesting one
--   input to ingesting another input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe InputClippingSettings -> Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlPath:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_urlPath</a> - The value for the
--   variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance
--   of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input
--   switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect
--   the input to a different content source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputClippingSettings:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputClippingSettings</a> -
--   Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set
--   up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.
--

--   <a>$sel:inputAttachmentNameReference:InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>inputSwitchScheduleActionSettings_inputAttachmentNameReference</a>
--   - The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to
--   switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.
newInputSwitchScheduleActionSettings :: Text -> InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for a private VPC Input. When this property is specified, the
--   input destination addresses will be created in a VPC rather than with
--   public Internet addresses. This property requires setting the roleArn
--   property on Input creation. Not compatible with the
--   inputSecurityGroups property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputVpcRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InputVpcRequest
InputVpcRequest' :: Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> InputVpcRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>InputVpcRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Input VPC network interfaces.
--   Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then the VPC default
--   security group will be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:InputVpcRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inputVpcRequest_subnetIds</a> - A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. Subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones
--   (AZ).
newInputVpcRequest :: InputVpcRequest
