-- | M2ts Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newM2tsSettings</a> smart constructor.
data M2tsSettings
M2tsSettings' :: Maybe M2tsSegmentationMarkers -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsNielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe M2tsSegmentationStyle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsAudioBufferModel -> Maybe M2tsPcrControl -> Maybe M2tsEbpPlacement -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DvbNitSettings -> Maybe M2tsAudioInterval -> Maybe Double -> Maybe M2tsCcDescriptor -> Maybe M2tsScte35Control -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsAudioStreamType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsBufferModel -> Maybe M2tsAribCaptionsPidControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsKlv -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsRateMode -> Maybe DvbTdtSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DvbSdtSettings -> Maybe M2tsAbsentInputAudioBehavior -> Maybe Double -> Maybe M2tsEbifControl -> Maybe M2tsArib -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M2tsTimedMetadataBehavior -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe M2tsEsRateInPes -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> M2tsSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>M2tsSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMarkers:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationMarkers</a> - Inserts segmentation markers
--   at each segmentationTime period. raiSegstart sets the Random Access
--   Indicator bit in the adaptation field. raiAdapt sets the RAI bit and
--   adds the current timecode in the private data bytes. psiSegstart
--   inserts PAT and PMT tables at the start of segments. ebp adds Encoder
--   Boundary Point information to the adaptation field as per OpenCable
--   specification OC-SP-EBP-I01-130118. ebpLegacy adds Encoder Boundary
--   Point information to the adaptation field using a legacy proprietary
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:klvDataPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_klvDataPids</a>
--   - Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:etvSignalPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_etvSignalPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source ETV Signal data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPeriod:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrPeriod</a> -
--   Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock Reference (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pmtPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values
--   are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_videoPid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationStyle:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationStyle</a> - The segmentation style
--   parameter controls how segmentation markers are inserted into the
--   transport stream. With avails, it is possible that segments may be
--   truncated, which can influence where future segmentation markers are
--   inserted. When a segmentation style of "resetCadence" is selected and
--   a segment is truncated due to an avail, we will reset the segmentation
--   cadence. This means the subsequent segment will have a duration of
--   $segmentationTime seconds. When a segmentation style of
--   "maintainCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an
--   avail, we will not reset the segmentation cadence. This means the
--   subsequent segment will likely be truncated as well. However, all
--   segments after that will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds.
--   Note that EBP lookahead is a slight exception to this rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_timedMetadataPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) of the
--   timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a
--   decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioBufferModel:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioBufferModel</a> - When set to dvb, uses DVB
--   buffer model for Dolby Digital audio. When set to atsc, the ATSC model
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrControl:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrControl</a> -
--   When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpPlacement:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpPlacement</a> - Controls placement of EBP on Audio
--   PIDs. If set to videoAndAudioPids, EBP markers will be placed on the
--   video PID and all audio PIDs. If set to videoPid, EBP markers will be
--   placed on only the video PID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pmtInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbNitSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbNitSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Network Information
--   Table (NIT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpAudioInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpAudioInterval</a> - When videoAndFixedIntervals is
--   selected, audio EBP markers will be added to partitions 3 and 4. The
--   interval between these additional markers will be fixed, and will be
--   slightly shorter than the video EBP marker interval. Only available
--   when EBP Cablelabs segmentation markers are selected. Partitions 1 and
--   2 will always follow the video interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nullPacketBitrate:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_nullPacketBitrate</a> - Value in bits per second of
--   extra null packets to insert into the transport stream. This can be
--   used if a downstream encryption system requires periodic null packets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccDescriptor:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ccDescriptor</a> - When set to enabled, generates
--   captionServiceDescriptor in PMT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Control:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_scte35Control</a> - Optionally pass SCTE-35 signals
--   from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aribCaptionsPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB
--   Captions in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or
--   hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_audioPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or
--   0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:etvPlatformPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_etvPlatformPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source ETV Platform data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal
--   or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:patInterval:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_patInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioStreamType:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioStreamType</a> - When set to atsc, uses stream
--   type = 0x81 for AC3 and stream type = 0x87 for EAC3. When set to dvb,
--   uses stream type = 0x06.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programNum:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_programNum</a> -
--   The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferModel:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_bufferModel</a>
--   - Controls the timing accuracy for output network traffic. Leave as
--   MULTIPLEX to ensure accurate network packet timing. Or set to NONE,
--   which might result in lower latency but will result in more
--   variability in output network packet timing. This variability might
--   cause interruptions, jitter, or bursty behavior in your playback or
--   receiving devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aribCaptionsPidControl:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_aribCaptionsPidControl</a> - If set to auto, pid
--   number used for ARIB Captions will be auto-selected from unused pids.
--   If set to useConfigured, ARIB Captions will be on the configured pid
--   number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebpLookaheadMs:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_ebpLookaheadMs</a> - When set, enforces that Encoder
--   Boundary Points do not come within the specified time interval of each
--   other by looking ahead at input video. If another EBP is going to come
--   in within the specified time interval, the current EBP is not emitted,
--   and the segment is "stretched" to the next marker. The lookahead value
--   does not add latency to the system. The Live Event must be configured
--   elsewhere to create sufficient latency to make the lookahead accurate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_pcrPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport
--   stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value
--   as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:klv:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_klv</a> - If set to
--   passthrough, passes any KLV data from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_audioFramesPerPes</a> - The number of audio frames to
--   insert for each PES packet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateMode:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_rateMode</a> -
--   When vbr, does not insert null packets into transport stream to fill
--   specified bitrate. The bitrate setting acts as the maximum bitrate
--   when vbr is set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbTdtSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbTdtSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Time and Date Table
--   (TDT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecmPid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_ecmPid</a> - This
--   field is unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbSdtSettings:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbSdtSettings</a> - Inserts DVB Service Description
--   Table (SDT) at the specified table repetition interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:absentInputAudioBehavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_absentInputAudioBehavior</a> - When set to drop,
--   output audio streams will be removed from the program if the selected
--   input audio stream is removed from the input. This allows the output
--   audio configuration to dynamically change based on input
--   configuration. If this is set to encodeSilence, all output audio
--   streams will output encoded silence when not connected to an active
--   input stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationTime:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_segmentationTime</a> - The length in seconds of each
--   segment. Required unless markers is set to _none_.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebif:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_ebif</a> - If set to
--   passthrough, passes any EBIF data from the input source to this
--   output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arib:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_arib</a> - When set to
--   enabled, uses ARIB-compliant field muxing and removes video
--   descriptor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbTeletextPid:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_dvbTeletextPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) for input
--   source DVB Teletext data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal
--   or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to passthrough,
--   timed metadata will be passed through from input to output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fragmentTime:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_fragmentTime</a> - The length in seconds of each
--   fragment. Only used with EBP markers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitrate:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_bitrate</a> - The
--   output bitrate of the transport stream in bits per second. Setting to
--   0 lets the muxer automatically determine the appropriate bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:esRateInPes:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_esRateInPes</a>
--   - Include or exclude the ES Rate field in the PES header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transportStreamId:M2tsSettings'</a>,
--   <a>m2tsSettings_transportStreamId</a> - The value of the transport
--   stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dvbSubPids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_dvbSubPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this
--   output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges
--   and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal
--   values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182
--   (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Pid:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_scte35Pid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32
--   (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte27Pids:M2tsSettings'</a>, <a>m2tsSettings_scte27Pids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output.
--   Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by
--   comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
--   Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
newM2tsSettings :: M2tsSettings

-- | Settings information for the .m3u8 container
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newM3u8Settings</a> smart constructor.
data M3u8Settings
M3u8Settings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8NielsenId3Behavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8PcrControl -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe M3u8Scte35Behavior -> Maybe M3u8TimedMetadataBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> M3u8Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>M3u8Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPeriod:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrPeriod</a> -
--   Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock References (PCRs)
--   inserted into the transport stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pmtPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport
--   stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_videoPid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the
--   transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nielsenId3Behavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_nielsenId3Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough,
--   Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the
--   input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataPid:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_timedMetadataPid</a> - Packet Identifier (PID) of the
--   timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a
--   decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or
--   0x1ff6).
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrControl:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrControl</a> -
--   When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is
--   inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This
--   parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video
--   or audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pmtInterval:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pmtInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioPids:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_audioPids</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the
--   transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in
--   ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or
--   hexadecimal values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:patInterval:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_patInterval</a>
--   - The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the
--   output transport stream. A value of \"0\" writes out the PMT once per
--   segment file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:programNum:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_programNum</a> -
--   The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pcrPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_pcrPid</a> - Packet
--   Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport
--   stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value
--   as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioFramesPerPes:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_audioFramesPerPes</a> - The number of audio frames to
--   insert for each PES packet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecmPid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_ecmPid</a> - This
--   parameter is unused and deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Behavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_scte35Behavior</a> - If set to passthrough, passes any
--   SCTE-35 signals from the input source to this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timedMetadataBehavior:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_timedMetadataBehavior</a> - When set to passthrough,
--   timed metadata is passed through from input to output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transportStreamId:M3u8Settings'</a>,
--   <a>m3u8Settings_transportStreamId</a> - The value of the transport
--   stream ID field in the Program Map Table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scte35Pid:M3u8Settings'</a>, <a>m3u8Settings_scte35Pid</a> -
--   Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream.
--   Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
newM3u8Settings :: M3u8Settings

-- | Mpeg2 Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMpeg2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data Mpeg2Settings
Mpeg2Settings' :: Maybe Mpeg2ScanType -> Maybe Mpeg2DisplayRatio -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorMetadata -> Maybe Mpeg2GopSizeUnits -> Maybe Mpeg2SubGopLength -> Maybe FixedAfd -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Mpeg2FilterSettings -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Mpeg2TimecodeInsertionBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Mpeg2ColorSpace -> Maybe Mpeg2AdaptiveQuantization -> Maybe AfdSignaling -> Natural -> Natural -> Mpeg2Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>Mpeg2Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scanType:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_scanType</a> -
--   Set the scan type of the output to PROGRESSIVE or INTERLACED (top
--   field first).
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayAspectRatio:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_displayAspectRatio</a> - Sets the pixel aspect ratio
--   for the encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorMetadata:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_colorMetadata</a> - Specifies whether to include the
--   color space metadata. The metadata describes the color space that
--   applies to the video (the colorSpace field). We recommend that you
--   insert the metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSizeUnits:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopSizeUnits</a> - Relates to the GOP structure.
--   Specifies whether the gopSize is specified in frames or seconds. If
--   you do not plan to change the default gopSize, leave the default. If
--   you specify SECONDS, MediaLive will internally convert the gop size to
--   a frame count.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subgopLength:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_subgopLength</a> - Relates to the GOP structure. If
--   you do not know what GOP is, use the default. FIXED: Set the number of
--   B-frames in each sub-GOP to the value in gopNumBFrames. DYNAMIC: Let
--   MediaLive optimize the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP, to improve
--   visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedAfd:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_fixedAfd</a> -
--   Complete this field only when afdSignaling is set to FIXED. Enter the
--   AFD value (4 bits) to write on all frames of the video encode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopSize:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_gopSize</a> -
--   Relates to the GOP structure. The GOP size (keyframe interval) in the
--   units specified in gopSizeUnits. If you do not know what GOP is, use
--   the default. If gopSizeUnits is frames, then the gopSize must be an
--   integer and must be greater than or equal to 1. If gopSizeUnits is
--   seconds, the gopSize must be greater than 0, but does not need to be
--   an integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterSettings:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_filterSettings</a> - Optionally specify a noise
--   reduction filter, which can improve quality of compressed content. If
--   you do not choose a filter, no filter will be applied. TEMPORAL: This
--   filter is useful for both source content that is noisy (when it has
--   excessive digital artifacts) and source content that is clean. When
--   the content is noisy, the filter cleans up the source content before
--   the encoding phase, with these two effects: First, it improves the
--   output video quality because the content has been cleaned up.
--   Secondly, it decreases the bandwidth because MediaLive does not waste
--   bits on encoding noise. When the content is reasonably clean, the
--   filter tends to decrease the bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopNumBFrames:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopNumBFrames</a> - Relates to the GOP structure. The
--   number of B-frames between reference frames. If you do not know what a
--   B-frame is, use the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timecodeInsertion:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_timecodeInsertion</a> - Determines how MediaLive
--   inserts timecodes in the output video. For detailed information about
--   setting up the input and the output for a timecode, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Timecode configuration\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. DISABLED: do not include timecodes. GOP_TIMECODE: Include
--   timecode metadata in the GOP header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gopClosedCadence:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_gopClosedCadence</a> - MPEG2: default is open GOP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpace:Mpeg2Settings'</a>, <a>mpeg2Settings_colorSpace</a>
--   - Choose the type of color space conversion to apply to the output.
--   For detailed information on setting up both the input and the output
--   to obtain the desired color space in the output, see the section on
--   \"MediaLive Features - Video - color space\" in the MediaLive User
--   Guide. PASSTHROUGH: Keep the color space of the input content - do not
--   convert it. AUTO:Convert all content that is SD to rec 601, and
--   convert all content that is HD to rec 709.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adaptiveQuantization:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_adaptiveQuantization</a> - Choose Off to disable
--   adaptive quantization. Or choose another value to enable the quantizer
--   and set its strength. The strengths are: Auto, Off, Low, Medium, High.
--   When you enable this field, MediaLive allows intra-frame quantizers to
--   vary, which might improve visual quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afdSignaling:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_afdSignaling</a> - Indicates the AFD values that
--   MediaLive will write into the video encode. If you do not know what
--   AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not given you
--   guidance, choose AUTO. AUTO: MediaLive will try to preserve the input
--   AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid). FIXED:
--   MediaLive will use the value you specify in fixedAFD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateNumerator:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_framerateNumerator</a> - The framerate numerator. For
--   example, 24000. The framerate is the numerator divided by the
--   denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:framerateDenominator:Mpeg2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>mpeg2Settings_framerateDenominator</a> - description": "The
--   framerate denominator. For example, 1001. The framerate is the
--   numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 =
--   23.976 FPS.
newMpeg2Settings :: Natural -> Natural -> Mpeg2Settings

data MsSmoothGroupSettings
MsSmoothGroupSettings' :: Maybe SmoothGroupStreamManifestBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupCertificateMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSegmentationMode -> Maybe SmoothGroupAudioOnlyTimecodeControl -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventIdMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SmoothGroupSparseTrackType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InputLossActionForMsSmoothOut -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SmoothGroupEventStopBehavior -> Maybe SmoothGroupTimestampOffsetMode -> Maybe Natural -> OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamManifestBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_streamManifestBehavior</a> - When set to
--   send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't start until all
--   streams start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filecacheDuration:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_filecacheDuration</a> - Size in seconds of
--   file cache for streaming outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fragmentLength:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_fragmentLength</a> - Length of mp4 fragments
--   to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must be compatible with GOP
--   size and framerate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventId</a> - MS Smooth event ID to be sent
--   to the IIS server. Should only be specified if eventIdMode is set to
--   useConfigured.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_certificateMode</a> - If set to
--   verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a trusted
--   Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acquisitionPointId:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_acquisitionPointId</a> - The ID to include in
--   each message in the sparse track. Ignored if sparseTrackType is NONE.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_segmentationMode</a> - useInputSegmentation
--   has been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioOnlyTimecodeControl:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_audioOnlyTimecodeControl</a> - If set to
--   passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment absolute
--   time will be set to the current timecode. This option does not write
--   timecodes to the audio elementary stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventIdMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventIdMode</a> - Specifies whether or not to
--   send an event ID to the IIS server. If no event ID is sent and the
--   same Live Event is used without changing the publishing point, clients
--   might see cached video from the previous run. Options: -
--   "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId - "useTimestamp" -
--   generate and send an event ID based on the current timestamp -
--   "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendDelayMs:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_sendDelayMs</a> - Number of milliseconds to
--   delay the output from the second pipeline.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sparseTrackType:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_sparseTrackType</a> - Identifies the type of
--   data to place in the sparse track: - SCTE35: Insert SCTE-35 messages
--   from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR frame to
--   start a new segment. - SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35
--   messages from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR
--   frame but don't start a new segment. - NONE: Don't generate a sparse
--   track for any outputs in this output group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of
--   seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server if the
--   connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and the
--   cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection is
--   re-established.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Parameter that control
--   output group behavior on input loss.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampOffset:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffset</a> - Timestamp offset for
--   the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is set to
--   useConfiguredOffset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventStopBehavior:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_eventStopBehavior</a> - When set to sendEos,
--   send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the event
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampOffsetMode:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_timestampOffsetMode</a> - Type of timestamp
--   date offset to use. - useEventStartDate: Use the date the event was
--   started as the offset - useConfiguredOffset: Use an explicitly
--   configured date as the offset
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_restartDelay</a> - Number of seconds before
--   initiating a restart due to output failure, due to exhausting the
--   numRetries on one segment, or exceeding filecacheDuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:MsSmoothGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothGroupSettings_destination</a> - Smooth Streaming publish
--   point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts as a "Push" encoder to
--   IIS.
newMsSmoothGroupSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> MsSmoothGroupSettings

-- | Ms Smooth Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMsSmoothOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MsSmoothOutputSettings
MsSmoothOutputSettings' :: Maybe MsSmoothH265PackagingType -> Maybe Text -> MsSmoothOutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>MsSmoothOutputSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:h265PackagingType:MsSmoothOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothOutputSettings_h265PackagingType</a> - Only applicable when
--   this output is referencing an H.265 video description. Specifies
--   whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1 or HVC1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nameModifier:MsSmoothOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>msSmoothOutputSettings_nameModifier</a> - String concatenated to
--   the end of the destination filename. Required for multiple outputs of
--   the same type.
newMsSmoothOutputSettings :: MsSmoothOutputSettings

--   multiplex. Keep in mind that each multiplex pipeline connects to both
--   pipelines in a given source channel (the channel identified by the
--   program). But only one of those channel pipelines is ever active at
--   one time.

--

--   fields.

--   bitrate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexStatmuxVideoSettings_priority</a> - The purpose of the
--   priority is to use a combination of the\nmultiplex rate control
--   algorithm and the QVBR capability of the\nencoder to prioritize the
--   video quality of some channels in a\nmultiplex over others. Channels
--   that have a higher priority will\nget higher video quality at the
--   expense of the video quality of\nother channels in the multiplex with
--   lower priority.
newMultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings :: MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings

-- | The video configuration for each program in a multiplex.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiplexVideoSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MultiplexVideoSettings
MultiplexVideoSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings -> MultiplexVideoSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiplexVideoSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:constantBitrate:MultiplexVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexVideoSettings_constantBitrate</a> - The constant bitrate
--   configuration for the video encode. When this field is defined,
--   StatmuxSettings must be undefined.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statmuxSettings:MultiplexVideoSettings'</a>,
--   <a>multiplexVideoSettings_statmuxSettings</a> - Statmux rate control
--   settings. When this field is defined, ConstantBitrate must be
--   undefined.
newMultiplexVideoSettings :: MultiplexVideoSettings

-- | Network source to transcode. Must be accessible to the Elemental Live
--   node that is running the live event through a network connection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkInputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkInputSettings
NetworkInputSettings' :: Maybe HlsInputSettings -> Maybe NetworkInputServerValidation -> NetworkInputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkInputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hlsInputSettings:NetworkInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>networkInputSettings_hlsInputSettings</a> - Specifies HLS input
--   settings when the uri is for a HLS manifest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverValidation:NetworkInputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>networkInputSettings_serverValidation</a> - Check HTTPS server
--   certificates. When set to checkCryptographyOnly, cryptography in the
--   certificate will be checked, but not the server's name. Certain
--   subdomains (notably S3 buckets that use dots in the bucket name) do
--   not strictly match the corresponding certificate's wildcard pattern
--   and would otherwise cause the event to error. This setting is ignored
--   for protocols that do not use https.
newNetworkInputSettings :: NetworkInputSettings

data NielsenConfiguration

-- | Reserved resources available for purchase
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOffering</a> smart constructor.
data Offering
Offering' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe OfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Offering

-- | Create a value of <a>Offering</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_duration</a> - Lease
--   duration, e.g. '12'
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationUnits:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_durationUnits</a> -
--   Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_arn</a> - Unique offering ARN,
--   e.g. 'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:offering:87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringId:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_offeringId</a> - Unique
--   offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_currencyCode</a> -
--   Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecification:Offering'</a>,
--   <a>offering_resourceSpecification</a> - Resource configuration details
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringDescription:Offering'</a>,
--   <a>offering_offeringDescription</a> - Offering description, e.g. 'HD
--   AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_fixedPrice</a> -
--   One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_usagePrice</a> -
--   Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_offeringType</a> -
--   Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Offering'</a>, <a>offering_region</a> - AWS region,
--   e.g. 'us-west-2'
newOffering :: Offering

-- | Output settings. There can be multiple outputs within a group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutput</a> smart constructor.
data Output
Output' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> OutputSettings -> Output

-- | Create a value of <a>Output</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:audioDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_audioDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   AudioDescriptions used as audio sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoDescriptionName:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_videoDescriptionName</a> - The name of the VideoDescription
--   used as the source for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputName:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputName</a> - The name
--   used to identify an output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionDescriptionNames:Output'</a>,
--   <a>output_captionDescriptionNames</a> - The names of the
--   CaptionDescriptions used as caption sources for this output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSettings:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputSettings</a> -
--   Output type-specific settings.
newOutput :: OutputSettings -> Output

-- | Reserved resources available to use
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservation</a> smart constructor.
data Reservation
Reservation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe OfferingDurationUnits -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReservationResourceSpecification -> Maybe ReservationState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe OfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Reservation

-- | Create a value of <a>Reservation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_end</a> - Reservation UTC
--   end date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2019-03-01T00:00:00'
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_duration</a> - Lease
--   duration, e.g. '12'
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationUnits:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_durationUnits</a> - Units for duration, e.g. 'MONTHS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_arn</a> - Unique
--   reservation ARN, e.g.
--   'arn:aws:medialive:us-west-2:123456789012:reservation:1234567'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringId:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_offeringId</a> -
--   Unique offering ID, e.g. '87654321'
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_currencyCode</a>
--   - Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g.
--   'USD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_name</a> - User
--   specified reservation name
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecification:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_resourceSpecification</a> - Resource configuration
--   details
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_state</a> - Current
--   state of reservation, e.g. 'ACTIVE'
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_tags</a> - A collection
--   of key-value pairs
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringDescription:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_offeringDescription</a> - Offering description, e.g.
--   'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West
--   (Oregon)'
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_fixedPrice</a> -
--   One-time charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '0.0' for a
--   NO_UPFRONT offering
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_count</a> - Number of
--   reserved resources
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_usagePrice</a> -
--   Recurring usage charge for each reserved resource, e.g. '157.0'
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_offeringType</a>
--   - Offering type, e.g. 'NO_UPFRONT'
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_region</a> - AWS
--   region, e.g. 'us-west-2'
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:Reservation'</a>, <a>reservation_start</a> - Reservation
--   UTC start date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2018-03-01T00:00:00'
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservationId:Reservation'</a>,
--   <a>reservation_reservationId</a> - Unique reservation ID, e.g.
--   '1234567'
newReservation :: Reservation

-- | Resource configuration (codec, resolution, bitrate, ...)
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationResourceSpecification</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReservationResourceSpecification
ReservationResourceSpecification' :: Maybe ReservationMaximumFramerate -> Maybe ReservationVideoQuality -> Maybe ReservationCodec -> Maybe ReservationMaximumBitrate -> Maybe ChannelClass -> Maybe ReservationSpecialFeature -> Maybe ReservationResourceType -> Maybe ReservationResolution -> ReservationResourceSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservationResourceSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumFramerate:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_maximumFramerate</a> - Maximum
--   framerate, e.g. 'MAX_30_FPS' (Outputs only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoQuality:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_videoQuality</a> - Video quality,
--   e.g. 'STANDARD' (Outputs only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:codec:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_codec</a> - Codec, e.g. 'AVC'
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumBitrate:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_maximumBitrate</a> - Maximum
--   bitrate, e.g. 'MAX_20_MBPS'
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelClass:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_channelClass</a> - Channel class,
--   e.g. 'STANDARD'
--   
--   <a>$sel:specialFeature:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_specialFeature</a> - Special
--   feature, e.g. 'AUDIO_NORMALIZATION' (Channels only)
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_resourceType</a> - Resource type,
--   'INPUT', 'OUTPUT', 'MULTIPLEX', or 'CHANNEL'
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolution:ReservationResourceSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>reservationResourceSpecification_resolution</a> - Resolution, e.g.
--   'HD'
newReservationResourceSpecification :: ReservationResourceSpecification

newRtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings :: RtmpCaptionInfoDestinationSettings

-- | Rtmp Group Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRtmpGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RtmpGroupSettings
RtmpGroupSettings' :: Maybe [RtmpAdMarkers] -> Maybe RtmpCaptionData -> Maybe RtmpCacheFullBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe AuthenticationScheme -> Maybe InputLossActionForRtmpOut -> Maybe Natural -> RtmpGroupSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>RtmpGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:adMarkers:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_adMarkers</a> - Choose the ad marker type for
--   this output group. MediaLive will create a message based on the
--   content of each SCTE-35 message, format it for that marker type, and
--   insert it in the datastream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captionData:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_captionData</a> - Controls the types of data that
--   passes to onCaptionInfo outputs. If set to 'all' then 608 and 708
--   carried DTVCC data will be passed. If set to 'field1AndField2608' then
--   DTVCC data will be stripped out, but 608 data from both fields will be
--   passed. If set to 'field1608' then only the data carried in 608 from
--   field 1 video will be passed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheFullBehavior:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_cacheFullBehavior</a> - Controls behavior when
--   content cache fills up. If remote origin server stalls the RTMP
--   connection and does not accept content fast enough the 'Media Cache'
--   will fill up. When the cache reaches the duration specified by
--   cacheLength the cache will stop accepting new content. If set to
--   disconnectImmediately, the RTMP output will force a disconnect. Clear
--   the media cache, and reconnect after restartDelay seconds. If set to
--   waitForServer, the RTMP output will wait up to 5 minutes to allow the
--   origin server to begin accepting data again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheLength:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_cacheLength</a> - Cache length, in seconds, is
--   used to calculate buffer size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationScheme:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_authenticationScheme</a> - Authentication scheme
--   to use when connecting with CDN
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Controls the behavior of
--   this RTMP group if input becomes unavailable. - emitOutput: Emit a
--   slate until input returns. - pauseOutput: Stop transmitting data until
--   input returns. This does not close the underlying RTMP connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restartDelay:RtmpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpGroupSettings_restartDelay</a> - If a streaming output fails,
--   number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0
--   means never restart.
newRtmpGroupSettings :: RtmpGroupSettings

-- | Rtmp Output Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRtmpOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RtmpOutputSettings
RtmpOutputSettings' :: Maybe RtmpOutputCertificateMode -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> OutputLocationRef -> RtmpOutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>RtmpOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_certificateMode</a> - If set to
--   verifyAuthenticity, verify the tls certificate chain to a trusted
--   Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause rtmps outputs with
--   self-signed certificates to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRetries:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_numRetries</a> - Number of retry attempts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionRetryInterval:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_connectionRetryInterval</a> - Number of seconds
--   to wait before retrying a connection to the Flash Media server if the
--   connection is lost.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:RtmpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>rtmpOutputSettings_destination</a> - The RTMP endpoint excluding
--   the stream name (eg. rtmp://host/appname). For connection to Akamai, a
--   username and password must be supplied. URI fields accept format
--   identifiers.
newRtmpOutputSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> RtmpOutputSettings

-- | Contains information on a single schedule action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduleAction
ScheduleAction' :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_actionName</a> - The name of the action, must be
--   unique within the schedule. This name provides the main reference to
--   an action once it is added to the schedule. A name is unique if it is
--   no longer in the schedule. The schedule is automatically cleaned up to
--   remove actions with a start time of more than 1 hour ago
--   (approximately) so at that point a name can be reused.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionStartSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionStartSettings</a> - The time for the
--   action to start in the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleActionSettings:ScheduleAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleAction_scheduleActionSettings</a> - Settings for this
--   schedule action.
newScheduleAction :: Text -> ScheduleActionStartSettings -> ScheduleActionSettings -> ScheduleAction

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ocrLanguage:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte27SourceSettings_ocrLanguage</a> - If you will configure a
--   WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use
--   this field to provide the language to consider when translating the
--   image-based source to text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pid:Scte27SourceSettings'</a>, <a>scte27SourceSettings_pid</a>
--   - The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector
--   languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts
--   captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID
--   and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify
--   Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens
--   to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub
--   that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.
newScte27SourceSettings :: Scte27SourceSettings

-- | Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_descriptor.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SegmentationDescriptor
Scte35SegmentationDescriptor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Scte35DeliveryRestrictions -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SegmentationDescriptor</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpid:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpid</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing the hexadecimal
--   representation of the characters that make up the SCTE-35
--   segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex
--   characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example,
--   the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex
--   "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentNum:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentNum</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subSegmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_subSegmentsExpected</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid for the
--   specified segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationUpidType:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationUpidType</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter one of the
--   types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a decimal. For
--   example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in decimal. In the
--   CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in the SCTE-35
--   specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in decimal (for
--   example, "12").
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentsExpected:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentsExpected</a> - Corresponds to
--   SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for the specified
--   segmentation_type_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationTypeId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationTypeId</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the segmentation_type_id
--   values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On the console, enter the
--   ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter
--   the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal (for example, "52").
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryRestrictions:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_deliveryRestrictions</a> - Holds the
--   four SCTE-35 delivery restriction parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationDuration:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationDuration</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration for the
--   time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks, multiple
--   the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If you do not
--   enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you insert a
--   cancellation message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationEventId:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationEventId</a> - Corresponds
--   to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentationCancelIndicator:Scte35SegmentationDescriptor'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SegmentationDescriptor_segmentationCancelIndicator</a> -
--   Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.
newScte35SegmentationDescriptor :: Natural -> Scte35SegmentationCancelIndicator -> Scte35SegmentationDescriptor

-- | Scte35 Splice Insert
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsert</a> smart constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsert
Scte35SpliceInsert' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertNoRegionalBlackoutBehavior -> Maybe Scte35SpliceInsertWebDeliveryAllowedBehavior -> Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsert</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:adAvailOffset:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_adAvailOffset</a> - When specified, this offset
--   (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad Avail PTS time. This only
--   applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and does not apply to OOB
--   messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noRegionalBlackoutFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_noRegionalBlackoutFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
--   
--   <a>$sel:webDeliveryAllowedFlag:Scte35SpliceInsert'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsert_webDeliveryAllowedFlag</a> - When set to ignore,
--   Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag set to 0 will no
--   longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates
newScte35SpliceInsert :: Scte35SpliceInsert

-- | Settings for a SCTE-35 splice_insert message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings
Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> - Optional,
--   the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert
--   seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter a
--   duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can read
--   the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a duration,
--   the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an
--   expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the
--   splice_insert at the appropriate time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spliceEventId:Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings_spliceEventId</a> - The
--   splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in SCTE-35.
newScte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings :: Natural -> Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings

-- | Settings for the action to activate a static image.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings
StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_height</a> - The height
--   of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will
--   be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank to use the
--   native height of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageX:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageX</a> - Placement of
--   the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the frame. If
--   the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right edge of
--   the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the right.
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_width</a> - The width of
--   the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will be
--   scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank to use the
--   native width of the overlay.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageY:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_imageY</a> - Placement of
--   the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of the video
--   frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the frame. If the
--   placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom edge of the
--   underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the bottom.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_duration</a> - The
--   duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If
--   omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will
--   remain until it is explicitly deactivated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layer:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_layer</a> - The number of
--   the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be overlaid on the
--   video, each layer with a different image. The layers are in Z order,
--   which means that overlays with higher values of layer are inserted on
--   top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:opacity:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_opacity</a> - Opacity of
--   image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque. Default is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fadeIn:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeIn</a> - The time in
--   milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts at the start
--   time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fadeOut:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_fadeOut</a> - Applies
--   only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for the
--   image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is hit,
--   so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no fade-out).
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>staticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings_image</a> - The location
--   and filename of the image file to overlay on the video. The file must
--   be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be larger (in pixels)
--   than the input video.
newStaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings :: InputLocation -> StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings

-- | Temporal Filter Settings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemporalFilterSettings</a> smart constructor.
data TemporalFilterSettings
TemporalFilterSettings' :: Maybe TemporalFilterPostFilterSharpening -> Maybe TemporalFilterStrength -> TemporalFilterSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>TemporalFilterSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:postFilterSharpening:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_postFilterSharpening</a> - If you enable
--   this filter, the results are the following: - If the source content is
--   noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the filter cleans up
--   the source. - If the source content is already clean, the filter tends
--   to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate control mode is
--   QVBR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strength:TemporalFilterSettings'</a>,
--   <a>temporalFilterSettings_strength</a> - Choose a filter strength. We
--   recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher strength might take out good
--   information, resulting in an image that is overly soft.
newTemporalFilterSettings :: TemporalFilterSettings

-- | Timecode Config
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimecodeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TimecodeConfig
TimecodeConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>TimecodeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncThreshold:TimecodeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>timecodeConfig_syncThreshold</a> - Threshold in frames beyond which
--   output timecode is resynchronized to the input timecode. Discrepancies
--   below this threshold are permitted to avoid unnecessary
--   discontinuities in the output timecode. No timecode sync when this is
--   not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:TimecodeConfig'</a>, <a>timecodeConfig_source</a> -
--   Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with
--   the events outputs. -Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output
--   timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is
--   detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0"
--   (zerobased). -System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time. -Start at
--   0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be
--   00:00:00:00.
newTimecodeConfig :: TimecodeConfigSource -> TimecodeConfig

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUdpGroupSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UdpGroupSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>UdpGroupSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that has the timecode.

--   interval in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputLossAction:UdpGroupSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpGroupSettings_inputLossAction</a> - Specifies behavior of last
--   resort when input video is lost, and no more backup inputs are
--   available. When dropTs is selected the entire transport stream will
--   stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected the program can be
--   dropped from the transport stream (and replaced with null packets to
--   meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when emitProgram is chosen the
--   transport stream will continue to be produced normally with repeat
--   frames, black frames, or slate frames substituted for the absent input
--   video.
newUdpGroupSettings :: UdpGroupSettings

--   <a>udpOutputSettings_bufferMsec</a> - UDP output buffering in
--   milliseconds. Larger values increase latency through the transcoder
--   but simultaneously assist the transcoder in maintaining a constant,
--   low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating clock recovery, input
--   switching, input disruptions, picture reordering, etc.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fecOutputSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_fecOutputSettings</a> - Settings for enabling and
--   adjusting Forward Error Correction on UDP outputs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_destination</a> - Destination address and port
--   number for RTP or UDP packets. Can be unicast or multicast RTP or UDP
--   (eg. rtp://239.10.10.10:5001 or udp://10.100.100.100:5002).
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerSettings:UdpOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>udpOutputSettings_containerSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
newUdpOutputSettings :: OutputLocationRef -> UdpContainerSettings -> UdpOutputSettings

-- | Placeholder documentation for VideoBlackFailoverSettings
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VideoBlackFailoverSettings
VideoBlackFailoverSettings' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoBlackFailoverSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blackDetectThreshold:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_blackDetectThreshold</a> - A value used
--   in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive considers a pixel
--   to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black, every pixel in a
--   frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is calculated as a
--   percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white. Therefore .1 means 10%
--   white (or 90% black). Note how the formula works for any color depth.
--   For example, if you set this field to 0.1 in 10-bit color depth:
--   (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of 102 or less is 'black'.
--   If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color depth: (255*0.1=25.5),
--   which means a pixel value of 25 or less is 'black'. The range is 0.0
--   to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.
--   
--   <a>$sel:videoBlackThresholdMsec:VideoBlackFailoverSettings'</a>,
--   <a>videoBlackFailoverSettings_videoBlackThresholdMsec</a> - The amount
--   of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be black before
--   automatic input failover occurs.
newVideoBlackFailoverSettings :: VideoBlackFailoverSettings

-- | Video Codec Settings

data VideoCodecSettings
VideoCodecSettings' :: Maybe FrameCaptureSettings -> Maybe Mpeg2Settings -> Maybe H264Settings -> Maybe H265Settings -> VideoCodecSettings

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

newVideoCodecSettings :: VideoCodecSettings

-- | Video settings for this stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VideoDescription
VideoDescription' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoDescriptionRespondToAfd -> Maybe Int -> Maybe VideoCodecSettings -> Maybe VideoDescriptionScalingBehavior -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:height:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_height</a> -
--   Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:respondToAfd:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_respondToAfd</a> - Indicates how MediaLive will
--   respond to the AFD values that might be in the input video. If you do
--   not know what AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not
--   given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH. RESPOND: MediaLive clips the
--   input video using a formula that uses the AFD values (configured in
--   afdSignaling ), the input display aspect ratio, and the output display
--   aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes the AFD values in the output,
--   unless the codec for this encode is FRAME_CAPTURE. PASSTHROUGH:
--   MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does not clip the video. But
--   MediaLive does include the values in the output. NONE: MediaLive does
--   not clip the input video and does not include the AFD values in the
--   output
--   
--   <a>$sel:width:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_width</a> -
--   Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most
--   codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the
--   height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that
--   leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height
--   and width are required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codecSettings:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_codecSettings</a> - Video codec settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingBehavior:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_scalingBehavior</a> - STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures
--   the output position to stretch the video to the specified output
--   resolution (height and width). This option will override any position
--   value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes (pillar boxes or letter boxes)
--   around the video to provide the specified output resolution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sharpness:VideoDescription'</a>,
--   <a>videoDescription_sharpness</a> - Changes the strength of the
--   anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is the softest setting, 100 is
--   the sharpest. A setting of 50 is recommended for most content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:VideoDescription'</a>, <a>videoDescription_name</a> - The
--   name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely
--   identify this Description. Description names should be unique within
--   this Live Event.
newVideoDescription :: Text -> VideoDescription

-- | Specifies a particular video stream within an input source. An input
--   may have only a single video selector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVideoSelector</a> smart constructor.
data VideoSelector
VideoSelector' :: Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceUsage -> Maybe VideoSelectorSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpaceSettings -> Maybe VideoSelectorColorSpace -> VideoSelector

-- | Create a value of <a>VideoSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceUsage:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceUsage</a> - Applies only if colorSpace is a
--   value other than follow. This field controls how the value in the
--   colorSpace field will be used. fallback means that when the input does
--   include color space data, that data will be used, but when the input
--   has no color space data, the value in colorSpace will be used. Choose
--   fallback if your input is sometimes missing color space data, but when
--   it does have color space data, that data is correct. force means to
--   always use the value in colorSpace. Choose force if your input usually
--   has no color space data or might have unreliable color space data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectorSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_selectorSettings</a> - The video selector settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpaceSettings:VideoSelector'</a>,
--   <a>videoSelector_colorSpaceSettings</a> - Color space settings
--   
--   <a>$sel:colorSpace:VideoSelector'</a>, <a>videoSelector_colorSpace</a>
--   - Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem
--   with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's
--   colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be
--   performed.
newVideoSelector :: VideoSelector

-- | The properties for a private VPC Output When this property is
--   specified, the output egress addresses will be created in a user
--   specified VPC
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettings</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettings
VpcOutputSettings' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> [Text] -> VpcOutputSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcOutputSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC
--   security group IDs to attach to the Output VPC network interfaces. If
--   none are specified then the VPC default security group will be used
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAddressAllocationIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_publicAddressAllocationIds</a> - List of public
--   address allocation ids to associate with ENIs that will be created in
--   Output VPC. Must specify one for SINGLE_PIPELINE, two for STANDARD
--   channels
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettings'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettings_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet IDs from the
--   same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique
--   availability zones (AZ).
newVpcOutputSettings :: VpcOutputSettings

-- | The properties for a private VPC Output
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcOutputSettingsDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcOutputSettingsDescription
VpcOutputSettingsDescription' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> VpcOutputSettingsDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcOutputSettingsDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_securityGroupIds</a> - A list of up
--   EC2 VPC security group IDs attached to the Output VPC network
--   interfaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_availabilityZones</a> - The
--   Availability Zones where the vpc subnets are located. The first
--   Availability Zone applies to the first subnet in the list of subnets.
--   The second Availability Zone applies to the second subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_subnetIds</a> - A list of VPC subnet
--   IDs from the same VPC. If STANDARD channel, subnet IDs must be mapped
--   to two unique availability zones (AZ).
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceIds:VpcOutputSettingsDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcOutputSettingsDescription_networkInterfaceIds</a> - A list of
--   Elastic Network Interfaces created by MediaLive in the customer's VPC
newVpcOutputSettingsDescription :: VpcOutputSettingsDescription

--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>webvttDestinationSettings_styleControl</a> - Controls whether the
--   color and position of the source captions is passed through to the
--   WebVTT output captions. PASSTHROUGH - Valid only if the source
--   captions are EMBEDDED or TELETEXT. NO_STYLE_DATA - Don't pass through

newWebvttDestinationSettings :: WebvttDestinationSettings
